Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: POSITION DESCRIPTION The Business Systems Analyst will take ownership of gathering requirements, building, testing, and deploying software solutions and features. We are looking for an analytical thinker who will serve as the primary liaison and point of contact between the development team and the assigned functional business areas. ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIESDefine business analysis requirements and specifications.Develop workflows, use cases, data flows, process flows, report specs, mock ups and wire frames.Design, document and maintain system processes and functionality including UI.Ensure that validated deliverable meet functional and design specifications and requirements.Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations.Works with users to define and document application or process problems.Evaluate workflows, methods, and recommend appropriate solutions.Develop written instructions and user manuals.Researches, analyze and evaluates requests for new features and enhancements.Report defects and verify defect fixes.Provides support to functional and user acceptance testing groups as part of project implementation.Supports quality assurance and control efforts through the use of data analysis.EXPERIENCE & REQUIREMENTSBachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related technical discipline.5 years previous experience as a business systems analyst.Proven experience with UI design, eliciting requirements, documentation and quality assurance.Exceptional organizational skills and ability to handle large projects.Ability to communicate about projects effectively with technical and non-technical audiences.Advanced skills in Microsoft Office 365, Front-End Scripting, UI Design, Microsoft Visio, and SQL.Experience with SaaS solutions.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Ability to work in a fast-paced agile environment. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. This position requires sitting for extended periods of time. Occasionally requires standing, squatting, reaching and bending. Requires ability to receive information through oral communication both in-person and on telephone. Manual dexterity needed for using computer keyboard. Must have adequate vision to operate computer and complete paperwork. Occasional lifting of up to 25 pounds. WORK ENVIRONMENT This job operates in a professional office environment. The role routinely uses standard office equipment such as assigned work station, computer, phone, copier and file cabinet. CONCLUSION This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the job and the general nature and level of work performed by the job holder. This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position. The Company reserves the right to change, amend, add, delete, and otherwise assign any and all duties, responsibilities, and position titles as it deems necessary to meet the needs of the business.  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $80,000.00 to $90,000.00 /year  Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Location: Scottsdale, AZ 85260 (Preferred) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Business Support Analyst
Description: Careers Center | Business Support Analyst Please Enable Cookies to Continue Please enable cookies in your browser to experience all the personalized features of this site, including the ability to apply for a job. Welcome page Returning Candidate? Log back in!  Business Support Analyst Job Number 230689 Facility Banner Plan Administration Inc Department Prior Authorization Address : Street 525 West Brown Rd Address : Location US-AZ-Mesa Work Schedule Day Position Type FT: Full-Time Posting Category Administrative / Clerical  --- Good health care is key to a good life. At Banner Health, we understand that, and that’s why we work hard every day to make a difference in people’s lives. We’ve united under a common goal: Make health care easier, so life can be better. It’s a lofty goal, but it’s one we’re committed to seeing through. Do you like the idea of making a positive change in people’s lives – and your own? If so, this could be the perfect opportunity for you. Apply nowOur Medical Management Prior Authorization team receives faxed documents via an application called Fortis Edit. For Prior Authorization, we use a list of items which require review by our nurses and/or medical director. Once our AA-Team (support/non-clinical) indexes the request they data enter it into IMPACT which is the application for our determinations (approve/cancel/deny) that can be accessed to pay claims. Location:This position will be located at Banner-Mesa 525 W Brown RDMesa, AZ 85201Schedule:Monday-Friday; 8:00AM-5:00PM, opportunity to work Saturday as well.On the holiday weekends that create a 3 or 4 day weekend, we’re required to have a partial crew in to manage our expedited requestsYour pay and benefits (Total Rewards) are important components of your Journey at Banner Health. Banner Health offers a variety of benefit plans to help you and your family. We provide health and financial security options so you can focus on being the best at what you do and enjoying your life. --- About Banner Health Network & Banner Plan AdministrationBanner Health Network (BHN) is an accountable care organization that joins Arizona's largest health care provider, Banner Health, and an extensive network of primary care and specialty physicians to provide the most comprehensive healthcare solutions for Maricopa County and parts of Pinal County. Through BHN, known nationally as an innovative leader in new health care models, insurance plans and physicians are coming together to work collaboratively to keep members in optimal health, while reducing costs.About Banner HealthBanner Health is one of the largest, nonprofit health care systems in the country and the leading nonprofit provider of hospital services in all the communities we serve. Throughout our network of hospitals, primary care health centers, research centers, labs, physician practices and more, our skilled and compassionate professionals use the latest technology to make health care easier, so life can be better. The many locations, career opportunities, and benefits offered at Banner Health help to make the Banner Journey unique and fulfilling for every employee. --- Job SummaryThis position performs entry-level analytical and reporting activities to support the business function of a department or division. This position is accountable generating and preparing reports, performing analysis, tracking and submitting data, and related activities in a timely and accurate manner.Essential FunctionsMaintains database information for facility and/or department personnel on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis. This includes ensuring accessibility of accurate information to department personnel as needed.Prepares and distributes weekly, monthly and ad-hoc business object reports in accordance with established guidelines and procedures or as requested.Assists department staff by performing project-related work, as needed or requested.Under the direction of experienced analysts, this position reviews, analyzes and evaluates business and user needs and documents findings.With direction and consultation of experienced analysts, this position reviews and recommends changes to business processes to increase system effectiveness for end users.May assist and participate in system testing and support to increase effectiveness of new changes or modifications.Minimum QualificationsHigh school diploma/GED or equivalent working knowledge.Must be familiar in the information technology areas, such as personal software packages, to generate reports and present information in a written or spreadsheet format, as described above. Has knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field respective to the system functions. Must have excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively interact with internal and external customers and department staff, as described above. Must be able to follow verbal directions and instruction to perform work as described above. Must have the ability to organize, prioritize, and manage a variety of tasks and activities in a timely and effective manner.Preferred QualificationsOne to two years of experience of business analysis or a related area preferred.Additional related education and/or experience preferred.Apply For This JobApply Connect With Us!  Join one of our Talent Communities to learn more about a career at Banner Health.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Here at Discount Tire, we celebrate the spirit of our people with extraordinary pride and enthusiasm. Our business has been growing for more than 55 years and now is the best time in our history to join our team. We are opening more locations every year and we are always looking for qualified individuals to promote our growth. We are a company that promotes from within, both in our retail and corporate operations.  As a critical member of our Strategic Business Services Segment, the Business Process Architect facilitates the analysis, design, and implementation of business and technology processes across the enterprise. The work includes collaborating with business segment and technology stakeholders to document and understand our current processes and lead innovation as new projects and initiatives are launched. In addition to an expert-level understanding of business and technology processes, the key to success is the ability to work across teams to influence stakeholders, champion efficiency in operations, can make the case for change while preserving the unique strengths supporting Discount Tire’s culture and commitment to customer satisfaction. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Identifies impacts and linkages to the business strategies, organization and its people, data and systems, business policies and business rules, as well as the physical assets of the businessFacilitates the assessment of the impact of business process changes within people, systems, operations and management; incorporates Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in collaboration with stakeholdersFacilitates the analysis of functionality gaps, develops alternatives and finalizes business blueprintingProvides group facilitation, leads workshops, gathers data, and interviews appropriate stakeholders to develop and validate Business Process Models (BPM)Develops robust and comprehensive Business Process Models that will enable the business to make sound process and financial decisionsMakes recommendations to determine appropriate resources, software (i.e., MS Visio), and tools to create Business Process ModelsMakes recommendations to determine appropriate system for hosting (i.e. SharePoint) Business Process ModelsStays current on the latest industry technologies, trends and strategies relating to business process architectureDevises strategies to facilitate transition from current state to desired end stateDesigns and conducts training on new BPM initiativesDevelops clear and detailed process maps standards, format, and definitionsCreates and executes functional test plans and system integration scenariosWorks with the Change Management Office to define and implement any job or department changes as defined by the changing business processFacilitates discussions to determine productivity and efficiency improvementsLeads / Conducts business plans, including, but not limited to, ROI, resource allocations, benefits realization plans, forecasts, and statistical studies related to Business Process ModelingAssists employees, vendors and customers by answering questions related to business processesCompletes work in a timely and accurate manner while providing exceptional customer serviceOther duties as assignedQualifications:This position requires a minimum of eight years of experience in business process management, problem definition, design, solutions evaluation, validation and deployment.Proven facilitation and negotiation skills are required. SAP ERP/ECC experience strongly preferred.Experience with Procure to Pay, Record to Report and/or Order to Cash is required, preferably in Retail or Wholesale industry.Demonstrated ability to extensively analyze business processes and workflows is necessary.Experience developing instructional and procedural documentation and presentations is vital.Experience with business process modeling and analysis and design tools is necessary.Ability to identify complex problems, review information to develop and evaluate options, then implement solutions is essential.Proven ability to collaborate across the Company, including the ability to respond to different organizational situations while maintaining a positive and friendly attitude, is necessary.Demonstrated ability to communicate across all levels of the organization is necessary; ability to clearly articulate complex technical ideas to a non-technical audience both verbally and in writing is required.Demonstrated business acumen with a deep knowledge and understanding of business issues, priorities, goals and strategy is necessary.Advanced skills with Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and Project are required.The ability to work efficiently under pressure, define tasks, establish priorities, and implement according to plan, accurately meet deadlines, present a professional demeanor and work well autonomously or collaboratively is essential.Maintaining confidentiality, treating others with respect and upholding Company values are key attributes.In addition, organizational and problem solving skills, a can-do attitude, and the ability to adjust to changing requirements are essential.Educational Requirements: This position requires a bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Information Technology or other quantitative field, or equivalent work experience. Work Days: Normal work days are Monday through Friday. Occasional Saturdays and Sundays may be necessary. Work Hours: Normal work hours are 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Additional hours may be necessary.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values—straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity – an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines – Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management. Job Description Summary Responsible for integration, transformation, and delivery of data to the primary reporting and analysis tools. Supports the delivery of information from Bank of the West's (the Bank) data by utilizing data integration processes and supports the Extract Transform Load (ETL) from multiple sub ledger transaction systems, creating information necessary to support reporting needs. There is frequent interaction with executive level financial managers. This role will apply effective and innovative technology solutions to improve functional performance and reduce information processing risk. Utilize experience and knowledge to provide the best solution to business integration challenges and make recommendations that will improve business results and generate significant return on Investment. Essential Job FunctionsUtilize experience and knowledge of the specific Integration solutions to provide the best solution to business integration challenges. Make recommendations to utilize technology in a manner that will improve business results and generate significant return on Investment. Analyzes and evaluates business requirements; diagnose the design and propose/design alternatives and business recommendations. Support the implementation of new data requirements. Provides basic technical/analytical assistance to Finance staff including interpretation of requirements. Able to communicate with functional users, lead teams of high level managers in solving business challenges.Assists with the design of ETL processes by leveraging Informatica Power Center 7.0 or Hyperion Data Integration tools. Strives to ensure ETL process is developed in a modular fashion in shared folders and reusable objects to enforce consistency standardsApply transformation rules or functions to extracted data to derive the data to be loaded.Support the data load production process and the implementation of new data load files in accordance with the department’s change management process.Trouble shooting to quickly diagnose and work towards problem resolution.Maintains data quality by implementing defined internal controls and monitoring processes. This can include controls to identify individual ETL flows that are performance issues. Ensure ETL code is organized into logical folder and directory names designing new structures as required utilizing object naming conventions to encourage consistent development and ease of migration from development to test to production.Work closely with Information Technology staff through the phases of coding and implementation of external data source files providing clarifications as necessary. Maintain effective ongoing communications with the business and IT community and operational management regarding system plans, projects, budgets, expenditures and policies.Applies systems procedures, system operating guides, contingency and recovery plans and maintains technical application level documentation.Other Job DutiesPerforms other duties as assigned.Required ExperienceRequires advanced knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience.May have practical knowledge of project management.Requires 5 years minimum prior relevant experience.EducationBachelor's DegreeEqual Employment Opportunity Policy Bank of the West is an Equal Opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers without regard to any status protected by applicable law. Bank of the West is also an Affirmative Action employer - Minority / Female / Disabled / Veteran.  Bank of the West will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance subject to the requirements of all state and federal laws and regulations.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSouthwest Service Administrators is a Third Party Administrator (TPA) providing unique and specialized administrative services to labor-management Trust Funds (primarily) in the southwest United States with offices in Phoenix, AZ (our corporate service center), Albuquerque, NM and Salt Lake City, UT since 1995.We offer competitive wages and an excellent benefit package including FULL FAMILY coverage for medical, dental, vision & Rx. Other benefits include (employee) short & long term disability, Life/AD&D Insurance, 401k, Pension, generous Paid Personal & Vacation Leave policy and career advancement and travel opportunities. We pride ourselves on being flexible, but there are somethings we feel very strongly about:Being an excellent communicator, because you take care in articulating your own thought process, as well as critique the work of others. Understanding the whole business. Great systems aren’t built in a vacuum – they require hard work from extremely smart people across many disciplines and an understanding of how it all fits together. Great teams are better than the all-star players. No matter how great someone’s ideas, they’ll be improved upon through collaboration. Position Purpose This position will promote best practices and new ideas within the Data Management Team by supporting pension and annuity standards. The Data Analyst will be expected to address client needs with a business focus that helps maintain profitability and quality throughout the team's projects. This individual will be able to self-motivate to meet hard deadlines on multiple client projects within a fast-moving environment. ResponsibilitiesData Management & MaintenanceCreate and maintain codes, parameters, schedules, rates, etc.Produce, verify and distribute reports and quarterly/year-end files.Create, verify and process data loads.Transfer data to Pension and Annuity records.Assist with the processing and distribution of vendor files.Assist with the creation of new reports as needed.Provide continuing support and technical guidance.ImplementationSupport group implementations and migration set up, file layouts, data review, loads, etc.Set up, maintain and support employer portal.TeamworkWork cooperatively with other team members.Actively participate in team meetings and training activities.Perform additional responsibilities as periodically assigned.Education/Certification:High School Diploma/GED or equivalent experienceSkills/Abilities:Proven problem solving and analytical skills.Basic understanding of MS Office.Detail oriented, with a high level of accuracy.Strong dedication to follow-through on all tasks and assignments.Ability to follow detailed instructions and vendor correspondence independently.Strong interpretation of reports/data extracts in a variety of file layouts and ability to identify errors/issues.Ability to sit for long periods of time operating a computer keyboard.Ability to organize, set priorities, work independently and complete multiple projects within established deadlines.Professional, client-focused approach to colleagues and assignments.Minimal knowledge of the fundamentals of defined benefit, defined contributions, and annuity is a plus (additional Pension training to be provided as needed).Competencies: Strategic/Analytical, Problem Solving, Critical Thinking, Communications, Interpersonal Relations/Teamwork, Organization Awareness, Self/Life Management, Continuous Improvement/Innovation and Change, Basic Technical Competence. Employee Benefits ProgramOne of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to five percent of an employee’s base pay.Affordable medical, dental and vision insurance; along with company paid disability and life insurance.Family and employee care programs. Southwest Service Administrators provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, military and veteran status, age, physical and mental disability, genetic characteristics, or any other considerations made unlawful by applicable state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Southwest Service Administrators expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, military and veteran status, age, physical and mental disability, or genetic characteristics. Company DescriptionSouthwest Service Administrators is a Third Party Administrator (TPA) providing unique and specialized administrative services to labor-management Trust Funds (primarily) in the southwest United States with offices in Phoenix, AZ (our corporate service center), Albuquerque, NM and Salt Lake City, UT since 1995.  We offer competitive wages and an excellent benefit package including FULL FAMILY coverage for medical, dental, vision & Rx. Other benefits include (employee) short & long term disability, Life/AD&D Insurance, 401k, Pension, generous Paid Personal & Vacation Leave policy and career advancement and travel opportunities.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: IDEALFORCE has a CONTRACT position available immediately for a Data Analyst to join our customer in Phoenix AZ . This is an ONSITE position. Please find below additional details about this job. Kindly respond with your most up to date resume if you would like to pursue this opportunity. Only Local Candidates are considered for this role. Position Summary: Identifies, gathers, organizes, and catalogs data gathered sources for input into company database. Processed data must conform to team standards and quality specifications. Duties also include analyzing database information for consistency, errors, and patterns using database analysis.. Responsibilities: • Analyze database information • Analyze/Rationalize data from multiple sources • Create status reports for management purposes • Work with team members to complete set objectives • Perform related duties to support production and delivery needs, asassigned Qualifications: • Bachelor’s degree • Proficient in job-related Microsoft Office products • Intermediate experience in the research and collection of technical data (e.g., technical specifications, product data) • Data Literacy: Intermediate competence in finding, manipulating, managing, and interpreting data, numbers, text, and images • Intermediate ability to write queries using SQL • Intermediate ability to utilize Excel functionality, such as VLookups, Charts, and Pivot Tables • 2 years of on-the-job analytical experience • Meticulous attention to detail • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, strong critical thinking skills • Exceptional prioritization, process, and communication skills • Strong work ethic • Familiar with common data modeling techniques • Must show initiative and have the ability to work on multiple tasks • Must exhibit time management skills • Ability to work independently to meet set goals and objectives • Ability to work in a team environment and use available resources in meeting team deadlines • Able to interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques to provide process improvement suggestions to business and IT • Able to develop and maintain databases, data collection systems, analytics solutions, and other related tools that optimize efficiency and quality of analysis work • Must be willing to quality check data records in accordance with established company processes and standards • Must be familiar with techniques for acquiring, merging, and cleaning data from multiple data sources • Knowledge and experience with reporting packages, ETL packages, scripting languages, and other database related programming tools. • Adept at communicating findings to non-technical audience THIRD PARTY CANDIDATES: Email your candidate/s resume to joseph dot shelton at idealforce.com along with the following details: Rate, Current location and Availability. Disclaimer : The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. - provided by DiceSQL, Excel, VLookups, Charts, Pivot Tables, Data Modeling, ETL

Name: Commercial Banking - Business Operations Analyst - Wholesale Lending Services - Phoenix, AZ or Indianapolis
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.6 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. JPMorgan Chase & Co.is committed to providing a comprehensive set of benefits choices to meet different employee needs and lifestyles, which include fully paid parental leave time, health care insurance and retirement benefits.Commercial Banking serves more than 30,000 clients, including corporations, municipalities, financial institutions, and not-for-profit entities with annual revenues generally ranging from $20 million to $2 billion. The Firm's broad platform positions the Commercial Bank to deliver extensive product capabilities - lending, treasury services, investment banking, and asset management - to meet our clients' domestic and international financial needs.Wholesale Lending Services (WLS) exists within Commercial Banking and provides lending operations and servicing functions to all four JPMorgan lines of business. These functions include loan documentation, closing and funding, payment and fee processing, syndication loan and trade processing, credit administration and collateral perfection and management.The Business Analyst will provide day-to-day management for various existing regulatory and control related initiatives within WLS supporting Dealer Services and program and project level support for the development and execution of new initiatives to streamline, simplify and improve controls, efficiencies and SLA's, including by not limited to: Flood Program ManagerInsurance Program ManagerFRBNY Program ManagerWork Flow enhancement Project ManagerThe incumbent will also be responsible for ensuring that all policies and procedures related to the documentation of commercial loans to auto dealers are maintained in a way to safeguard the client and the bankParticipate in the development of key performance metrics to which the team will be held accountableAssure compliance with all applicable Dealer Services, corporate audit and compliance policies & proceduresLead and participate in national project teams representing Dealer ServicesDirect root cause analysis and Action Plan resolutionDemonstrate strong product and process knowledgeAnalyze monthly reportingPerform other special duties or assignments as requested or requiredQualifications:Bachelors Degree or equivalent requiredRequires a minimum of 7 years of program or project experience in Financial Services operations, preferably in Auto Finance, Business Banking, Commercial Banking or Treasury ServicesPrefer extensive knowledge of credit products, payment services, regulations, controls and related proceduresRequires keen understanding of the financial and banking industries, including working knowledge of the key areas of the bank (i.e. Retail Bank, Credit, TS, CB)Must have strong leadership and influencing skillsAbility to adapt to rapidly changing business and technology environments, must be a change leaderThorough knowledge of financial exposure and operational risk associated with bank products and servicesStrong interpersonal skillsEffective problem solving, oral and written communication skillsAbility to exercise sound judgement and make effective decisionsAbility to prioritize, handle multiple tasks and work under pressure in a team environmentDisciplined approach to managing and acting upon key reports and auditsSuperior project management skills; must be able to engage all participants and meet deadlines/deliverablesRefined professional presentation skills

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Company SummaryJoin our team! As a global leader in providing title insurance, settlement services and risk solutions for real estate transactions, First American Title Insurance Company (NYSE: FAF) is an ideal place to build your career. We have been entrusted with helping our customers achieve and protect their dream of homeownership since 1889. First American Title’s Direct division provides comprehensive title insurance protection and professional settlement services for real estate purchases, refinances and equity loans.We believe that our people are the key to the company’s continued success. Because our employees enable our future, we invest in theirs by supporting their careers and promoting their overall wellbeing. First American has created an award-winning culture and has been named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® 2018 list for the third consecutive year and to more than 50 regional Best Places to Work lists. For more information, visit www.firstam.com.Job SummaryWe are open to candidates in other areas, Mountain Time zone hours are required.  This position will work with the Direct Division and assist multiple states.  Define business processes and system alignment. Translate business requirements into system definitions and solutions. Strategic partner, acting as liaison between the user community and the technical applications development staff (may include offshore staff). Resolve system problems to ensure customer processes run smoothly. Document business processes, training procedures, standard operating procedures, project status, etc. Implement system alignment with business processes. Essential FunctionsTechnical and implementation focus is on providing standard applications to resolve business needs/issues.Participates in identifying business system requirements and related business/application solutions for a specific business need.Gathers customer requirements for customized system solutions and provides alternative solutions.Writes and maintains system documentation.Provides training and support directly to customers.Job ComplexitiesWorks on requirements or problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors.Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriateFollows department processes and procedures and may make recommendations to improve these processes.Validate and/or create Quality Assurance Test Cases and/or perform testing.Supervision Received or ExtendedWorks under general supervision of more experienced Business Systems Analysts.Actively contributes to the results of a team and works towards achieving team goals and objectives.Uses expertise of more senior level Business Systems Analysts and leverages additional resources to confirm solution or explore customized applications as a solution.No supervision of othersKnowledge and Skills/Technology UsedHas basic knowledge of general business environment/operation and has general cost benefit awareness.Solid working knowledge of standard features/functions of one or more application to field, analyze and resolve customer issues/problems.Good written and oral communication skills in order to define parameters to meet business requirements.Identifies/receives problem, researches alternatives, prepares presentations, drives solutions, tests to confirm, gains consensus, and implements solutions for defined business processes.Creates documentation of business processes, training procedures, and standard operating procedures.Has basic understanding of system integrations and supporting technologies.Standard Microsoft Office skill set.Experience with FAST production system.Typical EducationTypically requires BS degree or equivalent combination of education and experienceTypical Range of ExperienceTypically 2-5 years of directly related experience First American invests in its employee’s development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer. For more information about our Company and our dedication to putting People First, check out firstam.com/careers.

Name: Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description Systems Analyst  Phoenix, AZ  11 MonthsDescription: This position will be responsible for assisting the Revenue Accounting Automation team with assessing impacts for Internal and External projects, Understanding business needs and writing user stories to effectively communicate the business needs. This role requires technical aptitude and business insight as well as the ability to work with diverse teams.  This Senior Analyst is expected to become a liaison with multiple areas, adapt and work in a rapidly changing environment and relate Revenue accounting system processes with business objectives. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: " Assess impact to Revenue Accounting for Internal and External Projects  " Refine and optimize revenue accounting processes to benefit from such projects  " Propose optimal processes and gather approval from Business stakeholders  " Work with business teams to elicit business needs and write user stories portraying the business need  " Ensure well defined acceptance criteria for stories  " Work with developers and Agile product teams to ensure user stories are communicated and understood by team  " Validate acceptance criteria is met, accept User stories and demo to stakeholders  " Communicate project status to the stakeholders through the project lifecycle  " Support the QA team in understanding project requirements and ensure test scripts created by QA team covers all business scenarios  " Other duties as assigned QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS or related field, or 3 years of experience as a Systems Analyst/Business Analyst working with IT. Payment gateway implementation or Payment processing Agile Previous experince in a Main frame enviornment Experience in Airline ticketing or using transnational based systems Effective verbal and written communication skills including presentation and the ability to influenceagile Strong project management skills and organizational skills Ability to work under a constantly changing environment and meet tight deadlines Experience working in a cross-functional environment Ability to work independently Excellent interpersonal skills

Name: Payroll Business Analyst
Description: # Requisition ID: _214300_  This Payroll Business Analyst position is primarily responsible for organizing and implementing changes to the Global Bechtel Business Services (BBS) Payroll system and Global Card Services expense allocation software, and does so in coordination with business process owners and subject matter experts. Additionally serves as the liaison between the finance user group and the appropriate Information Technology group at the direction of the Payroll Operation supervisor(s). Also functions as a finance group advocate for system strategies.  Work with the functional owners and subject matter experts to understand and analyze business and regulatory requirements and corporate initiatives and recommend solutions to systems issues. Prepare applicable documentation (functional specifications, decision papers, test cases, test plan, etc.) as needed to support requested and regulatory changes/updates to production finance systems. Effectively interface with technical and functional teams as needed to ensure system capability and specifications align with proposed modification of the finance application. Prepare solutions in support of proposed production system modifications. Attend meetings to represent functional organization in support of proposed solutions for payroll or expense allocation applications. Complete integration testing of proposed solutions, quality center test cases, and project schedule objects. Communicate production system changes to appropriate functional organization to generate desktop procedure and process map updates by the functional department. Develop training materials relative to production system modifications and deliver training as necessary. Support management through ad hoc data collection, reporting, and analysis and special projects as required.  # Other Remarks/Qualifications _(Indicate any skills not available in the SAP Skills Catalog along with the appropriate proficiency levels)_ *Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor Level Degree in Finance, Accounting or a related field, minimum 4 years of hands on payroll experience in a fairly big organization in lieu of degree  + Must have the legal right to work in the U.S. without sponsorship *Preferred Qualifications:** + Solid working knowledge of SAP Payroll module and related systems  + Strong analytical mindset with a technical aptitude  + Good communication, interpersonal and collaboration skills  + Ability to exercise initiative and make decisions with little or no supervision and be accountable for such actions  + Understanding of payroll compliance and knowledge of Bechtel Policy and Procedures  + 2 years of payroll systems analysts experience  + Able to learn systems quickly such as Forms+, Electronic File Storage Retrieval System (File NET), and other types of Payroll and Finance related systems  + Experience developing Test Plans and writing Specifications for technical team  + Systems experience with Concur, or similar expense management program  + Must be able to handle multiple projects/tasks simultaneously while meeting deadlines  + Oracle interface experience  + Intermediate to advanced skills in the areas of oral and written communications, project financial process controls, MS Office suite of applications (e.g. Word, Excel), accounts payable, general ledger and billing *_Shaping tomorrow together_***_Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we?ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Oil, Gas & Chemicals; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live._***_www.bechtel.com_** at https://www.bechtel.com/*_Bechtel is an Equal Opportunity Employer._** **_All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability._**

Name: Sr. Data Analyst
Description: Discover. A more rewarding way to work.  At Employer, you'll find yourself in the company of some of the industry's smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.  Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Build on a foundation of mutual respect. Join the company that understands rewarding careers like no other, with this exceptional opportunity: Job Description: At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. Were all about people, and our employees are why Discover is a great place to work. Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.  Responsible for leading data support for business initiatives. Plans, develops, and executes projects according to strict deadlines and within budget. Translates business requirements into clear technical specifications for technical teams. Responsibilities The Analytics Center of Excellence is a group dedicated to driving business value through cutting-edge analytical techniques and processes. The team supports a wide variety of business partners within Discover and is responsible for developing models, creating strategies and providing other analytics to generate business results.  This role will be responsible for developing, deploying, maintaining and monitoring first party fraud prevention strategies. The successful candidate will work closely with a variety of business partners including those in technology and in operations. RESPONSIBILITIES Provide analytical support for first party fraud prevention for the credit card portfolio  Develop and refine first-party fraud strategies and rules to control risk, increase profitable sales, enhance customer experience, while adhering to policy and regulatory requirements  Closely monitor first-party fraud performance and identify opportunities to enhance system capabilities and improve decision quality  Work closely with business partners to ensure first-party fraud rules and strategies are implemented accurately and completed on time  Work closely with operations to ensure appropriate processes and procedures are executed to mitigate first-party fraud losses  Manage and continue to improve customer experience related to first-party fraud and optimize related communications with customers  Collaborate with cross-functional business partners on enterprise-wide new initiatives as first-party fraud subject matter expert  Leverage rich first-party fraud analytics to refer accounts to business partners for treatment, such as credit line management, marketing, and customer service  Present findings and recommendations to business partners and senior management.  Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes. Skills:Minimum QualificationsAt a minimum, heres what we need from you: Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Statistics, Business, Computer Science, Programming, Engineering, Data Science, or relatedquantitative field  4+ years of experience in Data Processing and Analytics, Quality Control, Programming, or related field  In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in Data Processing and Analytics, Quality Control, Programming, or related field  MS in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, and other quantitative fields with 2-4 years of applicable work experience OR Ph.D. in one of these fields with 1-3 years of experience.  Proven expertise in the management of large volumes of data on multiple platforms, ideally, UNIX, Teradata and Windows.  Extensive SAS and SQL programming skills, preferably in multiple environments  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Proven problem solving and decision making skills  Project management experience in a high-profile, deadline driven environment  Familiarity with current regulatory requirements and model governance policy  What are you waiting for? Apply today!  And by the way, while you're waiting to hear from us, don't forget to check out the great benefits Discover offers.  The same way we treat our employees is how we treat all applicants with respect. Employer is an equal opportunity employer (EEO is the law). We thrive on diversity & inclusion. You will be treated fairly throughout our recruiting process and without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law in consideration for a career at Discover. #LI-LG1

Name: Business Analyst Control Default Services
Description: Making a career move is a big decision. At ditech, we have one of the industrys most well-known brands. And while were committed to providing our customers with an exceptional experience, we believe that our employees deserve a great work environment, where they can grow, learn and achieve their professional dreams. Professional, friendly and encouraging; we are a fast-paced, fun place to work, learn and develop your skills. Youll be creating a promising career for yourself and have the opportunity to earn a good living while helping our customers achieve an important life goal, homeownership. Position Summary: o Serve as a point of contact for client related issues. Perform servicing and or loan level reviews to ensure adherence of Policy and Procedures, Client Protocols and any associated Guidelines. Performing the reviews includes, but is not limited to; defining the scope, analyzing the data, summarizing results, developing project plans for process enhancements and follow up as appropriate.  o Responsible for review of financial risk items and conducting root cause analysis to limit future exposure. Additionally, the team works legal escalations, customer complaints, and audit responses for Loss Mitigation, Foreclosure and Property Preservation. Essential Functions/Specific Duties: o Field and track all client inquiries through completion and provide root cause analysis, providing appropriate communications to key internal department constituencies. Typical inquiries may range from account level questions, escalations from external clients to servicing protocol and process clarifications from internal clients.  o Partner with the business providing clarification and/or suggestions designed to ensure adherence of Policy and Procedures, Client Protocols, FNMA, FHA, State and Federal Guidelines. Maintain solid understanding of policies and procedures.  o Assist Client Management, Compliance Testing Organization (CTO), Examination Management with additional tasks, including but not limited to; assistance with more difficult special projects, FNMA STAR, Compensatory fee review and state examinations.  o Identify business opportunities and develop recommendations/drive solutions for improvement opportunities related to risk.  o Assist the business in the identification and adoption of operational best practice  o Any other job responsibilities requested by management. Qualifications/Job Requirements:o Education: High school diploma, post high school education preferred. o Experience: o Minimum 4 years experience with mortgage industry functions such as collections, loss mitigation, bankruptcy, foreclosure, property preservation and/or REO  o Previous servicing experience in operation or analytics preferred  o Experience with MSP, LoanSphere and Early Resolution is preferred. o Skills & Competencies: o Excellent computer skills, including MS Office, SharePoint, and advanced skills in Excel  o Strong verbal and written communication skills  o Strong numeric aptitude  o Demonstrated ability to effectively research, analyze and resolve complex business-related issues  o Demonstrated ability to understand new concepts quickly  o Self-motivated with exceptional time management and organizational skills  o High energy, assertive with problem solving skills  o Ability to handle multiple tasks and comply with schedule commitments to meet deadlines Conditions of Work: o Overtime may be required depending on business needs  While this description is intended to be an accurate reflection of the positions requirements, it in no way implies/states that these are the only job responsibilities. Management reserves the right to modify, add or remove duties and request other duties as necessary.  #mortgage  Ditech Holding Corporation (DHC), Employer (Ditech) and Reverse Mortgage Solutions, Inc. (RMS) and their affiliates are Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process or if youd like to view a copy of the companys affirmative action plan, please contact careers@ditech.com.

Name: Senior Research Informatics, Business Intelligence Analyst
Company: St Josephs Hospital and Medical Center
Description: Overview Located in the heart of Phoenix, Ariz., St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center is a 586-bed, not-for-profit hospital that provides a wide range of health, social and support services with special advocacy for the poor and underserved. St. Joseph's is a nationally recognized center for quality tertiary care, medical education and research. It includes the internationally renowned Barrow Neurological Institute, the Muhammad Ali Parkinson Center, the Norton Thoracic Institute, a campus of Creighton University's Medical School and the first Level I Trauma Center in Arizona verified by the American College of Surgeons. U.S. News & World Report routinely ranks St. Joseph's among the best hospitals in the United States for neurology and neurosurgery. For more information please visit our website at https://www.dignityhealth.org/arizona/locations/stjosephs .  ResponsibilitiesPosition Summary: The Research Business Intelligence Architect is responsible for leading the development of BI solutions and related reports implemented in enterprise Research Administration Data systems. These include the components of the various web, database, and application services provided by Research Administration to the corporate infrastructure and regional investigator needs. This position is responsible for ensuring accuracy and quality control methodologies of all analytics deployed to end-users including timely clinical and financial data integration and transformation as well as analytics tools, dashboards and scorecards for all end-users.  This position is also responsible for leading the development and implementation of the strategic vision of the Research Business Intelligence and Data Analytics program to meet the needs of research investigators and collaborators throughout the enterprise. The Research BI Architect acts as part of the internal consulting team to facilities and investigators in all matters relating to research business intelligence, data analytic and reporting needs to maintain a robust and easily accessible research data warehouse consistent with good clinical practices (GCP), research compliance laws, regulatory requirements surrounding data use and Dignity Health policies.  QualificationsEducation and Experience: 2 years Clinical/Healthcare data analytic experience. Broad functional background in the area assigned (Research, healthcare delivery). Enterprise reporting business experience.  Designing and developing customer solutions using SQL Server 2014 (SSAS/SSRS/SSIS) and coding experience in C# required. Designing and developing visualizations using Tipco Spotfire, PowerBi and/or Tableau experience preferred. Ability to do significant amounts of research and testing involved in understanding the technologies. Strong project management, problem solving, and leadership skills. Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, with ability to effectively communicate at different levels of an organization. Ability to prepare and present effective Powerpoint presentations and conduct end-user training Knowledge of the Cerner application suite. Strong understanding of: System Analysis, System Design. Process redesign including documentation of current and future state workflow processes. Ability to test, analyze, trouble shoot, and isolate complex problems. System configuration consultation to meet clinical needs. Functional hardware skills. Understanding of clinician needs and practice patterns, as well as, hospital operations and workflow.  4-year University or College degree in Computer Science / Information Technology or related field. Preferred: 5 years Clinical/Healthcare data analytic experience. Experience with enterprise reporting technologies, including methodologies, development, and implementation of BI solutions in a healthcare environment. Training in system design and/or build experience.  Informatics Certification, Masters strongly preferred. Advanced degree.

Progress Residential® is one of the largest providers of high quality single-family rental homes in the United States. With over 25,000 homes in the country's fastest-growing markets, we are committed to making the home rental process easy and enjoyable. Name: Guidewire Business Analyst
Description: Growing P C Insurance client is looking to full-time a Guidewire Business Analyst to join the team! The Business Analyst will be responsible for preforming requirements gathering, needs analysis and documentation around new functionality for our Guidewire solution. RESPONSBILITES INCLUDE: * Conduct requirements definition for Claims solutions; Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their business requirements, informational needs and data sources; Translate these business needs into clearly defined and documented detailed business requirements/functional requirements inclusive of business use cases, process flows, data flows, traceability matrices as well as report mock-ups * Plan, facilitate, and conduct requirements elicitation sessions, meetings, and presentations * Lead review sessions for completed business/functional requirements with key business users focused on gaining consensus and final business approval * Participate in the development of User Acceptance Test planning documentation, including test plans and scripts, based on business and functional requirements * Facilitate UAT execution phase and work with business stakeholders and project manager to obtain user acceptance test signoff * Assess production support and data issues encountered by end users and assist in problem resolution * Provide claims processing subject matter expertise to the IT team throughout the project; Working knowledge of business analysis documentation standards * Experience using standard project tools including Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal For immediate consideration, pleas submit your resume to Harrison.Shafran@rht.com - provided by DiceAnalysis, Analyst, Business Analyst, Business Requirements, Development, Excel, Manager, Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Project, Project Manager, Scripts, Testing, UPS

Name: Program Finance Analyst

Name: HRIS Reporting Technical Analyst
Description: Description As our HRIS Reporting Technical Analyst, you will play a critical role in revealing insights that drive Human Capital Excellence. You will define, analyze, design and develop the reports and dashboards in partnership with IT functions as well as external vendors to ensure quality and timely delivery of the content to support the Business Goals. As a key member of the HRIS team you will partner with HR business stakeholders to understand information needs and key KPIs across the HR functions as well as the technology teams to make sure we develop compelling solutions for day-to-day HR end-users and senior executives. This position requires a person with strong technical and analytical skills, high detail-orientation, and good written and verbal communication. Job Duties: Utilize technology and analytical tools to develop and analyze enterprise-wide people and other cross-functional data as needed. Collate multiple data sources, including Cloud and “On-premise” HR systems to provide a 360-degree view of HR analytics. Create, maintain and ensure quality of key human resources data sets, reports, and metrics. Ensure that deliverables to the business correspond to the level of the user and how they process information and are focused on business impact. Engage business partners across the organization to understand the implications of numbers/analyses and the level and type of learning and development required to support adoption. Present findings/solutions across a range of functions and levels of business partners. Partner with offshore team members to deliver reports and dashboards. Experience working in a global business environment preferred. Qualifications Experience with Oracle Business Intelligence and specifically HCM Analytics, OTBI and BI Publisher. Excellent knowledge and experience of writing complex SQL queries. Bachelor’s (or Master’s) degree in Business or an analytical field preferred. Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in HR data management or business analysis. Comfortable working with large sets of data. Database knowledge is a plus. Ability to work independently, deal with ambiguity, and meet deadlines in a fast moving environment focused on results. Ability to simplify the complex to communicate with team, partners and the broader organization. - provided by DiceHR Data Management, Business Analysis, HCM Analytics, OTBI, BI Publisher, SQL queries

Name: Strategic Materials Analyst
Description: Get onboard the UTC Aerospace Operations and Supply Chain team and play a part in managing our innovative products from inception to delivery. Operations and Supply Chain employees have the opportunity to network across our businesses and functions, all while improving the productivity, quality and efficiency of our operations worldwide.  Located in our Phoenix, AZ office, this role will lead materials projects related to Inventory, Material Replenishment & Sales and Operations Planning.  Maintain part detail database for changes planned and completed  Identify parts that need changes and track progress of changes and inventory impact  Identify and propose suppliers for Supplier Recovery  Support actions to achieve targets and track progress  Drive completion of project actions  Host project meetings and provide On-going (e.g. weekly) and ad-hoc reporting, prepare Steering Committee deck, Create charts for site flow down  Collaborate with S&OP leaders across UTAS to validate demand  Key Phx representative in process definition meetings  Create, propose and deploy project tools  Coordinate projects implementation with cell supervisors and MPS  Maintain ABCXYZ part detail file  Calculate Inventory impact of changes; Safety Stock Analysis  Validate Demand, Production, and Inventory metric files generated by Central Ops  Analyze data file to calculate impact, calculate Production and Inventory targets by product line  Change agent for standard factory implementation  Additional responsibilities will include leading or supporting both long term strategies and short term goals relating to inventory management and optimization.  Inventory analysis, planning, and management. Support Materials Management organization in establishing comprehensive inventory policies and monitoring results vs. policies  Drive continuous improvement and ensure service level and inventory targets are met  Support the development of inventory strategies and plans per the NA Ops goals and objective.  Drive implementation of Always On delivery clinic and other strategic initiatives.  Support various Sales, Inventory, Operations, and Planning (SIOP) processes and requests, as needed  Qualification:  Expert knowledge that extends across multiple disciplines  Team and / or Project Leadership experience needed  Able to coach and develop others  Working experience with Lean and ACE / Continuous Improvement  Knowledge of material management systems, a plus  Excellent computer skills- Strong use of MS Office Suite and database management  Ability to work well in a team culture  SAP materials system experience, a plus  Excellent communication and customer service Excellent presentation and group facilitation skills  Education: Associate’s degree required  Bachelor’s degree in progress required  Bachelors degree complete with 5 years’ experience, preferred  (Supply Chain, Finance or Business Administration major preferred)  CPIM/CIRM, preferred

Name: Application Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionOverviewPerform system analysis; reporting development and analysis; and application oversight that supports all phases of the software development lifecycle (SDLC).Essential Functions and Tasks Partner with Clinical Team by acting as primary support of the CARE KDAP management systemwhich includes, but is not necessarily limited to: Attending clinical team meetings to maintain trusting and value-added relationships.Identifying and recommending user enhancements/changes to CARE KDAP management system.Creating and/or revising user documentation materials.Providing training to new and existing users.Assess, triage, and manage service request (SR) tickets related to the CARE system and Data Warehouse; validate data integrity in Data Warehouse and CARE system.Assure integrity of weekly releases and communicate details of updates to users and stakeholders.Elicit, analyze and specify user needs and/or business processes to produce baseline specifications and development requirements including test cases and validation as well as support reporting needs.Determine application solutions by conferring with internal and/or external individuals; assuring any identified gaps in business processes are supported.Provide back-up to Business Data Analyst for FTP Management and Data Warehouse file load/mapping.Provide updates, request support, and communicate potential roadblocks to supervisor in a timely and professional manner.Proactively contribute to team and company goals which includes attending various meetings, training sessions, and following all established rules, processes, and procedures. Required Skills, Abilities, Experience, Education/Certifications Atleast seven years of related work experience in a similar or the same industry.Strong working knowledge of, and able to effectively use, MySQL, Access, Excel Power Query and Data Model features, and MS Office applications. We would love to have a candidate who also has experience utilizing Drupal content editor and Microsoft Power BI.Strong working knowledge of healthcare claim system structure and eligibility data.Strong written and verbal communication skills which includes the ability to clearly explain complex and/or technical concepts and processes via email, documentation, over the phone, and in person.Strong organizational skills which includes the ability to shift focus in the face of changing priorities while remaining calm and solution oriented.Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills and the ability to utilize those skills to expertly fulfill the functions of this position. Desired Personal Traits and Disposition You feel innately connected to our purpose and meet the requirements of this role.You take pride in everything you do and consistently challenge yourself to do better.You know that mistakes are an opportunity to improve.You proactively find ways to support and celebrate the successes of others.You maintain work/life boundaries and actively utilize strong emotional intelligence. Physical and Sensory Capabilities Pick up, lift, assemble, carry, and move objects and equipment of up to 30 pounds.Maintain sustained concentration while effectively utilize common office equipment (computers, keyboards, mice, phones, etc.).Use keyboards and a variety of peripherals.Process, retain, and utilize shared information.Understand and follow complex directions and respond to potentially convoluted questions.Sit and stand for prolonged periods of time.Bench, stoop, crouch, reach, walk, and climb short ladders.Utilize fine motor skills. Company DescriptionWHO IS RENALOGIC?  We exist to make a positive difference in the management of kidney disease and we strive to reduce the incidence of dialysis in this country one member at a time. We passionately advocate for our employer groups and for employees that are living with Chronic Kidney Disease or have indicators of the disease; helping them get properly diagnosed and empowering them to take charge of their health.  Our unique and innovative solutions ensure our employer groups and their employees have greater access to care, information, and support they need to establish and maintain a better quality of life. WHY WORK FOR RENALOGIC? The success of Renalogic depends on the overall health of our company and each team member embodying the nine traits of being an ideal team player of being Humble, Hungry and Smart. Candidates are also attracted to our company because we invest in our people’s personal and professional development by embracing and practicing being a Strength’s-Based company. We focus on developing the talents that you as an individual innately excel at; leveraging and investing in those talents to develop strengths which allow for both individual and team organizational success.  This is an intentional and strategic choice we have made as a company and we believe it gives us the best chance for growth and continued success and differentiates us from our competitors. We believe in helping our employees, unleash their talents by embracing and practicing healthy values daily, collectively, which will ultimate serve ourselves, our team members, our clients, and our market with excellence.  These guiding principles make for a unique, fun, and learning work environment and culture that we all our committed to which connects us as a team. WHAT BENEFITS DO WE OFFER?Competitive pay based on experience, skills, education, and fit.Unlimited paid time off to support a healthy work life balance.Medical, dental, vision, for you and your family at affordable prices.Optional life insurance, flexible spending, and AD&D.SimpleIRA with 3% employer match after one year of employment.100% employer paid short and long-term disability coverage and access to EAP services.
