Name: Data Analyst
Description: Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System  Accountability, Community, Innovation, Leadership, Passion, Quality, Respect, Teamwork  Data Analyst  First Resume Review: 11/30/2018  This position will remain open until filled  Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System (AHCCCS), Arizona's Medicaid Agency, is driven by the passion to deliver comprehensive and cost effective health care to Arizonans in need. AHCCCS is nationally acclaimed as a model for other Medicaid programs and recipient of multiple awards for excellence in workplace effectiveness and flexibility.  All Arizona state employees operate within the Arizona Management System (AMS), an intentional, results-driven approach for doing the work of state government whereby every employee reflects on performance, reduces waste, and commits to continuous improvement with sustainable progress. Through AMS, every state employee seeks to understand customer needs, identify problems, improve processes, and measure results. State employees are highly engaged, collaborative and embrace a culture of public service. Visit our careers page to learn more about AHCCCS. Use your skills to benefit others; join the AHCCCS Team! JOB SUMMARY: The Division of Health Care Management (DHCM) is looking for a highly motivated individual to join our team as a Data Analyst. This position will serve as a data expert in methodology design, validation and quality control of AD Hoc and routine reports extracted from COGNOS and CIS. The analyst will also accurately interpret data results and summarize them in a cohesive and understandable manner for a variety of stakeholders, both within AHCCCS and externally.  Major duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to: Designs methodology, extracts data, provides quality control for Ad Hoc and Routine reports for both internal and external stakeholder projects; (e.g. DIG, SAMSHA, Quality Improvement Performance Measures, Showing Report, CMHS Block Grant, Utilization of Services Report, Provider Sufficiency, Enrollment-Penetration Report TEDS, etc.).Performs complex data processing operations, performs standard and/or routine application programming.Collaborates in the development and implementation of complex methodologies and extracts data to support divisional and departmental needs.Performs ad hoc programming, develops and tests complex database queries for ad hoc and routine reporting.Interfaces with other team members to analyze and design methodologies for complex data extraction from a variety of data sources.Provides departmental support for data extraction methodology and protocols, quality assurance and database management.Provides written and verbal communication regarding the structure and methodologies associated with data extraction, reporting and development.Assists other team members in cross-training, quality control and reporting methodologies.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (KSAs):Demonstrated experience working with systems including COGNOS, Oracle, RDBMS, SQL, Visual Basics, SPSS, CIS, etc.Skilled in database design development, maintenance and modification; ability to comprehend, evaluate and implement complex data queries.Ability to perform complex analytic decisions related to computer programming language and data queries.Demonstrated knowledge of information systems analysis and design techniques and testing methodology.Strong ability to work independently and within a team setting; ability to adapt to changing priorities.Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal relationships.Ability to read and interpret detailed technical and business information.SELECTIVE PREFERENCE(S):Bachelor's Degree in Computer Systems or related degree and at least two years experience in computer programming.Applicable direct job-related experience may substitute for degree.BENEFITS At AHCCCS, we promote the importance of work/life balance by offering workplace flexibility and a variety of learning and career development opportunities. Among the many benefits of a career with the State of Arizona, there are 10 paid holidays per year, accrual of sick and annual leave, affordable medical benefits and participation in the Arizona State Retirement Plan. Click here to learn more about benefits.  Arizona State Government is an EOE/ADA Reasonable Accommodation Employer. Persons with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation such as a sign language interpreter or an alternative format by calling (602) 417-4497. Requests should be made as early as possible to allow sufficient time to arrange the accommodation. AHCCCS is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All newly hired employees will be subject to E-Verify Employment Eligibility Verification.  Click the APPLY NOW button to submit your application.  For technical assistance, email [email protected] or call 602-542-4700.

Name: Management Analyst
Description: Position Overview The Management Analyst oversees the division's Strategic Plan, the 5-Year Community Action Plan, and related performance metrics. The position will also manage HSD Online programmatic requirements, and provide data analysis to guide decision-making and program development efforts. Position Qualifications Minimum education and/or experience:Bachelor's degree in Public Administration, Business Administration, Political Science, or a closely related field and two (2) years of professional analytical experience. Professional analytical experience may substitute for education requirement on a year for year basis. Specialized training, certifications, and/or other special requirements:Must complete background check and fingerprint identification upon hire to secure and maintain a Level 1 DPS Fingerprint Clearance Card. Knowledge, skills, and abilities:Knowledge of:Federal, State, County, and local governance structures. Federal, State, and local laws, ordinances, rules, and regulations related to social service programs. Administrative principles, policies, processes and practices, ideally in a public sector environment. Structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar in order to create and distribute professional correspondence is essential.Skilled In:Exceptional written and verbal communications. Public speaking/presentation. Strong attention to detail and follow-throughs. Reviewing and interpreting laws, regulations, and procedures. Microsoft Office Suite products. Microsoft Excel formatting and generating complex reports. Ability to: Analyze problems and develop solutions and recommendations. Compile, analyze and summarize statistical and technical data. Prepare and present clear, comprehensive administrative reports, write papers, and other technical documents. Prioritize, organize, plan and manage multiple assignments efficiently and effectively, while working independently and making sound decisions. Establish and maintain constructive, trust based and cooperative working relationships with individuals from the public and all levels of the organization. Coordinate activities to meet goals and timelines. Interpret grant regulations and procedures. Preferred education and/or experience:Experience in grants management. Experience in contract administration. Experience in program development within an anti-poverty program. Working conditions:Work is routinely performed in an office environment. May require travel to and from job related locations during the course of a scheduled workday, subject to County policies regarding use of County vehicles and/or private vehicles used on County business. Essential Job Tasks Manages the CSD Strategic Plan and the 5-Year Community Action Plan required under federal legislation. Monitors the timely completion of goals, objectives and strategic initiatives and develops monthly, quarterly and annual management reports for Division Management and the CSD Advisory Commission. Tracks and monitors CSD Performance Metrics, generates dashboard indicators, analyzes performance outcomes and makes recommendations for operational improvements to create organizational efficiencies. Analyzes the effectiveness of existing programs or services and make recommendations for improvement. Conducts research and analyzes existing client profiles to inform CSD Management Team and CSD Advisory Commission in high level decision-making or program development efforts. Participates in various workgroups and committees at the departmental, local and state level to enhance program services. Develops data collection mechanisms, coordinates the compilation of programmatic data, and/or client demographic information, and develops regular and ad hoc reports for management review. Functions as a Liaison to Information Technology (IT) Staff for HSD Online data management issues, reporting, and new or revised database requirements. Conducts system/database testing and develops system desk aides, guidebooks or training manuals. Conducts research to inform the Local Area Needs Assessment required under federal legislation, to include population and poverty statistics obtained from the U.S. Census Bureau. Functions as the lead for the CSD Customer Satisfaction Survey as required under federal regulations; develops survey questions, analyzes results and makes recommendations for improvements. Maintains and updates CSD funding formulas with yearly population statistics published by American Community Survey; analyzes impact and advises management of significant anomalies. Maintains and updates the CSD Web Page, CSD Annual Report, Brochures, and Programmatic Literature, and develops marketing or outreach materials as assigned. Analyzes the reporting requirements of each CSD program or fund source, including application data elements, and determines necessary changes to data collection systems including HSD Online. Selection Procedure The hiring authority will select the successful candidate based on departmental needs. All offers of employment made to new hires and rehires at Maricopa County are contingent upon successful completion of a post-offer, pre-employment thorough background investigation. A background investigation is conducted on a current employee who changes to a Safety Sensitive Position or one having the potential for serious adverse impact on the integrity or efficiency of the County. These requirements do not pertain to employees of elected officials who undergo background investigation processes administered through their respective offices.Typically successful candidates are hired at a salary rate, up to midpoint of the range, based on applicable experience, internal equity and budgetary allowances.

Name: Analyst Cyber Security
Description: SRP is one of the largest public power and water utilities in the U.S. providing electricity to approximately one million customers in the greater metropolitan Phoenix area. Since its founding in 1903, SRP has fostered a culture of stewardship and customer service consistently ranking as an industry leader in customer service according to J.D. Power. SRP continues to adapt to its changing business environment by seeking innovative ways to reimagine utility service and the provision of critical resources essential to the life and economy of Arizona.Job Brief The Cyber Security Analyst will work in SRP's Security Operations Center (SOC) which is responsible for monitoring of, responding to, and mitigating cyber security events across the enterprise. This role will be responsible for supporting the Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) environment used by the operations team, assisting with cyber security event triage, and reviewing and improving SOC processes and procedures.  Candidates should have a strong understanding of Information Technology fundamentals with an awareness of cyber security defense technologies utilized in enterprise environments. Job ResponsibilitiesPerforms cyber security tasks such as system administration, requirements definition, analysis, design, programming, testing, and implementation.Applies standard processes/methods, practices and techniques.Responsible for SRP's compliance with various federal and state regulations as well as industry compliance requirements.Ensuring SRP's cyber security policies reflect current compliance standards (e.g. NIST, NERC CIP)Monitors and analyzes network traffic to identify unusual activity patterns and to recognize malicious attacksEducation Completion of a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution that prepares the employee for the assignment. Experience Promotion to level 2 requires a minimum of two years of experience at level 1; demonstrated capability to perform advanced and more difficult work as determined by the supervisor. Promotion to senior level requires a minimum of three-years of experience at level 2; is fully competent in all aspects of functional area of assignment and as such would be recognized as a specialist in area of assignment and may have periodic or occasional lead responsibilities. Experience Preferred5+ years of experience working in Information Technology and/or Information Security roles2+ years of experience administering a distributed Splunk environment (index clusters, search head clusters, universal and heavy forwarders, deployment server)Experience with installing and configuring Splunk AppsExperience managing Linux servers (CentOS or RedHat)Experience with Python and shell scriptingExperience with Splunk App for Enterprise Security a plusStrong desire to develop both Splunk and Cyber Security skillsAdditional Information Work schedule is flexible but primary coverage required during daytime business hours. Role requires participation in department on-call rotation which involves responding to emergency callout during non-business hours, as needed. Travel occasionally required for industry training and conferences that cannot be found locally.  The following certifications would be a plus: Splunk Enterprise Certified AdminSplunk Enterprise Certified ArchitectCyber Security related certifications (Security+, CISSP, etc.)Requisition Details Requisition ID: 8935  EOE - SRP encourages a diverse workforce  All candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States.  Currently, SRP does not sponsor H1B visas. Why Work at SRP SRP's success is rooted in our employees' happiness, health and safety. That's why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to meet the needs of our employees and enhance their well-being. In addition to competitive pay and performance incentives, eligible employees can take advantage of the following benefits:  • 401(k) plan with employer matching Retirement pensionPaid vacationParental leaveHoliday paySick leaveMedical, vision, dental and life insuranceWellness programsPre-tax benefitsShort and long-term disability plansTuition assistance

Name: QA Analyst
Description: Summary:Working within established quality assurance standards, the QA Test Engineer supports delivery of high quality software products by designing test strategies and test cases to validate customer business features using manual and/or automated test execution methods, ensuring that the product meets customer expectations. As a member of an Agile Scrum team, the QA Test Engineer participates in requirement/user story review and grooming sessions, ensuring clear definition of requirements and user acceptance criteria. In addition to performing various types of testing activities such as functional, integration, system, performance, and regression, the QA Test Engineer provides regular activity status updates to Scrum team members and management, and reports and tracks product defects and deficiencies in a defect management system.Essential Functions:Work with the project team to estimate User Stories and define the scope for testing. Create the corresponding test strategies, test plans, and test cases as needed.Work effectively and collaboratively within the scrum team, across scrum teams, and with other members on the product team.Work within established standards in the QA organizationCreate and maintain test environments and test data.Manage and maintain test cases in ALM.Track sprint progress accurately in AGM.Detect defects as early in the life cycle as possible. Report, track, and manage any discovered defects to resolution.Troubleshoot problems and find the root cause of issues and defects.Prepare progress reports and provide other metrics to management as needed.Actively contribute to development and implementation of Quality Assurance best practices and process improvements throughout the department.Required skills:Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or EngineeringMinimum one and one-half years' experience in the software development/quality assurance field, including experience with software product testing and validation in an Agile development environment, and use of defect tracking and test case management systems.Write and understand SQL queries in order to perform backend (database) testing.Experience in an agile development environment.Experience with HP Quality Center (QC) and/or HP Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) (or equivalent toolset) for test and defect management.Experience with HP Agile Manager (AGM) or equivalent tool for release planning and for tracking of sprint progress.Basic understanding and experience in writing and executing test automation scripts.Experience in working with databases like creating DBs, backups, and restores.Experience in regression resting, functional testing, backend/database Testing, black box testing, etc.Experience in testing .net applications, SQL Server, Windows web servers, etc.Basic knowledge of Windows servers, deployments and installations.Solid experience with a development language(s), e.g., C#, VB scripting.Proficiency Experience with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).Good verbal and written communication skills. Good presentation skills.Desired skills:Health care technology experience.Hands-on experience with Gherkin, Gherkin, Selenium, nUnit.Hands-on experience with MS Visual Studio.Web-service testing (SOAP UI).Job Location : Phoenix, Arizona, United States  Employee Status : Full Time Employee  Shift : Day Job  Travel : No  Job Posting : Sep 29 2018  Cognizant US Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran. If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions in the US, please send an email with your request to CareersNA2@cognizant.com  About CognizantCognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: About JDA Software Group, Inc.At JDA, we’re fearless leaders! We’re the leading provider of seamless supply chain planning and execution solutions for retailers, manufacturers, logistics providers and wholesale distributors for more than 4,000 customers worldwide. Our unmatched solution portfolio enables our clients to reduce costs, increase profitability and improve visibility so they can deliver on customer promises every time. More than 4,000 global customers run JDA, including 73 of the top 100 retailers, 71 of the top 100 consumer goods companies, and 13 of the top 16 3PLs. With JDA, you can plan to deliver. www.jda.com Position Title Business Systems Analyst Intermediate Location Scottsdale, AZ USA Overview JDA's vision for the future is the creation of an Autonomous Supply Chain™. To achieve this vision, we have started the transformation to a SaaS model. As we transform as a company and culture, our needs for talent are also evolving.  This role will play an integral part in building innovative solutions across the JDA product portfolio as part of our Enterprise Architecture group within the Research and Development organization. The focus of the role will include, but not be limited to, supporting the integration solution design and data modeling efforts to ensure the business objective of the end-to-end solution. The ideal candidate will possess excellent problem-solving skills, innovative thinking, and broad supply chain domain expertise to help solve complex business problems. Name: Sales Business Analyst
Description: Job Title: Salesforce/Financial Business AnalystCompany Description:Limelight Networks, Inc. (Nasdaq: LLNW) is the content delivery partner for thousands of entertainment, technology, enterprise and government entities around the globe. Limelight’s mission is to securely manage and globally deliver digital content, building customer satisfaction through exceptional reliability and performance.Job Purpose:The Financial Business Analyst works on key initiatives in support of the Sales Team customer lifecycle by interacting with other members of the Sales Management team to ensure effective coordination, planning, and execution of sales meetings, communication, process and sales enablement/knowledge. Sales Operations Analyst helps define and track key sales processes and metrics. The Sales Business Analyst is responsible for a timely and accurate response to the business needs and information request from the global sales and account management team.Essential Functions:Manage Salesforce Reports and Dashboards for the Sales Team.Oversee the internal communication process for the Sales Staff and serve as the corporate conduit for all written sales communications to Executive staff.Design and maintain the Sales Resource Center portal and ensure its ongoing utilization and relevance to the Sales team.Design and enhance processes to be utilized by the Sales Team to improve their overall effectiveness (e.g., Account Plans and Sales to Account Manager Handoffs).Coordinate efforts for the annual voice of the customer programs including oversight for outside vendors, system setup, internal team communications on the process, progress and follow-up action response planning and execution.Sales Opportunity Support- oversees the entire process of submission efforts.Other duties as assigned by management related to continual improvement of revenue generation and customer value delivery functions and effectively plan, coordinate and execute on projects independently.Qualifications:Experience and Education (minimums)Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Finance or related field.2-3 years’ experience in Sales Operations.Proven Data Management Skills in a fast-paced work environment.Experience with Salesforce.com Reports and Dashboards strongly preferred.Knowledge, Skills & AbilitiesAble to identify process gaps and effectively communicate with a Salesforce Administrator on engineering new sales processes supported in CRM.Proficient in MS Excel, MS Word, and PowerPoint.Experience in managing large datasets quickly and effectively. Strong ability to model data, and report forecast trends, churn and funnel metrics.Strong written and verbal communication skills, excellent cognitive reasoning, analytical, planning and process development skills, strong business judgment, business acumen, and high level of initiative.Ability to work on projects with minimal oversight at times, you’re a self-starter.Comfortable interfacing with Executive Leadership, Legal, Finance, Deal Desk, Product, Marketing and all Sales roles in the organization.Ability to rapidly gain a demonstrated knowledge and understanding of defined sales cycle.Ability to respond effectively to multiple conflicting priorities, continuously prioritize and reprioritize deliverables and to respond in a dynamic work environment.Interested in learning new technologies to support the business, including but not limited to Salesforce, Salesforce CPQ (Configure Price Quote), Salesforce App Exchange Products, and BI tools.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job Description As a Senior Business Analyst you will require the coordinate efforts across multiple functional teams including internal and external clients. You must be able to work well with all team members and be able to write clear, concise documentation.  You must be able and willing to quickly adapt to changes in the environment. In this job, you will be responsible for creating new, modifying existing, and analyzing reporting requests.  The successful candidate will possess the following: ability to focus on details; good organization skills; experience with Microsoft products (access, excel, word, PowerPoint, etc.); must meet all commitments on given time schedule; and develop any documentation as needed. Required Qualifications2+ years of experience working in a reporting or testing environment.Preferred QualificationsIt is preferred that the candidate have experience with the following: gathering requirements; creating written requirement documentation and working with internal and external clients.Education Bachelor's required. Business Overview CVS Health, through our unmatched breadth of service offerings, is transforming the delivery of health care services in the U.S. We are an innovative, fast-growing company guided by values that focus on teamwork, integrity and respect for our colleagues and customers. What are we looking for in our colleagues? We seek fresh ideas, new perspectives, a diversity of experiences, and a dedication to service that will help us better meet the needs of the many people and businesses that rely on us each day. As the nations largest pharmacy health care provider, we offer a wide range of exciting and fulfilling career opportunities across our three business units MinuteClinic, pharmacy benefit management (PBM) and retail pharmacy. Our energetic and service-oriented colleagues work hard every day to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers.  CVS Health is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or employment against any individual on the basis of race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, religion, sex/gender (including pregnancy), national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, physical or mental disability, medical condition, age, veteran status, military status, marital status, genetic information, citizenship status, unemployment status, political affiliation, or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law. CVS Health will consider qualified job candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with federal, state and local laws. CVS Health will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against any Colleague or applicant for employment because such Colleague or applicant has inquired about, discussed, or disclosed the compensation of the Colleague or applicant or another Colleague or applicant. Furthermore, we comply with the laws and regulations set forth in the following EEO is the Law Poster: EEO IS THE LAW and EEO IS THE LAW SUPPLEMENT  Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance to apply for this job, please contact us by clicking Advice and Counsel  CVS Health does not require nor expect that applicants disclose their compensation history during the application, interview, and hiring process.  For inquiries related to the application process or technical issues please contact the Kenexa Helpdesk at 1-855-338-5609. For technical issues with the Virtual Job Tryout assessment, contact the Shaker Help Desk at 1-877-987-5352. Please note that we only accept resumes via our corporate website: https://jobs.cvshealth.com/

Name: HIPAA Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary: This position will be assisting the Corporate Responsibility Officer to develop and manage system-wide HIPAA privacy and security functions, including the evaluation of industry standard and best practices in the area of health care privacy and security. Develops, implements, maintains and revises Notice of Privacy Practices, and corporate privacy and security policies and procedures, as needed, to maintain an effective program. Advises department managers regarding privacy and security-related activity to be conducted in the operating units and monitors to ensure alignment with applicable law. Develops and delivers privacy and security education and training to all appropriate staff. Conducts routine and complex HIPAA privacy and security audits and investigations. Provides subject matter guidance on interpretation and application of HIPAA privacy and security rules and regulations. Qualifications: Relevant training/education/experience in health information management or related field, OR equivalent combination of education and experience, and 1 to 5 years experience in health care privacy/security/compliance. Ability to prioritize and meet deadlines. Demonstrated ability to provide feedback to managers and physicians regarding federal and state privacy and security regulations, compliance guidelines, and audit results and risk areas. Excellent verbal and written communication

Description: Job DescriptionSRP is one of the largest public power and water utilities in the U.S. providing electricity to approximately one million customers in the greater metropolitan Phoenix area. Since its founding in 1903, SRP has fostered a culture of stewardship and customer service consistently ranking as an industry leader in customer service according to J.D. Power. SRP continues to adapt to its changing business environment by seeking innovative ways to reimagine utility service and the provision of critical resources essential to the life and economy of Arizona. Job Brief The candidate will be part of the Unified Messaging & Voice (UMV) team, whose mission is to support industry leading technologies and provide exemplary customer service to SRP stakeholders who rely on our messaging, mobility, voice, conferencing and collaboration services and supporting systems, including: email, calendaring, instant messaging, telephony, video conferencing, mobile communications and the mobility device and application management platform for stakeholders to access SRP applications and data. This position is responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting enterprise-wide voice, conferencing and collaboration platforms to provide consistent, reliable and secure communications services to SRP stakeholders and customers. Voice, Conferencing and Collaboration service offerings and products include: * Corporate Phone System (Atos Unify, Ribbon SBC, AVST, Empirix) * Corporate Voice Recorders (ASC) * Dispatch Phone System (Atos Unify, Ribbon SBC, Empirix) * Dispatch Voice Recorders (NICE) * Enhanced 911 Services (Enable e911) * Voice & Video Conferencing (Skype for Business, Polycom Video, Atos Unify, Ribbon SBC, Unify2, WebEx) Job Responsibilities * Support, maintain and monitor SRP's Voice, Conferencing & Collaboration environment * Troubleshoot and determine root causes of complex issues, failures or outages that could include issues with applications, operating systems, services, network connectivity and other infrastructure (e.g. leveraging packet capture technologies, log analysis, etc.) * Work within a defined set of IT service management processes and procedures, including: Incident, Request and Change management * Work with stakeholders and Information Technology peers to design, deliver and support Voice, Conferencing & Collaboration services and products * Provide scheduled after hours rotational support for on-call, security patching, software updates and change controls * Support ongoing and future Voice, Conferencing & Collaboration projects based on the technology roadmap Education Completion of a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution that prepares the employee for the assignment. Experience Promotion to Level 2 requires a minimum of two years of experience at Level 1; demonstrated capability to perform advanced and more difficult work as determined by the supervisor. Promotion to Senior Level requires a minimum of three-years of experience at Level 2; is fully competent in all aspects of functional area of assignment and as such would be recognized as a specialist in area of assignment and may have periodic or occasional lead responsibilities. Additional Information Requires in-depth working knowledge of and experience with multiple technical areas across a large- scale enterprise environment in the following areas: * Systems administration in large-scale voice environments * Proven experience with SIP Enterprise Telephony * Proven experience with VoIP Enterprise Telephony * Proven experience with Enterprise Telephony and 3rd party application integrations, including: voice mail systems, E911 systems, and voice recorders * Microsoft Skype for Business 2015 deployments * Windows 2012-16 server Operating Systems * Active Directory, Group Policy, NTFS permissions, DNS, Load Balancing * Architecting applications for High Availability and Disaster Recovery * Public and Private encryption Key Certificates Preferred requirements include knowledge and experience in the following areas: * Network troubleshooting skills in relation to VoIP/SIP * Integrating multiple platforms via SIP * Skype for Business Enterprise Voice * Polycom Video Conferencing * Office 365 Hybrid Deployments: Skype for Business, Teams The successful candidate will possess the following strengths: * Understanding of the OSI model and general networking concepts as they relate to application architecture. * A strong background in client support and demonstrated ability to work with clients of varied technical skill levels. * Expert knowledge in many areas of the role's technology focus including service design, monitoring, alerting, management, integration & migration, backup & disaster recovery, in a large organization with multiple data centers. * Expert knowledge and application of Microsoft and/or industry best practices and security principles for enterprise telephony and integrated communication and collaboration solutions. * Detail oriented

This analyst will also act as a liaison with the HR functional teams and IT technical team, supporting the HR team with technology and reporting requests. acceptance testingManaging table set ups and back end functionality including mass updates/loads and centralized correction of SAP employee records.Create reports and data analytics making recommendations to our internal and external clients providing alternatives to aid in maximizing efficiencies.Design and creation of metrics and analytics to improve our HR processes and people investments.Identify and resolve system data issues and partner with I.T. on monitoring interfaces.Supply thorough customer service, maintain positive client/customer relations, and work efficiently in the name of the client.Maintain knowledge of functional area and company policies and procedures.Ability to adapt to a flexible schedule.Perform other duties as assigned by management.Technical Skills:Technical expertise in SAP HCM/Payroll system with the ability to pay strong attention to detail while analyzing data.Ability to use good judgment by using time management skills, planning ahead, strong collaboration, building contingency plans and finding alternate solutions when original request is not possible.Able to communicate effectively and in a constructive manner, verbally and in writing, with all levels of the organization and vendors, inclusive of communicating schedules and timelinesProficient with Microsoft Outlook and Office (Word, Excel, Power Point) as well as Adobe Acrobat, Visio, Access and other commonly used applications.Able to demonstrate strong organizational skills.Strong problem solving skills (i.e. critical, strategic, and evaluative thinking).Must be a self-starter with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities with urgent deadlines, maintaining excellent customer service skills, while working in a fast paced team environment.Skill in researching and analyzing information related to HR and Business processes/best practices.Skill in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with co-workers, other employees, management, external organizations and the general public.Ability to take direction from multiple sources and communicate deltas appropriately.Detail oriented and accurate For more info reach me on Vishnu 704-804-7461- provided by Dice  HRIS, Payroll, SAP

Name: Sr. Business Analyst - IAM
Description: What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Name: Cloud Business Analyst (BSC5)
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we have one goal: to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them achieve their dreams. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Enterprise Finance & Information Technology offers technology and services that exceed Wells Fargo customers expectations and directly enable them to succeed financially. We interact with customers more than 12 billion times a year through in-store, online, ATM, and telephone transactions. We impact customers directly, through systems availability and security, as well as indirectly, through our business partners who offer and deliver a myriad of products and services that meet customers financial needs. We provide a competitive advantage for the company through excellence in fundamentals, integrated partnerships, and our talented and engaged team members.  As a Cloud Business Analyst (Business Systems Consultant 5) with the Cloud Foundry Engineering organization, you will be integral in efforts focused on driving internal adoption of the Pivotal Cloud Foundry platform offering. As a member of the team, you are responsible for assisting in defining and executing a product roadmap that expands and matures our platform solution by enabling more business units to deploy applications to the cloud.  This role is inherently cross-functional: you will work closely with the Technical Product Manager/Business Analyst; as well as the engineering, operations, application development, finance, and executive teams to set strategy, launch features, and grow business opportunities for Wells Fargo. This role is a member of a highly visible team that requires you to partner with a variety of leaders and teams across Wells Fargo and engage with leadership at customer organizations and third-party vendors.  The Cloud Business Analyst (Business Systems Consultant 5) is expected to: Perform business analysis/business systems consultant responsibilities while learning technical product management and project management responsibilities for Cloud Foundry Engineering; participating in the Agile functions for the PaaS teamsBuild relationships and collaborate with highly skilled Engineers (Cloud, Systems, Security), as well as with the Technical Product Owner/Business Analyst and business partners to ensure planning, strategy and execution of solutions align with requirements, compliance and bank standards.Partner in execution of the product strategy for driving PCF adoption within key verticals and use cases, including defining and delivering new features and services.Develop crisp, detailed business requirements, documentation, and other project deliverables that can be used to create development specifications and architecture for platforms and applications.Possess the ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, manage tradeoffs, and evaluate new ideas and opportunities with internal and external partners.Partner with Wells Fargos solution architecture, security, and application development organizations to define and drive go-to-market activities.Proactively identify and resolve issues that may impair the teams ability to meet strategic, financial, and technical goals.Strong analytical skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions.High attention to detail, including precise and effective customer communications and a proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously. Successful candidates are strong technical leaders who have demonstrated: Technical breadth and depth with platforms, including experience working with IaaS/PaaS, web services, or back-end application infrastructure.Experience driving focus and quality within strong, talented, cross-functional teams to deliver technical products and projects in a fast-paced environment.Strong track record of defining multi-year product strategies, executing on associated roadmaps, and consistent delivery of results.Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, manage tradeoffs, and evaluate new ideas and opportunities with internal and external partners.Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions.High attention to detail, including precise and effective customer communications and a proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.Required Qualifications7+ years of business systems analysis experience, business systems design experience, or a combination of both2+ years of data analysis experience2+ years of Agile experience7+ years of experience capturing and documenting complex business and functional requirements1+ years of experience with Cloud technologies5+ years of relationship management experience with business and technology partnersDesired QualificationsExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsAbility to articulate complex concepts in a clear mannerAbility to negotiate, influence, and collaborate to build successful relationshipsIntermediate Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint) skillsStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyOther Desired Qualifications3+ years of knowledge and understanding and/or experience with IT concepts including any of the following: Cloud services and platforms (Pivotal Cloud Foundry, AWS, GCP, Azure), VMware, PaaS, IaaS, SaaS, Security IT principles1+ years of relationship management experience within Cloud servicesAbility and desire to learn new concepts and skillsDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: IT Compliance Analyst
Description: Atrilogy Solutions Groups direct client is currently looking for an IT Compliance Analyst in Phoenix, AZ, 6 months Contract. The IT Compliance Analyst is responsible for ensuring security controls are in place for frameworks such as PCI DSS, Publication 1075, etc. This role collects data, tests audit evidence and processes, and documents, associated procedures according to IT audit guidance. This role interacts frequently with customers and requires attention to audit detail and project deadlines.  Experience: 2-4 years of IT Audit Technical Skills & Proficiency:Ability to audit various operating systems, databases, and applications.Additionally, audit technology processes and controls to assist with PCI, IRS and other framework compliance.Experience with PCI DSS, Publication 1075, NIST requirementsExperience with Information Technology auditsIntermediate to Advanced knowledge of Excel For immediate consideration please submit your resume in Word format, along with daytime contact information. All submittals will be treated confidentially. Selected candidate may be asked to pass a comprehensive background, credit and/or drug screening. Principals only, no third parties please. Established in 2000, Atrilogy Solutions Group, Inc. provides organizations of all sizes with high-quality, cost effective information technology (IT) and business process consulting & staffing services. Our industry-leading service model combines experienced project managers with seasoned technical and functional consultants to eliminate client uncertainty and deliver superior value and results. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Atrilogy also has offices in Denver, Phoenix, Atlanta, and Dallas with satellite offices in Boston, Jersey City, Las Vegas, Seattle, and Delhi, India.  Atrilogy Solutions Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Name: Senior Research Informatics, Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: OverviewLocated in the heart of Phoenix, Ariz., St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center is a 586-bed, not-for-profit hospital that provides a wide range of health, social and support services with special advocacy for the poor and underserved. St. Joseph's is a nationally recognized center for quality tertiary care, medical education and research. It includes the internationally renowned Barrow Neurological Institute, the Muhammad Ali Parkinson Center, the Norton Thoracic Institute, a campus of Creighton University's Medical School and the first Level I Trauma Center in Arizona verified by the American College of Surgeons. U.S. News & World Report routinely ranks St. Joseph's among the best hospitals in the United States for neurology and neurosurgery. For more information please visit our website at https://www.dignityhealth.org/arizona/locations/stjosephs.ResponsibilitiesPosition Summary: The Research Business Intelligence Architect is responsible for leading the development of BI solutions and related reports implemented in enterprise Research Administration Data systems. These include the components of the various web, database, and application services provided by Research Administration to the corporate infrastructure and regional investigator needs. This position is responsible for ensuring accuracy and quality control methodologies of all analytics deployed to end-users including timely clinical and financial data integration and transformation as well as analytics tools, dashboards and scorecards for all end-users.  This position is also responsible for leading the development and implementation of the strategic vision of the Research Business Intelligence and Data Analytics program to meet the needs of research investigators and collaborators throughout the enterprise. The Research BI Architect acts as part of the internal consulting team to facilities and investigators in all matters relating to research business intelligence, data analytic and reporting needs to maintain a robust and easily accessible research data warehouse consistent with good clinical practices (GCP), research compliance laws, regulatory requirements surrounding data use and Dignity Health policies.QualificationsEducation and Experience: 2 years Clinical/Healthcare data analytic experience. Broad functional background in the area assigned (Research, healthcare delivery). Enterprise reporting business experience.  Designing and developing customer solutions using SQL Server 2014 (SSAS/SSRS/SSIS) and coding experience in C# required. Designing and developing visualizations using Tipco Spotfire, PowerBi and/or Tableau experience preferred. Ability to do significant amounts of research and testing involved in understanding the technologies. Strong project management, problem solving, and leadership skills. Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, with ability to effectively communicate at different levels of an organization. Ability to prepare and present effective Powerpoint presentations and conduct end-user training Knowledge of the Cerner application suite. Strong understanding of: System Analysis, System Design. Process redesign including documentation of current and future state workflow processes. Ability to test, analyze, trouble shoot, and isolate complex problems. System configuration consultation to meet clinical needs. Functional hardware skills. Understanding of clinician needs and practice patterns, as well as, hospital operations and workflow.  4-year University or College degree in Computer Science / Information Technology or related field. Preferred:  5 years Clinical/Healthcare data analytic experience. Experience with enterprise reporting technologies, including methodologies, development, and implementation of BI solutions in a healthcare environment. Training in system design and/or build experience.  Informatics Certification, Masters strongly preferred. Advanced degree.

Name: Management Analyst
Description: Position Overview The Management Analyst oversees the division's Strategic Plan, the 5-Year Community Action Plan, and related performance metrics. The position will also manage HSD Online programmatic requirements, and provide data analysis to guide decision-making and program development efforts. Position Qualifications Minimum education and/or experience:Bachelor's degree in Public Administration, Business Administration, Political Science, or a closely related field and two (2) years of professional analytical experience. Professional analytical experience may substitute for education requirement on a year for year basis. Specialized training, certifications, and/or other special requirements:Must complete background check and fingerprint identification upon hire to secure and maintain a Level 1 DPS Fingerprint Clearance Card. Knowledge, skills, and abilities:Knowledge of:Federal, State, County, and local governance structures. Federal, State, and local laws, ordinances, rules, and regulations related to social service programs. Administrative principles, policies, processes and practices, ideally in a public sector environment. Structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar in order to create and distribute professional correspondence is essential.Skilled In:Exceptional written and verbal communications. Public speaking/presentation. Strong attention to detail and follow-throughs. Reviewing and interpreting laws, regulations, and procedures. Microsoft Office Suite products. Microsoft Excel formatting and generating complex reports. Ability to: Analyze problems and develop solutions and recommendations. Compile, analyze and summarize statistical and technical data. Prepare and present clear, comprehensive administrative reports, write papers, and other technical documents. Prioritize, organize, plan and manage multiple assignments efficiently and effectively, while working independently and making sound decisions. Establish and maintain constructive, trust based and cooperative working relationships with individuals from the public and all levels of the organization. Coordinate activities to meet goals and timelines. Interpret grant regulations and procedures. Preferred education and/or experience:Experience in grants management. Experience in contract administration. Experience in program development within an anti-poverty program. Working conditions:Work is routinely performed in an office environment. May require travel to and from job related locations during the course of a scheduled workday, subject to County policies regarding use of County vehicles and/or private vehicles used on County business. Essential Job Tasks Manages the CSD Strategic Plan and the 5-Year Community Action Plan required under federal legislation. Monitors the timely completion of goals, objectives and strategic initiatives and develops monthly, quarterly and annual management reports for Division Management and the CSD Advisory Commission. Tracks and monitors CSD Performance Metrics, generates dashboard indicators, analyzes performance outcomes and makes recommendations for operational improvements to create organizational efficiencies. Analyzes the effectiveness of existing programs or services and make recommendations for improvement. Conducts research and analyzes existing client profiles to inform CSD Management Team and CSD Advisory Commission in high level decision-making or program development efforts. Participates in various workgroups and committees at the departmental, local and state level to enhance program services. Develops data collection mechanisms, coordinates the compilation of programmatic data, and/or client demographic information, and develops regular and ad hoc reports for management review. Functions as a Liaison to Information Technology (IT) Staff for HSD Online data management issues, reporting, and new or revised database requirements. Conducts system/database testing and develops system desk aides, guidebooks or training manuals. Conducts research to inform the Local Area Needs Assessment required under federal legislation, to include population and poverty statistics obtained from the U.S. Census Bureau. Functions as the lead for the CSD Customer Satisfaction Survey as required under federal regulations; develops survey questions, analyzes results and makes recommendations for improvements. Maintains and updates CSD funding formulas with yearly population statistics published by American Community Survey; analyzes impact and advises management of significant anomalies. Maintains and updates the CSD Web Page, CSD Annual Report, Brochures, and Programmatic Literature, and develops marketing or outreach materials as assigned. Analyzes the reporting requirements of each CSD program or fund source, including application data elements, and determines necessary changes to data collection systems including HSD Online. Selection Procedure The hiring authority will select the successful candidate based on departmental needs. All offers of employment made to new hires and rehires at Maricopa County are contingent upon successful completion of a post-offer, pre-employment thorough background investigation. A background investigation is conducted on a current employee who changes to a Safety Sensitive Position or one having the potential for serious adverse impact on the integrity or efficiency of the County. These requirements do not pertain to employees of elected officials who undergo background investigation processes administered through their respective offices.Typically successful candidates are hired at a salary rate, up to midpoint of the range, based on applicable experience, internal equity and budgetary allowances.

Name: Analyst Cyber Security
Description: SRP is one of the largest public power and water utilities in the U.S. providing electricity to approximately one million customers in the greater metropolitan Phoenix area. Since its founding in 1903, SRP has fostered a culture of stewardship and customer service consistently ranking as an industry leader in customer service according to J.D. Power. SRP continues to adapt to its changing business environment by seeking innovative ways to reimagine utility service and the provision of critical resources essential to the life and economy of Arizona.Job Brief The Cyber Security Analyst will work in SRP's Security Operations Center (SOC) which is responsible for monitoring of, responding to, and mitigating cyber security events across the enterprise. This role will be responsible for supporting the Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) environment used by the operations team, assisting with cyber security event triage, and reviewing and improving SOC processes and procedures.  Candidates should have a strong understanding of Information Technology fundamentals with an awareness of cyber security defense technologies utilized in enterprise environments. Job ResponsibilitiesPerforms cyber security tasks such as system administration, requirements definition, analysis, design, programming, testing, and implementation.Applies standard processes/methods, practices and techniques.Responsible for SRP's compliance with various federal and state regulations as well as industry compliance requirements.Ensuring SRP's cyber security policies reflect current compliance standards (e.g. NIST, NERC CIP)Monitors and analyzes network traffic to identify unusual activity patterns and to recognize malicious attacksEducation Completion of a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution that prepares the employee for the assignment. Experience Promotion to level 2 requires a minimum of two years of experience at level 1; demonstrated capability to perform advanced and more difficult work as determined by the supervisor. Promotion to senior level requires a minimum of three-years of experience at level 2; is fully competent in all aspects of functional area of assignment and as such would be recognized as a specialist in area of assignment and may have periodic or occasional lead responsibilities. Experience Preferred5+ years of experience working in Information Technology and/or Information Security roles2+ years of experience administering a distributed Splunk environment (index clusters, search head clusters, universal and heavy forwarders, deployment server)Experience with installing and configuring Splunk AppsExperience managing Linux servers (CentOS or RedHat)Experience with Python and shell scriptingExperience with Splunk App for Enterprise Security a plusStrong desire to develop both Splunk and Cyber Security skillsAdditional Information Work schedule is flexible but primary coverage required during daytime business hours. Role requires participation in department on-call rotation which involves responding to emergency callout during non-business hours, as needed. Travel occasionally required for industry training and conferences that cannot be found locally.  The following certifications would be a plus: Splunk Enterprise Certified AdminSplunk Enterprise Certified ArchitectCyber Security related certifications (Security+, CISSP, etc.)Requisition Details Requisition ID: 8935  EOE - SRP encourages a diverse workforce  All candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States.  Currently, SRP does not sponsor H1B visas. Why Work at SRP SRP's success is rooted in our employees' happiness, health and safety. That's why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to meet the needs of our employees and enhance their well-being. In addition to competitive pay and performance incentives, eligible employees can take advantage of the following benefits:  • 401(k) plan with employer matching Retirement pensionPaid vacationParental leaveHoliday paySick leaveMedical, vision, dental and life insuranceWellness programsPre-tax benefitsShort and long-term disability plansTuition assistance

Name: QA Analyst
Description: Summary:Working within established quality assurance standards, the QA Test Engineer supports delivery of high quality software products by designing test strategies and test cases to validate customer business features using manual and/or automated test execution methods, ensuring that the product meets customer expectations. As a member of an Agile Scrum team, the QA Test Engineer participates in requirement/user story review and grooming sessions, ensuring clear definition of requirements and user acceptance criteria. In addition to performing various types of testing activities such as functional, integration, system, performance, and regression, the QA Test Engineer provides regular activity status updates to Scrum team members and management, and reports and tracks product defects and deficiencies in a defect management system.Essential Functions:Work with the project team to estimate User Stories and define the scope for testing. Create the corresponding test strategies, test plans, and test cases as needed.Work effectively and collaboratively within the scrum team, across scrum teams, and with other members on the product team.Work within established standards in the QA organizationCreate and maintain test environments and test data.Manage and maintain test cases in ALM.Track sprint progress accurately in AGM.Detect defects as early in the life cycle as possible. Report, track, and manage any discovered defects to resolution.Troubleshoot problems and find the root cause of issues and defects.Prepare progress reports and provide other metrics to management as needed.Actively contribute to development and implementation of Quality Assurance best practices and process improvements throughout the department.Required skills:Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or EngineeringMinimum one and one-half years' experience in the software development/quality assurance field, including experience with software product testing and validation in an Agile development environment, and use of defect tracking and test case management systems.Write and understand SQL queries in order to perform backend (database) testing.Experience in an agile development environment.Experience with HP Quality Center (QC) and/or HP Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) (or equivalent toolset) for test and defect management.Experience with HP Agile Manager (AGM) or equivalent tool for release planning and for tracking of sprint progress.Basic understanding and experience in writing and executing test automation scripts.Experience in working with databases like creating DBs, backups, and restores.Experience in regression resting, functional testing, backend/database Testing, black box testing, etc.Experience in testing .net applications, SQL Server, Windows web servers, etc.Basic knowledge of Windows servers, deployments and installations.Solid experience with a development language(s), e.g., C#, VB scripting.Proficiency Experience with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).Good verbal and written communication skills. Good presentation skills.Desired skills:Health care technology experience.Hands-on experience with Gherkin, Gherkin, Selenium, nUnit.Hands-on experience with MS Visual Studio.Web-service testing (SOAP UI).Job Location : Phoenix, Arizona, United States  Employee Status : Full Time Employee  Shift : Day Job  Travel : No  Job Posting : Sep 29 2018  Cognizant US Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran. If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions in the US, please send an email with your request to CareersNA2@cognizant.com  About CognizantCognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: USJobsCognizant.Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System  Accountability, Community, Innovation, Leadership, Passion, Quality, Respect, Teamwork  Financial Analyst  First Resume Review: 11/30/2018  This position will remain open until filled  Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System (AHCCCS), Arizona's Medicaid Agency, is driven by the passion to deliver comprehensive and cost effective health care to Arizonans in need. AHCCCS is nationally acclaimed as a model for other Medicaid programs and recipient of multiple awards for excellence in workplace effectiveness and flexibility.  All Arizona state employees operate within the Arizona Management System (AMS), an intentional, results-driven approach for doing the work of state government whereby every employee reflects on performance, reduces waste, and commits to continuous improvement with sustainable progress. Through AMS, every state employee seeks to understand customer needs, identify problems, improve processes, and measure results. State employees are highly engaged, collaborative and embrace a culture of public service. Visit our careers page to learn more about AHCCCS. Use your skills to benefit others; join the AHCCCS Team! JOB SUMMARY: The Division of Health Care Management (DHCM) is looking for a highly motivated individual to join our team as a Financial Analyst. This position is a key position in the area of financial oversight and reporting. The position will prepare financial summaries of the AHCCCS Acute Care, CRS, CMDP, Long-Term Care Programs and Medicare Advantage from the contractors' interim, unaudited quarterly financial statements, draft annual audit and final annual audit reports. Major duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to: Develop, prepare and distribute a variety of reports, charts and graphs including: quarterly financial summaries for the Acute, ALTCS, MAPD, CRS and CMDP programs.Develop, prepare and distribute a variety of reports, charts and graphs including: monthly claims payment dashboard charts and graphs; monthly capitation report and performance bond summary; and monthly enrollment demographic reports.Download and file Contractors' financial deliverables.Prepare the semi-annual CHEAT Sheet every May and November.Work directly with CMS and the DHCM management team, prepare the annual CMS enrollment survey as well as address any questions they may have.Provide technical assistance to and/or address questions from Contractors relating to financial reporting data elements on an as needed basis.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (KSAs):Demonstrated experience in accounting principles and auditing practices.Demonstrated experience in Excel, MS Access, COGNOS, PowerPoint and Outlook.Ability to work independently, plan, organize and multi-task to ensure completion of multiple work assignments within required timeframes.Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with a variety of people.Ability to interpret federal and state laws as well as agency contracts and policies.SELECTIVE PREFERENCE(S):Bachelor of Science in Finance or Business Administration with an emphasis in accounting.Two years professional level health care organization experience preferably as an auditor or analyst.BENEFITS At AHCCCS, we promote the importance of work/life balance by offering workplace flexibility and a variety of learning and career development opportunities. Among the many benefits of a career with the State of Arizona, there are 10 paid holidays per year, accrual of sick and annual leave, affordable medical benefits and participation in the Arizona State Retirement Plan. Click here to learn more about benefits.  Arizona State Government is an EOE/ADA Reasonable Accommodation Employer. Persons with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation such as a sign language interpreter or an alternative format by calling (602) 417-4497. Requests should be made as early as possible to allow sufficient time to arrange the accommodation. AHCCCS is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All newly hired employees will be subject to E-Verify Employment Eligibility Verification.  Click the APPLY NOW button to submit your application.  For technical assistance, email [email protected] or call 602-542-4700.

He or she should have proven ability to build relationships/partnerships and work cross-functionally to drive time sensitive deliverables, issues tracking and reporting. The Senior Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for executing and managing the following: Manage all internal Bank Analyzer needsDevelop and execute to the Bank Analyzer roadmapMaintain and manage the Bank Analyzer portfolioEnsure all documents are maintained and updated timelySupport production defect resolutionDefine user stories for new product development and enhancement requestsSupport special projects and initiatives: special projects vary from strategic initiatives to day to day operations. Support needs will vary by project and will require strong analytical and problem solving skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritize effectivelyResponsibilitiesBridge business users and the technology organizations. Lead collaborations and discussions among cross-functional teams for effective solution-building or issue-resolution.Starting with business questions, leverage strong analytical skills, critical thinking capabilities, and in-depth understanding of our data to collaborate with business users and engineers, brainstorm and strategize the “right” solution, initiate and document the requirements and associated functional specifications.Design, maintain and update PayPal’s Bank Analyzer financial system strategy.Understand impact various projects and products have on the financial application and associated requirements. Understand, manage and maintain: product development, inbound interface impacts, outbound interface maintenance and development as well as transformations of source data into the Bank Analyzer and BW on HANA environments.Create detailed product requirements, working closely with product development and project teams, managing implementation and user acceptance testing, provide post-launch support, and adhere to key business metrics post-launch and sound project methodologies.Preferred Qualifications8-10+ years of SAP and analytics experience in payment industry, financial services and/or management consulting firmsExperience with SAPData-warehouse skills in data modelling, ETL, or BIJob Requirements Advanced Microsoft excel, SQL and Business Objects skillsMust be self-motivated, detail-oriented, conscientious, thorough and accurateStrong interpersonal skills, diplomacy, and client service oriented attitude and mind-set.Excellent communication skills (written, oral, presentation skills)Proven ability to function well independently as well as in a teamAbility to prioritize deliverables and projects to meet timelines efficiently, to adapt to changes in priorities quickly and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously to drive projects to completion and deliver quality materials under tight deadlinesSubsidiary:PayPalTravel Percent:0Primary Location:Omaha, Nebraska, United States of AmericaAdditional Locations:Austin, ScottsdaleWe're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.Paypal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Name: Program Analyst (Business Process Analyst)(Short term)
Description: Hiring Salary Range $45,541 - $59,203/annually DOEGrade 114Work Schedule Monday - Friday, 8am - 5pm  Summer Hours: Monday - Thursday, 7am-6pmWork Calendar 12 MonthsJob Summary This is a short term position with renewal based on the needs of MCCCD. Projected end date June 30, 2019. Acts as the liaison between business units within HR, Business Services, and IT to coordinate the best way to design new processes and solve process-related problems. The business process analyst acts as the facilitator or assists with facilitation of business process modeling and research efforts; and reviews and streamlines documentation on project teams.Essential Functions 40% - Facilitates, or assists with the facilitation of business process modeling sessions; serves as a facilitator or co-facilitator in standard operating procedure development and documentation sessions; documents information elicited using process maps and business requirements documents  40% - Documents procedures and presents new process designs to stakeholders for discussion; participates in business process management group efforts to collect and analyze metrics and continually improve processes owned by the group; performs program/project research and analysis; researches trends and performs data analysis and reporting; prepares complex reports, presentations, correspondence and program documentation; may serve as a project coordinator on some projects  20% - Conducts basic analysis of business processes and workflows with the objective of finding out how they can be improved or automated; conducts root cause analysis to recommend product enhancements or other appropriate actions to improve productivity for HR, Business Services, and IT; maintains program records, documents, web content and/or related program communication materials; educates business users responsible for managing and operating business processes; participates in strategic planning of the teamMinimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in education, business or public administration, or directly related field and two years of related program management experience preferably in an educational setting.  OR  An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job such as those listed above, unless otherwise subject to any other requirements set forth in law or regulation.Desired Qualifications 1. Two Years of Experience with process mapping and business process reengineeringHow to Apply Applicants must submit a cover letter that details how the applicant meets minimum and desired qualifications.  Applications without a cover letter will be incomplete and will not be considered. Name: Security Analyst

A good Analyst looks  at network traffic and questions how and why. Desired Candidate Profile Summary 2+ years of IT experience.1+ years of Operations Experience (SOC Operations preferred).Experience with ticketing systems, to include understanding work flow, escalation and resolution documentation highly desirable.Experience analyzing both log and packet data to include the use to WireShark, tcpdump and other capture/analysis tools such as Netwitness, NIKSUN, or Security Analytics.Candidate must be reliable and able to function as part of a 24x7  operations center. Name: Strategic Pricing Analyst
Description: CBRE | FacilitySource provides an innovative, technology-driven, single-source facility management and support solution to leading brands in retail, banking, logistics, health care and many other sectors. CBRE | FacilitySource maintains the industry's largest and most reliable data repository to provide business intelligence, transparency, flexibility, support and the Elite Network of Service Providers to save money for our clients and get the most out of their facilities, while offering peace of mind. Established in 2005, CBRE | FacilitySource was acquired by CBRE Group, Inc., the largest commercial real estate services and investment firm in the world, in 2018. For more information, visit www.facilitysource.com. Position Summary: The Strategic Pricing Analyst role will work within the Market Research, Analytics, and Costing Team as a key contributor in executing the Company's pricing strategy. The Strategic Pricing Analyst will be responsible for data mining and performing various statistical analyses for use in building out and maintaining a complex and scalable pricing structure. The Strategic Pricing Analyst will also be responsible for performing predictive analytics to drive company strategy. Job Duties & Responsibilities: Integrate and extract relevant information from large amounts of both structured and unstructured data (internal and external) to enable analytical solutions  Conduct advanced analytics leveraging predictive modeling, optimization and other techniques to deliver insights or develop analytical solutions to achieve business objectives  Gather information, synthesize and communicate project statuses to stakeholders  Support strategic company initiatives as needed  \n\n Skills & Qualifications: Knowledge, Skills & Abilities  Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast paced environment  Strong analytical skills and ability to think strategically Education & Experience: Bachelor of Science Degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field  2+ years' experience performing statistical analysis  Advanced in MS Excel; VBA experience a plus  Experience with MS Access/relational databases  Experience coding in Python or R required Preferred Requirements: Facilities maintenance knowledge  Basic understanding or HVAC, Plumbing, Electrical and General Maintenance trades
