Name: Credit Analyst 3
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Wholesale Banking provides financial solutions to businesses across the United States and globally. Our nine major business lines include Business Banking, Middle Market Banking, Government and Institutional Banking, Corporate Banking, Commercial Real Estate, Financial Institutions Group, Wells Fargo Commercial Capital, Wells Fargo Securities, and the Investment Portfolio. We also have groups in credit risk, group risk, finance, marketing, human relations, and the Wholesale Chief Operating Office that support our businesses.  Responsible for analyzing complex companies and industries and conducting presentations on findings to senior management. Functions include: conducting complex credit investigations and analyzing diverse credit information for loans; analyzing/formalizing documentation of loan transactions and/or credit history of customers; assisting in preparation of credit reports for presentation to lending officers and/or approval committees; performing research/analysis related to projects such as industry studies and management reports.  Team members support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business units risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.Required Qualifications5+ years of credit analysis experienceDesired QualificationsIntermediate Microsoft Office skillsStrong analytical skills including analyzing complex dataExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsKnowledge and understanding of underwriting or evaluating commercial creditStrong commercial credit analysis skillsKnowledge and understanding of commercial credit: riskA BS/BA degree or higher in accounting, finance, or economicsStreet AddressAZ-PHX-Central Phoenix: 100 W Washington St - Phoenix, AZDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Financial Business Analyst
Description: Financial Business Analyst Company Description A-GAS is a global leader in the responsible life-cycle management of specialty chemicals and gases. As the world's largest refrigerant reclamation company, we are constantly striving to drive technology and innovation into our business to continue to provide our customers with the best environmental solutions to keep them compliant.  We are a growing company operating on 5 continents, with locations in the US in Bowling Green, Ohio, Ft. Worth, Texas, Peoria, AZ, and a national field service organization. For more information please visit www.agasamericas.com.  Job Purpose  The successful candidate will work as a business partner to our Rapid Recovery business to analyze the network service centers and track key performance indicators, including but not limited to company costs, inventory costs, and cash flow. This candidate will be an active participant in the company's forecasting and budgeting process and must have the ability to develop and maintain key performance indicators that measure the company's financial success. The candidate will also work closely to with the A-GAS financial analysis team related to financial reporting and analysis of the Rapid Recovery business.  Key Responsibilities Support the Rapid Recovery operations and field teams through interpretation of financial performance and key metrics;Assist the company in good decision making through analyzing results; monitoring variances; identifying trends.Participate with the global finance team in the forecasting cadences for the business.Provide standard and ad hoc reporting as needed. (P/L, OE, Capital, Cost Savings, Inventory, NPI, and Corporate Priority.Assist in creating multi-year business models.Other duties assigned Experience and Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance RequiredProgressive experience in Accounting requiredExperienced working with databasesHigh attention to detailExperience with Sage ERP, Cognos, and Crystal Reports desiredAdvanced skills with Microsoft Office (Excel & PowerPoint).Independently motivated, a collaborative teammate with an affinity for adapting to different situations and personalities.Multi-country currency experience, a plus.Knowledge and application of accounting principles including financial statements, costing, and fixed assetsExperience in creating multi-year business models. Key Competencies Task and projectAble to analyze problems and implement effective solutions.Well organized with good attention to detail.Uses time efficiently.Team work and communicationAble to work well within a team and build effective relationships, internally and with external customers.Excellent communication skills in both written and verbal forms.Maintains confidentiality.Self-management and motivationAble to use own initiative to complete a task.Confident, enthusiastic and a team player with a 'can do' attitude.Adapts flexibly to new challenges and circumstances.Has a style of working that fits with the SpotOn valuesSense of Fun, Sense of Purpose, Professionalism, Leadership, Openness, Honesty, Trust, & Respect.SDL2017

Name: Workforce Management Business Analyst
Description: Check out the following fantastic career opportunity! POSITION TITLE Workforce Management Business Analyst OVERVIEW AND REPORTING RELATIONSHIP With general supervision and using independent judgment and discretion, this position monitors the daily volume of inbound call traffic and distributes calls to achieve the optimal utilization and balance of resources across customer support sites judiciously. Additionally, this position is responsible for the timely analysis of information, including but not limited to contact center trends, call volumes, patterns, etc. and provides reports, forecasts, and recommendations for planning purposes as well as to increase call center efficiencies and effectiveness. REPORTING STRUCTURE & WORK SETTING This position typically resides in a field location but may provide centralized support to geographically diverse call centers. This position reports to the Workforce Management Manager or another manager or director within the customer service organization with traffic and scheduling responsibility. OTHER REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES * Monitors contact volume for multiple queues in multiple locations and moves agents into and out of queues in a timely manner to coordinate and distribute volume based on staff availability and skill level to support the optimal utilization of resources. Coordinates communication of staff moves appropriately. * Reviews and verifies intra-day performance reports as appropriate and projects adjustments for unanticipated volume shifts, staffing adherence, etc. Basing analysis on available information identifies opportunities for same day staff adjustments and the need to solicit extra hours and/or voluntary time-off. * Anticipates contact volume, training sessions, team and project work, vacations, personal leave and other information to determine adequate coverage and consistent levels of customer support. Uses results of analysis to forecast call arrival and build staffing and scheduling plans to meet business unit goals and objectives. * Analyzes data, including but not limited to customer support performance as well as internal and external customer feedback to identify trends and/or patterns. Makes recommendations as appropriate to reduce volume and improve the level of service or other capacity plans within the customer support center. Monitors and tracks the results of recommendations as appropriate. * Provides regular operational, financial and statistical reports, some in an Excel format, to the management team. Makes recommendations regarding opportunities for improvement where appropriate. * Addresses telephone and telecommunication issues for the customer care organization. This includes but is not limited to coordinating with other departments when outages occur and calls must be redirected. Maintains issue tracking log and reports on Service Level impacts as necessary. * Maintains an awareness of the call center activities, processes, and procedures as well as call center best practices. This may involve attending advanced training sessions or meetings in which information is imparted and discussed. This may also require participation with and maintenance of memberships with professional work groups; attending trainings, seminars, and other business-related conferences; and interfacing with peers. MARGINAL DUTIES & ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS * Researches and recommends enhanced customer support methodologies through the Company's service delivery systems, including telephone and email response and other telecommunications systems and technologies. Implements measures as approved and directed. * Participates in testing of enhancements. Scope of involvement may include creating / identifying test scenarios, developing scripts, executing tests, documenting results and measuring impact of enhancements. * Recommends training and development needs to maximize efficiency of staff while adhering to department and Company goals as well as staffing levels. * Performs other duties as assigned or apparent. QUALIFICATIONS The ability to effectively monitor inbound call volume and distribute calls as well as analyze data and make recommendations for planning purposes as described, as normally obtained through at least two years' experience in a directly related position. SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES: * Good communication skills (both verbal and written), presentation and strong interpersonal skills are required to perform the functions as described, including participation and facilitation of client meetings as described. * Incumbents must also be able to work well in a team environment to accomplish common goals. The ability to work well with people of diverse backgrounds and at all organizational levels is also required. A strong customer service orientation is essential. * Strong analytical skills are required as is the ability to review issues, evaluate conditions and employ independent judgment and discretion to determine the best way to move forward. The ability to analyze telephony reports along with reports data mined from ancillary applications critical to success is required. * A strong attention to detail and the ability to remain highly organized and focused is essential. * Excellent planning and organizational skills are required. Incumbents must be able to work under general supervision while exercising sound independent judgment and discretion. The ability to plan and manage one's own time, while working on multiple tasks and projects is critical. The ability to work while under stress is also essential. * A good understanding of WageWorks' call center operations and related products, technologies, and internal business processes is required to perform the essential functions as described. A working knowledge and understanding of Cisco telephony architecture is preferred. * Incumbents must demonstrate the ability to create detailed report requests, call flows, organizational charts, test scripts and application error tracking tickets in custom applications with appropriate training and tools. * Incumbents must have proficient skills and abilities with a personal computer and have a solid knowledge, understanding and experience with Microsoft Office Suite, specifically with Excel, Visio and Word. Incumbents must have knowledge of telephone ACD software and its reports. Workforce Management software experience is preferred. TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS & CONDITIONS Occasional travel may be required for training or meetings. Travel estimated at less than 10% of time with length of stay averaging single overnight trips. EDUCATION A thorough knowledge and understanding of business as normally obtained through the completion of a Bachelor's Degree in Business Management, Computer Science or a related major. Certifications in Microsoft Office applications and/or selected Workforce Management solutions is preferred. LOCATION Tempe, AZ Build Your Career at WageWorks! WageWorks enables millions of people to save money on critical expenses like healthcare, dependent care, and commuting, through Consumer-Directed Benefits, such as Health Savings Accounts (HSAs), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), Health Reimbursement Arrangements (HRAs) and Commuter Benefits. WageWorks is a leader in the industry serving more than 6.5 million people for over 100,000 employers, including 63% of the Fortune 500 and numerous public sector clients. WageWorks believes that our success is achieved by its People. Values describe how we work together to achieve our success. It is our employees that drive results through living our Company Values. Every employee at WageWorks is expected to uphold and demonstrate the six Company Values listed below as an additional component of the job description and as a standard of individual performance. Customer-Centric: Our Customer comes first. We aim to serve our Clients and their employees, our brokers and partners, as well as our internal customers. Caring: People are at the heart of our company. We care about people: our Clients, our Clients' employees and their families, our partners, and local communities, and our fellow employees at WageWorks. Passionate: We love what we do and are passionate about delivering Consumer-Directed Benefits that save people money and enrich their lives. Accountable: We are dedicated to making our team and the company succeed, and we are open, honest, ethical and conscientious, as we deliver on our commitments. Leading: Our actions inspire new ideas and drive change each and every day. Respectful: We value the diversity of our people, treat them with dignity and respect, encourage their development and reward their performance. Why Work for WageWorks? If you're looking for a career that provides plenty of growth opportunities, responsibility, and interesting challenges to tackle, you will find it here. If you want to join a fast-moving, high-growth, exciting company that's a market leader, you're looking in the right place. But mostly, if you want to help people live happier, healthier, and more productive lives, then you'll want to work for WageWorks. WageWorks provides equal employment opportunity without regard to pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, race, religious creed, color, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, mental or physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), medical condition, veteran or military status, marital or registered domestic partnership status, age, sex, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Employment will require successful completion of a background check. Equal Opportunity for Disabled Veterans, Recently Separated Veterans, Other Armed Forces Service Medal Veterans. Drug free workplace.SDL2017

Analyze existing Business Objects (and other system) reports, and determine best method to migrate to Tableau (or supported alternative technologies). Work with business partners to determine actual usage and business needs, and assure resulting reports will meet their business needs. Partner with cross-departmental team to assure delivery of project deliverables. Work strategically with team manager to minimize long-term maintenance burdens and maximize adaptability for future changes. Develop within procedural framework provided by team. Verify data for accuracy and be able to identify inconsistencies and recommend remediation. Perform rigorous testing to assure quality and accuracy of data in the system. Document development and analysis efforts. Perform other analysis and development efforts as assigned. Required Skills: Strong SQL and Tableau development skills a must, as are strong communication skills. Flexibility and Adaptability highly valued. Experience coordinating complex projects and competing priorities important. Banking experience a plus. - provided by DiceSQL and Tableau

Name: Modeling Analyst I
Description: Purpose of JobWe are currently seeking talented Modeling Analyst I for our Remote, Addison, TX, Tampa, FL (Sabal Park) or Phoenix, AZ facility.  Develop and analyze data to predict business results or member behavior. Technically proficient in statistics, mathematics, and tools used in predictive modeling. Partner cross-functionally with business to deliver breakthrough analytical solutions to support a winning strategy in a continually changing business environment.Job RequirementsDevelop, enhance and support implementation of statistical and other quantitative models to support forecasting, member behavior based scoring and other business applications.Understand technical issues in econometric and statistical modeling and apply these skills toward solving business problems.Proficient in the model development process and builds relationships with the business customer: from conceptualization through data exploration, model selection and validation, implementation, business user training and support.Understands the model lifecycle management process with ability to apply to models.Monitor statistical model performance and provide technical guidance to business leadership.Communicate technical subject matter clearly and concisely to individuals from various backgrounds.Minimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences or related field; Or 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree; OR A Master's Degree in Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences or related field; OR A PhD in Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences or related field4 or more years related work experience in statistical analysis and model development; OR If a Master's Degree, 2 or more years related experience in statistical model development; OR If a Ph.D., 1 or more years related experience in statistical model developmentProficient knowledge of data analysis tools and industry data sourcesProficient knowledge in developing analysis queries and procedures in SQL, SAS, BI tools or other analysis softwareProficient knowledge in 2 or more statistical techniques (Generalized linear modeling, Time Series, CART, Decision Trees, Neural Networks, Factor analysis experimental design and hypothesis testing).Successful completion of a job-related assessment may be required.Preferred6 or more years AML experience in transaction monitoring in design/validation statistical analysis and model development.Proven experience in one or more industry platforms (i.e. Actimize).Proven experience working with model risk management in the model validation process.Proven experience in retail banking organization.Active AML Certifications.Proficiency in SQL and standard modelling tools (e.g. SAS, SPSS, Python, R, etc.).Experience in conducting and documenting tuning and optimization activities related to Transaction Monitoring models, including data validation, statistical analysis, recommendation of thresholds, and presentation of results.Experience in producing documentation in a highly regulated environment. The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.  At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: The Financial Analyst will be responsible for the ongoing maintenance and improvement of data and data structures within the Financial Analysis database and will be responsible for aggregating and providing this data to other Financial Analysis team members via custom queries and views within SQL Server. Additionally, the Financial Analyst will create data extracts for use in other applications including analysis tools and ad hoc/analysis requests. The Financial Analyst will also be responsible for the completion of projects as assigned. These projects will require advanced proficiency in general finance theory (see "Knowledge Required" section), as well as a working knowledge of statistical and/or other quantitative methods.  This position reports to the Manager of Financial Analysis and will have direct visibility to AMERCO's Chief Financial Officer. Minimum Education and/or ExperienceThe ideal candidate will possess:Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration or a related field3 years' professional experience in financial planning and analysis in the public or private sectorsA Master's degree may substitute for the minimum experience requirementsSpecialized Training, Certifications, and/or Special Requirements:The ideal candidate will possess:Expert proficiency using SQL Server and SAPExpert proficiency in Microsoft ExcellentExperience performing analysis using R, Python, and/or VBA (strongly preferred)A professional designation e.g. CFA, FP&A, CTP, CMA (preferred)Knowledge Required:The ideal candidate will be proficient (conversational and applicational) in general finance concepts including, but not limited to:Expected return on equity (Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM))Weighted Average Cost of Capital (WACC)Discounted Cash Flow Analysis (DCF Analysis)Familiarity with the three primary financial statementsLocation: 2727 N Central Ave, Phoenix, Arizona 85004 United States of America  U-Haul is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants for employment will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, provincial, state or local law. Individual accommodations are available on requests for applicants taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Information obtained during this process will only be shared on a need to know basis.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Senior Financial Analyst Job Description:  The Senior Financial Analyst provides actionable decision making information by creating financial and analytical reports to assist with budget performance and variance analysis, administrative cost analysis and optimization, medical expense trend analysis and reduction opportunities, risk modeling, projections and operational reporting/modeling. The Senior Financial Analyst must be comfortable working with - and optimizing - existing models, as well as synthesizing information to develop new models. Also, this candidate should have an understanding of basic accounting principles and intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills. He/She should have experience in the healthcare industry, preferably managed care, and have the ability to understand and quantify key factors influencing financial performance of the various underlying businesses. Finally, this individual should pride themselves in their ability to learn quickly, accomplish goals with minimal supervision, synthesize and logically present thoughts and ideas, and work collaboratively within the finance and business organizations.  Qualifications: Strong budgeting experience2+ years experience in pro-forma financial modeling3+ years in a Financial Analyst roleExperience with balance sheets, projection experienceStrong excel skillsHyperion preferred, but not requiredHealth care/Insurance background preferred, but not required Soft Skills: Effective time management skillsEffective interpersonal and communication skillsAbility to work independentlyStrong analytic skillsAble to handle and prioritize multiple projects at changing a fast pace Location:  Phoenix, AZ  Compensation: $35-45/hourHealth, Vision, Dental, 401k, and PTO

Name: Junior Financial Reporting Analyst
Description: OverviewJunior Financial Reporting Analyst About Us Fox Restaurant Concepts is a privately-owned company that began as a single restaurant in 1998. Today, we’ve launched over a dozen innovative concepts and have grown to over 50 locations that span across 8 states and counting. A career with us in the Big Kitchen – our home office – can be the start of a journey into a variety of business areas, or the continuation of a meaningful career. We believe to do great things, you have to love what you do. And we love what we do. ResponsibilitiesGenerate financial reporting:Routine period-end & mid-month reporting: both financial statements and management reportingAd Hoc reporting as required by business leadersWork with IT counterpart to document, implement and maintain processes to ensure data integrity between systemsTie-out of all dimensions, values and organizational levelsOngoing maintenance as new dimensions are added to the various systemsProvide support during the forecast and planning processForecast / Plan reportingCorporate expense planning & reportingNew Store expense / investment planning & reportingAssist in maintenance of budget tracking tools for various aspects of the business including: major capital expenditures and new store openings.Assist with ad hoc reporting and analysis of various aspects of the businessEvaluate processes and seek solutions for process improvement: continuous improvement.RequirementsBachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting or a related field is preferred.1-3 years’ experienceAdvanced working knowledge of ExcelAbility to manage multiple assignments and deadlinesMotivated self-starter with a strong attention to detailAbility to communicate complex and dynamic financial information clearly and succinctlyKey characteristics: continuous improvement, excellent time management skills, sense of urgency, detail oriented, strong critical thinker; desire to learnWorking knowledge of any of these systems is a bonus: Mirus, Great Plains, Adaptive Insights, Management Reporter, CrunchTime, Marketing VitalsCompensation and Benefits PackageCompetitive salary and a yearly incentive opportunityMedical, Dental, Vision and Life InsuranceRetirement savings program (with company match)Tuition reimbursementPaid time offDining DiscountWho Is Sam Fox? Sam Fox – a “serial restaurateur” – is the creative visionary behind Fox Restaurant Concepts, one of the most successful restaurant groups in the United States. An eleven-time James Beard Award semifinalist for Restaurateur of the Year, Sam is a New York Times best-selling cookbook author and has been named one of the 50 most influential people in the restaurant industry by Nation’s Restaurant News for the fifth consecutive year. An important part of the Fox culture that Sam insists on is giving back to the community through the company’s charitable arm: Feed the Soul. Through the years, Feed the Soul has supported numerous non-profits, including the Boys & Girls Clubs, the American Heart Association and No Kid Hungry.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer  Proof of eligibility to work in the United States is required

Name: Trade Suitability Analyst
Description: Be a part of the team behind our success!  At Advisor Group, we support more than 5,000 financial advisors, the people who help everyday Americans achieve their dreams. Were a billion-dollar business with the mentality and drive of a startup. Join us in building something special.Trade Suitability Analyst Opportunity in Financial Services Location: 20 E. Thomas Rd. Phoenix, AZ 85012Summary: The Trade Suitability Analyst conducts suitability reviews of business requiring firm pre-approval, to include, but not limited to, Variable Annuity (VA) initial purchases and replacements and non-traded alternative investment purchases. Under the guidance of the Department Manager and Team Lead and/or Senior Trade Specialist, the Trade Suitability Analyst performs research and analysis of proposed transactions and documents findings, rationale and approval/rejection decisions. Ensures business is processed in accordance with the firms policies and procedures and in compliance with regulatory requirements to protect the client, the First Line Supervisor (FLS), and the firm.Responsibilities: Ensures proper business and sales practices are followed by the daily review of all assigned transactions and works with the advisors to address deficiencies in submissionsCompletes data entry into the Sales Supervision pre-approval platform and documents analysis, advisor communications, resolution of deficiencies and conclusionProvides a written recommendation of approval or rejection after a thorough suitability analysis is completedWorks with the Sr. Trade Specialist, Team Lead, and/or Trade Specialist Manager on escalated issues and rejectionsStays fully informed of firm rules, guidelines and procedures as well as regulatory changesMonitors, reports, and enforces internal controls to ensure compliance with industry standards and the firms policies and proceduresKeeps timely workflow and ensures regulatory deadlines are metMaintains an ongoing positive relationship with Advisors and First Line Supervisors in collaboration with the Supervision Regional Vice Presidents (SRVPs) and Regional Sales Managers (RSMs)Education Requirements: Bachelors degree preferred, high school diploma (or equivalent) in combination with significant experience will be considered in lieu of degree. Minimum of high school diploma or equivalent is required. Basic Requirements: Basic Variable Annuity knowledgeAt least one year related experienceFINRA Series 7, 63 (or 66), and 24 (or 8 or 9/10) requiredExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to effectively handle and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment to meet defined deadlinesAnalytical and problem-solving skillsPreferred Requirements: FINRA Series 65 or 66 desired.Life & Variable Insurance licenses preferred.

Name: Sr Business Systems Analyst
Description: *Sr Business Systems Analyst***Description** What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members?they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values?straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity ? an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines ? Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management. *Job Description Summary** Enterprise Data Services (EDS) group manages the enterprise data  warehouse which provides data for all the Bank?s internal and external  reporting needs, and data-driven analysis to support the Bank?s strategic  initiatives One of these strategic initiatives is to build a data mart for our  Digital Banking and Wealth Management partners to deliver easy and compelling  information management of financial services to our clients? fingertips. The successful candidate will function as a  collaborative member of the team focused on delivering scalable, high quality,  high performing technology solutions with high degree of customer  experience. *Essential Job Functions** + Acts as the primary liaison between IT and Digital and Wealthmanagement groups during analysis, requirements definition and designactivities for new solutions and/or integration projects  + Solves business-related problems using data-driven techniques.Looks for order and patterns in data, as wellas spotting trends that provide strategic advice for business processes and ITsolutions  + Collaborates with business stakeholders, conducts JAD sessions andtranslates high-level business requirements/user stories to technicalrequirements, functional specifications documents  + Gains a holistic understanding of a broad range of Retail Bankingproducts, processes and related systems  + Communicates how to use data to drive business decisions that mayinclude changing course, improving a process or product, or creating newservices or products  + Establishes and maintains productive working relationships withdepartmental staff, and internal business partners  + Analyzes, evaluates and profiles the data gathered from multiplesources to create source to target mapping documents  + Works with IT team through coding and implementation to ensure productmatches envisioned result  + Provides support as a subject matter expert to internal IT teams andbusiness partners  + May support development of test scripts and participate in functionaltesting  + May support users in user acceptance testing  + May support maintenance of business systems and interface applications *Qualifications***Required Experience** + 8 - 10 years' experience working as a Business Systems Analyst oncomplex, cross functional projects and the creation of detailed requirementdocuments and/or user stories  + Minimum 7 years? experience in Retail Banking  + Minimum 5 years? experience in data warehousing  + Experience leading large projects in a matrix organization  + Experience working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment  + Experience with Agile methodology  + Experience in Online/Mobile Banking and Wealth Management, preferred *Education** + Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Finance relatedfield *Skills** + Exceptional verbal and written communication, problem solving, andinterpersonal skills required  + Ability to present data as a concise story for diverse audiences  + Able to ask smart, straightforward, intelligent, and efficientquestions  + Knowledge of data analysis and SQL Data Query Tools required  + Able to mine and analyze large amounts of data to develop hypotheses,make inferences and hone in on customer and business objectives  + Exposure to Excel modeling, math and statistical skills a plus  + Must be highly detail oriented, meticulous, and self-directed  + Proficient in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, andOutlook)  + Experienced in R, Python, and other programming language a plus  + Familiarity with analytical techniques such as machine learning, deeplearning and text analytics a plus *Equal Employment Opportunity Policy** Bank of the West is an Equal Opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers without regard to any status protected by applicable law. Bank of the West is also an Affirmative Action employer - Minority / Female / Disabled / Veteran.  Bank of the West will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance subject to the requirements of all state and federal laws and regulations. *Job:** Accounting Finance*Location:** United States-Arizona-Tempe*Requisition ID:** 041152

Name: Senior Technical Analyst
Description: Be a part of the team behind our success! At Advisor Group, we support more than 5,000 financial advisors, the people who help everyday Americans achieve their dreams. Were a billion-dollar business with the mentality and drive of a startup. Join us in building something special. Senior Technical AnalystLocation: 20 East Thomas Road, Suite 2000, Phoenix, AZ 85012Summary: This Senior Technical Analyst (STA) role will be serve as the liaison between the various functions within Information Technology as it pertains to an acquisition project. Working with the various Information Technology team members, the STA will assist in defining scope, documenting and/or validating business requirements, identifying gaps between the two organizations, as well as overall coordination between both internal and external parties in the overall implementation. Additional aspects of the role will be to assist with the overall planning of the project and tasks, timing and resources for the different components of the project. Key Accountabilities:Assists with the technology definition and execution of project tasks, resources, timelines, status reports for each technology component of the project.Assists the business analysts in requirements gathering, coordination of requirements between the various technology group and reconciles any requirement interdependencies.Ability to interact with senior executives, external vendors and managed service partnersAccountable for the identification of appropriate automation and process technology support to further process improvement within the environmentDemonstrates good judgment and logic in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutionsAnalyzes data and creates documents and plans in service of informing, advising, or updating stakeholdersEnsure the requirements map to a real business need, are approved by all relevant stakeholders, and meets essential quality standardsManage meetings, issue resolution, escalation, etc. for the teams during the complete lifecycle of all assigned projectsParticipates in reviews or inspections, in collaboration with the project team, to ensure the quality of work products.Responsible for the creation of, refining of, and the analyses of applicable data as directed, as well as making recommendations for new metrics, KPIs, and additional reporting as directedMust manage project risk through comprehensive mitigation assessment and planning techniques, manage work efforts of multiple functional resources through the program objectives.Participates with cross functional teams that contribute to the definition of the processes, standards, and methodologies, as well as their adoption and governanceAssist with the development of a repeatable process for future mergers and/or acquisitionsResponsible for the identification of integration points with other processes. Ensures all integrated processes are fully documented, understood, and maintainedQualifications: Bachelors degree and/or equivalent requiredMinimum 10-15 years relevant work experience in implementing large scale projectsHands-on use of Project Management or related software, with an understanding of the Project LifecycleStrong analytical work experienceAbility to create presentable documentation in a clear and concise mannerAbility to interface with all levels of staff and managementOutstanding verbal and written communication skillsDemonstrated track record managing technical integration projectsAbility to multi-task and prioritize work tasksHighly organized and detail orientedAble to articulate issues, build consensus around recommendations and define next stepsSome travel may be required up to 5%Can work independently, requiring minimal supervision

Name: Decision Science Analyst Senior
Description: Purpose of JobWe are currently seeking talented Decision Science Analyst Senior for our Phoenix, AZ facility.The Decision Science Analyst will be leading the creation and implementation of standards, processes, controls, and training required to ensure accuracy of member behavior data, reporting, and analytics. ****Please note: This role will be filled in the Phoenix office but required to ensure there is consistency and integration with Phoenix, Plano, and San Antonio teamsProvide decision support for business areas across the enterprise. Staff in this area will be responsible for applying mathematical and statistical techniques and/or innovative /quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make `insight to action' recommendations to answer business objectives and drive change. The essence of work performed by the Decision Science Analyst involves gathering, manipulating and synthesizing data (e.g., attributes, transactions, behaviors, etc.), models and other relevant information to draw conclusions and make recommendations resulting in implementable strategies.Job RequirementsLeverages expert business/analytical knowledge to participate or lead discussions with cross functional teams to understand and collaborate highly complex businessobjectives and influence solution strategies.The business problems analyzed are typically medium to large scale with significant impact to current and/or future business strategy.Applies innovative and scientific/quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make 'insight to action' recommendations to answer the business objective and drive the appropriate change.Translates recommendation into communication materials to effectively present to various levels of management.Incorporates visualization techniques to support the relevant points of the analysis and ease the understanding for less technical audiences.Identifies and gathers the relevant and quality data sources required to fully answer and address the problem for the recommended strategy through testing or exploratory data analysis (EDA).Integrates/transforms disparate data sources and determines the appropriate data hygiene techniques to apply.Thoroughly documents assumptions, methodology, validation and testing to facilitate peer reviews.Subsequent analysts should be able to rely on documentation to replicate and continue work.Understands and adopts emerging technology that can affect the application of scientific methodologies and/or quantitative analytical approaches to problem resolutions.Succinctly delivers analysis/findings in a manner that conveys understanding, influences various levels of management, garners support for recommendations, drives business decisions, and influences business strategy.Recommendations typically have a major impact on business results.Provides subject matter expertise in operationalizing recommendations.Minimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences or other quantitative discipline (4 years work experience in statistics, mathematics or quantitative analytics or related experience can be substituted in lieu of a degree in addition to the minimum years of work experience required.) OR A Master's Degree in quantitative analytics or a related field OR A PhD in quantitative analytics or a related field If Bachelor's degree, 6 or more years experience in a decision support analytic function Or If Master's Degree, 4 or more years experience in a decision support analytic function Or If PhD, 3 or more years experience in a decision support analytic functionDemonstrates advanced skills in mathematical and statistical techniques and approaches used to drive fact-based decision-making*Qualifications may warrant placement in a different job level.*When you apply for this position, you will be required to answer some initial questions. Name: Senior Fuels Analyst/Natural Gas Trader
Description: SRP is one of the largest public power and water utilities in the U.S. providing electricity to approximately one million customers in the greater metropolitan Phoenix area. Since its founding in 1903, SRP has fostered a culture of stewardship and customer service consistently ranking as an industry leader in customer service according to J.D. Power. SRP continues to adapt to its changing business environment by seeking innovative ways to reimagine utility service and the provision of critical resources essential to the life and economy of Arizona.Job Brief As a member of SRPs Supply, Trading & Fuels department you will be responsible for executing natural gas trading and associated scheduling strategies. SRP is one of the largest transporters and consumers of natural gas in the Southwest. We seek a candidate that can successfully transact in natural gas commodity markets and then interact with gas pipeline and storage providers to ensure the reliable shipment of fuel to our generation facilities. In addition to trading and scheduling, the ideal candidate will possess excellent analytical skills which will be used to further optimize our scheduling strategies and to optimize the value of our assets. This position will also be responsible for developing long-term forecasts, negotiating contracts, and will represent SRPs interests across the gas industry. Job ResponsibilitiesManages power supply, gas transportation and gas storage contracts.Models and implements gas transportation and storage optimization strategies.Manages daily spot sales and purchases of natural gas as well as nominations and scheduling over gas pipeline systems. Analyzes pipeline capacity and gas storage requirements.Develops and implements balancing strategies including gas storage transactions.Develops long term gas transportation forecasts and acquisition strategies.Negotiates and administers gas commodity trading contracts.Represents SRP on interstate pipeline rate cases and gas related FERC and NAESB matters.Prepares and/or conducts written and oral reports and presentations.Prepares plans and forecasts, and performs analytical studies.Other duties as assignedEducation Completion of a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution that prepares the employee for the assignment. Experience 5 years post degree, professional experience for senior level. Additional Information Occasional travel for specialized training and utility business meetings. Effective interpersonal skills to communicate study work and results to high level management. Ability to discretely prepare and use proprietary and sensitive information. This position requires early mornings and will be on call for oneweekend out of themonth. Knowledge of corporate organization, operations and policies.Knowledge of the structure of the utility industry.Excellent analytical skills including extensive experience with Excel. Programing skills in a language such as SAS are preferred.Knowledge of economic analysis, and financial analysis.Knowledge of decision analysis communication skills both oral and written.Knowledge of power plant fundamentals for fossil fuel generation.Knowledge of the energy industry, with a preference for natural gas.Requisition Details Requisition ID:8885  EOE - SRP encourages a diverse workforce  All candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States.  Currently, SRP does not sponsor H1B visas. Why Work at SRP SRP's success is rooted in our employees' happiness, health and safety. That's why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to meet the needs of our employees and enhance their well-being. In addition to competitive pay and performance incentives, eligible employees can take advantage of the following benefits:  401(k) plan with employer matching  Retirement pension  Paid vacation  Parental leave  Holiday pay  Sick leave  Medical, vision, dental and life insurance  Wellness programs  Pre-tax benefits  Short and long-term disability plans  Tuition assistance

Name: Senior Business Analyst - B2B / B2C

Name: 6006 - Analyst Market Strategies Senior
Description: Job DescriptionSRP is one of the largest public power and water utilities in the U.S. providing electricity to approximately one million customers in the greater metropolitan Phoenix area. Since its founding in 1903, SRP has fostered a culture of stewardship and customer service consistently ranking as an industry leader in customer service according to J.D. Power. SRP continues to adapt to its changing business environment by seeking innovative ways to reimagine utility service and the provision of critical resources essential to the life and economy of Arizona. Job Brief Reporting to the Manager of Power Supply & Trading, the analyst will represent Supply & Trading & Fuels in the Western Energy Imbalance Market, as well as other emerging markets in the West. The analyst will support the Manager of PST in developing energy trading and asset optimization systems for EIM deployment and participation, as well as responsibility for analysis and delivery of EIM operational and financial results. The analyst will also be responsible for developing and implementing day-ahead and real-time dispatch strategies for optimizing SRP's portfolio of generating assets. Job Responsibilities * Represent SRP/S&T&F as subject matter expert in various forums in industry, including Western Energy Imbalance Market, emerging markets, ISOs, RTOs, and technical working groups * Develop asset optimization and dispatch strategies for SRP's generating assets * Responsible for maintenance and update of asset optimization model * Aid in monitoring fleet performance, trading positions, and operatonal risks * Develop and operate models and support tools for the daily forecast of native load, renewable generation resources, and market prices * Responsible for authoring and maintaining operating procedures and training materials * Assist traders with trade execution and compliance * Ensure successful integration of new resources and positions into the portfolio * Identify and assist with development of data and model methodologies that can be used to improve analytics * Other duties as assigned Education Completion of a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution that prepares the employee for the assignment. Experience 5 years post degree, professional experience for senior level. Requisition Details Requisition ID: 8917 EOE - SRP encourages a diverse workforce All candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Currently, SRP does not sponsor H1B visas. Why Work at SRP SRP's success is rooted in our employees' happiness, health and safety. That's why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to meet the needs of our employees and enhance their well-being. In addition to competitive pay and performance incentives, eligible employees can take advantage of the following benefits: • 401(k) plan with employer matching • Retirement pension • Paid vacation • Parental leave • Holiday pay • Sick leave • Medical, vision, dental and life insurance • Wellness programs • Pre-tax benefits • Short and long-term disability plans • Tuition assistance

Name: IT Organizational Change Management (OCM) Analyst
Description: Job Brief The Organizational Change Management Analyst will create and lead activities related to large-scale organizational change projects following the ITS organizational change management process and using the associated toolkit. Activities may include organizational development and design, organizational and stakeholder assessments, data analysis development and implementation of people focused transition strategies and strategic communication plans, facilitation of training. Collaborate across work programs to ensure information sharing and integration of related activities. Participate in developing work programs with other areas of the company as appropriate. Support project teams in integrating change management activities into their project plans. Job Responsibilities • Apply established structured change management approach and methodology for the people side change caused by projects and change efforts Identify potential people-side risks and anticipated points of resistance, and develop specific plans to mitigate or address the concernsConduct readiness assessments, evaluate results and present findings in a logical and easy-to-understand mannerDevelop a set of actionable and targeted change management plans – including communication plan, sponsor roadmap, coaching plan, training plan and resistance management planSupport the execution of plans by employee-facing managers and business leadersProvide active and visible coaching to executive leaders who are change sponsorsCreate and manage measurement systems to track adoption, utilization and proficiency of individual changesIdentify resistance and performance gaps, and work to develop and implement corrective actionsCreate and enable reinforcement mechanisms and celebrations of successWork with project teams to integrate change management activities into the overall project planWork with communication, training, and HR specialists in the formulation of particular plans and activities to support project implementation  Knowledge & Skills  A solid understanding of how people go through a change and the change process Experience and knowledge of change management principles and methodologies (example: Prosci certification)  Familiarity with project management approaches, tools and phases of the project lifecycle  Experience with large-scale organizational change effort  Advanced interpersonal skills - Ability to interact effectively with various individuals/groups throughout SRP from executive management to hourly personnel to perform high quality work under pressure and on tight deadlines  Exceptional oral, written and listening skills; ability to be persuasive with publics of diverse backgrounds and viewpoints  Ability to determine key points on complex issues  Solid organizational skills; ability to handle multiple tasks and work under intense pressure  Ability to negotiate with individuals on all levels of the organization, and provide communications counsel to executive management  Ability to guide and facilitate teams/partners who are experts in their fields  Ability to use discretion in handling confidential and highly sensitive information  Willingness to accept personal responsibility for independent actions taken on behalf of SRP  Ability to explain complex issues and technical information in terms appropriate for various audiences  Strong problem solving skills for providing answers, enlisting support and finding new solutions, often under stress and deadlines  Ability to work independently, often on sensitive issues, under severe deadlines  Ability to generate enthusiastic acceptance and support for SRP plans, policies and procedures  Knowledge of the electric utility industry and the current information technology environment is preferred Education Completion of a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution that prepares the employee for the assignment. Experience Bachelor's degree in related field appropriate for the assignment plus six years of experience is preferred.  Prefer experience developing concepts, processes, and systems that support organizational change activities relating to enterprise architectures, large-scale modernization efforts, and/or EAM/ERP initiatives.  Change Management Professional designation is a plus  Accredited Communicator Certification is a plus Requisition Details Requisition ID: 8706  EOE - SRP encourages a diverse workforce  All candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States.  Currently, SRP does not sponsor H1B visas.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: The Financial Analyst position is an integral part of Finance Shared Services organization in Global Business Travel (GBT).  The analyst will be a member of Client Billing team and will provide guidance and consultative support to ensure accurate and timely recording financial activity related to credit card payments received based on GBT as merchant activity.  This position will be a central point of contact for Finance and product owner teams, and will work with an array of credit card processing suppliers. The analyst may also have the opportunity for increased business exposure by working directly with other teams as our product lines expand and customer base grows to demonstrate our commitment to ensure controls, and drive results. The analyst will also work with off-shore colleagues to ensure accurate and timely financial reporting.  The key job duties, but not limited to, are as follows:  · Reviewing and recording bank statement activity into the general ledger  · Analyze merchant billing activity for accuracy and completeness  · Credit card charge and credit processing  · Consultation and collaboration with Finance, Controllership, Products, Client Management and off-shore support teams to expedite research and answer queries  · Manage Account Receivable and support collection effort by providing analysis and reporting to Commercial teams  -Provide support for ad hoc requests, such as adjustments to billing, audits, account reconciliation, and reporting requests from our business partners  · Support efforts and projects to implement new products, as well as process and system enhancements  · Provide training to enhance knowledge, and deliver premium value to our colleagues and business partners LocationUnited States>Arizona>PhoenixIt is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.  GBT Recruitment Privacy Statement

Name: Operations Analyst Business and Reporting
Description: Operations Analyst Business and ReportingDescription At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small.  Summary  The Business/Reporting Analyst will help us extract meaning from large volumes of data to make the right business decisions. The candidate will have to set the right vision, strategy and roadmap and work alongside with stakeholders in the organization to make it happen. The candidate knows and has a passion for working with business intelligence tools, can model multidimensional datasets, and can partner with business leaders to answer key business questions. Responsible for requirements gathering, report design/authoring, quality assurance and documenting artifacts related to the report development lifecycle. Utilized strong business and technical knowledge to ensure the highest level of service and efficiency for the customer.  General Responsibilities Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisionsPerform all basic phases of report development, including intake from a request queue, transformation or acquisition of data, report creation, and documentation of processesTranslate general reporting requests from the business into data requirements, acquire data from multiple sources, and develop reports to satisfy the immediate business need, with some effort to anticipate future questionsDevelop business requirements and process documentation for ad-hoc, on demand, and standard reportsLeverage sufficient understanding of the business and strategy to provide recommendations on report design and automation; using best practices to meet business needsCollaborate within a team environment to develop relevant and repeatable policies and procedures for preparing business reports and departmental processesMake recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve marketing campaign targeting and measurement in the futureDefine the data elements and data structure that our team should leverage to enable analytical and reporting capabilities for our business development teamPreparing and delivering business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocksWork with engineering and the data warehouse to enable the appropriate capture and storage of key data pointsEnable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable formatParticipate in strategic & tactical planning discussionsQualifications General Qualifications 4-year degree from an accredited institution in Business, Information Technology, Business Analytics or related field Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Computer Science, Information Management or related field OR combination of education and significant experience required (advanced degree preferred)Two (2) years of experience in designing and authoring reports/dashboards using Microsoft BI stack (Excel/SSRS/PowerBI) or other current reporting tools is required.Two (2) years of experience writing complex queries using T-SQL/PL SQL.Ability to work within a cross-functional team setting and shifting prioritiesGood communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning organizational levels.Demonstrated ability to use discretion and make sound decisionsUnderstanding of relational database design and concepts.
