Name: Analyst/ Senior Analyst, Credit and Fraud Risk
Description: American Express invites you to share your resume so you can be considered for future Analyst/ Senior Analyst opportunities in the New York and Phoenix locations within our Credit & Fraud Risk team.About American ExpressAmerican Express is a global services company that provides consumers and businesses with exceptional access to products, insights and experiences that enrich lives and build business success. We make it easier, safer and more rewarding for consumers and businesses to purchase the things they need and for merchants to sell their goods and services through innovative payment, travel and expense management solutions.Our direct relationships with millions of consumers, businesses and merchants worldwide -- combined with our leading-edge marketing, analytical, rewards, and servicing capabilities -- enable us to uniquely offer an array of differentiated experiences that enrich lives. American Express was built on service and sustained by innovation and our vision is to work hard every day to provide the worlds best customer experience.About Credit and Fraud RiskPurposeful, ambitious, insatiable, analytical, collaborative and courageous are the hallmarks of our Credit and Fraud Risk team.This critical team is responsible for managing enterprise risks through the customer lifecycle and across all our global products. We develop industry-first data capabilities, build profitable decision-making frameworks, create machine learning-powered predictive models, and improve customer servicing strategies. This team has delivered industry-leading results year after year while enabling profitable growth and delivering a best-in-class customer experience.This team is structured under four core functions:Credit Risk Strategy: Monitor credit portfolios and optimize profit-based risk management decisions at all stages of the customer credit lifecycleFraud Risk Strategy: Develop fraud prevention strategies on behalf of our customersDecision Science: Build predictive models using AI/Machine Learning for all portfolios and productsRisk Capabilities: Develop technical solutions and capabilities to manage data and execute credit and fraud risk strategiesAnalysts in Credit and Fraud Risk management will be:Responsible for providing analytical support to mitigate risk, enable revenue growth, and drive profitability through diverse analytical projectsIntegrating new data sources and capabilities to drive key business decisionsExpected to develop disciplined monitoring of credit and fraud risk metrics at the portfolio level, as well as across key stages of the customer lifecycle such as underwriting and customer management, and perform root cause analyses of concerning trends to identify performance driversCollaborating with multiple partners including Finance, Technology, and other cross-functional teams across the company. They will work with colleagues to design and implement risk control strategies based on statistical, financial, and economic analysis. QualificationsBachelors degree in finance, accounting, economics, engineering, or statistics from a top tier university with high GPA0-2 years of experience in credit/fraud risk management at a financial institution. More than 2 years of relevant experience for the Senior Analyst roleStrong analytical and problem-solving skills must have the ability to compile, analyze, research, and link complex issuesDemonstrated ability to work effectively in high pressure situations and handle multiple priority assignments simultaneouslyMust be a self-starterProven team skills including the ability to work effectively across geographical boundaries must have proven collaborative skills, and flexibility to adapt to a dynamic environmentExcellent communication skills, both written and verbal with the ability to effectively communicate at all levelsWillingness to learn and master new systems and processesKnowledge of Microsoft Office applications requiredSQL skills or other programming experience (e.g., Hive, SAS, R, Python) preferredEmployment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.Why American Express:Theres a difference between having a job and making a difference.American Express has been making a difference in peoples lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.Weve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or community. And when theyre ready to take on a new career path, were right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best future they envision.Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.The powerful backing of American Express.Dont make a difference without it.Dont live life without it. Name: Compensation Analyst
Description: Requisition Number: 71055  Our compensation team is small but mighty! In this role, you’ll get the opportunity to work with specific area of our business and be their go-to for anything compensation related.  As our compensation expert, you will evaluate internal equity and external market competitiveness to make sure we are able to retain and attract talented teammates!    As an Insight Compensation Analyst, your job is to:Consult and recommend. You’ll need to partner closely with various departments in order to recommend action plans to resolve compensation related inquiries and conducting analysis of existing jobs. Of course the strategies support established guidelines, policies and practices.Be the expert. Evaluate job duties and responsibilities, classify job exemption statuses, determine salary grades for new and existing positions and document our job descriptions. You’ll also be our go-to for compensation data and will need to have a solid understanding of SAP, SharePoint and Success Factors.Design and administer. Use your skills to create, modify and design new compensation plans. Start with managing compensation surveys and then use that data to determine our competitiveness in the market. You’ll need to keep up with all of our plans and make on-going changes as needed.    What you will bring to Insight:Bachelor’s degree and 1+ year of relevant experienceStrong analytical skills including efficiently reviewing large amounts to data to provide a direction. Expertise with MS Excel to create, understand and analyze.A proactive and independent mindset. We are going to give you a number of projects and look forward to you to succeed. Don’t worry we’ll be there all the way.Solid communication skills – to be successful in this position, you will need to have solid relationships with your business leaders and may regularly interact with our Executive teams. The position described above provides a summary of some the job duties required and what it would be like to work at Insight. For a comprehensive list of physical demands and work environment for this position, click here.  Today, every business is a technology business. Insight Enterprises, Inc. empowers organizations of all sizes with Insight Intelligent Technology Solutions™ and services to maximize the business value of IT. As a Fortune 500-ranked global provider of digital innovation, cloud/data center transformation, connected workforce, and supply chain optimization solutions and services, we help clients successfully manage their IT today while transforming for tomorrow. From IT strategy and design to implementation and management, our 6,800 employees help clients innovate and optimize their operations to run smarter. Discover more at insight.com.    Global provider of Intelligent Technology Solutions™ for organizations of all sizesRanked #417 on the 2018 Fortune 500, #12 on the CRN Solution Provider 500Founded in 1988 in Tempe, Arizona; now celebrating our 30th anniversary and operating in 20 countries$6.7 billion in revenue for 20178,000+ teammates worldwide working with 5,300+ partners2017 Arizona’s Most Admired Companies (AZ Business Magazine), #7 2017 Best Places to Work (Phoenix Business Journal)2018 Dell EMC Server Partner of the Year, 2018 Intel Retail Solution Partner of the Year, 2018 IBM Geography Excellence Award as the Top National Strategic Business Partner in North America, Microsoft’s largest global partner       Today's talent leads tomorrow's success. Learn about careers at Insight: jobs.insight.com.     Insight is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.     Posting Notes: Tempe || Arizona (US-AZ) || United States (US) || HR || None || US - Tempe, AZ ||

Name: Business Innovation Analyst
Description: Are you looking for your next professional challenge? Is your goal to join a dynamic global industry leader that can boast nearly 120 years of excellence, growth and continuing innovation? Do you hold yourself to the highest standards? If yes, then we would love to hear from you. At BSI, the Business Innovation Analyst will conduct research on emerging technologies, competitor offerings, assist with innovation projects and help design and create innovative technical solutions. He/she will be a collaborative partner delivering innovative ideas, solutions and services to meet BSI objectives. This role will work on a number of projects and initiatives with customers at varying levels within the organization. This individual will utilize their technical competency to perform external market and technical research, design, perform software testing and participate in proof of concept (POC) and prototyping activity. Essential Responsibilities:Drive strategic research that will identify and evaluate technologies to build new capabilities at BSI and support the execution of innovative ideasProvide input and guidance around design and innovationEnsure quality in the products and software developed by the innovation teamProactively anticipate obstacles or areas of concern and help identify potential solutionsCoordinate transfer of research, prototypes and improved processes to the customerAssist with the evaluation and selection of new technologiesServe as a point-of-contact for vendorsSupport the implementation, roll-out and adoption phases of transactional practice technologiesCoordinate and collaborate with business teams to ensure that practice solutions are appropriately integrated with systems, processes and dataAssist with testing new technology and provide feedback to project teams and vendorsDocument and promote best practices in the use of AI-enabled and automation technologies by the practice teamsUse advanced analysis techniques to research, design, develop, maintain and support user-friendly and efficient business information systems and processesMay be called upon to handle other duties as required This is a great opportunity for an ambitious professional to gain visibility within the organization. We seek someone who meets all of the following criteria:Bachelor’s degree and/or five (5) years related experienceStrategic, analytic and creative thinkerAbility to multi-task and prioritizeWork well in team environment, as well as, independently Our ambition is to be recognized and valued globally as a best-in-class company; a client-driven, efficiently-run, growing business. BSI has come a long way since being founded in 1901. Today, we're a global business services organization, respected world over for the development of standards; assessment of management systems; testing and certification of products and services; providing software solutions; and the delivery of training courses. We offer diverse career paths from auditing to sales, product development to finance, and from IT to marketing.  With around 4,000 employees working with over 80,000 clients in 172 countries it means that career opportunities are vast. BSI challenges mediocrity and complacency to help embed excellence into the way people and products work. That means showing businesses how to improve performance, reduce risk and achieve sustainable growth. Our Vision: "To be the global business improvement partner of choice." Our Mission: "To help organizations embed excellence", and states our shared purpose. Our Values: "Integrity - Continual improvement - Inclusivity", guide us in the way we work and help us deliver our Vision and Mission. What we offer: BSI offers a competitive salary, group-sponsored health and dental, short-term and long-term disability, a company-matched 401k plan, company paid life insurance, 11 paid holidays and 4 weeks paid time off.  BSI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to diversity.  #LI-CB1

Name: Programmer Analyst
Description: Programmer Analyst Technology Job #S20181022 Phoenix, Arizona  This position will serve as a Software Programmer Analyst on the Application Services Team. Acts as the technical expert within the Firm for software development. Responsibilities include full software development lifecycle, including analysis, application coding, testing and support. This position is also responsible for designing, writing, modifying and implementing advanced software applications, as well as coaching and mentoring junior developers in mastering software programming techniques and advanced engineering concepts.  Software Development: Develop working programs using a variety of languages and programming patterns that effectively respond to end-user requirements. Develop advanced mobile applications for both the iOS and Android platforms. Develop cloud-based applications using the Azure cloud. Effectively test and debug software. Lead and manage development sprints using standard agile methods. Work with project managers and business analysts to develop and manage effective project plans. Develop modular, reusable code using standard programming patterns and frameworks.  Scope of responsibility includes defining, designing, developing/testing, documenting and maintaining in-house developed applications or systems. SPECIFIC SKILLS REQUIRED Experience building web-based applications using ASP.NET MVC and SQL server, as well as experience with JavaScript, JQuery, Ajax and HTML/CSS/Bootstrap. Ability to handle multiple projects and prioritize effectively. Work well with a diverse group of people and the ability to listen and communicate well. Ability to work effectively with a team in a shared code environment. Ability to work efficiently and effectively with little supervision. SPECIFIC SKILLS PREFERRED Development of mobile applications for iOS and Android platforms. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Requires a degree in Information Systems/Computer Science and 5 to 8 years of programming business applications, or equivalent. The individual must demonstrate the years of experience has translated into the ability to take on more complex programming challenges and responsibility at this level.SDL2017

Name: Database Programmer Analyst Sr
Description: Position Overview  The Database Programmer Analyst Senior provides technical expertise and is responsible for adhering to and enforcing database standards and methodologies. This position is also responsible for thoroughness, accuracy, and solving complex problems related to the delivery of database solutions and integration that improve business capability and efficiency.     Position Qualifications  Minimum education and/or experience: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field and five (5) years of database development experience. An equivalent combination of post-secondary education and/or job-related experience may substitute for the minimum qualifications on a year for year basis.    Knowledge, skills, and abilities:Knowledge of:Complete software development lifecycle using different methodologies and frameworks (e.g. Agile, Waterfall, and SCRUM). Database diagramming concepts, theory and practices. Developing SSIS packages of high complexity (.NET) and scope while adhering to documented development standards.Skills In:Planning, organizational and analytical. SSRS configuration, security, subscriptions and reporting building. Analyzing databases with Microsoft SQL Management Studio.Ability to:Develop analysis reports and queries from structured and unstructured sources. Create and develop test Transact SQL queries, stored procedures, functions and views, following best practices and standards for a N-Tier high availability environment. Conduct data-driven experiments, to interpret data, and to create innovative data-based products and services. Prioritize and problem-solve complex enterprise applications. Lead database application development projects while communicating well both verbally and in writing. Preferred education and/or experience: Experience in a MS SQL Server database environment. Experience with SQL Server 2008-2016. Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS). Experience with using SSRS for reporting and BI. Experience with C# and current .NET Frameworks. Experience with N-tiered architecture. Experience with Visual Studio 2013/2015, TFS 2013/2015 and SharePoint. Experience using MS SQL Server, T-SQL, Business Intelligence, SQL Management Studio, SQL Reporting Services, SQL Integration Services and SQL Analysis Services.   Preferred training, certifications and/or other special requirements:Training In:developing database applications end-to-end. using SSIS to perform integration and workflows. obtaining and transforming raw data into meaningful and useful information for business analysis purposes. developing and implementing normalized databases in a relational design.Working conditions: Must be able to work in a normal, indoor office environment; must have manual dexterity of hands and body to operate office equipment; must be able to manage frequent interruptions, time pressures, high work volumes, multiple and complicated tasks, unscheduled tasks, team-oriented activities, prompt decision-making and interaction with government officials; must constantly maintain concentration, accuracy, ethical behavior and a professional demeanor.   Essential Job Tasks Designs, creates and deploys custom SQL Server database solutions. Follows industry practices of analysis, design, development, testing, deployment and maintenance/production support of COTS and custom databases and applications. Supports complex data integration through SSIS packages (C#). Works with stakeholders to design and deploy SSRS reports using various data sources. Supports web and application development through comprehensive data layer design. Functions as backup for SQL Server and SSRS administrator as needed. Interacts effectively and professionally (at all technical levels) in a team setting with co-workers, leadership, stakeholders and business staff. Acquires knowledge and understanding of business practices and processes to the extent needed to improve business outcomes through innovative data solutions. Completes special projects as assigned. Selection ProcedureThe hiring authority will select the successful candidate based on departmental needs.   All offers of employment made to new hires and rehires at Maricopa County are contingent upon successful completion of a post-offer, pre-employment thorough background investigation. A background investigation is conducted on a current employee who changes to a Safety Sensitive Position or one having the potential for serious adverse impact on the integrity or efficiency of the County. These requirements do not pertain to employees of elected officials who undergo background investigation processes administered through their respective offices.  Typically successful candidates are hired at a salary rate, up to midpoint of the range, based on applicable experience, internal equity and budgetary allowances.

Name: Merchant Risk Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJOB DESCRIPTION – RISK ANALYST The goal of the Risk Department is to mitigate financial loss to the company through proactive merchant review and analysis. This position is within the Risk Management Department, and reports to the Manager of Risk. The Risk Analyst Candidate will proactively review the companies merchant portfolio for credit risk and fraud. The candidate will utilize a host of risk monitoring tools to review and analyze merchant activity, business structure, and financial exposure. This information will be used to determine whether adverse action is required to prevent loss. JOB REQUIREMENTSMonitor merchant processing activity for exceptions outside of approved parameters.Identify, investigate and report potentially suspicious activity.Make decisions regarding the disposition of merchant processing activity to mitigate losses to the company.Assist in the mitigation of losses by ensuring activities are an accurate representation of merchant’s business model.Provide various reporting to management.Any other tasks as assignedQUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s in finance or the equivalent in relevant experience and training.Merchant risk and merchant services is a must.2 years’ experience in risk management and/or underwriting.Strong analytical skills.Experience in bank or bank card industry.Good practical knowledge of ExcelGood business senseExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work in a fast-paced environment

Name: Business Process Analyst (Project Manager - Technology)
Description: Title:: Business Process Analyst (Project Manager - Technology)  Duration: 05-Mar-2018 - 04-Jun-2018 (Possible Extension)  Location: 1030 N Colorado St. Gilbert, Arizona 85233  Client's Logistics is looking for a highly driven process improvement leader who can deliver efficiencies and cost savings in a highly manual work environment with a high degree of process variations. This role provides capabilities to the organization through disciplined process improvement methodologies. This position will work with all levels of employees in order to gain understanding of day to day operations from the frontline employees and department managers, as well as influencing and attaining buy-in from the leadership on proposed process improvement initiatives.  Client's Logistics, is a national leader in transportation and logistics for the automotive industry, offering end-to-end solutions and services utilizing leading technology to connect vehicle inventory for consumers, dealers, manufacturers and the overall automotive ecosystem worldwide.  Client is transforming the way the world buys, sells and owns cars with industry-leading digital marketing, software, financial, wholesale and e-commerce solutions. The global company has nearly 30,000 team members in more than 200 locations and is partner to more than 40,000 auto dealers, as well as most major automobile manufacturers; engaging U.S. consumer car buyers with the most recognized media brands in the industry.  Primary Responsibilities:  · Develop relationships with stakeholders in order to gain an understanding of business drivers and objectives.  · Lead analysis and design of existing and new business processes that span multiple areas of the organization.  · Document workflows, process requirements, and operational improvement plans.  · Utilize business metrics to facilitate process development.  · Help to define success metrics for each new system or process and establishes a plan to track, monitor, and measure the success of those metrics.  · Coordinate processes across operational departments to ensure that optimum operation results are achieved.  · Support training and change management efforts around technology and process.  Requirements:  Required Qualifications:  · Minimum of 2-3 years experience designing and leading improvement processes.  · Bachelors degree in Information Systems, Business Administration or equivalent combination of industry related professional experience and education.  · Strong analytical skills and detail-oriented with the ability to solve complex problems and make sound, strategic decisions.  · Proven track record of driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication.  · Excellent written, verbal, and presentation communication skills, especially in representing their technical expertise to a diverse audience.  Preferred Qualifications:  · Experience with logistics, vehicle logistics/ logistical constraints a plus.  · Experience in leading Lean operational projects is a plus.  · MBA.  Thanks & Regards  Parul Chhabra  Primus Software Corporation  Direct: 678 -666- 4393 | Fax: 770-234-4163  Email: parul.chhabra@primussoft.com  www.primussoft.com | 3061 Peachtree Industrial Blvd, Suite 110 Duluth, GA - 30097  Let's connect, LinkedIn: https://in.linkedin.com/pub/parul-chhabra/b1/42b/527

If you have experience working with Chartmaxx, SoftMed, Hyland Onbase, OneContent, Allscripts, EPIC, Cerner, 3M, Optum, or similar systems, it is time to apply for our position!  The Revenue Cycle Systems Analyst II provides primary software configuration for implemented production and non-production applications. Works existing open incidents and applies skills to more complex problem solving. communicate issues/risks to the project manager in a timely manner.Documents and executes an integrated test plan and a user acceptance test plan.Analyzes business requirements and develops design requirements into technical design and maintains comprehensive technical documentation.Configures software to meet design specifications and develops implementation plans for vendor provided software.Complies with, and contributes to, system configuration standards and guidelines.Gathers, standardizes and enters or imports all necessary clinical/business data into the system.Configures and unit tests the system as specified in the business and technical requirements to meet configurastion criteria according to schedule.Second tier application support.Acts as liaison with operations community to ensure continuing responsiveness of applicable system software user requirements.Ensures the maintenance of adequate software systems documentation.Provides technical assistance and training to users of systems, with little or no instruction or mentoring.Able to come on campus during off-shift hours and provide after hours call support required.Works collaboratively with vendors Name: Actuarial Analyst (M)
Description: Location:2721 N Central Ave, Phoenix, Arizona 85036 United States of America. Actuarial Analyst – ValuationJob Profile and Description Armed with statistical, financial, business computational, and modeling tools, actuaries determine, assess and quantify the risks of threats to the organization becoming realized and develop policies and programs to cover or minimize the disruptive operational and financial cost to the organization. This makes actuaries essential in the life insurance industry.  *** Oxford Life is seeking a talented Actuarial Analyst for the Actuarial Department of Oxford. This position reports to the Valuation Actuary. This is a great opportunity for an eager, motivated new grad of a Bachelor’s program in Actuarial Science to begin a successful career at a strong life insurance company. New grads MUST have a strong proficiency with Microsoft Excel. *** Duties and ResponsibilitiesDetermine the reserves required on a Statutory, GAAP, and Tax basis to ensure the company’s financial position to meet client claims.Determine the financial soundness of each line of business through the use of loss recognition testing, gross premium valuations, asset adequacy analyses, and/or experience studies.Gather and analyze experience statistics to estimate population mortality, morbidity, lapse, persistency and maturity rates.Work with accountants, compliance officers, marketing representatives, auditors, consultants, and senior management to develop and promote the proper reserving of insurance products.Use mathematical techniques and statistical concepts in order to determine and assess the risk inherent in a particular scheme.Keep a close eye to the new research and developments that have arisen in the actuarial field.Apply innovative solutions for resolving constantly changing business problems.Explain the risk and limitations of actuarial schemes in detail to a non-actuarial audience.Document the concepts, methodologies, and procedures that have been implemented.Skills and SpecificationsMust have proven multitasking skills and can work under extreme pressure.Must have excellent analytical and computational skills (Microsoft Excel, Word, Access and PowerPoint; Actuarial Software (e.g. MG-ALFA); Financial Reporting Software (Harris Data) and Policy Administration Software (LifePro and Life-support Plus).Must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Education and QualificationsMinimum Bachelor’s degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, accounting or finance with an active pursuit of successfully passing Society of Actuaries actuarial exams.Preference will be given to candidates who have shown success in passing exams towards completion of their designation as an Associate or Fellow of the Society of Actuaries.Relevant experience in the actuarial field is preferred but not required.Salary and compensation commensurate with appropriate experience U-Haul is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants for employment will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, provincial, state or local law. Individual accommodations are available on requests for applicants taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Information obtained during this process will only be shared on a need to know basis.

Name: Senior Software Business Analyst - Retail
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client seeking a Senior Software Business Analyst - Retail in Scottsdale, Arizona (AZ).  Responsibilities include:  Responsible for managing relationships with key stakeholders in functional business process areas by understanding specific business process area needs and ensuring timely development and deployment of applicable and reliable IT services and solutions to satisfy such needs Mentors and leads less experienced technical business analysts as assigned Works closely with designated business process area representatives and other business units/users to understand applicable business process requirements to support with appropriate IT services and solutions; as necessary, facilitate the definition and documentation of business processes (i.e. business process engineering or re-engineering); be an effective IT advocate for the business process area Becomes sufficiently familiar with IT applications and systems in the context of assigned specific business process areas to assist in the troubleshooting of reported errors and/or problems and coordinate timely resolution through other IT departments (i.e. Systems Engineering, Development, etc.) Coordinate the analysis/troubleshooting of system/application issues to determine/report root cause and encourage future prevention Documents issues, complaints, business requirements, and enhancement requests related to IT systems and/or applications Complies with all processes, adopted methodologies, standards, and deliverables associated with all elements of the SDLC Works closely with IT management to ensure that issues or enhancements are being addressed in future software enhancement releasesREQUIREMENTS: BS degree or equivalent preferred or equivalent proven experience; Name: Risk Analyst Lead
Description: Purpose of JobThis Job Posting is for multiple openings available in 2018.  We are currently seeking talented Risk Management professionals with large financial institution expertise in banking, insurance or investments.  Little to no travel is required.  Provides risk management support for a line of business or staff agency in key risk identification, measurement and aggregation, and the understanding and management of risk through appropriate practices and processes. Assesses and mitigates enterprise and business on exposures through the identification of key and emerging risks and evaluates alignment with risk strategy and appetite. Monitors the risk and control environment to ensure that exposures are kept at acceptable levels and may consult on risk mitigation plans. Leads and executes complex initiatives and cross functional teams within the Chief Risk Office and across the Enterprise that drive problem resolution. Leverages broad enterprise knowledge and/or expert knowledge of core business discipline(s), products and processes.Job RequirementsABOUT USAA USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level.  In each of the past five years, we've been a top-40 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For®, and we've ranked among Victory Media's Top 10 Military Friendly® Employers 13 years straight. We embrace a robust veteran workforce and encourage veterans and veteran spouses to apply. ABOUT USAA RISK Management USAA is a growing financial services company and the Risk Management function at USAA is an important part of this growth. It is an exciting time at USAA and in our Risk Management organization. We are a diversified team of Risk professionals, working across all lines of business across USAA operations (banking, insurance, investments) seeing the incredible growth first-hand. Working at USAA in Risk Management affords you the ability to be a part of USAAs noble mission on a daily basis. We stand behind our 11 million members who rely on us every day.  See what it's like to work for a company where your passion meets our purpose:  USAA Careers Identifies and seeks key stakeholders across the enterprise to support the identification, assessment, aggregation and the overall management of risks and controls.Presents findings and recommendations to various levels of leadership.Routinely communicates results of risk assessments to governance committees, business process owners and various levels of leadership and influences decision making.Develops process and procedures for successful implementation of new risk policies, practices, appetites and solutions to ensure holistic understanding and management of risks according to industry best practice.Develops strategies, tools, and methodologies to measure, monitor, and report risks.Applies expert knowledge to utilize or produce analytical material for discussions with cross functional teams to understand business objectives and influence solution strategies.Leads, assembles and facilitates cross-functional teams to identify, assess, aggregate and mitigate current and emerging risk events.Serves as the point of contact for senior risk leadership on projects and special management requests that often impact the enterprise or core operating area.Formulates and reviews stress test plans for a line of business or the enterprise.Evaluates results, and frames contingency plans in partnership with key business stakeholders.Crafts key communications to be delivered to executives and board members.Minimum QualificationsBachelor's degree in Risk Management, Business, Finance, or a related field required; Or 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree.8 or more years of risk management or 8 years operations experience in a relevant functional area to include banking, insurance, financial services, audit, project management, public accounting or other related operational area; Or advanced degree or designation in a quantitative discipline relevant to risk management and 6 or more years relevant risk management work experience; Or PhD in a quantitative discipline and up to 4 years relevant risk management work experience.PreferredAdvanced degree in a quantitative discipline such as: Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, other quantitative discipline; PhD strongly preferredCFA or Risk Management certification.Risk management experience in large financial institution.Working experience with Risk Controls and Risk Assessments.Knowledge of regulatory environment including role of federal oversight agencies. The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.  At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits package in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals. Relocation assistance is available for this position.

Name: Lead Peoplesoft Systems Analyst, Vice President
Description: Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world with total assets of over $2.4 trillion (as ranked by SNL Financial, April 2016) and 140,000 colleagues in nearly 50 countries. In the U.S., we're 13,000 strong, working together to positively impact every customer, organization, and community we serve. We achieve this by delivering on our values, putting people first, fostering long-term relationships built on honesty and mutual understanding, and inspiring the best in each other. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture supported by Total Rewards that include our cash balance pension plan. Join a team that's working to fulfill its vision to be the world's most trusted financial group.Lead Systems Analyst PeopleSoft, Vice PresidentJob SummaryThe Lead Systems Analyst will work closely with the Subject Matter Experts, Business Analyst, Solution Architects and Developers in supporting the Controllers organization. The candidate will demonstrate a high level of ownership and accountability and will lead efforts and consult with technology and business teams to offer solutions using best practices. The candidate will have a strong understanding of PeopleSoft Financials, especially the General Ledger and Fixed Assets and all tools delivered with the product.The candidate will have a strong understanding of the Corporate Controllers/Corporate Accounting functions at a large bank and have led have multiple PeopleSoft Financials Implementations in the past.The candidate should be able to successfully lead a team of resources in support of both a project and production environment. The candidate should have demonstrated ability to work effectively in a self-directed environment, taking initiative and proactively improving processes. The candidate should demonstrate strong verbal and analytical skills.Major Responsibilities:Perform system analysis and design to support the Corporate Controllers function.Leads in defining user requirements using various tools or JAD sessions; produce technical documentation in accordance with SDLC guidelinesInfluences business users in redefining business processes to maximize application usage as required. Recommends builds only for differentiation.Perform data analysis, profiling, and validation of new data sources, involving loans, deposits and other security related data.Manage technology project delivery; addressing risks and issues through effective contingency plans and proper escalation.Provide functional support to the technical team in systems development and act as a liaison between end users and the technical team members.Provide technical expertise on overall architecture and strategy of any Regulatory Solutions.Participate in and help lead change management activities associated with the automation of Finance processes and systems. Partner with management, project champions, and process owners to align process improvement initiatives with business objectives.Integrate with MUB Data Management Office, Finance and Risk DMO to ensure continuity and consistency of data integrity and data quality across all Finance technology platforms and solutions.Additional Responsibilities:Review analysis and design done by systems personnel, provide guidance and solution direction.Reviews, advises and designs standard software and hardware builds, system options, risks, costs versus benefits and impact on the enterprise business process and goals.Develops programming standards and procedures as well as programming architectures for code reuse.Recommends system improvements, new applications and develops plans to improve service.Prepares project schedules and budget estimates.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree, preferably in MIS, Accounting or related IT disciplineIn-depth understanding of PeopleSoft General Ledger and the Corporate Accounting functions at a major Bank.8+ years relevant consulting and/or industry experience in Banking and Corporate FinancialsAbility to communicate with and lead technical and non-technical groups on a regular basis to maintain transparency on work efforts and to ensure design and implementation is understood by all team participantsFinance and Technology background with experience in Banking industry preferredStrong personal ownership and commitment to qualityMust be a team player with good interpersonal, verbal and written communications skills.Should be able to work with off-shore vendors and resources spread out globally.Ability to communicate and work directly with business leaders across ISA and FinanceMust be detail oriented and possess ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.Must possess organizational, problem-solving skills and time management skills and be able to meet deadlines. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.  To learn more about MUFG, review all current career opportunities, and apply please visit us online: www.mufg-americas.com/careers  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.

Name: PMO Project Analyst
Description: American Express, the world's most respected service brand, has outstanding opportunities for Project Analysts working within the Strategy & Support team at our operations center. At American Express, we invest in you! Recognized as one of the "world's most admired companies". Our employees enjoy a generous benefits package, retirement programs, along with comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will help you achieve your professional goals.Position Overview:We are seeking a PMO Project Analyst to join our growing Project Management Office (PMO) team. You will be an integral part of our servicing department supporting customer interactions across various channels (Online, chat, social media, phone, etc). This dynamic role will provide governance support for multiple programs executing on the same objective, directly participate in customer-facing activities, partner across business leaders and teams to ensure alignment and clear accountability across the organization while collaborating with a peer group in advancing process maturity, including process definition, template design, and project and change management best practices. In addition, you will help support the mechanics of a maturing PMO function by partnering with Project Managers, Portfolio Managers, and senior business stakeholders to improve delivery consistency and transparency of strategic initiatives.The successful candidate should have a strong interest in Project Management work and project coordination activities. They will hold strong communication and analytical skills, presentation and organizational skills, as well as be self-motivated, an innovative thinker and possess the ability to work independently.Essential responsibilities include:Work directly with the Manager of the Project Management Office to implement process improvement changes throughout the PMO and assist with strategic realignment to achieve PMO goalsHeighten the capability of the organizations program management practice ensuring scalable structure and solutions that are aligned with the enterprise and can adapt to changes in needs and support of highly complex, customized environmentsUnderstand business objectives and translate strategic intent into rigorous, repeatable operational processes and services to meet these objectivesDevelop and maintain strong relationships with business partners and geographically dispersed cross-functional project teams to gather time sensitive project data, deliver project support & tracking, and report to various stakeholders and levels of leadership to meet common goalsLead, direct and support the effective implementation of process changes ensuring that appropriate change management principles are adhered toAct as a PMO expert and Business Partner to the Project Managers , providing program management skills and acting as the key contact for process knowledgeContribute in decision making by providing accurate project- and program- management reporting, metrics and analysis to the project teamProvide internal and external stakeholder communications and progress reports that effectively outline the project status, risks, issues and action plans to ensure project successSupport key product/project reviews utilizing PM skills, e.g. project plans, resource management (within triple constraint), issue tracking and dashboardsSupporting the PMO Manager in assessing and reviewing project risks and issues, and providing solutions where applicableAct as meeting facilitator where appropriate; distribution of minutes to all project team membersWork effectively with business partners, vendors, technology, and project management staff to develop the project meeting agendas and ensure agreement/adoption of project objectives/deliverables by all affected constituenciesHelp develop and maintain project management tools and templates.Train and coach staff in the proper application of these procedures and tools as needed to mature project management in the organizationDrive process improvement, standards development, and new working methods for project managementSkills Needed To Succeed:Proven ability to define and implement change initiatives through peer interaction and influenceExcellent organizational skills demonstrated by managing multiple priorities/projectsProven ability to identify, formalize and align resource needs across multiple departments in support of overall business objectives and client specific requirementsKnowledge in standard PMO frameworks and the fluency to communicate the value of a PMOMust be someone who is both passionate and meticulous and who can build, within the PMO, a community of practice dedicated to changing work habits and project results through application of a standard methodologyHas a Pro-Active attitude, is a self-starter and a self-motivator; willing to do what it takes to get the job doneAdaptive personality capable of interacting with all levels of organizationProven teamwork skills with the ability to influence, motivate, mentor and lead team resourcesAbility to achieve short/mid-term results while maintaining focus on long-term strategyAdmirable work ethics and respect for fellow team members (regular attendance, mindful planning and execution of daily/weekly, agendas, action driven minute taking, with regular follow-ups)Excellent written and oral communication skills with demonstrated success in creating senior level presentationsHigh learning agility to continue building knowledge and expertiseEmployment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.*Why American Express?Theres a difference between having a job and making a difference. American Express has been making a difference in peoples lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.Weve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or community. And when theyre ready to take on a new career path, were right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best future they envision.Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.The powerful backing of American Express.Dont make a difference without it.Dont live life without it.Qualifications2+ years of experience working in a formal PMO as a PMO Project Analyst, Project Manager, or equivalent experience while working within Waterfall, Agile, SAFe, and/or similar environments and associated methodologiesExperience demonstrating knowledge and understanding of business processes and the Project Management Office responsibilitiesFamiliarity with Agile (SAFe) methodology and Waterfall environment requiredKnowledge of PM best practices, methodologies, and project governance principlesProficiency with project management, collaboration, and communication toolsAbility to challenge upwards, lead and/or influence teams either with or without direct authorityStrong track record delivering results and exceeding aggressive targetsAbility to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environmentThought leadership, coupled with excellent collaborative skillsExcellent negotiation skills and ability to build strong relationships across different organizationsEnthusiastic, creative individual committed to delivering results within strict timeframesAbility to act with a sense of urgency, commitment to deadlines and deliverables, and personal accountability; Demonstrated self-starterExpert-level skillset in MS Excel, Word, SharePoint and PowerPoint requiredPreferred Qualifications:Experience in developing and deploying business and technical solutionsExperience within matrix organizations and technical environmentsExperience in financial services, call centers, or other service industryExperience in evaluation, analysis, and optimization of PMO processes and toolsEducation & Experience:Bachelors degree (Business Administration, Management, Finance, Risk or other Business related degrees) required or equivalent experience. Masters and/or Certifications (PMP, Lean, Scrum, etc.) is nice to have but not required. ReqID: 18015521  Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-time  Date Posted: Nov 20, 2018, 5:47:04 PM

Name: Application Systems Analyst II
Description: Under the direction of the IT Application Manager, this position is responsible for the continuing deployment and development of vendor proprietary hospital application software necessary to run business, clinical or financial systems within a large integrated hospital system. This position works independently on the analysis of existing and proposed vendor supplied software functionality to determine if the software conforms with current clinical health system workflow processes. The position utilizes specialized, proprietary software tool sets to enable software functionality; partners within project teams to achieve team goals and outcomes; provides measurable customer service, and performs duties within MIHS missions and values. This position will frequently work in conjunction with members of the Project Management Office to lead information technology deployment and optimization efforts based on the organization's performance improvement objectives. # # * Highly Preferred * Epic Willow Certification. Qualifications: #Requires a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Nursing, Information Systems (IS) or related field; or an equivalent combination of training and progressively responsible experience that will result in the required specialized knowledge and abilities to perform the assigned work in lieu of degree. A Master's degree is preferred and may substitute for required experience.# Requires three (3) years of healthcare, consulting, or IT related experience that demonstrates an understanding of the standard tools, workflow processes, and/or procedures and concepts used in the deployment and development of application software necessary to run the healthcare systems business, clinical or financial systems. Prefer certification(s) related to business, clinical, or financial application(s)/system(s).# In addition, prefer professional clinical licensure (eg. RN, Radiology, Laboratory, Pharmacy, etc) if supporting clinical application systems.# Must have ability to exercise individual judgment and initiative in conducting the necessary facilitation and resolution of application/system design along with the ability to perform workflow analysis and translate the outcome into definable software functionality. ##Must be able to perform cost/benefit analyses of actions/initiatives; and research options and recommend best course of action.# Must be able to execute basic change implementation plans.# Must be able to demonstrate the ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines while using independent judgment. ##Must possess good interpersonal and communication skills both verbally and in writing including ability to inform, advise, and instruct.# Requires the ability to develop initiatives in innovative manner for effective resolution. Must be able to prepare and conduct effective presentations; assess priorities and self-time manage through deliverables; and coordinate activities with diverse groups and individuals.# Requires the ability to read, write and speak effectively in English. #  Under the direction of the IT Application Manager, this position is responsible for the continuing deployment and development of vendor proprietary hospital application software necessary to run business, clinical or financial systems within a large integrated hospital system. This position works independently on the analysis of existing and proposed vendor supplied software functionality to determine if the software conforms with current clinical health system workflow processes. The position utilizes specialized, proprietary software tool sets to enable software functionality; partners within project teams to achieve team goals and outcomes; provides measurable customer service, and performs duties within MIHS missions and values. This position will frequently work in conjunction with members of the Project Management Office to lead information technology deployment and optimization efforts based on the organization's performance improvement objectives. Highly Preferred *Epic Willow Certification.Qualifications: Requires a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Nursing, Information Systems (IS) or related field; or an equivalent combination of training and progressively responsible experience that will result in the required specialized knowledge and abilities to perform the assigned work in lieu of degree. A Master's degree is preferred and may substitute for required experience. Requires three (3) years of healthcare, consulting, or IT related experience that demonstrates an understanding of the standard tools, workflow processes, and/or procedures and concepts used in the deployment and development of application software necessary to run the healthcare systems business, clinical or financial systems. Prefer certification(s) related to business, clinical, or financial application(s)/system(s). In addition, prefer professional clinical licensure (eg. RN, Radiology, Laboratory, Pharmacy, etc) if supporting clinical application systems. Must have ability to exercise individual judgment and initiative in conducting the necessary facilitation and resolution of application/system design along with the ability to perform workflow analysis and translate the outcome into definable software functionality. Must be able to perform cost/benefit analyses of actions/initiatives; and research options and recommend best course of action. Must be able to execute basic change implementation plans. Must be able to demonstrate the ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines while using independent judgment. Must possess good interpersonal and communication skills both verbally and in writing including ability to inform, advise, and instruct. Requires the ability to develop initiatives in innovative manner for effective resolution. Must be able to prepare and conduct effective presentations; assess priorities and self-time manage through deliverables; and coordinate activities with diverse groups and individuals. Requires the ability to read, write and speak effectively in English.

Name: Client Quantitative Analyst I
Description: Job Description:Job Description Summary Delivers the analytical work efforts on a project by project basis at the direction of a manager or team lead; in support of the Consumer Credit Card line of business. Will work with line of business to inform statistically valid test designs. Delivers individually or with the help of peers and others insightful data to be used in driving complex business decisions or processes. Communicates with managers to understand business problems to be analyzed and deliver the appropriate summary and data required. Ability to use data tools and techniques to find and deliver data from various sources of record. Required skills and ExperienceMinimum of Bachelor's degree with strong quantitative background in Marketing, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics  • 3+ years of analytics experience in support of a product, channel or segment with ad hoc analytics as primary output  • Comfortable and effective in tackling unstructured analytical challenges; ability to translate data into meaningful insight  • 3+ years analytics experience demonstrating strong proficiency in utilizing SAS  • 3+ years experience displaying solid working knowledge of SQL  • Demonstrated data skills with large data stores, comfortable navigating and connecting disparate data sources  • Strong demonstrated ability to summarize and interpret large amounts of data; experience with relational databases  • Statistical, analytical, and problem-solving skills; experience using techniques like Regression and Design of Experiments.  • Ability to organize and prioritize own work to meet deadlines and milestones with ability to manage multiple projects  Simultaneously  • Experience in developing and facilitating presentations utilizing MS Excel and Power Point.  • Strong attention to detail  • Solid packaging and presentation skills.  • Ability to build key relationships and influence thinking of internal stakeholders Desired skills and ExperienceFinancial services experience and knowledge  • Advanced degree in business or statistics  • 3+ years customer analysis experience  • Knowledge of and experience with BAC data, "W", CCBR, THOR, PAM and more  • Working knowledge of advanced analytic techniques including propensity models, segmentation, and decision trees  • Familiarity with advanced data mining software and visualization tools (e.g., SAS Enterprise Miner; CART JMP; Tableau; etc.)  • Familiarity with R, Python Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Production Control Analyst
Description: Talascend is currently seeking a Production Control Analyst for an opportunity in Phoenix, Arizona RESPONSIBILITIES: On Time Delivery of product to customer need dates on a daily basis.  Effective communications and coordination between customer operations, customer business teams, and functional support teams.  Execution of improvement projects to improve customer facing delivery performance.  SAP sales order alignment to customer need dates with proper time offsets.  Verification of material availability.  Verification of cell capacity and production plan alignment.  Personal accountability to shepherd every order for on time delivery.  Identify and execute longer term projects to address systemic barriers to on time delivery. REQUIREMENTS: Bachelors degree in business, supply chain, operations management, technical, engineering or related discipline.  Minimum 3 years of progressive leadership experience across Supply Chain, Engineering, Product Management, and/or Program Management.  On occasion the role will require to be out on the production floor and worker will need safety shoes.

Name: Sr Reimbursement Analyst
Description: Under the direction of the Director of Reimbursement, the Senior Reimbursement Analyst will assist in the preparation, filing, analysis and audit support of mandatory regulatory reports including but not limited to Medicare, Medicaid, Champus/Tricare, HRSA and FQHC Cost Reports as well as other agency surveys and reporting requests.# This position will also be responsible to acquire, manage and analyze cost report and health care revenue, cost and utilization data to help advance MIHS's financial reimbursement management strategy.# This position will participate in special projects, preparing management and financial data as necessary. Qualifications: Requires a Bachelor's Degree in Accounting/Economics/Finance/Business Degree or related field; or an equivalent combination of training and progressively responsible experience that will result in the required specialized knowledge and abilities to perform the assigned work. Must have a minimum of five (5) years of progressively responsible healthcare reimbursement, accounting or finance related experience that demonstrates a strong understanding of the required knowledge, skills and abilities. Prefer three (3) of those years in a healthcare setting. Extensive knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid reimbursement regulations and reporting requirements is preferred.# Must be familiar with, and be able to interpret, financial reports.# Must have the ability to work with and develop complex spreadsheets and work with computer systems for data extraction and analysis.# Familiarity with hospital claim payment #and hospital patient accounting systems as well as a general knowledge of CPT and HCPCS coding is a plus.# Must be able to assess priorities and self-time manage through deliverables; meet deadlines; and coordinate activities with diverse groups and individuals. The capacity to anticipate and meet required deadlines mandated by external agencies is required.# Must possess excellent computer and Microsoft Office skills (Microsoft Access and Microsoft Excel) effective verbal and written communication skills, advanced mathematical skills, strong organizational skills, and attention to detail.# Requires the ability to read, write, and speak effectively in English.  Under the direction of the Director of Reimbursement, the Senior Reimbursement Analyst will assist in the preparation, filing, analysis and audit support of mandatory regulatory reports including but not limited to Medicare, Medicaid, Champus/Tricare, HRSA and FQHC Cost Reports as well as other agency surveys and reporting requests. This position will also be responsible to acquire, manage and analyze cost report and health care revenue, cost and utilization data to help advance MIHS's financial reimbursement management strategy. This position will participate in special projects, preparing management and financial data as necessary. Qualifications: Requires a Bachelor's Degree in Accounting/Economics/Finance/Business Degree or related field; or an equivalent combination of training and progressively responsible experience that will result in the required specialized knowledge and abilities to perform the assigned work. Must have a minimum of five (5) years of progressively responsible healthcare reimbursement, accounting or finance related experience that demonstrates a strong understanding of the required knowledge, skills and abilities. Prefer three (3) of those years in a healthcare setting. Extensive knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid reimbursement regulations and reporting requirements is preferred. Must be familiar with, and be able to interpret, financial reports. Must have the ability to work with and develop complex spreadsheets and work with computer systems for data extraction and analysis. Familiarity with hospital claim payment and hospital patient accounting systems as well as a general knowledge of CPT and HCPCS coding is a plus. Must be able to assess priorities and self-time manage through deliverables; meet deadlines; and coordinate activities with diverse groups and individuals. The capacity to anticipate and meet required deadlines mandated by external agencies is required. Must possess excellent computer and Microsoft Office skills (Microsoft Access and Microsoft Excel) effective verbal and written communication skills, advanced mathematical skills, strong organizational skills, and attention to detail. Requires the ability to read, write, and speak effectively in English.

Name: Analyst HR Supplier Performance
Description: American Express is recognized for its innovative, forward-thinking Human Resources organization. Within Human Resources the Advisory Services and Capabilities (HR ASC) organization is responsible for delivering services to our employees and contingent workers that are simple, correct and cost effective. The HR Supplier Performance COE plays an important role within HR ASC and is specifically focused on 1) ensuring that our suppliers are compliant with both company and federally mandated requirements and 2) utilizing data and reporting to create and execute a strategy to ensure that we receive maximum value for the supplier services we purchase.The analyst in this role will report to the Manager on this team and support all work related to Third-Party Lifecycle Management (TLM) for HR suppliers. This will include working closely with the TLM team to complete TLM requirements for both new and existing HR supplier relationships. In addition, he or she will play a direct role in managing relationships with many of our key suppliers to ensure successful partnerships.Job Responsibilities:Track and carefully manage the onboarding TLM requirements for all new and renewed suppliers within this managers geographic remit.For suppliers in GTRM and Payroll within this managers geographic remit, he or she will also play a more direct role as Third-Party Risk and Relationship Manager (TRM) through the onboarding process. Upon completion of these requirements, the primary relationship manager will return to the HR functional area. This will require clear and organized communication between this manager and the business areas.Support tracking all TLM gaps for this region, and see them through to completionWork closely with TSM, TRMs and HR Supplier Performance colleagues to positively influence Control and Compliance Third-Party metricsParticipate in a bi-weekly meeting with the TLM BUL team to align on current suppliers going through or soon to be entering the TLM process, raising any issues associated with these suppliersSupport the creation of tools, resources and training as needed for Third-Party Risk and Relationships Managers (TRMs) and the HR Supplier Performance COE to assist them in successfully fulfilling Supplier Management duties in an increasingly regulated environment QualificationsRequired3-5 years of experience in progressively responsible positionsExperience in Supplier Management, Procurement, Compliance, Finance & Reporting or related fieldCoupled with process excellence, an ability and willingness to identify and call out process inefficiencies and errors and work collaboratively with stakeholders to resolveFunctional knowledge of MSFT tools including Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and SharePointPreferred but not requiredExperience working with GSM, especially the TLM groupDegree in business or related fieldCompany Hub location preferred.Employment  eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the  company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions. Name: Senior Consultant
Description: There's a revolution happening. Companies and agencies all over the world are realizing that in order to achieve their goals, they need to think differently about data. They are turning to MarkLogic to power their mission-critical data infrastructure and they need your help to navigate this new world. Come and join us!  MarkLogic® is the world's best database for integrating data from silos. MarkLogic is an operational and transactional Enterprise NoSQL database platform, and organizations around the world rely on it to integrate their most critical data and build innovative applications on a 360-degree view of that data. MarkLogic makes it easy to get data in and easy to get data out, and it is 100 percent trusted to run critical business operations. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, MarkLogic has offices throughout the U.S., Europe, Asia, and Australia.  We are the NoSQL technology that hundreds of organizations like the BBC, Dow Jones, OECD, and numerous government agencies trust to run their mission-critical applications. For example, MarkLogic powered the 2012 and 2016 Olympics coverage for the BBC, processes over 50% of the world's derivatives trades in the world of banking and supports the largest US health information exchange.  We hire intelligent, creative problem-solvers eager to use our Enterprise NoSQL technology to uncover opportunities for our clients. Are we offering the daily grind? Only if you're talking gourmet coffee! Be part of our smart and fun culture to take your ideas to the next level.  The role: The Senior Consultant is a customer-facing problem solver, chartered with providing specialized expertise on MarkLogic-based data management, search, and analytics solutions to enable customer success.  Responsibilities include: Participating in requirements and design workshops with our clientsDesigning and developing code, scripts and data pipelines that leverage structured and unstructured data integrated from multiple sourcesInstalling and configuring MarkLogic softwareParticipating in all aspects of the software life cycle using Agile development methodologiesDeveloping strong and effective working relationships with customers and internally with other consultants and teams across MarkLogic.Collaborating with clients to define future MarkLogic based applicationsLead and mentor your team, colleagues and the customer to achieve their goals. You have: Enthusiasm!An ability to quickly learn and acquire new skillsComfort working in a fast paced, high-growth startup environmentExperience delivering software implementation projects using agile methodologiesDirect experience of working with one or more of the following:content/knowledge management systems, search engines, relational databases, NoSQL databases, ETL tools, geospatial systems, semantic technology, or enterprise software solutions.Direct experience with XML and related technologies (XSLT and/or XQuery)Experience with enterprise architectures/technologies including .NET,Java, Web Services (SOA & REST) and JavaScriptWorking familiarity with multiple programming tools and development environments.A willingness to travel up to 75% of the time You might also have: Web development experience using: AngularJS/Node JSExperience in Mobile Web and UI Renovation.Understanding of database architecture and performance implicationsPrevious experience with MarkLogic We are/offer: The only Enterprise NoSQL database and world's best platformfor integrating data from silosHeadquartered in Silicon Valley with field offices in Washington D.C., New York, London, Paris, Utrecht, Frankfurt, Stockholm, Manila,Munich, Sydney, Singapore and Tokyo.Opportunity to grow: Ongoing training in technical and soft skills. Work with customers across the globe on cutting edge projects.Strong internal promotion: We revel in your success.A global team of motivated people with many interests. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Financial Analyst is responsible for financial analysis and job costing for Desert Classic Landscaping (DCL). This position is a critical and integrated member of the accounting team. The successful candidate will have previous related financial experience such as developing spending projections and analyzing business performance.  This position requires an individual who is ambitious, self-directed, and capable of working autonomously or with the Regional Corporate Accounting/Finance teams, Market President, and local Operations Management/Accounting to achieve the business and financial goals of the company. The role has a mix of recurring responsibilities and initiative-based work that provides a high degree of exposure to company leadership. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESReport and analyze financial and operating data; provide financial information that enables senior management to make informed long-term and short-term decisions. Examples may include divisional profitability reporting, job costing, payroll analysis, and revenue/expense analysisTranslate financial information to help local operations management understand the performance of their divisionProvide monthly variance analysis for monthly market and corporate business performance meetingsSupport the preparation of quarterly forecasts and annual budgetsMonitor and report contract gains/losses and ensure billing is aligned with contractual language.Assist with inventory control/reportingPerform ad hoc financial and special projects with support from local Operations Management, Market President, and Corporate AccountingSupport cost control initiatives and reportingIdentify process changes to improve operational and financial performanceUnderstand source systems as necessary to obtain financial information for above activities and analyses. Perform rigorous investigations of data sources to ensure accuracyDemonstrate and model company values with internal and external customersProactively communicate with Regional Corporate Accounting/Finance teams and Company leadership.Proactively communicate with local Operations Management and Accounting team.QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. High degree of business acumen and analytical and problem-solving skills. Must be able to synthesize information into actionable recommendations and analysesAdaptable in using organizational skills to prioritize tasks and take ownership of various projects; comfort and ability to deliver results in a flexible, fast-paced work environmentAbility to anticipate busy schedules and communicate with other members of the organization/department to complete assignments on timeDemonstrated integrity in research/analysis and commitment to accuracyHigh sense of urgencyStrong computer skills, including use of Excel and PowerPointExcellent oral and written communication skillsStrong ability to work as a team memberIntermediate knowledge of Microsoft Applications, especially Word and ExcelGood written and verbal communication skillsOutstanding critical thinking and problem-solving skillsBilingual Spanish helpfulExcellent general math skillsRequirementsTwo to four years of relevant professional experienceBachelor's degree or equivalent in Finance or AccountingMust have experience with job costing and the ability to create Profit and Loss Statements for business development team Company DescriptionAs North America’s property management leader and industry trailblazer, FirstService Residential offers an extensive selection of exciting career and personal growth opportunities throughout the U.S. and Canada.  We know that every member of our team enhances our success by delivering innovative programs and exceptional service that make a difference, every day, to those we serve. So we are highly selective in recruiting top quality professionals who demonstrate integrity, responsiveness, reliability and above all, a commitment to serving the needs of our residents and communities.  If your commitment to quality and service matches ours, we invite you to review our current career-advancing opportunities and join an amazing team!
