Name: Associate Sales Operations Analyst
Description: The Opportunity: We’re looking for an Associate Sales Operations Analyst to help us shape the future of education. With nearly 20,000 organizational customers and millions of student users, Blackboard is the world's leading education technology company with the industry's most comprehensive student-success solutions. Our mission is to partner with the global education community to enable student and institutional success by leveraging innovative technologies and services.  This role focuses on our Blackboard Campus Enablement™ platform which helps improve student experience and campus safety, while streamlining business operations and increasing revenue. The Blackboard Campus Enablement platform includes capabilities within three integrated modules: Commerce Management: facilitates campus ID card issuance, cashless payment processing, account management and reporting on-campus, off-campus, and online.Security Management: monitors all campus activity using integrated door access control, video surveillance and mass notification capabilities.Financial Services: offers innovative options for payment processing as well as both revenue enhancement or cost savings through extending the capabilities of the one-card solution to further enhance the student experience. Blackboard’s Sales Operations team partners with the Sales teams and is responsible for managing the sales operations as well as identifying Key Performance Indicators and Metrics to guide strategic decisions around forecasting, sales performance, and other strategic initiatives in support of the overall GTM sales goals. They create forecasting reports and lead the weekly forecasting meetings and track and maintain sales results by rep, team, and organization. This team does the monthly, annual, and YOY analysis and makes recommendations on how to improve sales outcome. Daily, they help the Sales organization with operational issues around compensation, pricing/contracts, and SFDC alignment.  As Associate Sales Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for providing operational, analytical, and quality support services to the Campus Enablement Consulting, Operations Management, Sales, and Support teams. Specifically, you will develop a strong understanding of the Campus Enablement business at a detailed level including products, what they do, and how they interact with other products to form a complete system. You will create, review, and reconcile sales orders to ensure accuracy between the customer purchase order and contractual agreement. You will Support the development of metrics to measure, analyze, and recommend improvement strategies on operational processes to include productivity models, resource allocation models, metrics, and measures. Providing process and reporting analysis to support the management team in decision-making, you will present findings to Campus Enablement Operations Management regarding key activities, trends, and measures affecting the business and our customers. You will also create and maintain customer-facing quotes and sales orders through Oracle Big Machines, prepare margin analysis to determine discount eligibility, and validate discount approvals and determine the appropriate resource to approve the discount.  Additionally, you will determine how the product or service will be delivered (by Consulting, Support, or third-party vendor) and confirm when it has been completed, analyzing all fulfillment systems (CRM, Kimble, Payment Gateways, etc.). You will assist the Consulting team to determine proper product pricing and provide information regarding sales details including project setup in Kimble and timesheet audits as well as determining the value of Consulting project change requests. You will provide operational support to the Support team by creating cases, determining the severity of cases, and assigning the appropriate resource to resolve the cases. You will also receive, review, and set up new projects in Kimble as well as prepare weekly and monthly invoicing files from Concur, CRM, Go Sign Me Up, and Kimble data to review and prepare Peoplesoft Financials Contracts for billing and revenue recognition. Additional responsibilities will include:Reviewing and correcting interface errors in relation to daily invoicing.Training Consulting and Sales resources on sales procedures relating to contracts; quotes and orders; Consulting timesheet and expense entry; Consulting forecasting by Project Managers; and standard invoicing procedures.Acting as a liaison with the Accounting department to resolve any invoicing and revenue-related questions.Researching customer disputes and providing necessary backup to support invoicing.Providing reporting to Consulting management to determine profitability, project statuses, and projected invoicing.Contributing to a growing knowledge network that improves the effectiveness of our teams and the information available to our clients.The Candidate:Has any experience in either Sales or Client Services OperationsHas any clerical or accounting experienceHas strong computer skills, especially in Microsoft ExcelCan collect and assess data and report findings in a clear and concise mannerCan work under minimal supervision to make decisions and solve complex problemsHas strong organizational, multi-tasking, and analytical skillsHas excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills and can interact with all levels of clients and vendorsExperience with reporting tools and report development is a plusExperience with Peoplesoft Financials, Peoplesoft CRM, Salesforce, Sharepoint, Big Machines, Kimble, Payment Gateway, or related platforms is preferredAn understanding of contract language and legal documents is desirableThe Team & Office: Blackboard has an office in modern, downtown Phoenix. A fully stocked vending machine with free sodas and snacksEndless nearby places to eat lunch or dinner with the team from In-N-Out Burger, P.F. Chang’s, and Chili’s, to OM Indian Bistro, Jo Jo’s Pizza, and Other Q Sports Bar and GrillAccessible via Valley Metro Bus and building offers free parking for employeesThis job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required. Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time. Blackboard Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, or any other protected factor.

And it doesn’t stop there - our associates also enjoy additional benefits such as 401(k) Savings Plan, Profit Sharing, Paid Time Off, as well as our incredible growth opportunities, continued education, wellness programs, and much more!

Name: IT Telecomm Analyst
Description: Careers Center | IT Telecomm Analyst Please Enable Cookies to Continue Please enable cookies in your browser to experience all the personalized features of this site, including the ability to apply for a job. Welcome page Returning Candidate? Log back in!  IT Telecomm Analyst Job Number 232447 Facility BH Corporate Office Department IT Customer Support-AZ Acute Address : Street 1400 South Dobson Rd Address : Location US-AZ-Mesa Work Schedule Day Position Type FT: Full-Time Posting Category Information Technology - Non-Clinical  --- Imagine a physician checking the vital signs of a patient – 1,200 miles away. Or a digital charting system that gives doctors and nurses more time to actually spend with the patient. The Information Technology professionals at Banner Health are more than imagining it – they’re making it a reality. We’re working at the forefront of technology in many ways.The IT AZ East Customer Relations Team is responsible for meeting the multidisciplinary IT needs of the Medical Centers and related buildings on the Banner University Medical Center Phoenix, Banner Gateway, Banner Baywood, Banner Desert, Banner Ironwood, Banner Goldfield, Cardon Children’s, Banner MD Anderson Cancer Center, and Banner Casa Grande Medical Center campuses.Banner Health is currently seeking an IT Telecom Analyst in the Phoenix South\East Valley, AZ. This position is a critical member of the on-site IT Facility teams supporting Banner Desert Medical Center, with on call responsibilities in the Phoenix. You will be responsible for supporting phone projects, phones and phone switch work. You will coordinate with Corporate IT resources, vendors and department leads to identify, prioritize and schedule requests.Your pay and benefits (Total Rewards) are important components of your Journey at Banner Health. Banner Health offers a variety of benefit plans to help you and your family. We provide health and financial security options so you can focus on being the best at what you do and enjoying your life. --- About Banner Health CorporateWithin Banner Health Corporate, you will have the opportunity to apply your unique experience and expertise in support of a nationally-recognized healthcare leader. We offer stimulating and rewarding careers in a wide array of disciplines. Whether your background is in Human Resources, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Managed Care Programs or Public Relations, you'll find many options for contributing to our award-winning patient care.About Banner HealthBanner Health is one of the largest, nonprofit health care systems in the country and the leading nonprofit provider of hospital services in all the communities we serve. Throughout our network of hospitals, primary care health centers, research centers, labs, physician practices and more, our skilled and compassionate professionals use the latest technology to make health care easier, so life can be better. The many locations, career opportunities, and benefits offered at Banner Health help to make the Banner Journey unique and fulfilling for every employee. --- Job SummaryThis position provides first-contact customer service for requests to acquire and/or install telecommunication hardware and software. Responds to customer inquiries and requests related to scheduling of work and purchasing of phone and phone related supplements. Reviews telecommunication service requests, determines requirements and coordinates course of action with customers, technical support, contractors and vendors. Ensures requests are in accordance to policies, procedures, standards and budget guidelines. Manages and maintains the facility infrastructure cabling in the areas of daily moves, adds changes and building construction. Responds to and resolves applicable problem tickets.Essential FunctionsProvides general direction to the cabling contractors. Assists in the project planning of small to medium scale moves, adds, changes and building construction. Primary telecommunications customer liaison. Assists the senior associates in the development of telephony product, application and technology strategies. Provides training on the use of the telephone features and ancillary equipment. Manages customer relationships by frequent service follow-ups, problem solving and identification of emerging needs.Basic station programming, installation and management of telephone and voice mail voice mail system(s) plus the ancillary equipment.Plans and coordinates daily administration, installation, removal and repair of telephone communications equipment and systems. Reviews departmental requests for new telephone installations and modifications, analyzes service needs and coordinates activities with requesting departments, contractors and telecommunication vendors. Ensures timely completion of tasks and short term projects. Provides PBX and voice mail system programming to the end-user. Maintains various records, directories, logs, files and manuals related to telecommunications activities.Monitors the facility service request queue. Adheres to written documentation guidelines and documented procedures. Escalates when required to routine operations in a manner that is consistent with existing solutions to problems. Conforms to established policies and procedures and logs work activities.Reviews and applies cost containment opportunities to reduce costs. Maintains facility records, ordering of voice services. Regular clean-up of lines, DIDs and demarcation block. Reviews project bids and periodic review of problem tickets making recommendations based on root cause.Minimum QualificationsMust possess strong knowledge as normally obtained through the completion of a bachelors degree. (Equivalent combination of relevant education, technical, business and healthcare experience typically achieved in 6 years also considered.)Must have worked 2 to 3 years in a related field and have at least 1 year of experience in a healthcare environment.Must demonstrate general knowledge of information technology and healthcare. Needs experience in small scale project planning and reporting either individual or team. Requires communication and presentation skills to engage technical and non-technical audiences. Requires ability to communicate, and interact across facilities and at various levels. Incumbent will have skills to mentor less experienced team members.Preferred QualificationsAdditional related education and/or experience preferred.Apply For This JobApply Connect With Us!  Join one of our Talent Communities to learn more about a career at Banner Health.

Name: Database Programmer Analyst Sr
Description: Position Overview  The Database Programmer Analyst Senior provides technical expertise and is responsible for adhering to and enforcing database standards and methodologies. This position is also responsible for thoroughness, accuracy, and solving complex problems related to the delivery of database solutions and integration that improve business capability and efficiency.     Position Qualifications  Minimum education and/or experience: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field and five (5) years of database development experience. An equivalent combination of post-secondary education and/or job-related experience may substitute for the minimum qualifications on a year for year basis.    Knowledge, skills, and abilities:Knowledge of:Complete software development lifecycle using different methodologies and frameworks (e.g. Agile, Waterfall, and SCRUM). Database diagramming concepts, theory and practices. Developing SSIS packages of high complexity (.NET) and scope while adhering to documented development standards.Skills In:Planning, organizational and analytical. SSRS configuration, security, subscriptions and reporting building. Analyzing databases with Microsoft SQL Management Studio.Ability to:Develop analysis reports and queries from structured and unstructured sources. Create and develop test Transact SQL queries, stored procedures, functions and views, following best practices and standards for a N-Tier high availability environment. Conduct data-driven experiments, to interpret data, and to create innovative data-based products and services. Prioritize and problem-solve complex enterprise applications. Lead database application development projects while communicating well both verbally and in writing. Preferred education and/or experience: Experience in a MS SQL Server database environment. Experience with SQL Server 2008-2016. Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS). Experience with using SSRS for reporting and BI. Experience with C# and current .NET Frameworks. Experience with N-tiered architecture. Experience with Visual Studio 2013/2015, TFS 2013/2015 and SharePoint. Experience using MS SQL Server, T-SQL, Business Intelligence, SQL Management Studio, SQL Reporting Services, SQL Integration Services and SQL Analysis Services.   Preferred training, certifications and/or other special requirements:Training In:developing database applications end-to-end. using SSIS to perform integration and workflows. obtaining and transforming raw data into meaningful and useful information for business analysis purposes. developing and implementing normalized databases in a relational design.Working conditions: Must be able to work in a normal, indoor office environment; must have manual dexterity of hands and body to operate office equipment; must be able to manage frequent interruptions, time pressures, high work volumes, multiple and complicated tasks, unscheduled tasks, team-oriented activities, prompt decision-making and interaction with government officials; must constantly maintain concentration, accuracy, ethical behavior and a professional demeanor.   Essential Job Tasks Designs, creates and deploys custom SQL Server database solutions. Follows industry practices of analysis, design, development, testing, deployment and maintenance/production support of COTS and custom databases and applications. Supports complex data integration through SSIS packages (C#). Works with stakeholders to design and deploy SSRS reports using various data sources. Supports web and application development through comprehensive data layer design. Functions as backup for SQL Server and SSRS administrator as needed. Interacts effectively and professionally (at all technical levels) in a team setting with co-workers, leadership, stakeholders and business staff. Acquires knowledge and understanding of business practices and processes to the extent needed to improve business outcomes through innovative data solutions. Completes special projects as assigned. Selection ProcedureThe hiring authority will select the successful candidate based on departmental needs.   All offers of employment made to new hires and rehires at Maricopa County are contingent upon successful completion of a post-offer, pre-employment thorough background investigation. A background investigation is conducted on a current employee who changes to a Safety Sensitive Position or one having the potential for serious adverse impact on the integrity or efficiency of the County. These requirements do not pertain to employees of elected officials who undergo background investigation processes administered through their respective offices.  Typically successful candidates are hired at a salary rate, up to midpoint of the range, based on applicable experience, internal equity and budgetary allowances.

Name: Business Consultant - Watson Health Curam Solutions
Description: Job Description IBMs Watson Health, Social Programs Management and Curam Solutions searching for a Senior Business Analyst/Consultant with expertise in Social Services for government/state programs.  As a Business Analyst/Consultant in the Watson Health Curam team, you will join an experienced team working with public sector customers to meet business objectives and project implementations while solving complex problems and adopting changing standards. You will learn the Curam software product and aspects of customizing & implementing the solution and act as a domain guide and resource.Job Responsibilities:Gather and/or define requirements, often through interviews and facilitating meetings with client partners and authoritiesProvide information on the data model and explain entities and attributes in the model and the relationships between them.Lead fit/gap sessions that map requirements to standard features and functions.Recommend and advise on application/functional extensions, as necessary, to client solution requirements.Serve as a liaison between technical staff and client domain authorities when the Curam technical team develops extensions.Develop functional designs associated with the extensions.Configure the Curam Business Application Suite (CBAS) to meet client requirements.Plan and execute tests to verify the solution is properly configured and extended to meet requirements.Build positive working relationships and trust with fellow employees, partners and client staff and promote confidence in IBM's technical credibility in proposed solutions. You will possess...Consistent record of effective presentation delivery and written communicationsSocial Services program experience with Government/public sectorDemonstrated experience leading Joint Application Design (JAD) sessionsScreen design and story-boarding. IBM's Curam solutions and product suite empowers organizations to collaborate around client needs, providing citizens with easier access to government programs.  To learn more, check us out at ...  https://www.ibm.com/watson/health/government/  https://www.ibm.com/watson/health/hhsri/  We live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Discover what you can make of this moment. Embark on the journey with us in IBM Watson Health.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise At least 5 years experience in a Business IT analyst/consulting roleat least 3 years of Social Service enterprise Management experience in public sector/government and core functionality or associated business processes of Human services programs - such as Medicaid (Non-MAGI), long term care, welfare, food stamp, TANF, SNAP, juvenile justice, income support, child services etcknowledge of Curam software product and solutions Preferred Tech and Prof Experience At least 1 year in Curam software product and services workat least 4 years of experience in Social service enterprise management in public sector/government and core functionality or associated business processes of Human services programs, such as Medicaid (Non-Magi), long term care, welfare, food stamp, TANF, SNAP, juvenile justice, income support, child services, etcAt least 1-year experience in Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) or Commercial-Off-The-Shelf (COTS) packaged software (ie: products from SAP, Oracle, PeopleSoft, Seibel, Lawson, CGI, etc.)Experience in a consulting related role for a large services/consulting company (ie: Deloitte, Accenture, etc) EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Analyst – Sales & Market Development – Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory, Managed Services & Products (Phoenix) - Summer/Fall
Description: Position summary Interested in being a part of selling mission critical solutions and products? Together, with our senior Partners, Principals and Managing Directors, we provide solutions and products that help our clients address ongoing operational challenges in reducing risk in key areas of reputation, compliance, cyber and financial risk. You’ll get the chance to work on teams that are transforming Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory from a traditional professional services organization by adding Managed Services & Products to the existing portfolio of solutions. You can be at the forefront of this wave of innovation at the #1 risk and financial advisory practice in the world. The teamOur Managed Services & Products team is comprised of deeply passionate and experienced professionals who guide clients through their most complex technology and risk challenges. We work with clients to help them secure their systems, applications, and data, as well as provide operational support and strategic recommendations to help them optimize their businesses’ operations, processes, and performance. We have a dedicated Sales & Market Development team of professionals that own the sales and marketing responsibilities to assist with all activities associated with the Managed Services & Products business.Work you’ll doAs an Analyst for the Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory Managed Services & Products practice, you will: • Work with a team to help guide our clients through their most complex technology and risk challenges• Provide sales and market development support in the expansion of this strategic business• Assist Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory professionals by being part of the sales pursuit teams• Help to drive training and awareness of the solutions and products portfolio as well as key sales techniques to drive sales growth for this business unit• Become an integral part of a fast-paced, client-centric and rapidly growing team• Use strong communication skills, both written and oral• Troubleshoot, problem solve, and simplify complex technical issues for clients• Quickly adapt to changing environments and learning new concepts• Work independently and as part of a team• Prioritize tasks, work on multiple assignments, and escalate questions and concerns where appropriate• Generate business through outbound lead activity and research companies to identify new prospects• Nurture prospects through email and communication efforts• Qualify inbound leads and prioritize opportunities and mobilize the appropriate internal resources to help accelerate our sales cyclesQualificationsRequired• Bachelor or Master of Science degree in Information Systems, Operations Management, Computer Science, Business Administration, Marketing, Communications, or other related degree• Willingness to travel up to 25 percent of the timePreferred• Understanding of general IT infrastructure and system architecture • Understanding of general IT concepts and processes (security, system administration, application administration, deployment) • Understanding or specific interest in IT service management and systems managementHow you’ll growAs we continue to grow, so has the need for delivery professionals. We will train professionals so that we can continue to provide the support for our client’s systems and business processes. Here you’ll be able to sharpen your technical, analytical and business skills as part of a team committed to delivering world-class service for clients around the globe. You’ll not only gain experience in Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory’s methodologies, but also gain new skills that are in high demand by our clients. BenefitsAt Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. Deloitte’s cultureOur positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.Corporate citizenshipDeloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.Recruiter tipsWe want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. We also suggest that you brush up on your interviewing skills and practice discussing your experience and job history with a family member, friend, or mentor. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.As used in this document, “Deloitte” means Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. Requisition code: S19PHXEF20JULMR-SMD

Name: FINANCIAL PLANNING BUSINESS ANALYST
Description: FINANCIAL PLANNING & BUSINESS ANALYST Req #: 12406  Location: Phoenix, AZ  Job Category: FINANCIAL PLANNING  Employment Type: Full-Time Regular  Exempt/Non-Exempt: Exempt  Job Overview  Primary Purpose and Essential Functions: Analyst is responsible for a full range of activities, which support Executive Management and their teams in operational effectiveness and excellence within their individual areas of responsibility. Analyst will analyze the profitability of operations through basic financial and statistical modeling and reporting, and make appropriate recommendations, leading to positive operational effectiveness. Analyst will also assist in the implementation of the Annual Operating Plans for the various areas of responsibility. Analyze the company's activities and trends, and compares analysis against service standards and best practices.Assist in the development of tactical and strategic initiatives to support organization objectives, and identify strategies for implementation. Collaborate with Financial Planning & Business Analysis (FP & BA) team to implement overall best practice processes to support those initiatives.Work closely with Business Intelligence Analyst (BIA) personnel to identify and maximize information and technology to improve business processes as well as financial and operational metrics.Responsible for developing and maintaining driver - based forecast models to properly inform Executive Leadership Team of expected operational results.Proactively identify opportunities for operational and financial improvement. Present findings to FP & BA and assist in implementation.Support business units in successfully executing plans and reaching forecasted goals.Heavily involved in the preparation and creation of the Annual Operating Plan.Proactively seek opportunities to broaden and deepen knowledge base and proficiencies.Skills: Ability to create advanced interactive and variable financial models with measurement tools including NPV, IRR, WACC, ROA, and ROI. Intermediate Microsoft Office skills (Excel, Word, Power Point). Ability to query raw data using Microsoft Query, VBA, Business Objects, and Sequel. Strong interpersonal, written and presentation skills. Ability to multi-task and prioritize workload. Self starter, needing little motivation or direct supervision. Intermediate knowledge of accounting, including the balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow statement.Education: Baccalaureate from an accredited university or collegeExperience Required: More than two (2) years of direct financial analytical experience is expected. Candidates with an MBA degree and more than one (1) year of relevant analytical experience may also be considered. Position Requirements  Ability to create advanced interactive and variable financial models with measurement tools including NPV, IRR, WACC, ROA, and ROI. Intermediate Microsoft Office skills (Excel, Word, Power Point). Ability to query raw data using Microsoft Query, VBA, Business Objects, and Sequel. Strong interpersonal, written and presentation skills. Ability to multi-task and prioritize workload. Self starter, needing little motivation or direct supervision. Intermediate knowledge of accounting, including the balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow statement.  Required Education  Baccalaureate from an accredited university or college Required Experience More than two (2) years of direct financial analytical experience is expected. Candidates with an MBA degree and more than one (1) year of relevant analytical experience may also be considered.

Name: Strategic Materials Analyst
Description: When the global aerospace community looks for ideas and solutions to its biggest challenges, they turn to the people of UTC Aerospace Systems. We design, invent and deliver the most advanced and diverse range of aerospace systems on the market. We are inventors. We are manufacturers. We work in space exploration, commercial air travel, defense and rescue applications. Always learning and pushing the boundaries, we are an undisputed industry leader that continually sets the bar higher and higher. Come soar with us  Get onboard the UTC Aerospace Operations and Supply Chain team and play a part in managing our innovative products from inception to delivery. Operations and Supply Chain employees have the opportunity to network across our businesses and functions, all while improving the productivity, quality and efficiency of our operations worldwide.  Located in our Phoenix, AZ office, this role will lead materials projects related to Inventory, Material Replenishment & Sales and Operations Planning. Maintain part detail database for changes planned and completedIdentify parts that need changes and track progress of changes and inventory impactIdentify and propose suppliers for Supplier RecoverySupport actions to achieve targets and track progressDrive completion of project actionsHost project meetings and provide On-going (e.g. weekly) and ad-hoc reporting, prepare Steering Committee deck, Create charts for site flow downCollaborate with S&OP leaders across UTAS to validate demandKey Phx representative in process definition meetingsCreate, propose and deploy project toolsCoordinate projects implementation with cell supervisors and MPSMaintain ABCXYZ part detail fileCalculate Inventory impact of changes; Safety Stock AnalysisValidate Demand, Production, and Inventory metric files generated by Central OpsAnalyze data file to calculate impact, calculate Production and Inventory targets by product lineChange agent for standard factory implementationAdditional responsibilities will include leading or supporting both long term strategies and short term goals relating to inventory management and optimization.Inventory analysis, planning, and management. Support Materials Management organization in establishing comprehensive inventory policies and monitoring results vs. policiesDrive continuous improvement and ensure service level and inventory targets are metSupport the development of inventory strategies and plans per the NA Ops goals and objective.Drive implementation of Always On delivery clinic and other strategic initiatives.Support various Sales, Inventory, Operations, and Planning (SIOP) processes and requests, as neededQualification:Expert knowledge that extends across multiple disciplinesTeam and / or Project Leadership experience neededAble to coach and develop othersWorking experience with Lean and ACE / Continuous ImprovementKnowledge of material management systems, a plusExcellent computer skills- Strong use of MS Office Suite and database managementAbility to work well in a team cultureSAP materials system experience, a plusExcellent communication and customer serviceExcellent presentation and group facilitation skillsEducation:Associate’s degree requiredBachelor’s degree in progress requiredBachelor's degree complete with 5 years’ experience, preferred(Supply Chain, Finance or Business Administration major preferred)CPIM/CIRM, preferred Nothing matters more to UTC Aerospace Systems than our strong ethical and safety commitments. As such, all U.S. positions require a background check, which may include a drug screen.  UTAS4220182United Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Position Summary:Symantec Sales Finance is seeking to hire a Financial Analyst in Mountain View’s Symantec office, reporting to the Controller, Americas Sales Finance. You will be responsible for researching, validating and processing manual uploads and adjustments requests of booked sales orders. The job also entails to track, summarize, and report the quantity and reasons for adjustments requests with the end result to improve the upstream process and minimize the number of manual adjustments requests. You will also be responsible for supporting Americas Commissions questions and required research. You will work with cross functional teams with Sales Operations, Commissions Team, IT Team and others. The role may be expanded to support business partnering, reporting, and analytics.Responsibilities:Validate and process manual adjustments including researchValidate and upload manual bookingsWork with upstream processes to eliminate the need for manual adjustments downstreamEnsure clean, consistent, and timely cadenceProvide insightful analysis to Controller by tracking, summarizing and reporting the quantities and reasons for manual adjustmentsDrive process improvements by maintaining and improving desk proceduresWork with cross functional team (Sales Operations, Commissions Team, other Finance, etc.)Partner with US senior financial analysts in providing support to Americas Sales Leaders.Requirements:Minimum of 5+ years of experience in Financial Planning & Analysis or Sales Finance.Bachelor’s degree in Accounting and/or Finance;Advanced analytic, financial modeling and reporting skills requiredExcellent written and oral communicationDirect experience in commission planning and payments, a strong plus but not necessaryAbility to maintain a high level of attention to detail, meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloadsAbility to work independently in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environmentAbility to work with cross functional teams, dive deep into the detailsDrive for resultsThinks big and has convictionsEnterprise systems experience: Oracle, Hyperion, Business Objects, SFDC, QlikView preferred ====================​====================​  Symantec is an equal opportunity employer. All candidates for employment will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law.Apply

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: The Financial Analyst is responsible for financial analysis and job costing for Desert Classic Landscaping (DCL). This position is a critical and integrated member of the accounting team. The successful candidate will have previous related financial experience such as developing spending projections and analyzing business performance.  This position requires an individual who is ambitious, self-directed, and capable of working autonomously or with the Regional Corporate Accounting/Finance teams, Market President, and local Operations Management/Accounting to achieve the business and financial goals of the company. The role has a mix of recurring responsibilities and initiative-based work that provides a high degree of exposure to company leadership. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESReport and analyze financial and operating data; provide financial information that enables senior management to make informed long-term and short-term decisions. Examples may include divisional profitability reporting, job costing, payroll analysis, and revenue/expense analysisTranslate financial information to help local operations management understand the performance of their divisionProvide monthly variance analysis for monthly market and corporate business performance meetingsSupport the preparation of quarterly forecasts and annual budgetsMonitor and report contract gains/losses and ensure billing is aligned with contractual language.Assist with inventory control/reportingPerform ad hoc financial and special projects with support from local Operations Management, Market President, and Corporate AccountingSupport cost control initiatives and reportingIdentify process changes to improve operational and financial performanceUnderstand source systems as necessary to obtain financial information for above activities and analyses. Perform rigorous investigations of data sources to ensure accuracyDemonstrate and model company values with internal and external customersProactively communicate with Regional Corporate Accounting/Finance teams and Company leadership.Proactively communicate with local Operations Management and Accounting team.QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. High degree of business acumen and analytical and problem-solving skills. Must be able to synthesize information into actionable recommendations and analysesAdaptable in using organizational skills to prioritize tasks and take ownership of various projects; comfort and ability to deliver results in a flexible, fast-paced work environmentAbility to anticipate busy schedules and communicate with other members of the organization/department to complete assignments on timeDemonstrated integrity in research/analysis and commitment to accuracyHigh sense of urgencyStrong computer skills, including use of Excel and PowerPointExcellent oral and written communication skillsStrong ability to work as a team memberIntermediate knowledge of Microsoft Applications, especially Word and ExcelGood written and verbal communication skillsOutstanding critical thinking and problem-solving skillsBilingual Spanish helpfulExcellent general math skillsRequirementsTwo to four years of relevant professional experienceBachelor's degree or equivalent in Finance or AccountingMust have experience with job costing and the ability to create Profit and Loss Statements for business development team Job Type: Full-time

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: JOB TITLE: Senior Financial Analyst LOCATION: Phoenix, AZ CLASSIFICATION: Full-Time / Exempt SALARY: Competitive Wages Based on Experience SUMMARY: Impact Group, a dynamic and growing leading grocery broker in the CPG industry, is looking for a high performing technically biased financial analyst to join its growing finance team. This position will report directly to the VP Finance and work as an integral part of the team focused on building and refining revenue estimating and reporting and analysis capabilities. This role will be responsible for determining revenue inputs for our annual budget and quarterly forecasting cycles, helping to facilitate clean and accurate month end close processes related to revenue recognition for our brokerage business, and assisting with post-integration analysis for our completed company acquisitions. This position will also be instrumental in supporting the continued growth of the Company by enhancing and increasing the functional capabilities of the finance department as it relates to our revenue processes.  The Senior Financial Analyst will have the ability to work cross-functionally with our accounting and business analytics teams to improve reporting and analytical efficiency, reduce redundancy, and drive accuracy. This will be a growth position as our business and the finance team continues to expand. Responsibilities:Under the guidance of the VP Finance, review and improve revenue processes, including variance analysis, client performance trending, KPI development and trackingUnder the guidance of the VP Finance, build and execute a detailed project road-map to replace manual reporting with automated solutions as well as define and deliver new business reporting needsSupport the CFO and business leaders with ad hoc reports to drive business insight and appropriate decision making, as neededProvide timely and accurate analysis of budgets, financial reports, and financial trendsParticipate as required in acquisition integration, as applicableJob Qualifications:Minimum of 5 years progressive experience in finance or accountingExcellent demonstrated technical and functional ability including: Excel, MySQLDemonstrated experience with revenue reporting, budgeting, and analysisAbility to form and maintain effective working relationships with peers and superiorsTeam player who can work effectively in a fast-paced, high-growth environment and be comfortable in a smaller corporate environmentExperience in the sales and marketing or CPG industries is preferred, but consideration will be made for experience in similar/comparable industries.Competencies:Ability to work as a partner to the VP FinanceStrong technical skillsCreative thinker and problem solverBehavior appropriate for a high energy and a spirited work environmentBenefits include:Medical, Dental and Vision InsuranceMedical Flexible Spending AccountDependent Care Flexible Spending AccountPaid Time Off & 9 Paid Holidays401(k)Basic and Supplemental Life and AD&DEmployee Assistance ProgramShort-Term and Long-Term Disability Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Sales, Marketing and/or CPG industry: 1 year (Preferred)progressive finance: 5 years (Preferred)

Name: Salesforce Business Analyst - Accenture Technology
Description: Job descriptionReady to fast-track your Salesforce career?Join the largest team of Salesforce certified professionals in the industry and champion innovation, leverage deep and cutting-edge Salesforce expertise and pioneer solutions to help transform the world’s leading organizations and governments.Ready to solve complex problems? Advance your skills? Deliver next-generation Salesforce solutions?Now is the perfect time for you to join the Accenture Salesforce team, where you’ll:Expand your experience with over 200 intelligent tools across all 12 Salesforce-recognized industries.Lead in the development and implementation of new Salesforce-based solutions.Benefit from our long-standing partnership with Salesforce to access the coolest Salesforce technologies, like Lightning, Einstein and Bolt, so you can put them to meaningful applications at scale.Join more than 11,800 skilled Salesforce professionals, collaborating across multiple areas to drive enterprise-wide transformational projects on a global scale.Build new skills and strengthen your expertise with unparalleled training and support—whether you're taking the more than 4,200 unique Salesforce certifications or working towards your Certified Technical Architect (CTA) certification.Join Accenture and be empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community.Job DescriptionThe Salesforce Business Analyst is a key member of our Delivery organization in the US. In addition to being responsible for business analyses, the BA would work directly with the project team and clients gathering requirements to analyze, design and/or implement technology best practice business changes. They work with senior members of the team ensuring the successful delivery of Salesforce.com implementation. They should have solid functional and/or industry knowledge, as well as Salesforce products such as Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Marketing Cloud. They enhance Accenture’s marketplace reputation. Our clients are world leading organizations that are/have selected Salesforce.com to advance their business and the Consultant is an essential team member inside the organization.We can hire for this role anywhere in the US, as long as you are located near an Accenture office, and willing and able to travel domestically approximately 80% of the time to meet client needs.Key ResponsibilitiesWork with Delivery Lead/Project Manager to maintain and coordinate communication with the customer/client throughout each project.Work with the project team to gather the business and functional requirements, by scoping, defining, and prioritizing requirements.Mapping functional requirements to Salesforce.com features and functionality.Understand and document requirements for configuring, testing and launching our CRM solution.Understand CRM requirements and Identify product requirements for future enhancements.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile inconsistency and break down high-level information into details.Work with Architects and Developers to transform new requirements into Salesforce.com design and implementation.Develop, maintain and perform processes to continuously monitor data quality and integrity in platform applications with Salesforce Administrator and functional managers to create training materials and documentation for Salesforce.com users and help train new end users on Salesforce.com and related applications.Configure Users, Profiles Role Creation/Maintenance, Custom and Formula Fields, Validation Rules, Page Layouts and List views, Assignment/Auto Response/Escalation, Workflows & Approvals, and Process Builder.Supports testing cycles (UAT, regression, system) and/or Training/Training Materials.Supports PM with project updates, scheduling, invoicing, etc.+ Basic qualificationsBasic QualificationsMinimum of 2 years’ Business Analysis experience.Minimum of 2 years’ as a Salesforce administrator or Salesforce App Builder.Minimum of 2 years’ Experience implementing CRM solutions from start to finish, including the creation of business requirements and other formal documentation.Preferred QualificationsExperience working with sandbox and production environments to manage the distribution of system functional or process changes.Applicants for employment in the US must have work Name: Analyst Cyber Security Senior
Description: SRP is one of the largest public power and water utilities in the U.S. providing electricity to approximately one million customers in the greater metropolitan Phoenix area. Since its founding in 1903, SRP has fostered a culture of stewardship and customer service consistently ranking as an industry leader in customer service according to J.D. Power. SRP continues to adapt to its changing business environment by seeking innovative ways to reimagine utility service and the provision of critical resources essential to the life and economy of Arizona.Job Brief The successful candidate will support the mission of providing low cost reliable power to SRP customers by participating in cyber security initiatives to protect the operation. As part of this team you will work closely with technical and non-technical personnel across SRP to evaluate and improve enterprise identity and access management. SRP utilizes a diverse portfolio of technology, and the successful candidate will be able to implement consistent account and access management solutions across a wide variety of technical and business use cases.  Successful candidate will be able to apply technical expertise and cyber security best practices to identify opportunities to reduce risk, streamline operations, and improve the user experience. Successful candidate will participate in the evaluation and implementation of new cyber security technology and procedures. Successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to provide well researched, specific, relevant and reasonable input to secure and enable new technology initiatives. Job ResponsibilitiesDevelop, implement and operate access management technology and processes as part of an enterprise cyber security program.Participate in operational support and project execution, as well as internal and external assessment activities.Facilitate access management operations through the day to day support of the customers, partners, and systems involved in the process.Develop process and technology to identify access events, exceptions, or trends which require investigation, remediation or mitigation.Participate in occasional after-hours support activities (on call, project implementation).Coordinate with both internal and external auditors to assist with and respond to audit findings.Education Completion of a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution that prepares the employee for the assignment. Experience Promotion to level 2 requires a minimum of two years of experience at level 1; demonstrated capability to perform advanced and more difficult work as determined by the supervisor. Promotion to senior level requires a minimum of three-years of experience at level 2; is fully competent in all aspects of functional area of assignment and as such would be recognized as a specialist in area of assignment and may have periodic or occasional lead responsibilities. Additional InformationAbility to:Understand and navigate the SRP organization in order to provide effective solutions which both secure and enable business operations.Analyze input from SRP's business and technical stakeholders to establish process and technical requirements for access control operations.Provide creative solutions leveraging input from peers, past experience, and industry research.Manage and effectively prioritize multiple (and often competing) assignments.Create and deliver effective communications to technical, business and executive stakeholders.Balance effective access controls with the need to maintain business operations and a positive customer service experience.Knowledge and Skills: Specific experience and knowledge of fundamental access control principles as they pertain to: Enterprise identity management tools and practices including identity, account, and access lifecycles.Privileged account management tools and practices.Account and access security controls, especially as they pertain to cloud hosted infrastructure/applications.Industry regulations, frameworks, and best practices related to cyber security which shape SRP's access control processes (e.g. NIST, NERC CIP, FICAM, HIPAA, PCI).DoD 8570 Certifications Strongly Preferred (e.g. CISSP/CISA/CISM/GSEC). Relevant tools/concepts: Identity and Access Management tools, CASB, IGA, Privileged Account Management (PAM), IDaaS, IaaS, SaaS, MFA, Entitlement Management, Federation, SSO, SAML, OAuth, ITIL, ERP Security, Scripting, LDAP structures and support. Requisition Details Requisition ID: 8657  EOE - SRP encourages a diverse workforce  All candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States.  Currently, SRP does not sponsor H1B visas. Why Work at SRP SRP's success is rooted in our employees' happiness, health and safety. That's why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to meet the needs of our employees and enhance their well-being. In addition to competitive pay and performance incentives, eligible employees can take advantage of the following benefits:  • 401(k) plan with employer matching Retirement pensionPaid vacationParental leaveHoliday paySick leaveMedical, vision, dental and life insuranceWellness programsPre-tax benefitsShort and long-term disability plansTuition assistance

Name: Data Analyst Lead
Description: Title: Data Analyst Lead Duration: 2 months Location: Remote Responsibilities:Develop end-to-end decision science systems to support client business imperatives – internal and external; descriptive and prescriptive.Be a hands-on partner with business and technology stakeholders to design and deliver scalable big data solutionsScan and capitalize on new approaches to data science which can yield revenue and bolster the travel experience with a client.Support travel innovation office; build a trusted collaborative research environment with our clients, travelers, partners, and suppliers.Build, manage and develop a data science center of excellence at client.Be passionate in the mission to develop, teach, learn, operationalize, and scale citizen decision science.The scalability engineer will be a member of the Data Analytics team and will lead multiple efforts around big data, data science, data quality, and insights automation.Requirements:10+ years in an analytic role, preferably with direct experience in big data solutions & approachesSME in statistics, analytics, big data, data science, machine learningHands-on experience analyzing large amounts of data to derive unique, actionable insightsStrong communication skills and partnerships with technology, product strategy, client managementStrong working knowledge of current client systems, data models and processesAbility and confidence to collaborate and influence senior leaders and business partnersSelf-starter and autonomous, able to work as part of the global team, a strong sense of ownershipDegree in statistics, mathematics, operations research, economics, engineering or information science

Name: Technology Center Operations Analyst
Description: Job descriptionJoin Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.Accenture people build careers in four different areas of our business: Consulting, Technology, Outsourcing and internal Corporate Functions. Each area offers a unique career experience and a compelling mix of work and training opportunities, work environment and structure for career progression. Operations professionals work on projects across a range of business processes, business applications and information technology. They may provide technology services, such as application management, infrastructure management and systems integration, or they may deliver business process outsourcing services, including finance and accounting, procurement and human resources. Depending on the role, Outsourcing professionals may be based at a client’s office or in one of Accenture’s 50 delivery centers around the world.The Technology Center Operations Analyst within Accenture will be the first line of defense in the IT Operations team responsible for monitoring and managing all alerts and end user issues in the client’s data centers and properties around the world. The scope of work includes servers, mainframes, databases, middleware, business intelligence tools, identity and access management tools, storage, backup, and local, wide, and property networks. The technology stack includes the latest hybrid private and public cloud technologies in addition to legacy technologies. The work is performed in a lively collaborative environment where Level 1 and Level 2 operators work together to monitor, manage, and triage issues. The Level 1 operator will be responsible for monitoring the IT infrastructure environment components and opening, troubleshooting, and referring incident tickets to the appropriate group and level of support ensuring that actions are taken to address and remediate the incidents. This role is located in Frederick, MD and the hours are Shift 1 - (Friday 6am-4pm), Shift 2 – (Sunday-Tuesday 2pm-12am)+ Basic qualificationsBasic Qualifications:Minimum of 1 year of experience in Technology related fieldPreferred Qualifications:Experience with IT Operations or Help Desk IT Service Management Tools (e.g. ServiceNow)Experience with IT Monitoring Tools (e.g. NetCool)Entry level networking skillsProficient in ITILSolid verbal and written communicationProblem solving and analysisApplicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.Equal Employment OpportunityAll employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Name: Senior Quality Analyst
Description: OverviewLocated in the heart of Phoenix, Ariz., St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center is a 586-bed, not-for-profit hospital that provides a wide range of health, social and support services with special advocacy for the poor and underserved. St. Joseph's is a nationally recognized center for quality tertiary care, medical education and research. It includes the internationally renowned Barrow Neurological Institute, the Muhammad Ali Parkinson Center, the Norton Thoracic Institute, a campus of Creighton University's Medical School and the first Level I Trauma Center in Arizona verified by the American College of Surgeons. U.S. News & World Report routinely ranks St. Joseph's among the best hospitals in the United States for neurology and neurosurgery.
