Name: Senior HRIS Analyst
Description: About UsRepublic Services is an industry leader in U.S. recycling and non-hazardous solid waste. Through our subsidiaries, Republics collection companies, recycling centers, transfer stations, and landfills focus on providing effective solutions to make proper waste disposal effortless for our 14 million customers. Well handle it from here., our brand promise, lets customers know they can count on Republic to provide a superior experience while fostering a sustainable Blue Planet for future generations to enjoy a cleaner, safer and healthier world. Why Work with Us Our Company cannot thrive without great people devoted to serving customers, the community, and the planet. We hire the best people to make Republic a great place to work. We are focused on attracting talented individuals across professions who are as committed to serving customers and the planet as we are. We strive to create a workplace that's meaningful and rewarding to our 33,000 employees. That's why we are proud to be recognized as Best Large Employer by Forbes, Worlds Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere, and One of the Most Meaningful Companies to Work for in America by Business Insider.Job Description  The Human Resources (HR) Systems Analyst II serves as a liaison between the HR Systems team and the Corporate and Field HR business teams to provide systems support and analysis and to facilitate in leveraging technology solutions to meet the needs of the HR Department and users of HR information systems. The position leads, evaluates, analyzes, designs, and implements projects within the Human Capital Management application. The position will make alterations and configurations to systems and gather requirements from end users while acting as a liaison between vendor technical support and Republic Services.  Knowledge, Skills & Abilities  Preferred Qualifications  Principal Responsibilities Performs configuration changes, creates test scripts, and tests to ensure all processes work according to the pre-determined goals.Responsible for data mapping and data conversion between multiple systems.Identifies and resolves operational and/or integration challenges.Coordinates projects including managing project plans, gathers statuses and sends status reports.Articulates project expectations to team members. Identifies, tracks, monitors and communicates on project-related issues, including scope changes that occur during the course of projects. Monitors project work to ensure that progress is maintained within expected guidelines and is completed on a timely basis.Researches, designs and tests systems and processes to develop process improvements, recommends solutions and implements new applications.Provides complex information in an understandable and compelling manner.Experienced in identifying the business current [As Is] and identifying the [To Be] improvement, along with supporting processes to accomplish this task.Identifies gaps and uses critical thinking to analyze the most proficient way to fix the gap.Serves as functional support for HR technology project, gathering requirements, writing business process procedures and systems integration documentation.Works with internal and external groups to identify, schedule and test changes to the systems.Consults with end users on high level and complex reporting solutions; Summarizes/synthesizes data and offers insight.Designs and develops enterprise-wide human capital metrics to support the business needs.Performs as the second level liaison and primary contact for business owners, IT and vendors; recommends vendors for selection and manages vendors and vendor relationships.Proactively shares knowledge with team to achieve objectives, analyze improvements, and better customer satisfaction; leads cross-functional teams to meet departmental objectives and goals.Reviews software release notes and develops plan of testing to manage risks before they are moved to a production environment.Troubleshoots and logs issues with service providers, follows up and tests resolutions and recommends promoting change to production.Performs other job related duties as assigned or apparent. The statements used herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by an employee in this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and skills required by an incumbent so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the Company.Qualifications Bachelors Degree in Human Resources, Business, Technology or related field of study.Minimum of 5 years of in-depth, hands-on, HR Systems administration, support, design and implementation and reporting experience (required).Demonstrated knowledge of HR and associated business systems (required).PC software knowledge and skills, including Excel complex formulas, MS Project, Visio, Access, PowerPoint and Crystal reporting (required).Experience with creating queries using multiple query tools.Experience with system development life cycle.Demonstrated ability to read, analyze, and interpret HR systems technical and procedural documentation.Strong ethics and the ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality.Strong attention to detail and problem solving skills.Effective interpersonal skills across various levels of the organization.Strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple projects and work in high-volume, fast-paced environment.An understanding of human resources concepts, processes, laws and procedures is very helpful.Must be able to work independently or collaboratively and cooperatively in a team environment. Rewarding Compensation and BenefitsEligible employees can elect to participate in: Comprehensive medical benefits coverage, dental plans and vision coverage.Health care and dependent care spending accounts.Short- and long-term disability.Life insurance and accidental death & dismemberment insurance.Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP).Employee discount programs.401(k) plan with a generous company match.Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP). Republic Services is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Name: IT STE Innovation Analyst
Description: CLA is seeking to hire a IT STE Innovation Analyst that will focus on business transformation and the client experience. This position will work closely with business and other IT teams to qualify innovation opportunities/issues, solution design and validation scenarios through activities such as process analysis, preliminary solution design, prototype development and software/application “proof of technology” exercises.This role can be based in any of the following locations: Minneapolis, MN, Phoenix, AZ and Madison, WI. This position may require occasional non-local or overnight travel for office visits, training, meetings and/or other business-related purposes. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:•Work with IT and business stakeholders to identify issues or opportunities with internal and external process or services.•Recommend and drive innovation opportunities.•Lead and/or participate along with other IT teams, proof of “concept” efforts, as prioritized by IT leadership and project portfolio processes.•For these purposes, “proof of concept” includes final platform design and analysis, conceptual migration to production strategies, integration design and execution and the development of support models.•Conduct software application, service and work process assessments to identify innovation opportunities for improvements to the “experience” for CLA clients and staff.•Monitor the use of key client-facing technologies and services. Name: Senior Category Analyst
Description: Summary and Essential DutiesThe Senior Category Analyst position is responsible for developing data-driven, actionable insights that contribute to all parts of Category Management. This position requires the ability to draw conclusions from imperfect and incomplete data, apply various statistical techniques, and develop retail strategies. Above all, you will help shape the strategic direction of Category Management by ensuring best analytical practices and techniques are used throughout the enterprise. The Sr. Category Analyst works as a strategic thought partner, sharing knowledge of the category to drive profitable business results. Essential Duties:Identify favorable and unfavorable data trends. Lead discussions with Category Management staff members, providing analytic results and recommendations for improved performanceLead the production of monthly results reviews of category management financials and operational performance metrics versus current plan and last yearUnderstand data resources and know how to utilize respective resources to improve efficiency and performanceSupport business partners in vendor negotiations and cost increase justificationsDevelop scorecards on suppliers for business reviewsProvide internal business management with accurate and pertinent information that enhances and guides effective decision makingAssist category management in developing detailed project analysis for model developmentWork with Category Management on the communication of rollout strategies to the BranchesDevelop analytics on categories that are highly deviated and underperforming for a dependable pricing reviewContinuously seek to learn of changes in the industry and enterprise to improve department performanceThe individual must be able to interface with the Category Management team on a regular basis in order to deliver timely and accurate recommendationsPerform regular, weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad hoc reporting/analysisOther duties as assigned QualificationsProven ability to take complex business analyses and projects from concept to completion and make the results accessible and relevant to business users at all levelsSelf-directed, innovative thinker with a strong attention to detail and commitment to consistently meeting timelines and operating from a sense of urgency.Creative problem solving skills, maturity to handle ambiguity, flexibility to perform in a dynamic environment, and ability to multitask across projects simultaneouslyUtilize analytical thinking skills and intuitive sense to efficiently maintain data qualityIntellectual and analytical curiosity, initiative to dig into the 'why' of various resultsEffectively translate complex data and analyses into presentation of findings, insights and strategic recommendationsFormulate business recommendations and alternative solutions based on prepared and analyzed statistical data Corporate SummaryCorporate Summary: At Shamrock Foods Company, people come first – our associates, our customers, and the families we serve across the nation. A privately-held, family-owned and -operated Forbes 500 company, Shamrock is an innovator in the food industry and has been since being founded in Arizona in 1922. Our Mission: At Shamrock Foods Company, we live by our founding family’s motto to 'treat associates like family and customers like friends.' Why work for us? Benefits are a major part of your overall compensation, and we believe offering them at an affordable cost is not only the right thing to do, but it helps keep you and your family healthy. That’s why Shamrock Foods pays for the majority of your health insurance, allowing you to take home more of your paycheck. And it doesn’t stop there - our associates also enjoy additional benefits such as 401(k) Savings Plan, Profit Sharing, Paid Time Off, as well as our incredible growth opportunities, continued education, wellness programs, and much more!

Name: Senior Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) Analyst - Phoenix, AZ Phoenix, Arizona 10/31
Description: Senior Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) Analyst - Phoenix, AZ Date posted 10/31/2018 Job DescriptionFreeport-McMoRan is a premier U.S.-based natural resources company with headquarters in Phoenix, Arizona. We operate large, long-lived, geographically diverse assets with significant proven and probable reserves of copper, gold and molybdenum. The company has a dynamic portfolio of operating, expansion and growth projects in the copper industry. Freeport-McMoRan is the world’s largest publicly traded copper producer, the world’s largest producer of molybdenum and a significant gold producer. We have a long and successful history of conducting our business in a safe, highly efficient and socially-responsible manner.We have the assets, the talent, the drive and the financial strength to provide attractive and rewarding careers for our employees. We encourage you to take some time to explore your career opportunities at Freeport-McMoRan.Responsible for managing North & South America’s refined copper Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process and the related analysis to ensure inventory optimization in accordance with the overall Sales Company’s goals and objectives in a collaborative manner with the relevant operations, logistics and finance teams.Lead the planning functions for the North & South American refined copper market segments for short term, mid-term and long term planning utilizing SAP as a tool while leveraging the global planning teamDevelop and maintain data analysis of various sales and logistics planning and analytical models necessary to manage the refined cathode and rod sales efforts both domestically and internationally including, but not limited to available to sale model, netback analysis, safety stock calculations, distribution optimization models including truck vs. rail analyses, production and sales balances, commercial sales term analysis by customer / mine / country of sale, customer contract terms summaries required to administer contract and summaries of sales terms to be negotiated annuallyDevelop and maintain, as needed master data, reporting, key performance metrics and ad-hoc analyses as requiredLead the forecasting process with Sales / Marketing enabling effective planning with and/or without constraintsAnalyze North American refined copper inventories, safety stocks, and seasonal variations to produce coverage profiles that are tailored to meet the business requirementsCreate sales reports and data analytics to use in decision making; organize and communicate the analytics in a readily consumable form for leadership and users; may partner with MIS on special projects as neededPerform other duties as requested Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree and six (6) years of experience in broad-based Business Analysis and Management within a multi-disciplinary environment; in any combination of Finance, Global Supply, Information Services, Production Planning, or Commodity SalesSkill in effective communication, both written and verbalSkill in presenting complex, technical ideas to technical and non-technical stakeholdersPresent a positive and professional imageMust be self-motivated and client service orientedAbility and willingness to travel domestically and internationallyAbility to make good decisions and enforce company policies in accordance with applicable regulations and proceduresAbility to prioritize tasks, meet aggressive deadlines and work well under pressureAbility to develop and maintain business relationships within a diverse populationProficiency in using SAP, Microsoft Office Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OutlookQualificationsPreferredBi-lingual (Spanish)Proficient in Business Objects and data visualization tools such as Power BI or TableauCriteria/ConditionsAbility to understand and apply verbal and written work and safety-related instructions and procedures given in EnglishAbility to communicate in English with respect to job assignments, job procedures, and applicable safety standardsMust be able to work in a potentially stressful environmentPosition is located in a busy, non-smoking office located in downtown Phoenix, AZLocation requires mobility in an office environment; each floor is accessible by an elevator and internal staircaseMay include both occasional domestic and international travelMust be able to frequently sit, stand, walk, hear, see and talkMust be able to frequently lift and carry up to ten (10) poundsPersonal protective equipment is required when performing work in a mine, outdoor, manufacturing or plant environment, including hard hat, hearing protection, safety glasses, safety footwear, and as needed, respirator, rubber steel-toe boots, protective clothing, gloves and any other protective equipment as requiredFreeport-McMoRan promotes a drug/alcohol free work environment through the use of mandatory pre-employment drug testing and on-going random drug testing as per applicable State LawsFreeport-McMoRan has reviewed the jobs at its various office and operating sites and determined that many of these jobs require employees to perform essential job functions that pose a direct threat to the safety or health of the employees performing these tasks or others. Accordingly, the company has designated the following positions as safety-sensitive:Site-based positions, or positions which require unescorted access to site-based operational areas, which are held by employees who are required to receive MSHA, OSHA, DOT, HAZWOPER and/or Hazard Recognition Training; orPositions which are held by employees who operate equipment, machinery or motor vehicles in furtherance of performing the essential functions of their job duties, including operating motor vehicles while on company business or travel (for this purpose “motor vehicles” includes company owned or leased motor vehicles and personal motor vehicles used by employees in furtherance of company business or while on company travel); orPositions which Freeport-McMoRan has designated as safety sensitive positions in the applicable job or position description and which upon further review continue to be designated as safety-sensitive based on an individualized assessment of the actual duties performed by a specifically identified employee.Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/DisabilityJobSenior Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) Analyst - Phoenix, AZPrimary LocationUnited StatesArizonaPhoenix Corporate OfficeRequisition ID1805321

Name: Product Analyst, Global Assisted Application Experience
Description: Analyst, Global Assisted Application Experience  The card application experience is often one of the first impression prospective card members will have of the American Express and is the primary source of new Amex customers. As online technologies evolve, so too must our acquisition experience.  We are looking for talented product analyst to join our Global Application Experience team. The team's purpose is to grow new accounts acquired, billed business acquired and accounts receivables by accelerating the completed applications experiences for our global prospect and customer base. You will have the opportunity to learn new things and see how you can make a direct contribution to the success of our company.  Responsibilities  This challenging and exciting position within the Enterprise Digital & Analytics organization will play a pivotal role in transforming the application experience across assisted applications. It requires a candidate with a broad range of skills and experience, including marketing knowledge of digital conversion and an end to end understanding of the customer experience.  You will be responsible for bringing new products to life and enhancing existing ones. You must understand the user, customer and business goals, and collaborate with the development team and the stakeholders. You will be responsible for the success of the product and empowered to do so.  Responsibilities include: Understand user and customer needsDescribe the user experience and product featuresCollaborate with development teamCoordinate between multiple scrum teams working on the same common product backlog within the departmentDevelop epics, story boards, and user stories with stakeholders (both internal and external).Manage StakeholdersDefine and contribute to product roadmapDecide what to do next - Set the sprint goal and detail storiesStrong analytic approach to set and validate goalsWrite , refine and groom user storiesGather/maintain requirement documents including UI mockups, field definitions, copy translations, process flows, etc. for engineering to build the productActively participate in Agile ceremonies. QualificationsBachelors degree Experience building digital products and customer journeysMinimum 1 years experience working in an Agile environmentExperience partnering with 3rd party agencies (UI/UX) is highly preferredStrong communication and technical skills with the ability to quickly grasp technical issues/concepts Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.ReqID: 18014708  Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-time  Date Posted: Nov 28, 2018, 2:34:44 PM

Name: Financial Analyst I/II
Description: Arizona Public Service has an opportunity for a Financial Analyst I/II who will with ongoing supervision, assist or conduct a variety of basic financial analysis projects or functions. Performs a variety of routine research and studies on topics that may include rates of return, working capital, investments, cost analysis, budgeting, forecasting, financial modeling, corporate finance, cash management, financial targets and financial and expense comparisons. Prepares routine reports of findings and recommendations to more senior financial analysts or appropriate Manager. Supports strategic planning and analysis. Contacts are primarily with immediate supervisor and other personnel in the section or group. Minimum Qualifications Financial Analyst I : Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting or an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved. MBA, MS in Finance or CPA certification preferred. Basic knowledge of finance or economic analysis, Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and income tax laws. Good research and effective communication skills a must. Good word processing and spreadsheet skills. Time constraints, scope and complexity are commensurate with the beginning level. This position may rotate through various areas of Accounting and Finance prior to permanent assignment.  Financial Analyst II : Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting with two years experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved. MBA, MS in Finance or CPA certification preferred. Frequent use and general knowledge of finance or economic analysis, Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and income tax laws. Good research and effective communication skills a must. Good word processing and spreadsheet skills.  Major Accountabilities Performs routine analyses and reporting to provide ongoing information, compiles relevant information, makes comparisons and evaluates results. Prepares a variety of routine financial data, information and studies in a clear, concise format.Assists in the development of department strategies and financial models to accurately reflect impacts of new regulations and market events on the Company's financial performance.Assist in administering department programs / plans by maintaining basic knowledge of each and preparing ongoing analyses of specific topics.Ensures compliance by maintaining appropriate documentation, files, records or systems.Provide analysis and resolution of cost issues based on current industry standards.Maintains basic knowledge of the primary emerging issues facing the industry and company business specifics.Develops basic understanding of company, unit policies and procedures, accounting practices, and federal and state regulations.Provides support to other team members to enhance development and productivity.

Name: Information Technology Analyst/Programmer II
Description: The Aviation Department Technology Division is seeking to fill an Information Technology Analyst/Programmer II position. This position helps support various systems including, but not limited to SITA common use self-service system, Parking Revenue Control System, Automated Vehicle Identification, Honeywell Enterprise building integrator, Operational security portal and an array of Web Applications. Under general supervision, the Aviation Application Administrator participates in application system administration, detailed analysis, program design and development, documentation, testing, implementation and maintenance of business application systems. This position also works independently or as a member of a functional and technical team to develop recommendations and design and develop enhancements to existing systems or recommend replacement of existing business systems.  This recruitment may be used by any department for any current or future vacancies over the life of the eligible list. RECRUITMENT DATES Recruitment may close when we have received a sufficient number of qualified applications. First review of resumes will be the week of June 4, 2018. SALARY $60,174 - $89,856 annually. Appointment can be made above the minimum depending upon qualifications.  Comprehensive benefits package includes: 11.5 paid holidays, 12 vacation days, 15 sick days, free bus/light rail pass, traditional pension and 457/401 plans, tuition reimbursement upon hire, choice of Blue Cross/Blue Shield or Cigna HMO, PPO. For more details, visit:  https://www.phoenix.gov/hrsite/Benefit%20Category/007.pdf JOB REQUIREMENTSTwo years of experience in application programming and development and systems analysis.Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer information systems, business administration, mathematics, or related field (an additional four years of related experience may be substituted for the Bachelor’s degree).Must have the ability to work after hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays as required.Works more than forty hours in a workweek without additional compensation to perform assigned job duties, including weekends, evenings, early morning hours and holidays as required.An equivalent combination of related experience and education may be considered.Only the highest qualified will be posted to the eligible to hire list.The following list is not all inclusive, but are TSA general factors for disqualification of employment for working at Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport. Other factors will be assessed that may also lead to disqualification. Qualified candidates should consider these factors when applying. https://forms.skyharbor.com/Downloads/AviationEmploymentDisqualifiers.pdfPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Includes the job requirements listed above, plus: Experience developing software using Microsoft .net or Java technologies and any other client side technologies like HTML, PHP, Javascript, Sharepoint, and Android or IOExperience creating or modifying database schema to support application data store and retrieval in most efficient fashionAbility to work on the projects involving technical and non-technical resources. Candidate should also be familiar with Software life cycle Methodologies, Helpdesk and Training.At least two years supporting enterprise / multi-user applications and working directly with vendors for application support, patching, and other maintenance.Possess the ability to diagnose and troubleshoot end devices and peripheral issues.Possess experience in the following: PL/SQL, Visual Studio, XML Messaging, Application development/support in Oracle and/or SQL Server environments, Client Server (Multi-Tier) application development/support, Web services development/support.Possesses excellent communication, facilitation, and problem-solving skills working across multiple technical domains and teams.Excellent customer support skills, including ability to train users and present data.Ability to creatively solve complex business problems.Ability to work with both non-technical and technical users alike.HOW TO APPLY Apply online by completing the required information and attaching your cover letter and resume. Please include your experience as it relates to the qualifications stated above.  YOUR COVER LETTER AND RESUME, PLUS ANY OTHER REQUESTED MATERIAL, MUST BE IN ONE ATTACHMENT. Only online applications are accepted for this position. The results of the resume screening process will be sent to your primary email address. WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOWAll finalists for positions are subject to a criminal background check applicable to the department or position.For other important information related to employment with the City of Phoenix, please visit: https://www.phoenix.gov/hrsite/Documents/Talent-Acquisition/Employment-Information.pdfIf you need assistance applying for this job, please contact our HR Connection Center at (602) 495-5700.REFERENCE Info Tech Analyst/Prg II, JC: 09660, ID# 27358, 5/2018, 6 mos, AB, Benefits: 007, Q  City of Phoenix is an equal opportunity employer; our employees demonstrate superior seamless customer service, integrity, and commitment to innovation, efficiency, and fiscally responsible activity.  AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service alumni who meet the required qualifications are encouraged to apply.

Name: ATO Fraud Strategy Analyst III/II
Description: Job Description: Responsible for developing account takeover fraud detection strategies by performing more complex analysis and modeling with a focus on Small Business and Debit Card activity or Credit Card Electronic Balance Transfers and ACH activity. Uses multiple databases to acquire statistical, financial, transactional, and non-monetary event data to identify fraud patterns and activity for the creation of optimal fraud detection strategy rules. Utilizes portfolio trends to propose strategy/policy/procedural changes within assigned segmentation structure to produce optimal results as well as to provide updates for senior management. Excels at risk/reward trade off. Builds relationships with external agencies. Participates in the rollout of company-wide pilot programs developed as a result of programmed models. Duties primarily include the regular use of discretion, independent judgment, the ability to communicate with multiple levels of management and the utilization of core leadership behaviors. Proficiency with SAS, SQL, and/or other statistical and analytical tools preferred; knowledge of fraud strategy management preferred; 2-5 years' experience preferred.  May be filled as an Analyst II or III depending on experience and skill set. Job Description:Responsible for establishing and maintaining account takeover fraud detection rules and strategies for Small Business and Debit Card activity or Credit Card Electronic Balance Transfer and ACH activity.Defines the criteria to systematically impact customer transactions and to determine which accounts need to be alerted to the detection operations teams for review and customer contact.Responds to suspicious activity across the enterprise by interdicting and/or alerting suspicious activity while balancing customer experience, fraud risk, operations capacity, and regulations.Monitors incoming fraud claims and overdraft activity for trends.Performs fraud strategy/rule definition, implementation, and performance monitoring.Prepares regular management updates of strategy performance, trends, and key issues.Performs data analysis of operations capacity, performance and alert prioritization.Serves as expert with regards to assigned fraud detection systems in order to determine how to best leverage the technology.Required Skills and Experience:2+ years of proficiency with SAS and/or other statistical and analytical tools2+ years of proficiency with SQL, specifically the ability to write, interpret, and data mine the results of queries in large data environments i.e. SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or similar enterprise database platformsAnalytical, logical reasoning, and problem solving skillsIntermediate level skills in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically ExcelStrong intellectual curiosity and passion for innovationAbility to communicate effectively and influence others to drive results Desired Skills and Experience:2-5 years fraud strategy creation and/or management experienceKnowledge of SFM, Brainiac, and/or FLASH fraud detection systemsKnowledge of TSYS, ICDP card and processing systemsKnowledge of data platforms such as BACARDI, W, HULC/Hadoop, and/or FRPRExperience in operational and fraud risk in Financial institutionsKnowledge of fraud schemes with a focus on account takeover fraudExperience with credit and/or debit card transaction processing including balance transfers and ACHExperience with small business banking relationships and activity a plusAbility to gather, arrange, process, and model data to support fraud detection strategy developmentCollege degree in quantitative discipline, statistics, math, economics, or computer scienceSix Sigma Enterprise Role Overview:  Responsible for performing more complex analysis and modeling for multiple products with the goal of maximizing profits and asset growth and minimizing risk and operating losses and/or other financial and marketing exposures. Develops complex program models to extract data and uses multiple databases to acquire statistical and financial data. Utilizes portfolio trends to propose policy/procedural changes within segmentation structure to produce optimal results. Excels at risk/reward trade off. Build relationships with external agencies. Participates in the rollout of company-wide pilot programs developed as a result of programmed models. Duties primarily include the regular use of discretion, independent judgment, the ability to communicate with multiple levels of management and the utilization of core leadership behaviors. SAS and/or MicroStrategy experience preferred; 2-5 years experience preferred. Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Associate Acquisitions Analyst - Phoenix, AZ
Description: About the teamYou will join a brand new team that is at the center of Zillows effort to transform the future of home selling. This team will be responsible for establishing and developing best-in-class operations for residential real estate transactions, central to our mission to make the process of buying or selling a home a consumer friendly, state of the art experience that can be launched with just the click of a button.About the roleZillow is looking for an Acquisitions Associate to underwrite single-family homes including purchase and sale pricing, renovation estimates and general property level P&L. You will be able to demonstrate your experience to provide insight and analysis to the Market Teams to hone in pricing, evaluate ROI, analysis of upgrades and capture local intel on market conditions. You will work closely with Senior Acquisitions Analysts, Asset Managers and the field team on any price adjustments during diligence or closing process of acquisitions and resale.  You will: Be responsible for verification of automated valuation pricing, initial pricing & final pricing of acquisitions and sales pricing/days on market monitoring of dispositionsWorking with detailed financial models in ExcelPerform market research and trend analysisAssist in preparing investment committee memorandumsAssist with monitoring and seeking ways to optimize existing portfolio of propertiesAd hoc data analysis and reporting relevant to acquisitions activityDevelop deep understanding of the market to help the team make financially sound, operationally efficient decisions. We encourage one another at every level, and our efforts are supported by employee-driven, world-class benefits that enable us to enjoy our lives outside the office while building fulfilling careers that impact millions of individuals every day.  Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Name: Technical/Clinical Help Desk Support Analyst
Description: Req ID: 34813 At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.  NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Technical/Clinical Help Desk Support Analyst to join our team in Bowling Green, Kentucky (US-KY), United States (US).  This position will be a part of our Clinical Service Desk. This is a call center environment in which we support our customers 24/7. Shift work is required including nights and weekends. We are only considering local applicants at this time  Role Responsibilities Responds to incidents regarding the clinical aspects of various clinical applications such as Epic, Cerner, McKesson and Meditech. Incidents may include, but are not limited to, workflow issues, application errors, user access, and functionalityWill receive, analyze, and process the EMR requests submitted via e-mail, Web, and voice mails; examples include master files and category list modifications, smart lists, text, note support, etc.Tracking and documenting the appropriate comments, and close or escalate the incident tickets and related issues in a timely mannerResponsible for driving resolution of incidents on a 24/7 desk  Requirements4+ years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and work experience / High school diploma or equivalent required1+ years of technical troubleshooting or equivalent technical analyst role experiencePrevious experience in a call center environmentDemonstrates a service philosophy in all interactions with clinicians and colleaguesStrong communication and interpersonal skillsAll candidates will have to be shift flexible. Nights and weekend work will be required  PreferencesExperience in EMR system integration with other clinical systemsCertifications in one or more of the above mentioned EMR applicationsAssociates degree, technical college or some college course work preferred  - 1+ years of experience in one or more of the following EMR applications – Epic, Cerner, McKesson and Meditech1+ years clinical care delivery experience Experience required: 3 years of analysis experience This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.  NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.  NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result. Nearest Major Market: Bowling GreenJob Segment: Help Desk, Information Technology, Technical Support, Consulting, Technology

Name: Government Actuarial Analyst
Description: Mercers Government Human Services Consulting (GHSC) practice focuses on the unique and challenging needs of the public health care sector, providing a wide array of consulting services to local, state, and federal government agencies across the country. GHSC specializes in helping governments shape tomorrows health programs. GHSC has been partnering with states and other stakeholder organizations for over 30 years to support health care programs for the low-income and most vulnerable populations in this country. To accomplish these challenging and exciting tasks, GHSC brings together a team of highly-skilled and dedicated consultants, clinicians, actuaries, analysts, accountants and pharmacists across four offices in Phoenix, Minneapolis, Atlanta and Washington DC to ensure a coordinated approach to the administrative, operational, actuarial, and financial components of public-sponsored health care programs. RESPONSIBILITIES • Assists in basic actuarial/quantitative analysis projects under the guidance of senior project team members in order to assess and calculate costs, rates, risks and trends associated with underwriting health and welfare insurance, brokering contracts, or projecting health care related costs • Gathers, organizes, tests, and reviews client or vendor data for accuracy, validity, and reasonableness, and to identify any discrepancies • Performs basic analyses and cost projections by using or modifying existing products, tools, and pricing models in Excel, SAS, and other software, with oversight and feedback from senior project team members • Assists senior project team members in preparing reports for data trend analyses in order to summarize findings and recommend a strategy, solution, or plan design to the client • Participates in development of company's intellectual capital in order to develop knowledge of health insurance actuarial services and products • Researches, analyzes, and reviews industry, regulatory, and legislative trends for calculating risk, liability, and cost for client or government reports Qualifications Minimum 1 Actuarial Exam OR defined plan to sit for upcoming exam Minimum 1-3 years experience in Insurance industry, Government industry or similar industries Bachelors degree or equivalent relevant, professional experience At Mercer, we make a difference in the lives of more than 110 million people every day by advancing their health, wealth, and careers. Were in the business of creating more secure and rewarding futures for our clients and their employees whether were designing affordable health plans, assuring income for retirement or aligning workers with workforce needs. Using analysis and insights as catalysts for change, we anticipate and understand the individual impact of business decisions, now and in the future. We see peoples current and future needs through a lens of innovation, and our holistic view, specialized expertise, and deep analytical rigor underpin each and every idea and solution we offer. For more than 70 years, weve turned our insights into actions, enabling people around the globe to live, work, and retire well. We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. At Mercer, we say we Make Tomorrow, Today . Visit www.mercer.com for more information and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter @Mercer Marsh & McLennan Companies offers competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits and programs including: health and welfare, tuition assistance, 401K, employee assistance program, domestic partnership benefits, career mobility, employee network groups, volunteer opportunities, and other programs. For more information about our company, please visit us at: http://www.mmc.com/. We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. For more information, please visit us at: www.mmc.com/diversity . Mercer LLC and its separately incorporated operating entities around the world are part of Marsh & McLennan Companies, a publicly held company (ticker symbol: MMC). Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity employers. R_024164-en R_024164

Name: Settlement Operations Analyst I
Description: About Blackhawk NetworkBlackhawk Network Holdings, Inc. is a global financial technology company and a leader in connecting brands and people through branded value solutions. Blackhawk platforms and solutions enable the management of stored value products, promotions and rewards programs in retail, ecommerce, financial services and mobile wallets. Blackhawk’s Hawk Commerce division offers technology solutions to businesses and direct to consumers. The Hawk Incentives division offers enterprise, SMB and reseller partners an array of platforms and branded value products to incent and reward consumers, employees and sales channels. Headquartered in Pleasanton, Calif., Blackhawk operates in 26 countries. For more information, please visit blackhawknetwork.com, cashstar.com, hawkcommerce.com, hawkincentives.com or our product websites GiftCards.com, giftcardmall.com, GiftCardLab.com and OmniCard.com.OverviewConsidered a Finance position with a blend of accounting, data analysis and account management in regards to settlement. The Settlement Operations Analysts’ primary responsibility will be to assist with supporting and managing their assigned partners from a settlement and reconciliation perspective. This role will also expand to assist with the Settlement Operations departmental needs in regards to Partner reconciliation and research and will heavily rely on a strong analytical and communication skill sets.  The Settlement Operations Analyst will work on projects and day to day business functions supporting our partners from a Gift Card settlement/billing perspective. We will provide analysts with an overview of our full business operations including our proprietary technical systems, settlement operations and processes. This position is located in Phoenix, Arizona.ResponsibilitiesManages and supports assigned Gift Card Partners from a settlement and reconciliation perspective while establishing and building effective Partner rapportResponsible for Partner settlement support, cash application, accounts receivable collections, high volume transaction level research and reconciliations including cross-functional and Partner facing facilitation towards resolutionUnderstand all settlement inputs and outputs in order to facilitate communication and resolution in addition to reconciliation support of internal systems and processesIdentifies settlement and reconciliation process improvementsAnalyze and manage data to help internal and external customers optimize business decisionsPerform testing with automated reconciliation systemAssist with maintenance and application of business controls and performance audits QualificationsMinimum education requirement is Bachelor’s degree optimally with a major in Accounting or related field. Name: Critical Application Support Analyst (Information Technology Analyst /Programmer II)
Description: The City of Phoenix is currently seeking an Information Technology Analyst/Programmer II (ITAP II) to support Critical Systems of the Phoenix Police Department (PPD). Interested applicants should have experience in Linux, TSQL/SQL and Shell scripting. Knowledge of troubleshooting critical systems and familiarity with Law Enforcement agencies is a plus. The selected applicant will be responsible for maintaining multiple mission-critical IT subsystems for the Police Department. This support also includes maintaining interfaces between various Law Enforcement, City and State Agencies.  Work Location: Phoenix Police Headquarters: 620 W. Washington Street, Phoenix  Work Shift: Monday – Friday, 8am – 5pm Police Civilian Employment Disqualifiers: Positions in the Police Department must meet the polygraph and background standards that are appropriate to non-sworn positions. The General Factors for Disqualification are listed below and at: https://www.phoenix.gov/policesite/Documents/disqualifierscivilian.pdf  Listed below are general factors for disqualification regarding civilian employment with the Phoenix Police Department. Note: Exceptions may apply and will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis: Felony: Conviction of a job-related felony.Misdemeanor: Conviction of a job-related misdemeanor within the last 3 years.Drug Use: Illegal marijuana use occurring within the last 12 months.Other Illegal drug use occurring within the last 5 years.Financial: Job-related negative financial history occurring within the last 5 years.Driving: Job-related negative driving history occurring within the last 5 years. This is not an all-inclusive list. Other factors (i.e., poor driving record, immoral conduct, criminal activity, dishonesty) will also be assessed and may lead to disqualification. Individuals should consider all these factors when applying.  This recruitment may be used by any department for any current or future vacancies over the life of the eligible list. RECRUITMENT DATES First review of applications will occur the week of August 20, 2018. Recruitment will close when we have received a sufficient number of qualified applications. SALARY $60,174 - $89,856 annually. Candidates may be hired above the minimum depending upon qualifications.  Comprehensive benefits package includes: 11.5 paid holidays, 12 vacation days, 15 sick days, free bus/light rail pass, traditional pension and 457/401 plans, tuition reimbursement upon hire, choice of Blue Cross/Blue Shield or Cigna HMO, PPO. For more details, visit: https://www.phoenix.gov/hrsite/Benefit%20Category/007.pdf JOB REQUIREMENTSBachelor’s degree in computer science, computer information systems, mathematics or a related field.Two years’ experience in computer applications programming and development and systems analysis.Equivalent combination of related experience and education may be considered.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSExperience supporting enterprise / multi-user applications and working directly with vendors for application support, patching, and other maintenance.Hands-on experience with UNIX or Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems environments.Experience creating complex reports using SSRS, SSIS and shell scripting.Ability to write SQL queries.Experience with Extraction of Data from various data sources.Excellent customer support skills, including ability to train users.Ability to work with both non-technical and technical users alike.Experience working with GIS applications and data.Familiarity with process and policies related to Law Enforcement agencies.Experience with large scale enterprise applications.Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.Experience with working in a fast-paced dynamic environment supporting the business requirements of internal city departments and external law enforcement agencies.Only the highest qualified will be posted to the eligible to hire.HOW TO APPLY Apply online by completing the required information and attaching your cover letter and resume. Please include your experience as it relates to the qualifications stated above.  YOUR COVER LETTER AND RESUME, PLUS ANY OTHER REQUESTED MATERIAL, MUST BE IN ONE ATTACHMENT. Only online applications are accepted for this position. The results of the resume screening process will be sent to your primary email address. WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOWAll finalists for positions are subject to a criminal background check applicable to the department or position.For other important information related to employment with the City of Phoenix, please visit: https://www.phoenix.gov/hrsite/Documents/Talent-Acquisition/Employment-Information.pdfIf you need assistance applying for this job, please contact our HR Connection Center at (602) 495-5700.REFERENCE Info Tech Analyst/Prgmr II, JC: 09660, ID# 28174, 7/29/1818, 6 mos, DD, Benefits: 07, Q  City of Phoenix is an equal opportunity employer; our employees demonstrate superior seamless customer service, integrity, and commitment to innovation, efficiency, and fiscally responsible activity.  AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service alumni who meet the required qualifications are encouraged to apply.

Name: Sr Materials Analyst
Description: Sr Materials AnalystJoin a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  Expertise the implementation of material purchasing, material planning, production planning, inventory control, shipping/receiving and stores functions within Honeywell Analyst. You will engage in the execution and follow up with policies, procedures and material control systems. You will identify and solve problems in and out of immediate work area independently and ensure materials are ordered and in stock to meet company requirements, while maintaining acceptable inventory levels. You are expected to lead project teams within the business.  Keep Honeywell's production lines moving by ensuring materials are well scheduled, evaluated and accurately delivered on time, every time  Continuously improve material management processes to drive better business results  Use your agility and ability to support clients to solve escalations and achieve metricsCreated with SnapEnsure timely material orderingEnsure correct demand is in placeSolve material related problems Provide data and analysis to leadership YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree or Minimum of 5 years of supply chain experience5 years experience and expertise with MRP/ERP Systems2 to 3 years experience using SAPWE VALUEExperience planning tasks in Servigistics preferredKnowledge of manufacturing planning processes is desiredKnowledge in lean, six sigma tools and problem solving methodologyKnowledge in Project ManagementMentor junior membersStrong experience in Materials managementAPICS certificationExcel and Access experience Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements.  Exempt INCLUDES1st ShiftSome Travel RequiredContinued Professional DevelopmentADDITIONAL INFORMATIONJob ID: HRD48776Category: Integrated Supply ChainLocation: 1944 E Sky Harbor Circle, Phoenix, AZ 85034 USA Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

Name: Sr Manager Analyst
Description: Description:Phoenix - AZ, PHX8040, 8040 South 48th Street, 85044  Lance Alan Britton  20180208-970 We believe that, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every client’s goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of ‘own your tomorrow’ every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.  As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future. Our Opportunity:Are you a code ninja? Ready to turbocharge your analytics career? Read on… Schwab’s Analytics & Business Insight (ABI) team helps Schwab compete on analytics to serve our clients and cultivate their loyalty by understanding their needs and goals better than anyone, and then to make data-driven, strategic decisions.  Our team is highly skilled at delivering firm-wide strategic decision support, client behavior diagnostics, advanced analytics, market research, client loyalty, management metrics, and client & prospect data management. Our services are in heavy demand due to our reputation for accuracy, strong business insight, outstanding productivity, and attention to detail. We’re an army of 159 influencers. Ready to be #160?What you’ll do:Five key tasks, not for the faint of heart The Senior Manager - Analyst position sits within the Institutional Analytics team that supports Schwab Advisor Services. Overall, this ninja will be responsible for delivering measurements, metrics and analytics via statistical analysis and business intelligence tools on a wide array of very interesting structured and unstructured datasets. More specifically, this role will drive five key actions: Lead efforts to leverage highly scalable, modern business intelligence platforms to drive business results and enhance performance visibility.Partner with multiple business stakeholders to uncover and articulate business needs, critical paths, and timelines for key business initiatives.Work actively to support business priorities by engineering creative, modern, optimal solutions that leverage interactive business intelligence and advanced analytic tools.Deploy an analytic mindset to develop creative and compelling visuals that represent key trends and insights for informed decision-making.Navigate complex and sometimes unstructured data with the goal of delivering high impact business intelligence & analytics used by executives across the organization.What you have:Do you have what it takes? To successfully deliver on the role, the Senior Manager will need to effectively leverage education, experience, personal attributes, and technical expertise “queried” below: /*Critical qualifications: education, technical & inter-personal skills, and experience*/SELECT candidate_name, FROM tbl_candidate_info candidate INNERJOIN tbl_education education ON candidate.id=education.candidate_id INNERJOIN tbl_skills skilz ON candidate.id=skilz.candidate_id INNERJOIN tbl_interpersonal_skills interskilz ON candidate.id=interskilz.candidate_id INNERJOIN tbl_experience experience ON candidate.id=experience.candidate_id WHERE education.undergrad_degree in ('Engineering','Information Management','Finance','Math', 'Math related field')  AND skilz.SQL_experience='Advanced'  /*Able to translate business requirements into SQL "from scratch" and understand existing complex SQL*/  AND skilz.BI_platform_experience in('Moderate','Advanced')  /*Hands-on experience developing new dashboards and reports on scalable business intelligence platforms such as Tableau, SAP Business Objects, etc. along with maintaining and enhancing existing artifacts*/  AND skilz.relational_databases_experience='Advanced' AND interskilz.self_starter='Yes' AND interskilz.work_style='Can work independently & collaboratively' AND interskilz.time_management='Advanced'  /*Have ability to manage concurrent projects at different stages of completion*/ AND interskilz.business_partner_communication='Ability to translate and summarize technical jargon to business partners'  AND interskilz.ability_to_lead_projects='Yes' AND interskilz.agile_project_work='Well practiced' AND (experience.years_systems_analyst BETWEEN5AND7OR experience.years_data_analyst BETWEEN5AND7OR experience.years_business_intelligence_developer BETWEEN5AND7) AND experience.years_teradata>=3 AND experience.years_oracle>=3 AND experience.years_SQL>=3  /*Looking for candidates with 3+ years creating and maintaining reports, dashboards, self-serve tools in an automated production environment*/ /*Additional nice-to-have qualifications*/SELECT candidate_name, casewhen education.masters_degree='Yes' then 1 elsewhen experience.dashboards_with_predictive_metrics='Yes' then 1 elsewhen skilz.R_experience='Yes' then 1 elsewhen skilz.Python_experience='Yes' then 1 else 0 endas CutAboveRest_Candidate What you’ll get:Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits packageFinancial Health: 401k Match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discountsWork/Life Balance: Sabbatical, Paid Parental Leave, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer, Employee Matching Gifts ProgramEveryday Wellness: Health and Lifestyle Wellness Rewards, Onsite Fitness Classes, Healthy Food Choices, Wellness ChampionsInclusion: Employee Resource Groups, Commitment to diversity, Strategic partnershipsNot just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life Learn more about Life@Schwab.  Charles Schwab & Co., Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversifying its workforce. It is Schwab's policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, legally protected medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, military status, citizenship status or any other status that is protected by law. Schwab also does not discriminate against applicants or employees because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. At Schwab, we believe that every employee, through their diverse abilities and experiences, can contribute to our growth, innovation and client loyalty. We embrace diversity and are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants. If you have a disability, and require reasonable accommodations in the application process, call Human Resources at 800-725-3535. We will be happy to assist you. Schwab will only share your accommodation request with those individuals who have a specific need to know. The request for an accommodation will not affect Schwab's hiring decisions. All other submissions should be performed online.Job Specifications  Relocation Offered?: No Work Schedule: Days Languages: English - spoken Current Licenses / Certifications: None Relevant Work Experience: IT-Other Specialty Engineering-6+ yrs Position Located In: AZ - Phoenix, TX - Westlake Education: BA/BS Job Type: Full Time Category:Marketing Analytics  Activation Date: Friday, February 16, 2018  Expiration Date: Saturday, December 1, 2018  Apply Here

Name: Sales Compensation Analyst
Description: About Us Republic Services is an industry leader in U.S. recycling and non-hazardous solid waste. Through our subsidiaries, Republics collection companies, recycling centers, transfer stations, and landfills focus on providing effective solutions to make proper waste disposal effortless for our 14 million customers. Well handle it from here., our brand promise, lets customers know they can count on Republic to provide a superior experience while fostering a sustainable Blue Planet for future generations to enjoy a cleaner, safer and healthier world. Why Work with Us Our Company cannot thrive without great people devoted to serving customers, the community, and the planet. We hire the best people to make Republic a great place to work. We are focused on attracting talented individuals across professions who are as committed to serving customers and the planet as we are. We strive to create a workplace that's meaningful and rewarding to our 33,000 employees. That's why we are proud to be recognized as Best Large Employer by Forbes, Worlds Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere, and One of the Most Meaningful Companies to Work for in America by Business Insider. Job Description The Sales Compensation Analyst role assists with administering sales commission plans for approximately 1,500 sales staff. This role supports calculation, verification and approvals of monthly commission processing. This includes, but is not limited to, data processing and validation, troubleshooting, end user support, and on-going system maintenance. In addition to the day to day administration, the Sales Compensation Analyst will frequently be asked to assist in projects related to process improvements, data cleansing and the end user experience. The Sales Compensation Analyst should be proactive in building relationship with internal field sales payees, sales management and corporate customers, providing assistance as required. Knowledge, Skills & AbilitiesPreferred QualificationsPrincipal ResponsibilitiesActs as the primary point of contact for monthly/quarterly sales commission payments to approximately 1,500 sales staff in compliance with documented plans.Proactively and collaboratively develops and standardizes processes and workflows around the compensation system.Drives effective use and adoption of automated compensation system.Communicates, educates and trains field staff on automated system.Understands how pricing, delivery, service and support drive revenue and best practices to appropriately incentivize and reward desirable behaviors.Collaborates with stakeholders to develop appropriate processes for compensation plan governance.Ensures that effective protocols and measures are in place to confirm accurate compensation payments and organizational compliance.Collaborates with Sr. Manager, Sales Compensation regularly to review responsibilities, open items and milestones.Builds deep relationships with the Field Sales payees, sales management and corporate stakeholders.Works closely with Corporate Compensation team on plan design, modeling and policy matters related to sales commission plans.Performs other job-related duties as assigned or apparent. The statements used herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by an employee in this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and skills required by an incumbent so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the Company. QualificationsBachelor's Degree.Experience with Incentive Compensation software, i.e. Xactly Incent .Minimum of 1 year of experience in Compensation, Human Resources, Accounting, Finance, Sales Administration or related field (required).Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills (pivot tables, vlookups, etc.) (required).Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks (required).Trustworthy; maintains the highest level of confidentiality at all times (required).Proven ability to manage difficult customers; capable of diffusing challenging situations and sympathizing with the customer position.Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to effectively communicate to all levels of management, both internally and externally (required)Ability to gain a deep understanding of the Companys sales team objectives and pain points.Ability to maintain a thorough knowledge of the Companys value proposition, available services, lines of business and pricing structures.Ability to identify key milestones, goals and objectives at the outset of any task and remain intently focused on attainment.Demonstrated ability and willingness to adjust and adapt to changing conditions.Understanding of all roles that are part of the sales process and their responsibilities.Ability to fully understand sales team challenges and identify potential solutions.Grasps concepts quickly and has good follow-through skills; adheres to work schedule and follows through on challenges as they arise; maintains a positive outlook.Good time management skills to ensure assigned responsibilities are completed in an efficient manner.Rewarding Compensation and Benefits Eligible employees can elect to participate in: Comprehensive medical benefits coverage, dental plans and vision coverage.Health care and dependent care spending accounts.Short- and long-term disability.Life insurance and accidental death & dismemberment insurance.Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP).Employee discount programs.401(k) plan with a generous company match.Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP). Name: Watson Health - Data Warehouse Analyst
Description: Job Description2nd shift resource in Ann Arbor, Sacramento or Denver Position Summary:The Data Warehouse Analyst is responsible for maintaining data warehouse solutions that deliver diverse reporting and analytic capabilities to health and human services in customers in the public and private sector. This role provides operational support, data profiling and audit and reconciliation services for the data integration platform in the data warehouse environment, additionally this role assures that operational processes follow data warehouse best practices. This individual works with data integration programmers, data architects, analytic consultants, and HW/SW engineers to ensure enterprise DW solutions are reliable, scalable, flexible and low maintenance. The candidate must demonstrate an understanding of data warehouse concepts, practices, and procedures, has technical hands on experience supporting data warehouse solutions, has strong communication skills and the ability to provide support to customers and collaborate internally on projects as a contributor/specialist. This candidate should also be able to find creative solutions to complex and diverse business requirements. This position typically reports to a Team Lead or an Operations Managers.Essential Responsibilities:Support data warehouse data loadsMaintain and support extract solutions for data warehousesMaintain, execute and document data warehouse tests and support UATExecute monitoring and measurement of data quality as defined by business rulesParticipates in analysis of data quality root cause issues and data investigationsContributes to ETL maintenance efforts for team utilizing ETL toolsOff hour and weekend support required to meet project milestonesRequired Technical and Professional ExpertiseREQUIRED Skills and Experience:• Up to 3 years of experience performing data analysis and profiling, and maintaining ETL systems/programs• Understanding of data warehouse best practices• Familiarity with Microsoft SQL and ETL tools• Experience reading/evaluating/interpreting code• Strong PC skills with experience using Microsoft Office applications• Strong problem-solving ability• High attention to detail• Strong communication skill• Self-starter with good ability to work in a team environment• Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and complete work within allocated time framesPreferred Tech and Prof ExperiencePREFERRED Skills and Experience:• Familiarity with Federal reporting requirements for Medicaid programs (e.g., MSIS, PERM, TMSIS) • 1-2 Years of State Medicaid experience • Applies extensive expertise and knowledge of specific area of healthcare practice or expertise• Demonstrates effective supervisory skillsEducation / Certifications:• Bachelors' degree OR up to 3 years of experience in a data processing, data warehouse maintenance OR healthcare knowledge OR equivalent experience preferred.EO StatementIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: IT Security Analyst Senior
Description: IT Security Analyst Sr.Onsite – Phoenix, AZ FIS connects consumers to their money through leading-edge payments solutions. We’re the largest, Fortune 500, Fintech company in the world. Our solution is branded by our customers — banks and retailers — so you might not have heard of us. But, if you’ve used a mobile banking app, interacted with an ATM, or used a debit card to complete a financial transaction, you’re most likely using FIS software. Our product is one that touches the average consumer on a regular basis, and makes the financial world go ‘round.  Headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida, FIS serves more than 20,000 clients in over 130 countries, and our technology powers billions of transactions annually that move over $9 trillion around the globe. FIS is a Fortune 500 company, ranked 392 on the Fortune 500 list and is a member of Standard & Poor’s 500® Index. Named a 2016 “World’s Most Admired Company” by Fortune Magazine.  Responsible for lifecycle of cybersecurity solutions used to deliver Managed Security Services such as email security, web security, intrusion detection, intrusion prevention, security event and information management, proxy, reverse proxy, malware prevent, etc. Involved in security strategy, design, and review for the Managed Security Service platform as well as customer technology platforms. Performs all procedures necessary to ensure the Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) solution is performing efficiently and effectively. Serve as escalation point for critical incident response in support of the Managed Security Operation Center. Responds to information security-related questions and inquiries using established information security tools and procedures. Resolves and/or performs follow through to resolve all information security issues and questions. ResponsibilitiesExecutes security controls to prevent hackers from infiltrating company information or jeopardizing programs.Researches attempted efforts to compromise security protocol and recommends solutions.Maintains security systems and administers security policies to control access to systems.Maintains company firewall and utilizes applicable encryption methods.Creates information security documentation related to work area and completes requests in accordance with company requirements.Responds to information security-related questions and inquiries using established information security tools and procedures.Resolves and/or performs follow through to resolve all information security issues and questions.Implements and administers information security controls using software and vendor security systems.Identifies opportunities and executes plans to improve workflow and understands and quantifies business impacts of those improvements for communication to management.Interfaces with user community to understand security needs and implements procedures to accommodate them. Ensures that user community understands and adheres to necessary procedures to maintain security.Provides status reports on security matters to develop security risk analysis scenarios and response procedures.Other related duties assigned as needed.EducationBachelor’s degree in computer science or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.General Knowledge Skills & AbilitiesExperience working in and implementing cybersecurity solutionsExperience working in a Managed Security Services environment Experience administering SIEM solutionsExtensive knowledge of the Windows Security Log and Group Policy Audit PolicyExtensive knowledge of Email Security solutionsExtensive knowledge of Web Security solutionsExtensive knowledge of Endpoint Security solutions·Extensive knowledge of Firewall logging from various vendorsExtensive knowledge of logging various other security logs such as Intrusion Prevention Systems, Anti-Virus Software, IIS logs, etc.SIEM Production Certification preferred (LogRhythm, Security Analytics, QRadar, etc.)Knowledge of networks technologies (protocols, design concepts, access control)Knowledge of security technologies (encryption, data protection, design, privilege access, etc.)Knowledge of network design and engineeringProficiency in time management, communications, decision making, presentation and organizational skillsProficiency in planning, reporting, establishing goals and objectives, standards, priorities and schedulesBasic to intermediate decision-making and problem solving skillsBasic to intermediate verbal and written communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organizationExperience establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with employees and/or clients WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM US? At FIS we value new ideas and we pride ourselves on providing a wide-range of opportunities for professional growth in a face-paced environment. FIS offers an open minded collaborative culture with enthusiastic technologists. A true partner. We are dedicated to our team members and our customers equally. We strive to create an environment to help you succeed. FIS Benefits and Perks:A generous paid time off program in which the benefits increase along with your tenure with the companyHealth coverage offered for you and your family through Health/Vision/Dental/Insurance plansTax advantage flexible spending accounts and health savings accounts that allow you to pay for specific health-care and dependent care expenses with pre-tax dollarsTo help you manage your work and life needs we offer a health advocate program, tuition reimbursement and a group legal service plan401K match and Employee Stock Purchase ProgramCompany Paid Volunteer DayFIS Gives Back Program – supporting our local community
