Name: 360 Summer Intern - Business Optimization Analyst
Description: Requisition Number: 71114  What are you doing this summer? If you are an undergraduate entering either your Junior or Senior in College studying Finance, Accounting, Supply Chain Logistics/Operations or Business and are looking for a cool way to spend your summer in Arizona and get paid for it, check out this summer internship!  Our Operations team is looking for a summer intern. What you’ll experience at Insight:A fun, learning culture where hard work and dedication pay offTeammates and leaders who demonstrate and foster our Values: Hunger, Heart and HarmonyA unique opportunity to meet other students and participate in a cohort-style internship   What you’ll gain:Life Learning Seminars (e.g. wealth management, professional workshops, public speaking skills and more)Invaluable knowledge with a Fortune 500 company in the ever-changing technology industry   What you’ll do:Review and analyze different pricing strategies to identify the best possible outcomeBe part of the RFP process to understand the sales opportunity and review commercial termsAnalyze executed contracts to determine appropriate pricing actionsCreate and maintain a contract repository to allow for timely and actionable managementDiscuss and participate is cost saving initiatives and go-to-market strategiesWhat you’ll need to have:Strong analytical skills and critical thinkingMedium to Advanced MS Excel skillsBusiness Acumen related to profitable sales growth and operational efficienciesStrong written and verbal communication skillsWhat our internship offers:  Insight’s 360 Summer Internship Experience is just that. An experience. You will have the opportunity to work along-side an Insight teammate who lives our core values of Hunger, Heart and Harmony. They will help guide you through the tasks and projects set for you during your 10-week journey with us. You will also have weekly trainings that include learnings like 7 Habits of Highly Effective People, Speaking with Confidence, Dress for Success, DiSC, Wealth Management and many other fun topics like best ways to find a job, basics of behavioral interviewing and resume writing. If you ever wondered what Recruiters look for and what the best way is to find a job, you don’t want to miss this opportunity to join our program! Apply today. Interviews will start in late January/early February and offers will be made in March. Internships start May 28th and run through August 2nd. You must be able to work entire 10-week program and live in Arizona during the full duration of the internship.   The position described above provides a summary of some the job duties required and what it would be like to work at Insight. For a comprehensive list of physical demands and work environment for this position, click here.  Today, every business is a technology business. Insight Enterprises, Inc. empowers organizations of all sizes with Insight Intelligent Technology Solutions™ and services to maximize the business value of IT. As a Fortune 500-ranked global provider of digital innovation, cloud/data center transformation, connected workforce, and supply chain optimization solutions and services, we help clients successfully manage their IT today while transforming for tomorrow. From IT strategy and design to implementation and management, our 6,800 employees help clients innovate and optimize their operations to run smarter. Discover more at insight.com.    Global provider of Intelligent Technology Solutions™ for organizations of all sizesRanked #417 on the 2018 Fortune 500, #12 on the CRN Solution Provider 500Founded in 1988 in Tempe, Arizona; now celebrating our 30th anniversary and operating in 20 countries$6.7 billion in revenue for 20178,000+ teammates worldwide working with 5,300+ partners2017 Arizona’s Most Admired Companies (AZ Business Magazine), #7 2017 Best Places to Work (Phoenix Business Journal)2018 Dell EMC Server Partner of the Year, 2018 Intel Retail Solution Partner of the Year, 2018 IBM Geography Excellence Award as the Top National Strategic Business Partner in North America, Microsoft’s largest global partner       Today's talent leads tomorrow's success. Name: Sr Financial Analyst
Description: Company Overview Headquartered in Concord, CA (across the street from the Concord BART Station), ASRC Industrial Services ("AIS") provides industrial construction, environmental engineering, and remediation services to customers throughout the United States through its subsidiary businesses. AIS is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Arctic Slope Regional Corporation (ASRC), a Native Alaskan corporation with annual revenue of about $2.6 billion. Our association with ASRC permits us to perform large, highly complex projects, as well as to invest in systems and processes that improve cost effectiveness and enhance safety an  AIS offers a full range of benefits including: generous vacation plan, paid holidays, medical, dental, vision, FSA and HSA, 401K (w/4% match), life insurance, short & long term disability, health advocacy, EAP(employee assistance program), tutition reimbursement and commuter benefits.  This postion is for our new Phoenix, AZ location. Position Overview AIS Finance & Accounting (F&A) department is seeking an experienced Senior Financial Analyst who is interested in joining the AIS team and helping us reinvent our company and position it for substantial growth.  Under the direction of the Controller, the Accounting Manager will become a key member the fast-paced F&A team, responsible for forecasting, budgeting, and monthly reporting. The successful candidate will love work in a dynamic environment and partnering with a variety of functions. This rock star will understand financial decisions and be a 'trusted' business advisor.  The successful candidate will be a professional, high-performing individual who takes pride in performing top-quality work with a team-oriented, service mindset. Core Responsibilities for all F&A Department Team Members All Finance & Accounting department team members must demonstrate the following characteristics: Commitment to the long-term success of AIS as an organizationUnblemished commitment to the principles of ethical business practices and compliance with all applicable laws and Generally Accepted Accounting Practices (GAAP)Superior oral and written communication skillsAbility to work both independently and collaborativelyAbility to smoothly adapt to changing circumstances and short deadlinesJob DutiesDevelop, improve, and create monthly reporting and forecastingEnhance and lead budgeting processProvide decision support to the business by digging deep into transactions and identifying KPIs and savings initiativesKey Requirements - What You Will Bring to the Team:3+ years of experience in similar finance or accounting role3+ years in positions that require analysis, financial reporting, forecasting, and budgeting3+ years' experience in performing financial ad hoc analysis using data reporting toolsStrong analytical and organizational skills. Exceptional attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAdvanced problem solving and root cause analysis combined with proven ability to communicate those analysisEducation/ExperienceBachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance required (CPA or MBA preferred)Proficient in Microsoft OfficeExperience working with large-scale data mining and reporting tools (i.e. SQL, MS Access, Essbase and/or Cognos) and other financial systems such (i.e. Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)Vista ERP experience and construction finance background preferredTravel:Periodic travel may be required

Name: Fusion Engineer - Technical Analyst
Description: As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as, technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.  As a Sr. Support Engineer, you will be the technical interface to customers, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and Value-Added Resellers (VARs) for resolution of problems related to the installation, recommended maintenance and use of Oracle products. Have an understanding of all Oracle products in their competencies and in-depth knowledge of several products and/or platforms. Also, you should be highly experienced in multiple platforms and be able to complete assigned duties with minimal direction from management. In this position, you will routinely act independently while researching and developing solutions to customer issues.  Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. 4 years experience with Core products or five years experience with Applications products and have a technical degree i.e., BS Computer Science/Management Information Systems/Science/ Engineering/Math/Physics/Chemistry with a 3.0 GPA OR (for Applications) proven professional/ technical experience, i.e., demonstrating an understanding of Applications at a functional and technical level (preferably Oracle) Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.* Are you interested in being part of a dynamic andfast paced team supporting Oracle s newest Supply Chain Management andManufacturing offering? Name: Sr. Business Analyst - IAM
Description: *Sr. Business Analyst - IAM***Description** What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members?they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values?straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity ? an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines ? Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management. *Job Description Summary** The Candidate  is responsible to work closely with Business and Development teams in Identity  & Access Management (OIM, OAM, SSO, MFA) domain, gathering requirements,  analysis and review with Development team. As a Product Owner, expertise in writing Stories (requirements) in JIRA Product Backlog follow rules, such as INVEST (Independent, Negotiable, Valuable,  Estimable, Small, Testable) Should be able to run Scrum Ceremonies and help remove impediments in Sprint cycles Responsible for functional validation as per Acceptance Criteria Reviews, drafts, and outlines business requirements that impact strategic initiatives and/or  business unit objectives. Should be familiar with both Agile and Waterfall methodology Assists in the development and documentation of business requirements and/or business  solutions to solve problems and issues related to business operations. Examines various data sources and applies consistent approaches to data interpretation  and performance measurement results. In coordination with business partners and users, assists to ensure that critical  strategic decisions are vetted and well thought out prior to implementation. Ensures project dependencies are clearly defined, documented and communicated  appropriately in terms of time required to complete. May liaise with the business, development team and technology on certain projects.  Assists in the planning and implementing of Projects and Strategic initiatives  of the Business Line Unit/Operations. *Qualifications***Required Experience** + Must have worked in Identity & Access Management Domain for atleast 3-5 Years or Role Based Access Control in Banking Industry.  + Verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail, customerservice and interpersonal skills.  + Strong ability to work independently and manage one's time.  + Strong knowledge of business and management principles involved instrategic planning, and production methods.  + Must have 3-5 years of experience with Jira Agile.  + Previous experience with computer applications, such as Microsoft Wordand Excel; Enterprise Application experience a plus.  + 5-7 Years of experience in Identity Access Management, platforms suchas OIM (Oracle) and IIQ (SailPoint) is huge plus. *Equal Employment Opportunity Policy** Bank of the West is an Equal Opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers without regard to any status protected by applicable law. Bank of the West is also an Affirmative Action employer - Minority / Female / Disabled / Veteran.  Bank of the West will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance subject to the requirements of all state and federal laws and regulations. *Job:** Accounting Finance*Location:** United States-Arizona-Tempe*Requisition ID:** 037784

Name: Senior Risk Analyst - Technology
Description: Purpose of JobWe are currently seeking a talented Senior Risk Analyst - Technology for our Phoenix AZ. or Addison TX. facility.  The Senior Risk Analyst - Technology position provides risk management support for a line of business or staff agency in key risk identification, measurement and aggregation, and the understanding and management of risk through appropriate practices and processes. Assesses and mitigates enterprise and business exposures through the identification of key and emerging risks and evaluates alignment with risk strategy and appetite. Monitors the risk and control environment to ensure that exposures are kept at acceptable levels and may consult on risk mitigation plans. Leads and executes complex initiatives and cross functional teams within the Chief Risk Office and across the Enterprise that drive problem resolution. Leverages broad enterprise knowledge and/or expert knowledge of core business discipline(s), products and processes.Job RequirementsPartners with key stakeholders in the business to identify, assess, aggregate and document risks and controls, including risks associated with new or modified products, services, distribution channels, regulations and third-party operations using advanced knowledge.Presents findings to various levels of leadership.Communicates results of risk assessments to governance committees, business process owners and various levels of leadership.Implements new risk policies, practices, appetites and solutions to ensure holistic understanding and management of risks according to industry best practice.Enhances and contributes to strategies, tools, and methodologies to measure, monitor, and report risks.Applies advanced knowledge to utilize or produce analytical material for discussions with cross functional teams to understand business objectives and influence solution strategies.Serves as a key contributor in cross-functional teams to identify, assess, aggregate and mitigate current and emerging risk events.Effectively contributes to projects that impact the organization.Serves as a key contributor on projects that may impact the enterprise or a core operating area.Formulates stress test plans for a line of business or the enterprise including the evaluation of results, and framing of contingency plans in partnership with key business stakeholders.Minimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in Risk Management, Business, Finance, or a related field required, 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree6 or more years risk management experience or 6 years operations experience in a relevant functional area to include banking, insurance, financial services, audit, project management, public accounting or other related operational area OR advanced degree or designation in a quantitative discipline relevant to risk management and up to 4 years relevant risk management work experience Or PhD in a quantitative discipline and 2 or more years relevant risk management work experience.Successful completion of a job-related assessment may be required *Qualifications may warrant placement in a different job level.*  When you apply for this position, you will be required to answer some initial questions. This will take approximately 5 minutes. Once you begin the questions you will not be able to finish them at a later time and you will not be able to change your responses. PreferredPossess related industry certifications such as CISA, CISSP, ITIL, CIA, CRISC, CGEIT or CRMAExperience working with Risk, Security or Audit frameworks (COBIT, COSO, ISO 27001/2, NIST 800-53, SSAE16), Conducting SOC1 Reviews and Cloud CUECs6+ years experience in IT Risk Management and/or Technology Audit, Compliance or Regulatory functions with assessing Information Systems/Technology risks and controls, performing risk & control evaluations in a variety of IT environments with demonstrated background in applying risk & control, security and technology principles3-5 years experience working in a large financial institution or hi-tech industry directly involved in establishing, implementing or supporting cloud services, virtualization and emerging technologies for financial servicesExperience in evaluating Cloud computing risks for Software As a Service, Infrastructure As a Service and Platform As a Service and Application Service Providers6+ years of experience in executing day to day technology operations in two or more areas server, storage, network, telecom, database or client computing (Eg: SQL, Oracle, Desktop and Server Application Configuration / Installation, Deploying and Integrating Client/Server, Cloud or Hosted Applications)Prior experience at a Senior or higher level, and experience with leading large/complex projects, programs or initiativesClear understanding of Agile execution utilizing scrum practices and experience assessing software development life cycle processes The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.  At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals.  USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers. Relocation assistance is available for this position.

Name: Business Systems Analyst X 2

XML experience. What skills/attributes are nice to have? - working with one or more aspects of the System Development Life Cycle, experience in an Agile environment, experience working on mixed methodology program (Scrum interfacing with Waterfall from a dependency perspective) REQUIREMENTS: 3+ years of working with one or more aspects of the System Development Life Cycle1+ years of experience in an Agile environment1+ years of experience working on mixed methodology program (Scrum interfacing with Waterfall from a dependency perspective)  • Provided guidelines for project stakeholders and resources on project priorities and task priorities within projects.Fully Proficient in interpret and eliciting business requirementsMentored resources in completing their tasksAnticipated business / product needs - capabilities and featuresDisplayed and execute logical and complex troubleshooting methods.Provided application support to ensure that issues are managed to resolutionAble to clarify a business/technology problem and determine feasibility of business requirements.Worked collaboratively with business partners, SMEs, Developers and Testers to ensure a shared understanding of business requirementsPerformed analysis of technology solutions options to meet the business requirementsDocumented solutions (e.g., functional, technical, reference, artifacts, data dictionary)Conducted mapping discussions, create technical mapping documents and/or user stories.Good understanding of applications and their upstream/downstream impactPartnered with Quality Engineers and identify test plans and metricsPerformed system walk-throughs and design reviews with developers, testers, customers, stakeholders Preferred:Healthcare experienceFamiliarity with common Agile practices, service-oriented environments, and modern development practicesFamiliarity with tools like SplunkParticipation in industry agile communities of practice  • Participation in industry agile communities of practice#Low #LI-JB1,#LI-RD1,#LI-SA1Horizontal Integration is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We seek to provide employment opportunities to talented, qualified candidates regardless of race, color, sex/gender including gender identity and/or expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under federal, state or local law. In addition, Horizontal Integration will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need to request a reasonable accommodation in order to complete the application or interview process, please contact hr@horizontalintegration.com. Name: Senior Financial Control Analyst
Description: Overview  The Senior Financial Control Analyst is responsible for Western Alliance Bancorporation's (the "Company") compliance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act ("SOX") by performing and/or leading planning, execution, and reporting of SOX results. This individual will assist with the annual SOX risk assessment, work with business owners to verify SOX documentation is compliant with COSO framework and mitigates related risks, oversees and/or performs walkthroughs and test of controls, tracks and assist with deficiency evaluation, and assist with related reporting to upper management. This position will also be responsible for creating and maintaining organized SOX documentation and overseeing internal and external audit requests. ResponsibilitiesPerform SOX planning, execution, evaluation, and reporting under the direction of the Financial Control ManagerParticipate with and/or supervise staff, which includes coaching, training, and developing staff.Assist with the annual SOX risk assessment, development of audit objectives, scope, and audit plans and procedures.Work with business owners to ensure comprehensive flowcharts and risk control matrices capture accurate and complete information that meet department and regulatory standards. Lead the quarterly SOX control self-assessment process.Execute and document walkthroughs and test of controls, including reviewing staff work.Identify and track control deficiencies and assist with evaluation procedures.Maintain organized SOX documentation within our SOX software (Workiva).Develop presentations and coordinate meetings to discuss on-going status updates and audit results.Oversee Internal Audit and External Audit requests.Perform ad hoc management and Department requests.Develop and maintain effective relationships within the team and throughout the organization.Stay abreast of audit "hot" topics and standards.QualificationsBachelor's degree from a four-year college or university in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or other relevant fields.Master's degree in Accounting preferred.Professional certification as a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Certified Internal Audit (CIA) required.3 years of public accounting experience with SOX expertise.Working knowledge of internal controls over financial reporting and risk assessment methodologies, COSO Framework, SOX Section 302/402 requirements, and GAAP standards.Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills are required to work with all levels of internal and external teams. Must be effective at communicating issues through written reports, verbal discussions, and presentations.Team oriented, organized, and have the ability to represent the Department in a professional manner. Client-oriented, exercises good judgment and tact in dealing with others, and have the aptitude to manage multiple properties simultaneously while meeting established deadlines.Well-developed analytical thinking skills are needed to identify problems, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and solve problems with minimal assistance.Ability to remain independent, unbiased, and neutral. Must be able to handle confidential information.SDL2017

Name: Sabre Support Analyst - Travel & Lifestyle Services
Description: Position SummaryThe Global Product Operations Team works with internal and external resources to continuously define and deliver exceptional support of our Travel Technology products and tools to the global TLS User population. This includes day-to-day maintenance, functional support, and business process protocols for the capabilities, tools and SaaS applications deployed throughout the network.Job ScopeThe Analyst is responsible for providing TLS Users with expert advice, solving complex problems, troubleshooting & documenting product issues & solutions, and escalating & managing open issues. This role is instrumental in representing the voice of the TLS User, and works closely with Product Management, Operations, 3rd Party Vendors, and AX Technology Teams to ensure that products are installed & working properly and to notify stakeholders when they are not. The Analyst serves as a technical/functional specialist and works independently with guidance only in the most complex situations.LocationTLS campus in Phoenix or Sunrise. Some exceptions to WAH on a full or part-time basis may be considered.ResponsibilitiesResearches and responds to incoming problem reports and requests for product information or advice.Maintains stated case handling protocols (troubleshooting techniques, escalation processes & ongoing follow-up procedures), volume, and SLAs.Analyzes case data to identify critical problem areas.Works with Operations, Support, and Development teams to manage issues to resolution and/or define permanent solutions.Flags opportunities to increase service quality or efficiency and represent the voice of the TLS Frontline User to other internal teams.Helps establish team SOPs, creates and maintains runbooks and knowledge articles aligned with Blue Box ITSM protocols.Independently seeks additional product & industry knowledge.Additional duties as assigned. Qualifications5 plus years experience in a technical customer support role; travel or financial industry environment preferred.Travel agency experience (operations or accounting) with SABRE GDS expertise required.Proficiency with troubleshooting and resolving complex technical issues using case management software for follow-up and customer communications.Self-starter with proven abilities in organizational, conceptual, and logical problem solving.Ability to manage assignments that are of diverse scope and complexity and require significant initiative and judgment.Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal skills are required.Flexibility to work varied shifts to cover multiple time zones.Desired skills/certification: Familiarity with the principles of ITSM & Helpdesk automation tools (ServiceNow preferred). Proficient with MS Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience required.Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions. Name: Sr. Billing Analyst
Description: About Blackhawk NetworkBlackhawk Network Holdings, Inc. is a global financial technology company and a leader in connecting brands and people through branded value solutions. Blackhawk platforms and solutions enable the management of stored value products, promotions and rewards programs in retail, ecommerce, financial services and mobile wallets. Blackhawk’s Hawk Commerce division offers technology solutions to businesses and direct to consumers. The Hawk Incentives division offers enterprise, SMB and reseller partners an array of platforms and branded value products to incent and reward consumers, employees and sales channels. Headquartered in Pleasanton, Calif., Blackhawk operates in 26 countries. For more information, please visit blackhawknetwork.com, cashstar.com, hawkcommerce.com, hawkincentives.com or our product websites GiftCards.com, giftcardmall.com, GiftCardLab.com and OmniCard.com.OverviewThe Billing Analyst will be responsible for invoicing of customer transactions within the financial accounting system. The Billing Analyst will support the growing incentives business, our rewards and recognition products, in our rapidly expanding world class Finance department. This role requires a detailed review of contracts to ensure that billing is accurate and complete. The candidate must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills and will be partnering with cross functional areas of the business to identify the root cause of billing issues and develop business solutions. The successful candidate will also have a demonstrated track record of developing and improving financial, accounting and/or transaction processes.ResponsibilitiesLead and supervise Billing staff for BHN Trade and BES to ensure all daily responsibilities are completed in a timely fashion with 100% accuracy Review and approve free text and pro forma invoicing within established thresholdsResponsible for capturing, reporting and monitoring billing metricsUnderstand the functional relationship between the ERP system and Billing processes; identify areas for improvement and implement / oversee solutions through analysis and user acceptance testing Oversee billing automation initiativesReview Billing processes and controls and incorporate efficiencies in collaboration with related operational departments Integral to customer onboarding / CRCL process for ensuring invoicing requirements and revenue opportunities are accurately and completely captured in our systems and processesCoordinate integration of billing from other locations as neededManage and lead Billing related projects to ensure all tasks, goals and deadlines are met in alignment with project objectivesOversee processes to audit billing completeness and accuracyOversee BHN Customer/DAX set-up/administration of customer billing portalsWork closely with business and operational teams to onboard new customers while ensuring team in creation and maintenance of policies and procedures for billing and returnsMaintain portfolio of mid to complex accounts for daily invoicing of non-settlement related partner transactions.Train Billing staff on new and existing procedures to guarantee consistency and standardization in daily processingCreate and manipulate SQL and reporting queries to assist in daily tasks and for management review and analysisOversee management of the Billing email inboxes to ensure team is responding to inquiries in a timely fashion to both internal and external customersAssist with Internal and External audits QualificationsEducation: Bachelor’s degree optimally with a focus in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or related field or experience commiserate Qualifications:6 + years previous accounting experience, particularly in areas of Billing, AR and GLExperience with Microsoft Dynamics or similar large, integrated, transactional/accounting systemExperience with project management and related planning, organization and process improvementAbility to work independently with minimal supervision under rigid time constraintsDetail oriented with the ability to analyze, manipulate, and quantify large sums of dataExperience with Visio, Access, BI360 and SQL query writing a plusIntermediate to advanced competency in Microsoft Windows, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and OutlookStrong analytical, problem solving, decision making and organizational skillsExcellent oral and written communication skillsProven leadership skills, minimum 2 years as a team lead or supervisorSuperior teamwork and strong customer service focus

Name: Shared Services Database Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we have one goal: to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them achieve their dreams. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Enterprise Finance & Information Technology offers technology and services that exceed Wells Fargo customers expectations and directly enable them to succeed financially. We interact with customers more than 12 billion times a year through in-store, online, ATM, and telephone transactions. We impact customers directly, through systems availability and security, as well as indirectly, through our business partners who offer and deliver a myriad of products and services that meet customers financial needs. We provide a competitive advantage for the company through excellence in fundamentals, integrated partnerships, and our talented and engaged team members.  We are looking for a highly competent and motivated individual to fill a Mid - Senior level DBA role in the Enterprise Data Technology Shared Services DBA organization to manage and support highly complex Teradata data warehouses. This is a database management and support role to service all of the Teradata databases within the data technology area. The role is involved in the planning, analysis, implementation, maintenance, and control of the organization's server-class databases. Consults with and make recommendations to management and multiple application DBA/support teams on high impact data, queries or database management issues. Handles and leads various large-scale or highly complex data/database management and deployment activities including one or more of the following: Monitor the shared services mailbox for any work requests, work orders and problem tickets and address them in a timely mannerReview code and deploy database code/objects for new projects and enhancementsCollaborate with production support and Application DBA teams to address any data backfill/load failures during production issuesShare on-call rotation duties and troubleshoot and resolve user and database issues to ensure the service level requirements.Collaborate with Infrastructure DBA & Application DBA teams and external vendors in support of database installations, patches, upgrades and migrationsProvide necessary support in space management, access management and other manual intervention tasks required in productionSupport data copy to lower environments and assist with backup and restore activities when requiredMonitor database performance and provide query recommendation to the usersProvide guidance to less experienced database analysts, managed resources and other team members where applicable, including guidance for troubleshooting escalated issues and support regular/emergency requests during production issues.Required Qualifications7+ years of database design and administration experience4+ years of Teradata experienceDesired QualificationsStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills2+ years of performance tuning experience4+ years of SQL experienceOther Desired QualificationsAbility to work and influence successfully within a matrix environment and build relationshipsAbility to execute in a fast paced, high demand, environment while balancing multiple prioritiesThe job involves on-call duties once in 4-6 weeks for implementation and support activities. Flexible schedules for the on-call week can be arranged.DisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Consultant/Business Analyst - Sage Enterprise Management (X3)
Description: Come work for Net@Work ranked #29 among the world’s 501 most strategic and innovative managed service providers (MSPs) and the top Sage partner in North America! Net@Work is a full service IT and business consultancy with unparalleled expertise in the development of business technology solutions. We deliver a range of unbiased, integrated solutions that brings our clients every competitive advantage possible. Consultant/Business Analyst - Sage Enterprise Management (X3) Mid-senior level  Located on the West Coast Job Description The Business Analyst’s role is to plan, design, develop, and launch efficient information systems and operations systems in support of core organizational functions. Using both business and technical skills, the business analyst works directly with customers to identify business requirements with sufficient detail and clarity to allow technical solution proposal development. The business Analyst will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate and resolve systems issues in order to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments. Additionally, the business analyst works with the sales team to develop and close services projects and maintains customer relationships to ensure customer satisfaction and ease of on-going support. Job Qualification:5+ years Sage EM ERP implementation or implementation of similar ERP solution (Epicor, Infor, Syspro, Chempax, Workday, ProcessPRO, MS Dynamics)Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, quality assurance, or equivalent, required. Advanced degree preferredA consulting background with a record of delivering complex technical solutions within defined timeframes and budgetsStrong business expertise, a keen understanding of business needs, and ability to ensure technical solutions, strategies, practices, and deliver business and customer value.Experience translating business requirements into solution specifications.Experience leading requirements definition and design sessions through use of interviews, surveys, user workshops, product/prototype demo's, etcSuccessful track record of delivering on agreed upon business objectives and performance on key metrics.Ability to effectively document business and technical designsAbility to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.Strong relationship and social skills with the ability to build and manage a strategic external industry networkKey Responsibilities:Conducts analysis of client business processes and functional requirements. Prepares appropriate documentation to communicate and validate the information.Analyzes the data, evaluates existing application products, and recommends efficient, cost effective solutions which support client business processes and functional requirements.Documents functional requirements, workflow, and system specifications. Applies technical and business knowledge to analyze client requirements and match them to system functionality.Performs gap analysis, identifies options and make recommendations on best methods to address gaps. This may include customizations, third party products, process changes or other industry best practices.Becomes familiar with key functions of client’s key systems in order to easily identify integration points and make recommendations.Works with clients throughout system testing and product acceptance phases to ensure quality and customer satisfaction.Develops technical and industry specific knowledge on an on-going basis and keeps up to date with industry trends and latest technology solutions.Ensures timely administration and entering time and expense reports in a timely manner.Interacts with peers and managers to share knowledge, raise critical issues and suggest process improvements.Supports sales team with business opportunities by assisting with estimate and proposal generation, performing demos, and responding to customer Pre-sales requests as neededManages and supports relationships and installed products at existing clients. Name: Project Financial Analyst
Description: Dignity Health, one of the nation's largest health care systems, is a 22-state network of more than 9,000 physicians, 63,000 employees, and 400 care centers, including hospitals, urgent and occupational care, imaging and surgery centers, home health, and primary care clinics. Headquartered in San Francisco, Dignity Health is dedicated to providing compassionate, high-quality, and affordable patient-centered care with special attention to the poor and underserved. In FY17, Dignity Health provided $2.6 billion in charity care, community benefit, and unpaid cost of government programs. For more information, please visit our website at www.dignityhealth.org. You can also follow us on Twitter and Facebook. Position Summary: As a Project Financial Analyst you will support Dignity Health Planning Design and Construction (PDC) leaders to drive efficient, accurate analysis of data and reporting for major capital projects in support of PDC leadership to meet hospital operations, clinical needs and corporate initiatives across the Dignity Health system. Works independently to analyze performance data and metrics to identify trends related to project performance. Understands construction terminology and project management tools, and can communicate with team members to use for increased project performance. Creates and interprets project management system data and communicates data/information in an understandable and compelling manner to a variety of end users at many levels of the organization. Principal Duties and Accountabilities: Understands and combines data from a variety data sources, including Projecto, to create and support meaningful project budgets, schedules, forecasts, and cash flow analyses for departmental team.  Supports PDC team in purchasing and accounts payable projects issues. Works with internal Dignity Health departments to resolve ongoing data issues and monitors resolutions.  Communicates, educates, and facilitates training for project management software to users/customers in a clear and compelling manner, using written, verbal, and other mediums. Collaborates with other users and leadership team members to understand capital project processes and makes system performance improvement recommendations.  Participates weekly, monthly and quarterly project reporting, as well as annual 5-year capital planning initiative with department and system leaders.  Assists CRE Project Finance Manager in identification and implementation of key metrics utilizing project management system software, external benchmarks, and internal data, by identifying important trends and variances through the review of management reports and financial analysis Education & Experience: Requires a Bachelor degree in Construction Management, Business, Accounting/Finance, Computer Science, Business Administration, or other related field.  Minimum three (3+) years of experience with project management and/or reporting systems.  Experience in construction projects and with project management teams.  Experience and knowledge of accounting/finance terminology and reporting Preferred Qualifications: Experience with Projecto preferred, but not required.  Experience with Lawson is preferred, but not required. Special Skills: Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite.  Proficiency with Windows 10.  Demonstrates strong abilities in analysis, data interpretation, computer software applications, spreadsheet programs, plus a proficiency in financial modeling techniques to generate management reports, projections, allocations, and analyses.

Name: Commercial Banking - Business Operations Analyst - Wholesale Lending Services - Phoenix, AZ or India
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.6 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world?s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. JPMorgan Chase & Co.is committed to providing a comprehensive set of benefits choices to meet different employee needs and lifestyles, which include fully paid parental leave time, health care insurance and retirement benefits.  Commercial Banking serves more than 30,000 clients, including corporations, municipalities, financial institutions, and not-for-profit entities with annual revenues generally ranging from $20 million to $2 billion. The Firm's broad platform positions the Commercial Bank to deliver extensive product capabilities - lending, treasury services, investment banking, and asset management - to meet our clients' domestic and international financial needs.  Wholesale Lending Services (WLS) exists within Commercial Banking and provides lending operations and servicing functions to all four JPMorgan lines of business. These functions include loan documentation, closing and funding, payment and fee processing, syndication loan and trade processing, credit administration and collateral perfection and management.  The Business Analyst will provide day-to-day management for various existing regulatory and control related initiatives within WLS supporting Dealer Services and program and project level support for the development and execution of new initiatives to streamline, simplify and improve controls, efficiencies and SLA's, including by not limited to:  + Flood Program Manager  + Insurance Program Manager  + FRBNY Program Manager  + Work Flow enhancement Project Manager  + The incumbent will also be responsible for ensuring that all policies and procedures related to the documentation of commercial loans to auto dealers are maintained in a way to safeguard the client and the bank  + Participate in the development of key performance metrics to which the team will be held accountable  + Assure compliance with all applicable Dealer Services, corporate audit and compliance policies & procedures  + Lead and participate in national project teams representing Dealer Services  + Direct root cause analysis and Action Plan resolution  + Demonstrate strong product and process knowledge  + Analyze monthly reporting  + Perform other special duties or assignments as requested or required *Qualifications:** + Bachelors Degree or equivalent required  + Requires a minimum of 7+ years of program or project experience in Financial Services operations, preferably in Auto Finance, Business Banking, Commercial Banking or Treasury Services  + Prefer extensive knowledge of credit products, payment services, regulations, controls and related procedures  + Requires keen understanding of the financial and banking industries, including working knowledge of the key areas of the bank (i.e. Retail Bank, Credit, TS, CB)  + Must have strong leadership and influencing skills  + Ability to adapt to rapidly changing business and technology environments, must be a change leader  + Thorough knowledge of financial exposure and operational risk associated with bank products and services  + Strong interpersonal skills  + Effective problem solving, oral and written communication skills  + Ability to exercise sound judgement and make effective decisions  + Ability to prioritize, handle multiple tasks and work under pressure in a team environment  + Disciplined approach to managing and acting upon key reports and audits  + Superior project management skills; must be able to engage all participants and meet deadlines/deliverables  + Refined professional presentation skills  JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Keeps updated on changes to banking environment, bank competition and customer’s business environment applicable to area of responsibility.Conducts analysis on work procedures, business results, and recommends changes to improve the effectiveness.Strong Fluency in Windows applications and Microsoft Office programs such as MS Project, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.Expertise in Metavante Insight, FoxtrotStrong Database Management SkillsCapability to learn quickly and achieve proficiency in new software applications as needed.

Name: Privacy Analyst
Description: Hi, we're Oscar.  We are changing how health insurance works. Our goal is to make health insurance simple, transparent and human. We need your help to do so. We brought together leaders from top technology, service and healthcare companies to work side by side to disrupt health insurance. The result? Better people, better ideas, and better healthcare. Deliverables: What you have to achieve Oscar is currently operating in 6 states and will continue to grow. Everywhere we work, we must comply with state and federal requirements, including HIPAA (and its state-level equivalents), along with implementing regulations. The Privacy Analyst will work from our Tempe office (the Oscar Health Hub) but report to the Senior Manager of Corporate Compliance in New York. They will support the activities of Oscar's Compliance Program by ensuring through auditing, monitoring, and education efforts that our operations continue to meet applicable privacy standards across all markets. The Privacy Analyst will also be responsible for the day-to-day operationalization of our privacy policies, by working with all departments and analyzing business processes to mitigate the risk of unintentional or unauthorized data disclosures, and by analyzing and responding to such disclosures that do occur. The goal is to maintain an effective Compliance Program.  In your first six weeks, you will: Familiarize yourself with Oscar's methods for identifying, logging, analyzing, and (where necessary) reporting data disclosuresLearn to support the Senior Manager of Corporate Compliance in guiding Oscar through federal and state audits, in monitoring business processes for privacy compliance, and in developing corrective actions and mitigation steps as appropriate By the end of month 3, you will: Independently manage Oscar's day-to-day processes for addressing privacy concerns across the organizationBegin work with staff responsible for IT and physical security in all Oscar locations to mitigate data disclosure risksBegin making formal presentations on various aspects of HIPAA and privacy to both internal and external stakeholders Afterwards and on an ongoing basis, you will: Suggest and implement process changes to minimize data disclosure risksDevelop and deliver training programs on HIPAA and privacy-related complianceChart a path forward to personal growth as a Compliance professional in a dynamic, fast-paced organizationReview vendor privacy programs, where appropriate prescribing and monitoring corrective actionAssess and ultimately strengthen Oscar's internal policies and procedures for mitigating the risk posed by potential and known data disclosuresAssume general responsibility for implementing (and, through critical reflection, improving) the privacy aspects of Oscar's Compliance ProgramWinning factors: What leads to success We are looking for someone with a passion for compliance who will promote a culture of compliance and ethics in Tempe and across Oscar's operations.  Must-have qualifications and expertise include: 1-2 years' work experience, ideally in a healthcare setting Preferred qualifications include: Bachelor's degree preferredCEHP, CHPS, or other privacy/HIPAA certificationKnowledge of federal and state security and privacy-related regulatory requirements We think you will be successful if... You have experience with HIPAA, HITECH, data privacy, or data security processesYou are willing to read, understand, and ultimately analyze complex laws and regulationsYou enjoy writing, teaching, and generally communicating with others to solve problemsYou are comfortable speaking in front of groupsYou enjoy working in a collaborative environment and working cross-functionally with all business areas within the organizationYou are personable, self-starting and organizedAt Oscar, being an Equal Opportunity Employer means more than upholding discrimination-free hiring practices. It means that we work to cultivate an environment where exceptional people can be their most authentic selves and find both belonging and support. We're on a mission to change healthcare -- an experience made whole by your unique background and perspectives.Oscar applicants are considered solely based on their qualifications, without regard to applicant's disability or need for accommodation. Any Oscar applicant who requires reasonable accommodations during the application process should contact the Oscar Benefits Team (accommodations@hioscar.com) to make the need for an accommodation known.Pay Transparency Policy:Oscar's Pay Transparency Policy ensures that you won't be discharged or discriminated against based on whether you've inquired about, discussed, or disclosed your pay. Read the full policyhere.

Able to analyze and troubleshoot complex issues spanning multiple technology platforms.Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal. Able to articulate information to internal customers and IS leaders and lead complex and nunanced discussions. If you are not and know of someone that qualifies or is looking for opportunities, please forward their contact information. We compensate for referrals that are successfully placed.

Name: Analytic Consultant 4 / Senior Data Analyst Wholesale Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Data Management and Insights (DMI) is transforming the way that Wells Fargo uses and manages data. Our work enables Wells Fargo to empower and inform our team members, deliver exceptional experiences for our customers, and meet the elevated expectations of our regulators. The team is responsible for designing the future data environment, defining data governance and oversight, and partnering with technology to operate the data infrastructure for the company. This team also provides next generation analytic insights to drive business strategies and help meet our commitment to satisfy our customers financial needs.  This Analytic Consultantfor Wholesale Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Data is being created as part of the strengthening of the Wholesale Data Office and its ability to strategically support the business objectives and initiative based investments for the continuous improvement and enhancement of the Customer Data Domain (CRM) for Wholesale Banking and in particular the common Wholesale CRM strategy and objective as part of Whole Relationship Management Foundations (WRMF) initiative.  The Analytic Consultant will be working under the direction and guidance of the WRMF/Wholesale CRM Data Leader and will perform the detailed capture, analysis and documentation of business data elements & taxonomy, business rules and other supporting data for the CRM data management. With input from Wholesale LOB representatives and WRMF process team, perform the necessary alignment and standardization of definitions for key terms and align with WRMF target state system definitions.  Support the data governance and data profiling work in concert with EIT and other resources. Perform data quality gaps analysis and capture data quality rules in support of target state.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Work closely with cross functional teams inclusive of WRMF Process & Tools teams, Wholesale LOB representatives, PPMG, EIT and other disciplines to align business and data strategies for CRM data.Establish and document data taxonomies and other data management artifacts like business glossary, lineage, data quality metrics for effectiveness of data related activities.Work with business to establish data standards in customer data / CRM domain and instrument the ecosystem with data quality measurements and drive continual improvement in data quality.Analyze CRM, Non-CRM and External vendor data.Identify and bring visibility to cross-LOB opportunities regarding CRM data. Enable common definitions and standardization.Data Profiling and Data Analysis.Perform Data quality analysis and profiling and enable the capture of data quality rules.Support the documentation of required data governance artifacts.  LOCATION(S): The preferred location(s) for this job opening is Summit, NJ; Charlotte, NC; San Francisco, CA; Minneapolis, MN; Phoenix, AZRequired Qualifications6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling; Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Are you a Financial Analyst looking for a new career opportunity? Well, this may be your next move. Cable ONE is looking for a Capital Project Analyst in the Phoenix area. This position is responsible for the support and administration of Capital Expenditure process for Business Sales. This position coordinates business processes related to financial management, purchase order creation, and project close-out, and assists in developing and monitoring key metrics. The Capital Project Analyst performs quality control reviews to help ensure projects are completed on time and within budget.  Before you learn more about this opportunity, learn more about the excellent benefits offered. Benefits: Cable ONE appreciates the role our associates play to help the company grow, and in return Medical and Dental Plan benefits, retirement savings, and other work/life programs are offered to recognize the importance of our associates contributions, such as: Medical and Dental Plans Starts on 1st Day of HIRETuition ReimbursementUp to $75 a month towards cable and internet servicesPaid Time Off (Vacation, Holiday, and Personal/Sick Days)401k - 100% Company Match (match program starts after 1 year of service, up to 5% of pay)Plus Other Perks: **Annual community support to various organizations across the U.S.Cable ONE Associate Recognition & Award ProgramAdvancement opportunitiesCollaborative work environmentOnsite gym and game roomFood truck Tuesdays!RESPONSIBILITIESObtains Fiber and company-wide project costs to ensure that expected revenue is received in accordance with Return on Investment (ROI) and Internal Rate of Return (IRR) guidelines.Facilitates the Capital Investment Request process for business-related projects by inputting approved requests into the Accounting Cap Track system, and monitoring expenditures over time.Authorizes all company-wide Capital invoices ensuring compliance and proper General Ledger (GL) coding.Performs analysis of capital expenditures and metrics related to business sales to provide reporting to leadership.Forecasts capital spending by obtaining information from Deployment Coordinators and reviews these forecasts with finance.Performs quality assurance and quality control on capital-spend process to ensure efficiency of capital deployment.Performs quality control reviews to help ensure projects are completed on time and within budget.Other duties and/or responsibilities not specifically set forth above may, however, be assigned as needed.QUALIFICATIONSBachelors degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university; or a minimum of three years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs with intermediate to advanced skills in Excel.Working knowledge of accounting concepts.Understanding of complex financial concepts.Working knowledge of capital expenditure process preferred.Ability to multi-task and organize complex, multi-faceted workloads with attention to detail and timelines.Skills in planning, organizing, coordinating, and implementing complex capital programs with multiple components preferred.This position requires up to 5% business travel.About Us: Honored as the 2018 MSO (Multiple System Operator) of the year by Cable Fax, Cable ONE is the 7th largest cable company in the United States. Headquartered in Phoenix, AZ, Cable ONE serves more than 800,000 customers in 21 states with cable television, high-speed Internet, and telephone services.  Cable ONE operates with the philosophy that happy associates make satisfied customers. Therefore, associates enjoy good benefits and an open culture where their ideas are not only asked for but crucial to the success of our business. Cable ONE provides a great place to work for talented and passionate associates who are committed to the Companys goals. Equal Employment Opportunity EmployerTo be considered, applicants must apply via our Company Website at: https://recruiting2.ultipro.com/CAB1003/JobBoard/d87d7da8-1e7f-3d96-c01e-b457c3a2faac/OpportunityDetail?opportunityId=41bb5cb4-e181-472f-a2cd-ebfe4bbcf76f Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Financial Analysis: 2 years (Required) Location: Phoenix, AZ (Required)

Name: Senior Technical Data Analyst (Digital)
Description: OverviewDignity Health is one of the nation's largest health care systems. As of June 30, 2017, Dignity Health operated more than 400 care centers, including hospitals, urgent and occupational care, imaging and surgery centers, home health, and primary care clinics in 22 states, through its network of more than 9,000 physicians and more than 60,000 employees. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dignity Health is dedicated to providing compassionate, high-quality, and affordable patient-centered care with special attention to those who are poor and underserved. In its fiscal year ended June 30, 2017, Dignity Health provided $2.6 billion in charitable care and services. More information on Dignity Health is available at www.dignityhealth.org.ResponsibilitiesPosition Summary The Dignity Health Office of Digital (OOD) team is on a mission to provide an intensely positive and personalized digital experience for our patients and consumers. We develop products that engage and empower patients as active participants in their health and healthcare and work closely with cross-functional stakeholders throughout the enterprise to make our products better. We are looking for someone with excellent technical, analytical and communication skills who is passionate about healthcare and helping patients get the most out of our digital products.  As a Technical Data Analyst, you’ll be working hands-on with Product and Operations data to ensure its timely and accurate availability for our digital offerings. You will need to exhibit a strong combination of analytical expertise, technical aptitude and business acumen. You will be expected to focus on results, be a self-starter and have a commitment to success in providing data that drives access, personalization and convenience to healthcare for our patients. ResponsibilitiesUntangle ambiguous data problems and help drive product excellenceIndependently compile, analyze, validate, map, and transform data using data validation and statistical methodsInterpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data setsIndependently review logical and physical data models and provide input to enhance data qualityCreate analytical reports, graphs, spreadsheets, comparative statistics, presentations, and conduct ad-hoc reporting and special projects as needed, with minimal supervision.Support databases and processes to update data as neededWork directly with Product Owners to understand requirements and needs; actively participate in the development and delivery of data solutions to support those requirementsAutomation of data uploads and downloads using standard ftp tools as well as custom ETL processing QualificationsMinimum Qualifications5+ years experience managing, mining and evaluating data from complex databases5+ years experience performing data queries and data profilingAdvanced SQL and ETL skillsAbility to understand technology projects and concepts as they relate to high-level business objectives, and ability to communicate data recommendations and solutions effectivelyHands-on support and maintenance experience with a variety of database solutionsDemonstrated experience implementing and supporting data solutions for mobile and web based applicationsExperience with data formats and transmission methods, specifically JSON, Excel, CSV, large .txt, XML, API, SFTP, FTPPreferred Qualifications3+ years working with healthcare-related data3+ years Agile methodology experienceExperience working with Microsoft Azure3+ years experience in .NET development

Name: Application Analyst
Description: CBI is looking for an Application Analyst to join the team. Candidate will be responsible for providing continuing deployment and development of application software for clinical and laboratory systems.  The ideal candidate will have at least 4 years of experience in software design, testing and implementation. Successful candidates will have direct experience with clinical and laboratory workflows across the continuum of patient care; can be flexible with change client management; have excellent organizational skills to manage multiple priorities; and have the ability foster an environment of team building and coordination. In addition, a strong candidate would be able to effectively communicate with stakeholders as well as clinical and IT support staff. The ability to collaborate with clinical, laboratory and technical resources is key.  *Job Description  *CBI has an immediate opening for an application analyst opportunity. The Application Analyst will be responsible for leading the vision, process design, system architecture, development, testing, implementation and support of the clients applications environment. They will lead a combination of internal staff and outsourced partners to deliver reliable technology systems for health services in a HIPAA compliant environment. The application analyst will also ensure that appropriate standards are achieved for system up-time, respond to end-user support requests, and maintain standards for backups and disaster recovery. They will also oversee the implementation of systems transitions and knowledge transfer to the clients staff.  *Responsibilities  *Collaborate and assist with leading current IT and operational staff in efforts to: Conduct assessment of current state workflowsPerform gap analysis between current state workflows and application functionalityPerform hardware audit to ensure clients hardware meets technical specifications of vendor applicationDesign and build applications with future growth and expansion in mindTest application (functional testing, end-to-end workflow testing)Remediate issues found in testingCreate training documentationTrain end users and implement functionalityProvide go-live supportProvide post-go-live optimization recommendationsAdhere to HIPAA rules and regulations, maintaining clients culture of confidentialityRequirementsBachelors degree in MIS, Business Administration, or equivalent within applied sciencesMinimum 4 years in a healthcare IT environmentDemonstrated understanding of HIPAA for delivering secure services in healthcareExperience with the electronic health records and scheduling systemsTakes initiative to address issues as they arise and develop long-term solutionsStrong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to adjust to fluctuating workflows and work in an environment of changeAbility to establish and maintain positive working relations with people in various situations Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Healthcare IT: 4 years (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required)

Name: Associate Client Strategy Consultant Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY The purpose of this position is to support an advisory services team through research, data collection and data management for the development of deliverables focused on real estate strategies in support of CBRE's clients.  CBRE Labor Analytics provides specialized consultancy services to corporate tenants, combining human capital and brick-and-mortar solutions to maximize cost savings, financial success and desired change for their clients. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Research, collect and compile information. Makes detailed observations, analyzes data, and interprets results. Process, consolidate, and transform data sets within and between databases using statistical and/or analytical techniques.  Conducts market interviews; synthesizes and presents relevant data and other issues of concern to the client / consultant. Prepares preliminary recommendations.  Prepares professional supporting documentation in a variety of formats. Assists and supports development of research and analysis (e.g. market views, market dynamics, benchmarking, etc.) related to specific initiatives.  Analyst works with large economic and market data sets from various sources and conducts analysis using various methods and systems.  Maintain and update quantitative and qualitative economic, financial, or statistical databases  Acts as liaison between corporate site selection consultants and economic development / public private partnerships / local municipalities.  Other duties may be assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.  \n\n QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE  Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from four-year college or university required. Minimum 0-2 years of related experience.  CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES  None COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills, ability to communicate effectively with colleagues, clients, external sources. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. High comfort level speaking with industry experts over the phone. Comfort with or experience interacting professionally over the phone. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. REASONING ABILITY Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills. Express innovative logic, business goals awareness and adaptability in a dynamic work environment.  OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES  Strong understanding of principles of information design and display and ability to create compelling documentation and deliverable. Ability to work quickly and independently with minimal guidance or oversight. Ability to work under pressure and multitask in a fast-paced environment.  Skilled at applying economic theory and knowledge. Demonstrated ability to study data and statistics and use understanding of economic relationships to uncover trends and forecast data.  Proficient use of Microsoft Office Suite Products.  Working knowledge of graphic/information design programs (e.g., InDesign, ArcGIS, Tableau). SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Name: Sr. Reporting Analyst
Description: We are searching for an innovative Senior Reporting/Solution Expert to join our experienced team in Phoenix, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh or New Mexico. This creative role offers an excellent opportunity to directly impact an innovative function and secure your future with an industry leader. This position is predominantly responsible for creating new, modifying existing, and analyzing the data within regulatory reports and interacting directly with state health plans. This position is a primary contributor in designing, coding, testing, debugging, documenting and analyzing all types of reports consistent with established specifications and business requirements to deliver business value. Generally work is self-directed and not prescribed. Primary Responsibilities  Assesses, interprets, and analyzes customer needs and requirements  Provides analytical support and expertise when compiling and reporting information  Evaluates and presents information in a manner that will facilitate management's understanding of the results and impact  Identifies solutions to non-standard requests and problems  Solves moderately complex problems and/or conducts moderately complex analyses  Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex tasks  Translates concepts into practice  Provides explanations and information to others on difficult issues  Provides management with statistical findings and conclusions in analyzing interpreting trends and root cause analysis

Name: Sr Business Analyst - IAM
Description: The Candidate is responsible to work closely with Business and Development teams in Identity & Access Management (OIM, OAM, SSO, MFA) domain, gathering requirements, analysis and review with Development team.  · As a Product Owner, expertise in writing Stories (requirements) in JIRA Product Backlog follow rules, such as INVEST (Independent, Negotiable, Valuable, Estimable, Small, Testable)  · Should be able to run Scrum Ceremonies and help remove impediments in Sprint cycles  · Responsible for functional validation as per Acceptance Criteria  · Reviews, drafts, and outlines business requirements that impact strategic initiatives and/or business unit objectives.  · Should be familiar with both Agile and Waterfall methodology  · Assists in the development and documentation of business requirements and/or business solutions to solve problems and issues related to business operations.  · Examines various data sources and applies consistent approaches to data interpretation and performance measurement results.  · In coordination with business partners and users, assists to ensure that critical strategic decisions are vetted and well thought out prior to implementation.  · Ensures project dependencies are clearly defined, documented and communicated appropriately in terms of time required to complete.  · May liaise with the business, development team and technology on certain projects. Verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail, customer service and interpersonal skills.  Strong ability to work independently and manage ones time.  Strong knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, and production methods.  Must have 3-5 years of experience with Jira Agile.  Previous experience with computer applications, such as Microsoft Word and Excel; Enterprise Application experience a plus.  5-7 Years of experience in Identity Access Management, platforms such as OIM (Oracle) and IIQ (SailPoint) is huge plus.

Name: Senior Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) Analyst
Description: Freeport-McMoRan is a premier U.S.-based natural resources company with headquarters in Phoenix, Arizona. We operate large, long-lived, geographically diverse assets with significant proven and probable reserves of copper, gold and molybdenum. The company has a dynamic portfolio of operating, expansion and growth projects in the copper industry. Freeport-McMoRan is the world?s largest publicly traded copper producer, the world?s largest producer of molybdenum and a significant gold producer. We have a long and successful history of conducting our business in a safe, highly efficient and socially-responsible manner.  We have the assets, the talent, the drive and the financial strength to provide attractive and rewarding careers for our employees. in any combination of Finance, Global Supply, Information Services, Production Planning, or Commodity SalesSkill in effective communication, both written and verbalSkill in presenting complex, technical ideas to technical and non-technical stakeholdersPresent a positive and professional imageMust be self-motivated and client service orientedAbility and willingness to travel domestically and internationallyAbility to make good decisions and enforce company policies in accordance with applicable regulations and proceduresAbility to prioritize tasks, meet aggressive deadlines and work well under pressureAbility to develop and maintain business relationships within a diverse populationProficiency in using SAP, Microsoft Office Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OutlookPreferred*Bi-lingual (Spanish)Proficient in Business Objects and data visualization tools such as Power BI or TableauCriteria/Conditions*Ability to understand and apply verbal and written work and safety-related instructions and procedures given in EnglishAbility to communicate in English with respect to job assignments, job procedures, and applicable safety standardsMust be able to work in a potentially stressful environmentPosition is located in a busy, non-smoking office located in downtown Phoenix, AZLocation requires mobility in an office environment;
