Name: Analyst Relations AI and Data Governance
Description: Job Description IBM is looking for an Analyst Relations Specialist for Analytics, AI and Data Business Unit to raise the visibility of the IBM Analytics and AI to drive revenue via leveraging key global analysts and influencers. The candidate should possess: + Strong analytical skills, and experience evaluating qualitative and quantitative research in the areas of data integration, data quality, metadata management, master data management and data governance.  + Work closely with IBM Product Management, Engineering, Sales, Marketing and Communications teams to strategically position IBM Analytics and AI offerings.  + Understand the offerings and clearly communicate IBM Analytics and AI vision and capabilities to the influencer market place and analyst community.  + Be proficient in articulating key IBM differentiators in an engaging manner.  + Be persuasive at technical writing to support key RFIs  + Possess a hospitable, polished demeanor to develop or strengthen relationships with key analysts, influencers and thought leaders.  + Significant experience presenting material in large and small venues is required.  + Possess a background in market research, communications, data analysis and competitive positioning.  + Understand this role is one where you will have a seat at the table to build a market and a business  + Experience in driving revenue is important  This role requires the ability to work in parallel on multiple fast paced projects. Candidate must also enjoy building relationships with industry influencers, technical global and internal stakeholders. Candidate will be a blend of technical and business expertise with strong experience in data governance, analytics and AI.  This position is part of the Analyst Relations (AR) department. Candidate will report to the leader of the Analytics and AI group inside of AR with dotted line into Analytics and AI business unit.  IBM Analyst Relations is considered a strategic function at IBM which drives revenue and influences strategy  The candidate will interact with colleagues across IBMs global offices to build and nurture strong internal relationships that will be leveraged to engage with leading influencers to help elevate IBMs story and customer successes. RESPONSIBILITIES Develop, manage and execute a targeted Analytics and AI plan for the influencer community; educate the most influential industry/technical analysts, hybrid analysts, bloggers, marketers, etc., who work with existing or prospective IBM customers, key global media and financial markets.  Embed with the business unit to influence strategy while improving analyst/influencer perceptions and relationships year-over-year.  Interview and question influencers; digging for answers and passing compelling details along to engineering, product management and sales whereby changing the trajectory of a product or platform offering.  Drive face to face and phone interactions with influencers on a weekly basis.  Ensure IBM Analytics and AI business unit is highlighted against its competitors and the markets that IBM competes in; shape the perception of IBM and the value it brings to its customers.  Monitor the competitive landscape and strategic developments for Analytics and AI ; share relevant analyst and influencer research and implications with senior management to shape BU strategy and offerings.  Connect key IBM executives with expert analysts/influencers for advisory sessions to help define and influence offering strategy for Analytics and AI.  Collaborate and triangulate with colleagues to ensure that IBM is getting the best representation with the analyst/influencer community.  Manage and procure paid strategic research projects on behalf of IBM to ensure that key analyst firms are actively engaged with IBM offerings.  Develop a keen understanding of how to build credible and impactful relationships with key influencers and leading industry analysts. Honesty, tenacity and consistency are key.  Grow a deep technical interest in Analytics and AI in order to go toe to toe with analysts and influencers on the subject.  Embody the spirit of an individual who likes to create a business and a market.  Co-Create and Co-execute plans for Analytics and AI and third-party AR external events that complement and validate IBMs corporate messaging and strategy by incorporating actual customer use cases.  Skills include; analytical, technical in area of Analytics and AI  specifically in the area of data integration, data quality, metadata management, master data management, and data governance. Must be entrepreneurial, persistent, collaborative, open and curious.  Candidate must be willing to travel up to 50% to meet in person with business unit executives and key global analysts and influencers.  Applicants must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorship.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Experience working in or covering the tech industry specifically in Analytics and AI, in the areas of; data integration, data quality, metadata management, master data management, and data governance.10+ years of diverse work experience in more than one functional area such as: engineering, product management, product marketing, M&A, market research, product launch, technology consulting, communications or strategy..Engineering Degrees (Undergrad and Graduate in EE, ME, or Software Fields)Executive presence to counsel to senior management regarding the market, competitive landscape and analyst outlook. Candidates must have the tenacity, determination and patience to be able to challenge conventional thinking and processes.Entrepreneurial mindset and ability to operate in a highly visible and accountable role.Candidates must have the tenacity, determination and patience to be able to challenge conventional thinking and processes. Preferred Tech and Prof Experience MBA StrategyExperience building an AI or Analytics based product and taking it through full commercialization.Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Superior inclusive team-building skills.Existing relationships with leading industry analysts/influencers in the database management space EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Business Intelligence and Reporting Manager
Description: Job DescriptionManager, Business Intelligence and Reporting - CommunityRing.com - ArizonaWe are seeking a Manager of Global Business Intelligence and Reporting in support of our contact center. You will be accountable for establishing and maintaining contact center reporting infrastructure and dashboard reporting for multiple key performance indicators. They will facilitate organizational data strategies for governance, design, implementation, integration and usage. They also are responsible for leading the design and maintenance of business intelligence applications. They will be expected to collaborate on and develop strategies to improve contact center efficiencies. In addition, they will lead a team of analysts in support of these goals.Responsibilities• Establish and maintain user-friendly, self-service dashboards that report on key performance indicators that enable the user to drill down to multiple organization levels and locations.• Develop and maintain trending reports which show change in key performance indicators over time. Identify and evaluate business changes and their impact on trends.• Craft and maintain agent dashboards which enable real time reporting of agent performance across key measures of success.• Established and maintains structure for data governance.• Continually evaluates current reporting tools and functionality preparing business cases as appropriate for more robust tools.• Analyzes financial and operational data/performance metrics, communicates findings and risks, and makes suggestions to improve processes.• Leading the reporting and analytics platform(s) to ensure that scheduled jobs are successfully run and analytics data aligns to timeliness / completeness requirements.• Working with database administrators to ensure that databases feeding the reporting platforms are tuned for optimal performance.• Leading end-user access to reporting tools• Trains, supervises, and develops business intelligence and reporting staff. Runs the day-to-day performance of the BI/reporting team and develops skills of teamMinimum Requirements• 5+ years running a BI/reporting team in a multi-site contact center environment• 5+ years of direct experience building contact center dashboards• 5+ years of direct experience crafting agent and supervisor level scorecards• 3+ years experience in integrating CRM and WFM systems with BI tools• 3+ years experience communicating large amounts of complex data in a clear and concise format at an executive leadership level• Authority level understanding of databases such as MS SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL etc.• Authority level SQL skills• Bachelor’s degree in an analytical or technical fieldPreferred skills• 10+ years leading a BI/reporting team in a multi-site contact center environment• 10+ years of direct experience building contact center dashboards• 10+ years of direct experience crafting agent and supervisor level scorecards• 5+ years experience with integrating CRM tools• 5+ years experience integrating WFM tools Aspect or IEX• 7+ years experience communicating large amounts of complex data in a clear and concise format at an executive leadership level• Masters degree in an analytical or technical field• Authority level skills with Tableau or Power BI• Understanding of data warehousing, data modeling and ETL concepts; familiarity with Big Data or 1010 data and HadoopCompany DescriptionRing's mission is to reduce crime in neighborhoods and empower consumers by creating a Ring of Security around homes and communities with its suite of smart home security products: Ring Video Doorbell, Ring Video Doorbell Pro, Ring Stick Up Cam and the new Ring Floodlight Cam. With these security devices, Ring has created the neighborhood watch for the digital age and continues to keep homes around the world safe. For more information, visit www.ring.com. With Ring, you're always home.Ring LLC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants with our regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Ring LLC. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. Apply Now!

Then this is the position for you! The Senior Financial Analyst will be responsible for analyzing future and past events. This position offers a great mix of analytical duties and allows the opportunity to provide information which will impact the way the business operates. Responsibilities:Provide annual budgeting, forecasting and operational review support and provide oversight to various departmentsProvide financial leadership, monthly financial reports and analysisReport findings to managementDeveloping financial modelsROI, NPV, DCF, Interest Rate Risk AnalysisRequirements:B.S. in Finance, Math or related3+ years of financial analysis experienceMBA or CFA would be greatStrong Excel skillsThe ability to think outside of the box to solve problems Interested candidates please either respond to this posting or email a word copy of your resume to: bernadette@theresourcelink.com  We love recruiting! That is the difference.  This is what makes us different from our competition  This is a difference you will see immediately  This difference is what makes us so successful  Let us pass this success on to you  Come experience the difference of working with a recruiter that loves what they do! Name: Financial Analyst II
Description: Careers Center | Financial Analyst II Please Enable Cookies to Continue Please enable cookies in your browser to experience all the personalized features of this site, including the ability to apply for a job. Welcome page Returning Candidate? Log back in!  Financial Analyst II Job Number 221980 Facility Banner Pharmacy Services Department Admin-Pharmacy Svcs Address : Street 2901 North Central Ave Address : Location US-AZ-Phoenix Work Schedule Day Position Type FT: Full-Time Posting Category Accounting / Finance  --- A position in a Banner Health pharmacy is one you can look forward to. Join an engaging environment of full service, high technology and experience a wide variety of responsibilities. You’ll also see how important a pharmacy job is to our ability to make life easier for our patients. Come enjoy great challenges and build both your knowledge of the field and your analytical skills.Pharmacy services is an industry continually changing and in the process opening doors to learn and grow within the industry making employees valuable assets. The Banner Pharmacy Services senior leadership demonstrate the willingness to mentor staff in effort to help staff achieve their career goals. BPS is a vital part of Banner Health as we strive to improve patient care in all arenas of the pharmaceutical industry.As a financial analyst with BPS you will be exposed to the impact of pharmacy services not only in the environment of the hospitals and medical groups, but also specialty and retail pharmacy operations in the community. Financial analysts with BPS are assigned specific business lines to support our business leaders. This provides the analyst the opportunity to demonstrate their analytical and leadership skills as they work on a variety of projects. As BPS continues to grow the BPS finance team will need to expand their support. A financial analyst with the right skill set will have the opportunity to move into leadership roles if desired as they progress in their career. SQL is highly preferred. Your pay and benefits (Total Rewards) are important components of your Journey at Banner Health. Banner Health offers a variety of benefit plans to help you and your family. We provide health and financial security options so you can focus on being the best at what you do and enjoying your life. --- About Banner Pharmacy ServicesBanner Pharmacy Services division provides excellent patient care across our entire continuum through convenient access, improved medication outcomes and innovative pharmacy practices. Banner Pharmacy Services will be recognized nationally as a clinical leader and trusted partner in proactively providing innovative pharmacy services through excellence in integration, care coordination, medication management and service to make a difference in people's lives. Banner is expanding its focus from being a hospital company to a clinical quality company focused on population health management. Clinical Pharmacy Services are also included in this robust new service line and are responsible for the management of the Banner formulary, development of standardized system wide clinical pharmacy services, and management of adverse drug event preventions. Clinical Pharmacy Services provides collaborative drug therapy management and educational interventions in patient care to optimize medication therapy, improve outcomes, promote wellness, and disease prevention.About Banner HealthBanner Health is one of the largest, nonprofit health care systems in the country and the leading nonprofit provider of hospital services in all the communities we serve. Throughout our network of hospitals, primary care health centers, research centers, labs, physician practices and more, our skilled and compassionate professionals use the latest technology to make health care easier, so life can be better. The many locations, career opportunities, and benefits offered at Banner Health help to make the Banner Journey unique and fulfilling for every employee. --- Job SummaryThis position is responsible for providing coordination and/or collection of relevant financial data to prepare and interpret financial reports for management in an accurate and timely manner. This position provides maintenance/updates as necessary to ensure the integrity of assigned financial systems and databases.Essential FunctionsGathers data from various sources to document and analyze statistics and financial information necessary to complete projects in assigned area. Generates various monthly or bi-weekly financial reports or ad hoc reports that enable management to control and analyze operations.Works with management and staff of various departments to assist with financial data gathering and/or interpretation. Ensures accuracy of financial information systems and maintenance of reporting. Ensures the integrity of statistical files and databases used for financial reporting.Works with other analysts to manage key financial processes within the organization (including operating budgets, forecasts program reporting and analysis, charge management, cost accounting, decision support and reimbursement analysis).Provides financial modeling resources for special projects assigned to the department by management for analysis. Brings strength in logic and analysis of data, sorts through data and determines which elements are useful or pertinent to the assigned project. Identifies outliers and recognizes trends, presents data and analysis results to appropriate parties.Prepares timely and accurate reports and presentations for state and federal agencies, administration and corporate to satisfy mandated reporting requirements policy, law or management. Maintains accurate statistical, contractual or other financial databases, as assigned.Assists in identification and implementation of operating improvements and efficiencies by identifying important trends and variances through the review of management reports and financial analysis. Educates users of the assigned financial reporting system on the utilization of reports and the functionality of those reports.Provides education on available financial tools and resources and provides learning to non-financial staff so they can break down analysis in simple terms.Assignments located in the Western region will have regional accountability and will provide financial analysis support for multiple facilities within the Western Region.Minimum QualificationsRequires a Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration or equivalent experience.Requires a proficiency level typically attained with 3 to 4 years of experience in healthcare financial management/analysis work. Must have excellent analytical and organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities with changing needs and deadlines. Requires excellent human relations skills and the ability to effectively interact and communicate both verbally and in writing with all levels staff and outside professionals. Requires strong abilities in statistical analysis, data interpretation, computer software applications, database and spreadsheet programs, plus a proficiency in financial modeling techniques to generate management reports, projections, allocations, and analyses. Preferred QualificationsAdditional related education and/or experience preferred.Apply For This JobApply Connect With Us!  Join one of our Talent Communities to learn more about a career at Banner Health.

Name: Associate Analyst
Description: The AssociateAnalyst position will be responsible for all aspects of underwriting and due diligence for commercial real estate transactions including stabilized, value-add, and development type transactions. Applicants should have 2-3 years of experience in a similar background. We expect the candidate to be able to work in a fast-paced environment, organizing and executing multiple projects at once while demonstrating the potential to handle a larger role as the company grows.  This position is located in Las Vegas, NV. Duties &ResponsibilitiesPrepares underwriting of commercial real estate properties based on historical financial statements, projections, and market standards to determine a projected income, and valuation of the asset(s).Assists with all due diligence relating to new investments.Gathers market data including demographics, sales and rent comparables, supply absorption, and employment statistics for understanding feasibility.Assist with drafting investment memos to be presented to lenders and investment committees.Provides loan closing coordination including collecting due diligence items, ordering third party reports, coordinating with all parties including borrowers, lenders and legal counsels, and acting as liaison with the servicing department.Monitors and analyzes the financial performance of the portfolio and individual properties.Assists in the preparation of investment reports in compliance with company guidelines and investor requirements.Assists with financing and disposition transactions.QualificationsBachelors degree, preferably with a major in Real Estate, Finance, or Business Administration.2-3 years of experience in commercial real estate/investment banking/private equity.Demonstrated analytical skills and underwriting related experience, preferably with all commercial property types.Strong computer knowledge and skills including in-depth expert knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, & PowerPoint).Ability to prioritize and to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.Ability to handle confidential information in a discreet, professional manner.Eye for detail, accuracy is imperative.Excellent organizational and analytical skills.Ability to be an effective team member and display initiative.Excellent verbal and written communication skillsBenefits Full benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision  Matching 401k  Job Type: Full-time

Name: Sr Quantitative Analyst - Analytics
Description: What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values—straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity – an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines – Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management. Sr Quantitative AnalystJob Description Summary Responsible for analysis and reporting efforts to support the Risk function within Consumer Banking Division. Consumer Banking Division covers a wide range of products and segments: Credit cards, Home Equity, Mortgages, Indirect loans (Auto, RV, Marine), Wealth Management, lending solutions for Small Medium Enterprises, etc.  The position involves conducting independent quantitative analysis and reporting to provides effective challenges on credit performance, emerging risks, and business conformity with Bank’s credit policy and standards operating within the boundaries of the credit risk appetite and bank’s credit policy and standards for Consumer, Residential and Small Business portfolios. Essential Job Functions 1. Perform moderate to highly quantitative analysis and reporting on assigned projects.  2. Ad-hoc analytics support including tracking and managing portfolio risk performance in line with Bank's credit policy and stated Risk Appetite objectives.  3. Conduct development and production of key reporting providing credit quality trends, concentration levels, and policy exception information.  4. Identifying trends, summarizing findings, developing recommendations and presenting analyses to management.  5. Makes recommendations for process improvements addressing gaps and areas for additional/improved reporting and data.  6. Maintain documentation as required.  7. Performs other duties as assigned.  · Bachelor’s Degree in Math, Statistics, Finance or Economics - Required  · Master’s/Advanced Degree in Financial Engineering, Science, Math - Preferred  · Requires deep knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience. Typically viewed as a specialist within discipline. May have broad knowledge of project management.  · Requires 7 years minimum prior relevant experience.  · Field of Experience – Job-specific knowledge requirements  o Strong analytics background with attention to details to deliver quality results.  o Ability to solve complex analytical and data integrity problems while prioritizing and managing multiple tasks.  o Technical skills to manipulate and analyze data in a variety of formats: proficient user of SAS, and data analytics tools (e.g. Tableau).  o Possess strong written and verbal communication skills.  o Must be able to work independently and proactively and take initiative in solving problems quickly.  o Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint). Equal Employment Opportunity Policy Bank of the West is an Equal Opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers without regard to any status protected by applicable law. Bank of the West is also an Affirmative Action employer - Minority / Female / Disabled / Veteran.  Bank of the West will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance subject to the requirements of all state and federal laws and regulations.

Name: Associate Client Strategy Consultant Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY The purpose of this position is to support an advisory services team through research, data collection and data management for the development of deliverables focused on real estate strategies in support of CBRE's clients.  CBRE Labor Analytics provides specialized consultancy services to corporate tenants, combining human capital and brick-and-mortar solutions to maximize cost savings, financial success and desired change for their clients. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Research, collect and compile information. Makes detailed observations, analyzes data, and interprets results. Process, consolidate, and transform data sets within and between databases using statistical and/or analytical techniques.  Conducts market interviews; synthesizes and presents relevant data and other issues of concern to the client / consultant. Prepares preliminary recommendations.  Prepares professional supporting documentation in a variety of formats. Assists and supports development of research and analysis (e.g. market views, market dynamics, benchmarking, etc.) related to specific initiatives.  Analyst works with large economic and market data sets from various sources and conducts analysis using various methods and systems.  Maintain and update quantitative and qualitative economic, financial, or statistical databases  Acts as liaison between corporate site selection consultants and economic development / public private partnerships / local municipalities.  Other duties may be assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.  \n\n QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE  Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from four-year college or university required. Minimum 0-2 years of related experience.  CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES  None COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills, ability to communicate effectively with colleagues, clients, external sources. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. High comfort level speaking with industry experts over the phone. Comfort with or experience interacting professionally over the phone. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. REASONING ABILITY Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills. Express innovative logic, business goals awareness and adaptability in a dynamic work environment.  OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES  Strong understanding of principles of information design and display and ability to create compelling documentation and deliverable. Ability to work quickly and independently with minimal guidance or oversight. Ability to work under pressure and multitask in a fast-paced environment.  Skilled at applying economic theory and knowledge. Demonstrated ability to study data and statistics and use understanding of economic relationships to uncover trends and forecast data.  Proficient use of Microsoft Office Suite Products.  Working knowledge of graphic/information design programs (e.g., InDesign, ArcGIS, Tableau). SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: Salesforce background (includes CRM experience)  This position will have a primary responsibility for soliciting, gathering and documenting detailed business requirements from key business personnel and must be able to convert the requests into a workable solution to present to technology staff. They will work directly with internal and external clients, requiring good communication skills, as well as fundamental technical troubleshooting abilities. They will also need to manage user acceptance testing and coordinate testing environment schedules and setups for their respective projects. Their jobs will include working closely with and taking direction from Program & Project Managers to implement a solution throughout the company. At times, it may be required for this position to manage smaller projects, communicating and coordinating with various departments and staff to ensure successful delivery on target dates with proper adherence to company standards. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Elicit and document quantitative business cases for product backlog using advanced Excel macros and formulas  Present business cases to management and facilitate ROI discussions  Utilize Enterprise Architect (EA) v. 13 for all Business Documentation  Create and Maintain Business Requirements documentation and facilitate requirements review sessions  Contribute business analysis and technical analysis to determine business impacts with the ultimate goals of completing a Business Requirements Document, including financial and process analysis  Create process decompositions using Enterprise Architect for current and future states  Create detailed process decompositions for current and future states using Enterprise Architect and/or Visio  Create Logical ERD Diagrams and Data Flow Diagrams  Work with Database Architects to transform Logical ERDs into Physical ERDs  Work with IT Architects and Engineers to build contingency plans  Create RFIs and RFPs for Product Backlog  Facilitate workshops with both technical and business constituents to drive clarity of requirements via process mapping activities, JAD sessions and the like  Create detailed user stories and work with IT Architects and Engineers to decompose identified features into non-functional, system, and functional user stories  Communicate project status, issues and risks within and outside of the project team  Responsible for keeping manager informed of any important aspects of a project in a timely manner  Support Quality Assurance in creating and executing test plans, documenting faults/errors, reporting test progress against requirements.  Other Duties and Responsibilities  Develop broad knowledge and understanding of business & technology areas  Develop broad knowledge and understanding of appropriate business tools  Any other duties that can be safely performed as requested by manager Qualifications: Education and Experience  4-year college degree preferred  At least 5 years working knowledge as a Business Analyst  Experience as a Developer preferred  CRM (Salesforce) preferred  Extensive experience with data modelling preferred  MBA a plus  Experience with Insurance products a plus  Licensure/Certification  Project Management Professional (PMP)® a plus  Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP)® a plus  Software certifications a plus  Database certifications a plus  Special Qualifications  Must be able to understand complex requirements and design appropriate Business Architecture to meet them  Time management skills, a diligent work ethic and strong interpersonal skills  Strong oral and written communication skills with excellent listening skills  Must be able to manage diverse projects with a clear understanding of how they relate to corporate objectives, requirements, and priorities  Expert knowledge in Excel, PowerPoint and Visio is required  Must be proficient in Microsoft Project  Must be detail-oriented, extremely organized, and have exceptional writing and communicating skills  Good presentation skills to all levels of leadership with proven expertise in managing meetings, presentations.  Experience with Oracle any version above 9i a plus  Must be able to work with a diverse group of people at all levels of the organization, across multiple lines of business, and who possess varying degrees of technical competency  Risk assessment, negotiation and problem resolution skills  In this position, the individual must be fully able to independently manage day-to-day activities while taking direction from a Project Manager or the PMO Director.

Name: Client Support Analyst
Description: Job Summary  Provide Level 1 day-to-day technical support for external customized client software  General Duties & Responsibilities  • Provides Level 1 phone, email and on-line/Web assistance in resolving application and technology support issues. Provides customer training as needed for on-boarding of new customers or refresher for existing customers. • Provides effective customer service in a 5x8 production environment (rotating on-call and holiday support may be required.)  • Utilizes soft skills and troubleshooting skills to resolve client issues and questions.  • Asks probing questions to gather relevant information on routine and complex calls.  • Uses effective listening skills to develop understanding of client questions or issues.  • Documents, tracks and monitors client incidents in ticketing system to ensure a timely resolution.  • Prioritizes and escalates support incidents and requests based on business impact and documented guidelines. Performs remote installations, trouble shooting and upgrades of new and existing softwareCreate, update, proof and distribute Software Release Notices for internally developed client facing software and procedures. • Communicates highly technical information to both technical and nontechnical personnel.  • Other related duties assigned as needed.  Educational Requirements  High school diploma or GED.  General Knowledge, Skills & Abilities  • Ability to verbalize or express complex technical concepts effectively in writing and overall excellent communication and customer interface skills Basic working understanding of Microsoft file systems and registry entries • Skill in troubleshooting and using diagnostic tools for client accessibility problems to applications  • Knowledge of basic problem resolution and escalation practices  • Ability to provide appropriate level of support and guidance with FIS applications and procedures  • Effective use of listening skills to develop an understanding of client inquiries and problems  • Excellent team player  • Self-motivated to learn new technology and new ways to deliver support  • Shows enthusiasm when providing technical support  • Stays up-to-date with latest technology  • Problem Solving and critical thinking skills Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office products Technical Support Representative II  Intermediate role. Moderate skills with high level of proficiency. Works under general supervision with ability to work independently. Recognizes importance of customer satisfaction and works towards achieving high levels of customer satisfaction daily. Demonstrates effective customer service with solid soft skills and troubleshooting skills when dealing with external clients. Can handle a medium volume of calls while consistently maintaining excellent ticket documentation quality. Resolves client issues efficiently and effectively by having a solid understanding of different systems, applications and support procedures. When unable to resolve a client issue, quickly identifies and escalates issue to appropriate business area. Clearly documents client issue to ensure problem is clearly understood by others. Can resolve more complex and critical issues with minimal guidance and direction. On occasion, will assist team supervisor and manager with developing and improving team documentation and procedures. Exhibits a solid understanding of FIS environment and demonstrates a detailed understanding of specific applications and systems. Typically requires at least three years professional work experience in a support desk role.

Name: Financial Analyst II
Description: Careers Center | Financial Analyst II Please Enable Cookies to Continue Please enable cookies in your browser to experience all the personalized features of this site, including the ability to apply for a job. Welcome page Returning Candidate? Log back in!  Financial Analyst II Job Number 221980 Facility Banner Pharmacy Services Department Admin-Pharmacy Svcs Address : Street 2901 North Central Ave Address : Location US-AZ-Phoenix Work Schedule Day Position Type FT: Full-Time Posting Category Accounting / Finance  --- A position in a Banner Health pharmacy is one you can look forward to. Join an engaging environment of full service, high technology and experience a wide variety of responsibilities. You’ll also see how important a pharmacy job is to our ability to make life easier for our patients. Come enjoy great challenges and build both your knowledge of the field and your analytical skills.Pharmacy services is an industry continually changing and in the process opening doors to learn and grow within the industry making employees valuable assets. The Banner Pharmacy Services senior leadership demonstrate the willingness to mentor staff in effort to help staff achieve their career goals. BPS is a vital part of Banner Health as we strive to improve patient care in all arenas of the pharmaceutical industry.As a financial analyst with BPS you will be exposed to the impact of pharmacy services not only in the environment of the hospitals and medical groups, but also specialty and retail pharmacy operations in the community. Financial analysts with BPS are assigned specific business lines to support our business leaders. This provides the analyst the opportunity to demonstrate their analytical and leadership skills as they work on a variety of projects. As BPS continues to grow the BPS finance team will need to expand their support. A financial analyst with the right skill set will have the opportunity to move into leadership roles if desired as they progress in their career. SQL is highly preferred. Your pay and benefits (Total Rewards) are important components of your Journey at Banner Health. Banner Health offers a variety of benefit plans to help you and your family. We provide health and financial security options so you can focus on being the best at what you do and enjoying your life. --- About Banner Pharmacy ServicesBanner Pharmacy Services division provides excellent patient care across our entire continuum through convenient access, improved medication outcomes and innovative pharmacy practices. Banner Pharmacy Services will be recognized nationally as a clinical leader and trusted partner in proactively providing innovative pharmacy services through excellence in integration, care coordination, medication management and service to make a difference in people's lives. Banner is expanding its focus from being a hospital company to a clinical quality company focused on population health management. Clinical Pharmacy Services are also included in this robust new service line and are responsible for the management of the Banner formulary, development of standardized system wide clinical pharmacy services, and management of adverse drug event preventions. Clinical Pharmacy Services provides collaborative drug therapy management and educational interventions in patient care to optimize medication therapy, improve outcomes, promote wellness, and disease prevention.About Banner HealthBanner Health is one of the largest, nonprofit health care systems in the country and the leading nonprofit provider of hospital services in all the communities we serve. Throughout our network of hospitals, primary care health centers, research centers, labs, physician practices and more, our skilled and compassionate professionals use the latest technology to make health care easier, so life can be better. The many locations, career opportunities, and benefits offered at Banner Health help to make the Banner Journey unique and fulfilling for every employee. --- Job SummaryThis position is responsible for providing coordination and/or collection of relevant financial data to prepare and interpret financial reports for management in an accurate and timely manner. This position provides maintenance/updates as necessary to ensure the integrity of assigned financial systems and databases.Essential FunctionsGathers data from various sources to document and analyze statistics and financial information necessary to complete projects in assigned area. Generates various monthly or bi-weekly financial reports or ad hoc reports that enable management to control and analyze operations.Works with management and staff of various departments to assist with financial data gathering and/or interpretation. Ensures accuracy of financial information systems and maintenance of reporting. Ensures the integrity of statistical files and databases used for financial reporting.Works with other analysts to manage key financial processes within the organization (including operating budgets, forecasts program reporting and analysis, charge management, cost accounting, decision support and reimbursement analysis).Provides financial modeling resources for special projects assigned to the department by management for analysis. Brings strength in logic and analysis of data, sorts through data and determines which elements are useful or pertinent to the assigned project. Identifies outliers and recognizes trends, presents data and analysis results to appropriate parties.Prepares timely and accurate reports and presentations for state and federal agencies, administration and corporate to satisfy mandated reporting requirements policy, law or management. Maintains accurate statistical, contractual or other financial databases, as assigned.Assists in identification and implementation of operating improvements and efficiencies by identifying important trends and variances through the review of management reports and financial analysis. Educates users of the assigned financial reporting system on the utilization of reports and the functionality of those reports.Provides education on available financial tools and resources and provides learning to non-financial staff so they can break down analysis in simple terms.Assignments located in the Western region will have regional accountability and will provide financial analysis support for multiple facilities within the Western Region.Minimum QualificationsRequires a Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration or equivalent experience.Requires a proficiency level typically attained with 3 to 4 years of experience in healthcare financial management/analysis work. Must have excellent analytical and organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities with changing needs and deadlines. Requires excellent human relations skills and the ability to effectively interact and communicate both verbally and in writing with all levels staff and outside professionals. Requires strong abilities in statistical analysis, data interpretation, computer software applications, database and spreadsheet programs, plus a proficiency in financial modeling techniques to generate management reports, projections, allocations, and analyses. Preferred QualificationsAdditional related education and/or experience preferred.Apply For This JobApply Connect With Us!  Join one of our Talent Communities to learn more about a career at Banner Health.

As such, all U.S. positions require a background check, which may include a drug screen.  UTAS4220182United Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Name: Sr. Systems Analyst
Description: Make Next Happen Now. For more than 30 years, Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) has helped innovative companies and their investors move bold ideas forward, fast. SVB provides targeted financial services and expertise through its offices in innovation centers across the world. With commercial, international and private banking services, SVB helps address the unique needs of innovators.Work closely with cross-functional business, IT and vendor teams to ensure delivery of the right-sized solutions to meet current, future and long-term needs in support of SVB’s End User Computing and File Transmission Platforms. Responsible for end-to-end health and maintenance of assigned systems, including working closely with stakeholders to understand new capabilities and future roadmaps, and being able to apply this knowledge to solve for business needs and pain points. Serve as a liaison with the business owners to facilitate the elicitation and prioritization of business/functional requirements including but not limited to interface design, user interface specifications and report design specifications. Act as a senior consultant to the business, striving to meet their business and compliance objectives with innovative, cost effective and efficient solutions, leveraging existing infrastructure and capabilities whenever possible. This position also will be responsible for the File Transmission platform within Silicon Valley Bank. They will work daily within all file movement applications deployed at SVB, to include but not limited to, the IBM Sterling Managed File Transfer suite of applications and traditional FTP products running on Windows Server platforms as well as Linux.They will participate in the design, engineering, development, testing and implementation, operation and maintenance of all MFT strategies at SVB. They will maintain technical quality in operating environments through monitoring and development of intermediate solutions; and familiarity with various components of the MFT platforms.Primary Responsibilities:Leads development of MFT internal & external business processes within the MFT team utilizing BPML (Business Process Modeling Language) based upon XPATHDevelops managed file transfer business processes to simplify, streamline and standardize internal & external bank file transfersWorks with business lines to understand, model and implement business processes to meet business needsCreates and modifies client notifications within the MFT management solutionWorks with systems and databases to ensure maintenance and patching is currentAnalyze and translate complex business requirements into a functional system design document. Technology and system related analysis using knowledge of current applications, interfaces and data structures to recommend solutions and provide inputConfigure systems and develop expertise in system functionality and designUnderstand points of interaction and impact on other systems across the enterpriseUnderstand client needs and pain points; recommend enhancements to release tracksProvide support for system production issues and maintain documentation. Able to direct, with authority, remote team members to quickly resolve business critical production incidents successfully. Assist in developing and executing test scriptsPerform and/or participate in testing releases prior to installing in productionAssist in developing training materials for system functionalityAssist with performing applications changes and configurationsManage the installation of maintenance/patches and software upgradesConvert application designs into data model and data mapping specificationsProvide guidance and mentoring to new systems analysts, when requestedOversee proactive maintenance on our existing SaaS and on premise applications Drive departmental best practices, guidelines implementation and adhere to standards.Deep love of building elegant, maintainable, well-documented, secure solutions.Drive to learn new things and go above and beyond the call of duty.Always working to improve yourself and constructively support the team around you3 plus years of the following platforms; IBM Sterling File Gateway, B2B Integrator, Secure Proxy, Control Center, and Connect Direct5 plus years’ experience in FTP, SFTP, or Connect Direct protocols7 years’ experience in Systems Administration in Windows3 years’ experience in Systems Administration in LinuxBasic demonstrated knowledge of Xpath and XML principals as well as the use of regular expressionsUnderstanding of Microsoft SQL maintenance and queriesExperience with production and disaster recovery systems/application supportExperience with development coding and relational database (SQL) queries is a plus. Writing SQL queries and navigating databases will be required as part of troubleshooting or looking at data for the business.Performs impact analysis of proposed changes on existing architecture, capabilities, system priorities, and technology solutions; looks for additional solution options or trade-offs. Identifies cost/benefit implications of proposed solutions (e.g. people, processes, technology, strategy, finance).Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels within the organizationAbility to execute and prioritize a number of tasks, initiate and conduct meetings with team and peers.Able work independently with minimal supervisionHigh attention to detailStrong interpersonal skillsBeing able to communicate effectively with colleagues, stakeholders and clients.Being confident to have face to face interactions with senior business and IT stakeholdersNot being afraid to pick up the phone to talk to peopleAbility to understand data flows and how applications interface with one another (including upstream / downstream) Quick Thinking – being able to think on the spot quickly to minimize business impact and make key decisionsBasic level of understanding regarding IT infrastructure e.g. understanding networks, circuits, routers, etc.Flexible, Friendly and ApproachableBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Science, or related discipline or equivalent work experience7 years of relevant work experience with systems implementations and/or system enhancements, ideally with 3 years of experience working in information technology domain within Banking or Financial Services industry

Name: IT Technical Analyst II

Headquartered in San Francisco, Dignity Health is dedicated to providing compassionate, high-quality, and affordable patient-centered care with special attention to the poor and underserved. In FY17, Dignity Health provided $2.6 billion in charity care, community benefit, and unpaid cost of government programs. For more information, please visit our website at www.dignityhealth.org. You can also follow us on Twitter and Facebook.ResponsibilitiesPosition Summary:The IT Technical Analyst II role serves a vital function as the key liaison between business and technology stakeholders, forging business ideas into concrete requirements to support business operations across the entire Dignity Health enterprise. Ability to quickly grasp business needs and assess impact to IT operations and systems. Present options for problem resolution.Recognize scope limitations and raise potential scope issues, while supporting the best technical solution design and approach.Identify issues and risks and handle them in a manner that mitigates the risks to quality, timeline and scope.Works on mid to long-term projects and programs, and/or maintenance assignments.Manage and deliver project assignments within the established timelinesParticipation in on-call rotations or after hours project activities as directed by supervisor QualificationsMinimum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Technology, Medical, or Business discipline or equivalent experienceAt least two (2) years of experience as a business, data, or technical analystReview all new PMO approved projects, balancing key project identification attributes with resource technical skill and availability amongst a group of resources of varied skillsets and role focusSkillfully review and lead time-tracking support business operations across the entire Dignity Health enterpriseFacilitate the technical requirements analysis process, develop strong working relationships with business partners, and successfully support multiple on-going projects within various subject areasWork with technical process owners to complete and publish SOPs for new enterprise technologiesFormulate and present managementEvaluate and provide approval/analysis for all requests for project funding for the accounting unit as the telecommunications center of excellence lifecycle ownerCoordinate employee Name: Consumer Product Strategy Analyst II / III
Description: Job Description:Line of Business Description:This position is responsible for forecasting near term delinquency and losses on the Home Loans portfolio through various forms of analysis. These analyses are aimed at determining portfolio risk and operational performance in order to accurately forecast future delinquency and loss performance for the Home Loans portfolio.Key functions involve extracting data from key analytical databases, forecasting delinquency and losses using asset quality monitoring, identifying business trends, and understanding economic/portfolio conditions. Frequent communication and interactions with all levels of management are required in order to relay key information related to delinquency and loss projections, performance trends, and variance attribution. The ability to effectively communicate in both written and oral form is a critical skill for this position. While this position has no direct people management responsibilities, it does require the ability to act independently, as well as interact with business partners (both within and external to the department). This position requires being the subject matter expert on multiple business-related and technical-related topics and an ability to independently develop and drive forecasting improvements.Enterprise Role Overview:Responsible for performing more complex analysis and modeling for multiple products with the goal of maximizing profits and asset growth and minimizing risk and operating losses and/or other financial and marketing exposures. Develops complex program models to extract data and uses multiple databases to acquire statistical and financial data. Utilizes portfolio trends to propose policy/procedural changes within segmentation structure to produce optimal results. Excels at risk/reward trade off. Build relationships with external agencies. Participates in the rollout of company-wide pilot programs developed as a result of programmed models. Duties primarily include the regular use of discretion, independent judgment, the ability to communicate with multiple levels of management and the utilization of core leadership behaviors. SAS and/or Micro Strategy experience preferred; 2-5 years' experience preferred.May be filled as an Analyst II or III depending on experience and skill set.Required Skills:Programming and analytics with SAS/SQLSkilled with MS Office (Excel, Access, Word, and PowerPoint) Strong analytical and problem solving skills as demonstrated by concrete and documented projects and analytical workStrong evidence of leveraging analytics to drive business resultsAbility to work independently as well as with multiple business partnersProficient at written and oral communication, including presentation skillsAbility to interact with various levels of managementDesired Skills:Strategic Analyst experience, including skills like forecasting, trend analysis data mining, or statisticsShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week: 40

Name: Jr. Cost Analyst
Description: Position: Jr. Acquisition Specialist Location: Phoenix, AZ Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (“JPS”) is currently seeking qualified and motivated candidate. Must be knowledge of cost methodologies and cost modeling applications, including Microsoft Excel. Must also be knowledgeable of time value of money, net present value, real US nominal dollars and other common cost estimating practices.Acquisition planning assistance, including market research and recommending procurement strategy.Acquisition document development, including cost/price estimates, quality assurance surveillance plans, statements of objectives, synopsis, solicitations, price memoranda, source selection plans, etc.Expect assistance in supporting quote and quote evaluations, including price/cost analysis or technical quote or quote analysis.Contract administration support services, including assistance with reviewing contractor performance, developing contract modifications, and investigating reports of contract discrepancies.Contract/task order closeout assistanceDrafting policy or procedure documents for government review.B.A or B.S Degree (in a business related field) with a combination of education and five (5) years of procurement/ acquisition experience and at least 3 of those years shall have been at a junior level.Extensive working knowledge of Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) will be required.U.S. Citizenship: Must be able to successfully pass a background check. Name: Analyst Relations AI and Data Governance
Description: Job Description IBM is looking for an Analyst Relations Specialist for Analytics, AI and Data Business Unit to raise the visibility of the IBM Analytics and AI to drive revenue via leveraging key global analysts and influencers. The candidate should possess: + Strong analytical skills, and experience evaluating qualitative and quantitative research in the areas of data integration, data quality, metadata management, master data management and data governance.  + Work closely with IBM Product Management, Engineering, Sales, Marketing and Communications teams to strategically position IBM Analytics and AI offerings.  + Understand the offerings and clearly communicate IBM Analytics and AI vision and capabilities to the influencer market place and analyst community.  + Be proficient in articulating key IBM differentiators in an engaging manner.  + Be persuasive at technical writing to support key RFIs  + Possess a hospitable, polished demeanor to develop or strengthen relationships with key analysts, influencers and thought leaders.  + Significant experience presenting material in large and small venues is required.  + Possess a background in market research, communications, data analysis and competitive positioning.  + Understand this role is one where you will have a seat at the table to build a market and a business  + Experience in driving revenue is important  This role requires the ability to work in parallel on multiple fast paced projects. Candidate must also enjoy building relationships with industry influencers, technical global and internal stakeholders. Candidate will be a blend of technical and business expertise with strong experience in data governance, analytics and AI.  This position is part of the Analyst Relations (AR) department. Candidate will report to the leader of the Analytics and AI group inside of AR with dotted line into Analytics and AI business unit.  IBM Analyst Relations is considered a strategic function at IBM which drives revenue and influences strategy  The candidate will interact with colleagues across IBMs global offices to build and nurture strong internal relationships that will be leveraged to engage with leading influencers to help elevate IBMs story and customer successes. RESPONSIBILITIES Develop, manage and execute a targeted Analytics and AI plan for the influencer community; educate the most influential industry/technical analysts, hybrid analysts, bloggers, marketers, etc., who work with existing or prospective IBM customers, key global media and financial markets.  Embed with the business unit to influence strategy while improving analyst/influencer perceptions and relationships year-over-year.  Interview and question influencers; digging for answers and passing compelling details along to engineering, product management and sales whereby changing the trajectory of a product or platform offering.  Drive face to face and phone interactions with influencers on a weekly basis.  Ensure IBM Analytics and AI business unit is highlighted against its competitors and the markets that IBM competes in; shape the perception of IBM and the value it brings to its customers.  Monitor the competitive landscape and strategic developments for Analytics and AI ; share relevant analyst and influencer research and implications with senior management to shape BU strategy and offerings.  Connect key IBM executives with expert analysts/influencers for advisory sessions to help define and influence offering strategy for Analytics and AI.  Collaborate and triangulate with colleagues to ensure that IBM is getting the best representation with the analyst/influencer community.  Manage and procure paid strategic research projects on behalf of IBM to ensure that key analyst firms are actively engaged with IBM offerings.  Develop a keen understanding of how to build credible and impactful relationships with key influencers and leading industry analysts. Honesty, tenacity and consistency are key.  Grow a deep technical interest in Analytics and AI in order to go toe to toe with analysts and influencers on the subject.  Embody the spirit of an individual who likes to create a business and a market.  Co-Create and Co-execute plans for Analytics and AI and third-party AR external events that complement and validate IBMs corporate messaging and strategy by incorporating actual customer use cases.  Skills include; analytical, technical in area of Analytics and AI  specifically in the area of data integration, data quality, metadata management, master data management, and data governance. Must be entrepreneurial, persistent, collaborative, open and curious.  Candidate must be willing to travel up to 50% to meet in person with business unit executives and key global analysts and influencers.  Applicants must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorship.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Experience working in or covering the tech industry specifically in Analytics and AI, in the areas of; data integration, data quality, metadata management, master data management, and data governance.10+ years of diverse work experience in more than one functional area such as: engineering, product management, product marketing, M&A, market research, product launch, technology consulting, communications or strategy..Engineering Degrees (Undergrad and Graduate in EE, ME, or Software Fields)Executive presence to counsel to senior management regarding the market, competitive landscape and analyst outlook. Candidates must have the tenacity, determination and patience to be able to challenge conventional thinking and processes.Entrepreneurial mindset and ability to operate in a highly visible and accountable role.Candidates must have the tenacity, determination and patience to be able to challenge conventional thinking and processes. Preferred Tech and Prof Experience MBA StrategyExperience building an AI or Analytics based product and taking it through full commercialization.Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Superior inclusive team-building skills.Existing relationships with leading industry analysts/influencers in the database management space EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Legal - Legal Specialist Analyst, Consumer & Community Banking, Auto
Description: JPMorgan  Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with  assets of $2.6 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in  investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business,  commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A  component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves  millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most  prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan  and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at  www.jpmorganchase.com.  The  Legal Department of JPMorgan Chase & Co is responsible for the provision of  legal services to the Corporation and is organized by practice groups that  generally align with the Corporations lines of business and corporate staff  areas. This structure encourages legal  teams and businesses and staff areas to discuss legal, regulatory and business  developments effectively and in a timely manner.  The  Legal Department is seeking a highly motivated individual to join a legal  specialist team dedicated to support the Auto business within the Consumer and  Community Banking line of business. The  Auto business includes retail and commercial services.  The Analyst  will work closely with the legal staff in the Auto business to support diverse  client needs from loan origination to servicing and must also be able to work  independently to provide legal support to development and management of  projects and programs within the Auto line of business. The Analyst will be responsible for routine  tracking and maintenance of legal and regulatory changes that impact the Auto  business and helping attorneys respond to client inquiries regarding  application of laws and regulations.  This  position requires a candidate with excellent oral and written communication  skills, experience researching and summarizing federal and state regulatory  requirements, and the ability to manage multiple assignments  simultaneously. The ideal candidate for  this position has previous experience supporting consumer lending attorneys in  a law firm, bank or finance company on both regulatory and transactional  matters.  The  preferred location for this position is Phoenix, AZ other hub locations may be  considered for qualified candidates.Communicate  and liaise with business partners and internal departments regarding various  projects, procedures, and processesManage  responses to business partner inquiries from the legal team related to loan and  lease originationsMonitor,  research and summarize state and federal law applicable to the businessPrepare  legal analysis and memorandaSummarize  agreements and other legal documentsParticipating  in cross-line of business initiatives and working with other legal teams across  Consumer & Community Banking, as appropriateProviding  transactional support, including review and drafting loan and lease origination  documents.Update,  manage, and maintain Practice Group files, reports, records, databases,  inventories, and systemsCommunicate  and liaise with internal departments regarding various projects, procedures,  and processesIdentify  issues in projects and processes as they develop and escalate as neededSet  up and maintain document management practices in iManageAssist  with special projects as neededAll  other duties as necessary or assigned in connection with legal support to the  businessAll  candidates for roles in the Legal department must successfully complete a  conflicts of interest clearance review prior to commencement of employment.

Name: Global Partnership Analyst
Description: Wolters Kluwer is a global leader in professional information services. Professionals in the areas of legal, business, tax, accounting, finance, audit, risk, compliance and healthcare rely on Wolters Kluwer's market leading information-enabled tools and software solutions to manage their business efficiently, deliver results to their clients, and succeed in an ever more dynamic world. Every day, our customers make critical decisions to help save lives, improve the way we do business, build better judicial and regulatory systems. We help them get it right.  Within Wolters Kluwer, CT Corporation contains our expert information services businesses that serve large corporations, small businesses and law firms specializing in incorporation and legal business compliance solutions and clearance and protection solutions for trademark and brand professionals. Responsibilities:Provide support and drive results in areas surrounding global partnerships and alliances, operations support, financial and data analysis support and other key roles as determinedLead and participate in projects related to the identification of potential partners, partnership operational assessments, pricing negotiations, profitability analysis, coverage model analysis, service level management and strategic partnership pipeline analysisCoordinate, influence and participate in projects and the on-boarding of new partnersWork with leadership to achieve goals including Best Customer Experience, Best in Class Economics, and Great Place to WorkManage reporting responsibilities, analyze data and reports, as well as identify and implement opportunities for improvementDevelop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the CT product line and systems, specifically as they relate to Global Corporate ServicesIdentify gaps in global coverage, potential partners and document process of exploring new partnershipsProvide support to leadership team including analyzing and reporting on metrics; Project Management Professional (PMP), and/or Six Sigma Green or Black Belt preferredExperience gathering and analyzing information, integrating information from multiple sources quickly and accurately, as well as utilizing the results from analysis to inform and influence business decisionsDemonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple concurrent projects, along with driving and managing projects to successful completionProficient with Microsoft Office Suite applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OutlookExperience using Sales tools such as Salesforce.com; and ancillary software to support the CRM databaseStrong working knowledge of E1, Salesforce.com, Tableau, and/or Arrow preferredAbility to travel up to 40% Wolters Kluwer N.V. (AEX: WKL) is a global leader in information services and solutions for professionals in the health, tax and accounting, risk and compliance, finance and legal sectors. We help our customers make critical decisions every day by providing expert solutions that combine deep domain knowledge with specialized technology and services.  Wolters Kluwer reported 2017 annual revenues of ?4.4billion. The company, headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands, serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries and employs 19,000 people worldwide. Wolters Kluwer shares are listed on Euronext Amsterdam (WKL) and are included in the AEX and Euronext 100 indices. Name: Schematics Analyst

They also perform category reviews which uses predefined templates in MS Excel and Symphony EYC Space Planning. They assess schematic assortment performance and make recommended improvements. This includes accommodating decisions for new and discontinued items, working closely with the Category Manager, the Schematic Technology Manager and supplier partners. Analytical skill and experience developed in this role provide important insight into assortment performance and future modifications. The Schematic Analyst also develops and maintains financial and other reports to display progress of the department. EYC Space Planning & SPINS capabilities and insights gained by ongoing analysis of all schematicsSupport fact-based and objective decisions that produce the best results Work in partnership to design a category, segment, or store layout using the insight gained from category reviewsDevelop new reports to define and improve the process and better relay the information required by people involvedWork with peers and the Schematics Manager to meet deadlines, deliver quality and accuracy in analytics and output using the approved Category Review ScheduleShare insights and skills to help the team meet their performance and support requirementsWork with the Schematics Technology Manager to develop mutual growth and a stimulating work environment within the Sprouts buying team.Create schematic versionsEnsure that the core assortment is maintained across all schematic versions Continually address questions that stores or vendors may have in regards to schematic designPerform analysis on departments to determine optimal spaceWork with analytical programs to analyze data to determine space to sales ratios Make proposals based off of analytical programs for future new stores as well as pre-existing storesWork with Category Managers and the SPINS on-site group to compare current categories with industry standards to develop the best mix for the consumers.Creating reports to improve overall processes at SproutsCreate opening product orders for new store developmentAssist in developing databases that help streamline information flow from the Schematic Department to the Directors, Category Managers, stores, and vendor partners Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Physical RequirementsPreferred Bachelor Degree with a minimum of one (1) year of experience in merchandising and a strong knowledge of the Natural Foods industry; or an acceptable combination of education and experienceStrong knowledge of the fundamental concepts and processes to support schematic development, assortment management and retail implementationAbility to comfortably engage in vendor, Category Manager and corporate meetings Excellent computer skills with a working proficiency with and meetingsMeet deadlines while adapting to regularly changing work prioritiesDemonstrates proficient verbal and written communications skillsAbility to work independently and with multiple cross functional team members BenefitsIn addition to a rewarding career, Sprouts offers a comprehensive program to help support you and your family. These programs include:Competitive payOpportunities for career growth15% discount for you and one other family member in your household on all purchases made at SproutsFlexible schedulesEmployee Assistance Program (EAP) Eligibility requirements may apply for the following benefits: 401(K) Retirement savings plan with a generous company matchAffordable benefit coverage, including medical, dental vision Pre-tax Flexible Spending Accounts for healthcare and dependent care Company paid life insurance and short-term disability coverage  Why SproutsGrow with us!If you have a passion for inspiring people and a flair for fresh food, consider applying for a job at Sprouts! With a focus on customer service, our neighborhood grocery stores offer high-quality, farm fresh produce, natural meats, plenty of scoop-your-own bulk goods and much more in a fun, friendly, old-fashioned farmer’s market setting. Come grow your career in healthy living with a fast-paced, rapidly growing company and teams that pride themselves on empowering others along their journey.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by people assigned to this work. This is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and requirements. Sprouts’ management reserves the right to amend and change duties, responsibilities, and requirements to meet business and organizational needs as necessary.
