either military or civilian + Basic qualificationsBasic Qualifications:Minimum 1 year of Application security experience including proficiency in AppSec concepts such as those in OWASP top 10, etc.Minimum of 1 of the following: 1 year of experience in one or more security testing tools, including Static Analysis and/or Dynamic Analysis1 year of experience working in Agile methodologies and transformations, as well as E2E understanding of the SDLC1 year of experience in at least one configuration & continuous integration tool such as Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Jenkins, Hudson, Maven, Ant, Git, SonarBonus – Exposure to one or more of the following: Container technology such as Docker, OpenShiftCloud deployments and securityVulnerability and threat assessment/remediationGovernance, reporting and escalation best practicesMinimum Bachelor degree, preferred Bachelor of Science in a technical concentration (Engineering, Computer Science, MIS) Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status). Name: Senior Reimbursement Analyst
Description: OverviewDignity Health, one of the nation’s largest health care systems, is a 22-state network of more than 9,000 physicians, 63,000 employees, and 400 care centers, including hospitals, urgent and occupational care, imaging and surgery centers, home health, and primary care clinics. Headquartered in San Francisco, Dignity Health is dedicated to providing compassionate, high-quality, and affordable patient-centered care with special attention to the poor and underserved. In FY17, Dignity Health provided $2.6 billion in charity care, community benefit, and unpaid cost of government programs. For more information, please visit our website at www.dignityhealth.org. You can also follow us on Twitter and Facebook.ResponsibilitiesLocation: Systems Office - Phoenix, Sacramento and/or PasadenaPosition Summary: The Senior Reimbursement Analyst is responsible for providing cost report preparation, cost report appeals, audit preparation and other duties related to the regulatory reimbursement services of Dignity Health. The position maintains current knowledge of Medicare, Medicaid and other State and Federal regulations. The Sr. Reimbursement Analyst interacts with customers and ensures value is delivered and customer satisfaction is achieved. The Sr. Reimbursement Analyst also assists in the improvement of internal business processes and meeting future reimbursement service needs. The Senior Reimbursement Analyst carries out his/her duties by adhering to the highest standards of ethical and moral conduct, acts in the best interest of Dignity Health and fully supports Dignity Health’s Mission, Philosophy and core values of Collaboration, Dignity, Excellence, Justice, and Stewardship. The Senior Reimbursement Analyst reports to the Reimbursement Managers and/or Directors. Accountabilities: Prepares interim and annual cost reports for Medicare, Medicaid and other State or Federal agencies for Dignity Health facilities and regionsCalculates periodic adjustments for deductions from revenue, revenue reserves, bad debt and other revenue adjustments related to regulatory reimbursement for all Dignity Health facilities and regions in accordance with Dignity Health policies and proceduresAssist the Reimbursement Managers and/or Directors with recommendations for internal Dignity Health strategy by evaluating current growth, anticipating future needs, and assessing impact of services deliveredAssists in the maintenance of standardized policies and procedures and third party settlement methodologiesReviews operational reports, identifies opportunities/problems, and makes recommendations for improving processesAssesses the impact of new products, technology, and processes on the existing organization and makes recommendations for improvement Required Non-Technical Competencies: Commitment to Dignity Health ValuesAnalytical ThinkingContinuous ImprovementProblem SolvingCustomer OrientationTeam OrientationFlexibilityCommunication AbilityReasoning Required Technical Competencies: MedicareMedicare Regulatory ReportingMedicaid (Medi-Cal)Medicaid (Medi-Cal) Regulatory ReportingAccounts Receivable and Cash CollectionCapital and Fixed AssetsReimbursement – Monthly Analysis ProcessDecision SupportGeneral Accounting QualificationsMinimum Qualifications:Minimum of five (5) years of experience with all aspects of Medicare and Medicaid (Medi-Cal) regulations monitoring and report processes requiredExperience as hospital Reimbursement staff or auditing experiences with Fiscal Intermediary requiredMinimum of five (5) years of experience and excellent working knowledge of general accounting, government reimbursement, appeals and audits in a complex organization, and maintaining relationships with internal and external entities such as general accounting, patient accounting, and fiscal intermediaries requiredExperience and knowledge of current reimbursement regulations and applications in a complex healthcare environment requiredBachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Accounting or equivalent work experience required

Name: Fire Protection Technical Consultant
Description: Job DescriptionThis could be the challenge you are looking for! Telgian is searching for a Fire Protection Technical Consultant to provide technical support to internal and external customers to accomplish maintenance/repair resolutions. A broad background and field experience of providing service and repair to the Fire Pump, Fire Sprinkler, Backflow, Fire Alarm, and Kitchen Hood Suppression systems is required. Technical Consultants must effectively communicate with internal/external associates, local authorities, and subcontractors. Therefore, the most successful candidates often have (but not required) Service Manager experience, NICET certification and/or manufacturer certifications. Communicating long distance with the service partners/providers is also necessary to resolve problematic or recurring repair issues. In doing so, the Consultant will communicate with local authorities in all 50 states and Canada, to reassure them and reach acceptable terms of service for customer equipment to prevent citations and other actions; this means the knowledge and the ability to research local fire codes, NFPA and ISO standards is required. Your Opportunity Telgian is looking for a hands-on Fire Protection Technical Consultant to act as a Subject Matter Expert to internal/external customers and regulatory agencies on subjects related to inspection and repair of fire protection systems. In performing these functions, the Consultant acts as an customer advocate to ensure the validity/need and scope/costs of indicated repairs are within industry norms and guidelines and in compliance with jurisdictional codes. Secondary functions include providing training and/or technical support to Telgian associates as required to drive top-level customer service.More specifically you will: Review scopes of work, confirms best course of action, validates pricing/costs and prepares inspection/repair proposals for presentation to customers.Acts as liaison between customers, vendors and regulatory authorities to ensure alignment of work order details and guidelines meet regulatory requirements.Directly manages technically complicated or recurring work order issues that require attention beyond that of a typical work order (i.e. coordinating with another vendor to address a system issue, recurring issue needing resolution, etc.).Act as primary escalation point to resolve fire system issues without dispatch; if unable to resolve provides pertinent information to dispatch team to ensure appropriate vendor response.Reviews and validates vendor recommendations or modifications to original scope of work; authorizes completion of modified scope of work or recommends alternate course(s) of action.Review open service orders, determine if enough information on deficiencies is listed to prepare blind quotes; prepare blind quote or solicit additional information from vendor as required.Write reports and provides information to internal or external consumers as requested to communicate progress and/or resolution activities of work in progress.Support associate technical development by creating/implementing technical training programs, standard work documents or informational articles.Your Compensation and Benefits At Telgian, we are proud to offer a unique, professional work environment where we consider all of our associates to be part of our family. We provide a competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits package with market leading (low!) health-care costs, and a place to advance your career. More importantly as a values driven organization, at Telgian you will be treated with dignity while having fun in your work! Your Qualifications At Telgian, we are looking for high performing associates to help drive Telgian’s mission to save lives and property in partnership with our customers. To achieve this, you will bring the following qualifications to the table: Associates Degree or higher preferred; H.S. Diploma or Equivalent required;NICET II certification preferred;Prior experience working with fire protection sub-contractors or technicians; 5 years Field Technician Experience a strong plus;Intermediate Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook skills required; Expert level preferred;Excellent communication skills, written and verbal;Ability to work in a high pressured and structured environment;Ability to establish professional relationships at all levels of the organization as well as with vendors and providers;Ability to explain technical or complex data in simple, non-technical language;Ability to make decisions impartially and objectively;Able to occasionally travel (up to 10%) to survey job sites, perform inspections, acceptance tests and consult with local authorities. Company DescriptionTelgian Holdings, Inc. is a worldwide provider of comprehensive fire, security, and life safety services. Headquartered in Phoenix, Arizona, Telgian provides service throughout the U.S., Canada and Mexico. Telgian offers expertise for consulting, inspections, engineering, and design of fire alarms, sprinkler systems, suppression systems, security alarms and life safety programs. We provide our clients a single-source solution for all of their fire protection and life safety needs. Our client base includes top retail chains, commercial building owners, healthcare companies, restaurants and food service, hospitality and insurance companies. We partner with architects, contractors, heavy manufacturers, industrial and commercial corporations, fire and building departments and facility managers to design a system based on our clients requirements and specifications.

Name: Planning and Research Analyst (South Mountain Community College)
Description: Salary Range $52,139 - $67,781 /annually, DOEGrade 116Work Schedule Monday - Friday, 8am - 5pm; some evenings and weekends may be required  Summer Hours: Monday - Thursday, 7am-6pmWork Calendar 12 MonthsJob Summary South Mountain Community College’s Planning, Research and Development Office is hiring a Planning and Research Analyst. This position collects, analyzes, and interprets institutional and external data to provide findings and reports for use in decision making and in support of the college's strategic initiatives. Additionally, we seek applicants who demonstrate a commitment to service excellence, innovation, student success, integrity and diversity in the performance of job duties.  The Planning, Research and Development Office works as a team to fulfill our department Vision and Mission: Vision Profoundly improve the way SMCC delivers on its Vision, Mission, and Values. Mission Enhance organizational success through integrated planning, institutional research, informed decision-making, student outcomes assessment, accreditation, and grant development.  SMCC is a designated Hispanic-Serving Institution serving a diverse community.  As a strengths-based institution, we are dedicated to helping you determine and understand your own personal strengths, and will help you maximize them in the pursuit of your educational and career goals.  http://www.southmountaincc.edu/about-us/Essential Functions 40% - Data Extraction and Preparation - Access and extract data from data warehouses and other data sources using tools such as Hyperion, Tableau or other SQL browsers; clean and prepare data for analysis  35% - Data Analysis and Reporting - Conduct research, analyze data, and generate reports and visualizations utilizing tools such as Excel, SPSS and Tableau  15% - Survey Research - Manage administration, research and reporting related to college survey initiatives such as the Community College Survey of Student Engagement (CCSSE), Noel-Levitz, Course Evaluations and internal college survey projects  10% - Committee and Staff Support - Serve on and support efforts of college committees, task forces, and work groups; Support Planning, Research & Development office staff with operational needs such as website updates and other duties as assignedMinimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in business statistics, educational studies, information technology or directly related field  And two years of professional-level experience in research and analysis  OR  An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job such as those listed above, unless otherwise subject to any other requirements set forth in law or regulation.Desired Qualifications 1. Experience extracting complex data sets from relational databases using queries written in SQL or SQL browsers.  2. Experience presenting research results, either with written reports or verbal presentations.  3. Experience creating data visualizations with Tableau or similar data visualization software.  4. Experience conducting research or statistical analysis using data sets related to higher education, such as student or course records.  5. Experience with survey design and administration. 6. Experience conducting statistical analysis with SPSS, SAS, R or other statistical software.Special Working Conditions May be required to work evening and weekend hours; summer work hours vary  May be required to lift objects up to 25 lbs  May be required to sit for a prolonged period of time, viewing a computer monitor  May require travel to various Maricopa County Community College District locationsHow to Apply Applicants must submit a cover letter that details how the applicant meets minimum and desired qualifications.  Applications without a cover letter will be incomplete and will not be considered.  Please ensure your resume and cover letter provide the following items: Clearly illustrate how prior experience, knowledge and education meet the minimum and desired qualifications for this position.Provide employment history in a month/year format (e.g., 09/07 to 10/11) including job title, job duties, full or part time and name of employer for each position.Three professional references, preferably current and/or former supervisors. If references are not provided in resume upon application, they will be requested at time of interview.Posting Close Date Open until filledEEO Information Maricopa County Community College District (MCCCD) will not discriminate, nor tolerate discrimination in employment or education, against any applicant, employee, or student because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status (including document abuse), age, disability, veteran status or genetic information.

Name: Technical Consultant
Description: *Technical Consultant** Location **US-Remote (United States)**  Job ID **12887**  Apply Now *Overview of Job Function:** The Technical Consultant works as part of Engagement Management Professional Global Services teams and engages directly with our clients to develop world class customer experience solutions. *Principal Duties and Essential Responsibilities:** + Contribute to and challenge the design documentation, identify gaps (and suggest solutions) and develop all aspects of the solution such as User Interface, Business Rules, Object Model, Integration and Database model independently.  + Maintain awareness of impact of own work on overall solution, ensuring output fits appropriately into overall design.  + Participate in code reviews and learn lessons from those reviews in order to continually improve coding standards.  + Triage defects (UI, process and integration) and fix medium/difficult complexity bugs.  + Be responsible for designing significant sections of our solutions maximizing OOTB functionality, adhering to specifications, requirements and standards without support. Follow and challenge best practice guidelines for the installation, configuration and delivery of Engagement Management Professional solutions to ensure high quality and customer acceptance  + Specify and execute use cases, test sprints, and performance tests of customer solutions.  + Develop greater understanding of relevant Engagement Management Professional solutions.  + Have quality as a focus for all tasks and deliverables, of own work as well as helping less experienced colleagues achieve high quality outputs.  + Carry out duties according to company policy and quality assurance processes.  + Adhere to project plan and deliver tasks on time with timely updates (progress/dependencies/blockers) to project lead.  + Estimate medium complexity work packages with little or no support.. *Minimum Requirements:** + 3 plus years? experience of all stages of the Software Development Lifecycle on at least 3 projects.  + 2 plus years? experience of using SQL and relational database technologies e.g. SQL Server, Oracle.  + 2 plus years? experience in Spring Framework.  + 2 plus years? experience in developing web services e.g SOAP, REST.  + Languages: Working knowledge of Java and the following: HTML, Javascript, XML, XSL/XSLT, CSS, JQuery, JSP  + Demonstrable skills in Object Oriented design concepts.  + Demonstrable skills in Relational Database design concepts.  + Successful completion of Verint background screening process including, but not limited to, employment verifications, criminal search, OFAC, and SS verification *Preferred Requirements:** + Experience with Version Control technologies e.g. SVN/GIT  + Experience of using bug tracking software e.g. BugZilla, JIRA, HPQC is desirable  + Other performance testing tools (e.g. Selenium, DynaTrace, JMeter, LoadUI, Charles, etc)  As an equal opportunity employer, Verint Systems Inc. prides itself in providing employees with a work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity. This means we are committed to providing equal opportunity to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to one?s race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, disability, alienage or citizenship status, marital status, creed, genetic predisposition or carrier status, sexual orientation, Veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment including but not limited to hiring, placement, promotion, compensation, training, leave of absence or termination.

Name: Data Analyst Healthcare
Description: Fortune 500, multiline healthcare corporation. Looking for a data analyst to collect and validate data, and analyze performance metrics for health management programs such as: claims, provider data, member data, clinical data, pharmacy, HEDIS, and external reporting (IRS, CMS, HHSC, HEDIS). You’ll perform these roles: extract/load/model large data from multiple system platforms and sources; review data for operational impact/elevate issues & actions/trends, look for improvement opportunities; develop reports; model data using MS Excel, Access, SQL and other data analysis tools; audit data compliance; train/mentor other analysts. Requirements You must have a bachelor’s degree plus at least four years of statistical or data analysis experience. Our client strongly prefers that you have healthcare experience. Qualified candidates will have advanced knowledge of enterprise reporting and analysis tools, SQL, Microsoft Office (especially Excel/Access), and project management/implementation experience. Technical qualifications also include Encounters experience, data warehouse, understanding of HRMS database design/structure/functions/processes (supports HR systems as functional administrator). Preferred candidates will have experience with: healthcare, SQL, SSIS, SSRS, Visual Studio, Teradata, Microstrategy, and strong knowledge of health plans.  You must be eligible to work for any employer in the United States without sponsorship: the employer will not sponsor visas.  Relocation assistance is not available; local candidates only. Competitive base salary is provided, along with bonus opportunity. Recognized in the top 100 fastest growing companies in 2017 and named to the FORTUNE Change the World List. How to Get Started Submit a complete resume with details about how you meet the minimum expectations. Qualified candidates will be contacted via phone and/or email, so watch your inbox! We’ll start with a brief phone call to provide an overview about the position to ensure that you are qualified and interested. We’ll present your qualifications to our client and coach you through each step of candidacy. Let’s get started!

Name: Business Manager, Sales - Medical Molds
Description: Husky is hiring a new Sales Engineer/ Account Representative in the South East (US) for the Medical Injection Mold and Medical Systems Market! You will be responsible for the overall sales and account management in the region.. As a sales leader, you will establish and manage relationships with potential and existing customers, and develop strategies and objectives to increase the sales of Husky systems.  This direct sales role is responsible to meet or exceed revenue, price, product mix and share of wallet targets for a given group of customers. This role is also responsible to ensure the Husky corporate image (brand) is well known and respected over competitors. The role is responsible to have a very in-depth understanding of his/her market and Husky solutions (products and services) and build strong relationships with his/her customers (including service accounts). These strong relationships should be built with all levels of the customer's organization.  This person will need to ensure that other Husky sales members calling on service accounts are well informed of the account strategy that he/she has developed and that the team is fully aligned and executing the strategy. Key responsibilities: Sales and account management of target customers and target applications in the injection molding industry Prospect new accounts in their defined areas Develop a long term written strategy (including account planning and budgeting) for his/her area and accounts that align with the corporate mandate and ensure the strategy is well communicated to other sales members covering service accounts for alignment in meeting objectives Build a deep understanding of his/her accounts business mandates relating to Husky solutions, products and services and provide updates as needed to other sales members supporting service accounts Review customer needs and develop opportunities and solutions ultimately resulting in a proposal to close the order. This will require facilitating order management with the sales support team Prepare professional reports, presentations and cost models to present his/her customers Host customers during visits to Husky, shows and dinners Ensure all opportunities are reported in the Husky order management tool and update these opportunities as needed Is aware of competitors' offerings and activities in his or her accounts and is aware of all equipment purchased regardless of whether or not it is Husky equipment Provide market and competitor feedback to other groups within Husky to drive strategies Submit lost order reports of all products and services that their primary and service accounts may have acquired elsewhere Aware of and report all mergers, buy-outs related to his/her accounts, align strategy as needed and communicate the impact of the change to their team leader and other sales members supporting service accounts Identify and communicate high risk opportunities to their team leader and sales support to ensure he/she has the full support of the team Conduct market research of his/her area to identify strengths and weaknesses of Husky's products and services relative to market requirements and competition Provide regular market feedback to Business Development in the interest of supporting development projects Identify potential risks and anticipated points of resistance associated with meeting his/her targets and develop and facilitate resolution Communicate with his/her team leader keeping them up-to-date with progress, issues and developments with their respective area, primary and service accounts Is aware of quality and service issues related with his/her accounts and is driving accountability with the service team to ensure service is taking the lead in driving resolution. If required he/she will raise a red flag with senior service team members for them to take action Bring attention to his/her team leader and senior service team members of any critical service issues that are causing significant dissatisfaction with his/her customers that may hold up final payments or potentially losing the next order Facilitate resolution to issues that may hold up final payment of ordersQualifications: Degree in Engineering or Business or equivalent work experience 10+ years of related sales experience Sales Managers with mold making background and experience to support technical discussions with the customer A comprehensive understanding of the Husky business and corporate philosophy Very strong business and financial acumen Excellent negotiating and selling abilities Committed to delivering results Ability to think and execute strategically Excellent understanding of injection molding and the customer's end product and market Promote Husky products based on their customer needs Strong relationship and interpersonal skills, inspires others to outperform and has the ability to influence others that are not within his/her direct report Displays maturity - gives credit for success and own failures Passion for continuous improvements and driving change as needed Strong understanding of local culture Travel is essential with understanding and open-mindedness to different cultures Excellent knowledge of customer business model Excellent communication and presentation skills Husky is an exciting company with tremendous potential. We have a great team and great expectations. If you are attracted to bold goals, believe in uncompromising honesty, support mutual respect, care about environmental responsibility, have a passion for excellence and a desire to make a positive contribution – then we want you to join the Husky team!  Husky is committed to creating a barrier free environment for people with disabilities and providing the tools required to reach one’s full potential. As such, accommodations are provided, as required, in all parts of the hiring process to ensure everyone has what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters to begin a conversation about how to ensure your individual accessibility needs are met.  Husky Injection Molding Systems is committed to equal opportunity employment and welcomes diversity in the workplace. Husky also values being a great place to work and strives to maintain a safe workplace. Accordingly, Husky conditions all offers of employment on satisfactory completion of background checks. No agency or telephone inquiries please.  #LI-MMM

Name: SAS Data Analyst
Description: Job Description : Retrieve data and export to SAS for data review and statistical analysis using Libname engine and SQL pass-through facility. Create new datasets from raw data files using import techniques and modified existing datasets. Participate in various phases of unit testing and production support. Design and write technical specifications for ETL processes and BI reports. Generate reports and perform ETL process, including data extraction, transformation, loading and validation. Modify macros for report generation per the requirements. Generate highly customized reports using various tools and technologies. Will work in unanticipated locations. Req MS in Biology, Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Science, or related and 1 year experience or BS in Biology, Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Science, or related and 5 years progressive experience. Name: Operations & Finance Analyst
Description: Working closely with Asset Management, Accounting, Investor Relations and our third-party property management partners, the Operations and Financial Analyst role is a newly-created position where a numbers-oriented team player will leverage their accounting experience and superior communications skills to turn data and accounting information into impactful insights and reports. The analyst will play a pivotal role in arming Asset Management and Operations with timely information to support day-to day operations and strategic initiatives, providing Accounting with data and projections to support cash management, and supporting Investor Relations in the production of impactful and insightful reports and other communications with investors. Essential duties and responsibilities:Collect and analyze financial and operating data to produce operating and financial reports and summaries for Asset Management/Operations, Accounting, Investor Relations and the Executive team.Ensure timely and accurate reporting of the portfolios performance, including both financial and operational reports and metrics.Use critical-thinking, leveraging the expertise of key internal resources, to identify and recommend impactful initiatives to improve financial and operating performance.Identify and correct process and data deficiencies.Liaise with third-party property management partners along with Asset Management in the successful implementation of systems and processes to support the collection, analysis and reporting of operating and accounting information.Coordinating Yardi imports of monthly financials.Provide support and training to other Yardi users within our team.Assist in the preparation of year end tax information (reports and supporting documentation).Assist in the preparation and analysis of property operating budgets and projections.Assist in the due diligence and underwriting of potential acquisitions and divestitures.Contribute to ensuring clear transition of financial models from the acquisition team to the business execution teams.Maintain strong relationships with both internal and external staff and partners.Assist with other financial reporting and analysis projects as required.Contacts and Liaisons: This position works closely with the Asset Management and Operations team, Accounting. The Executive team, Property Management partners and Investor Relations/Marketing Communications. Diplomacy, tact, confidentiality and a helpful, positive, team-player attitude is required. Training/Education:Bachelors Degree required with a concentration in business, finance, accounting and/or mathematics/statistics strongly preferred.Experience/Skills:Minimum of three years experience as an analyst and/or in an accounting role, preferably in the multi-family or commercial real estate sector.Strong financial, organizational and analytical skills. Professional accounting designation would be considered a strong asset.Exceptional computer skills, particularly with Microsoft Excel, Yardi and databases. Strong Microsoft Word, Microsoft Powerpoint skills are also required.Detail-oriented with a passion for producing accurate reports along with impactful insights.Strong planning and organizational skills; is highly effective at handling multiple priorities and persistently ensuring tasks are seen through to timely and accurate completion.Outstanding verbal and written communications skills.Works well independently as well as part of a team; takes initiative and is comfortable with pushing conventional thinking.Demonstrated ability to work under pressure to deadlines.Highly detailed oriented completes tasks in an accurate and efficient manner.Proven effectiveness at building strong relationships with internal and external partners and clients at all levels.

Name: DSNP Operations and Business Consultant
Description: Req ID: 54862BR  Aetna is hiring a DSNP Operations and Business Consultant to join our National DSNP Program Office. Telework is a requirement for this position (no physical office location). Be part of the newly established National DSNP Program Office, help implement new programs and services, identify opportunities for process and outcomes improvement  We are willing to consider candidates based on location, not location specific and telework only.  DSNP Operations and Business Consultant  Operational planning, process improvement, implementation oversight, reporting and analysis for Medicare Advantage Dual Special Needs Plans (DSNPs) as part of newly established National DSNP Program Office. Work across enterprise functions, business segments and markets to support implementation, growth and ongoing performance of DSNPs throughout the county. Fundamental Components: (*) Support development of operational and performance improvement strategies to support ongoing growth and expansion of Medicare Advantage Dual Special Needs Plans  (*) Facilitates and leads cross functional planning and implementation teams  (*) Develops business cases, implementation plans, and operational execution working across enterprise functions and business segments  (*) Gathers, analyzes, and synthesizes internal and external business intelligence and best practices  (*) Completes market and competitive research  (*) Develop internal and external presentations  (*) Completes financial and budget analyses BACKGROUND/EXPERIENCE desired: (*) 5+ years experience with one or more of the following methodologies: management consulting, project consulting, business process consulting, financial strategic analysis, mergers and acquisitions, strategic business planning, and/or risk management consulting.  (*) Experience with moderate scale initiatives with moderate degree of complexity.  (*) Operational experience in Medicare Advantage.  (*) Demonstrated superior business process, project management and organizational redesign experience.  (*) Demonstrated experience successfully implementing change in complex organizations.  (*) Demonstrated leadership with relevant initiatives: Business process, enterprise business project management/consulting, financial strategic planning and analysis, mergers and acquisitions, strategic planning, scalable interventions and programs.  (*) Demonstrated relationship management skills at the senior level; capacity to quickly build and maintain credible relationships at varying levels of the organization simultaneously.  (*) Demonstrated ability to effectively define and present complex strategy messaging to all levels of internal and external stakeholders  (*) Demonstrated ability analyze market and operational opportunities  (*) Strong presentation skills EDUCATION The highest level of education desired for candidates in this position is a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. FUNCTIONAL EXPERIENCES Functional - Planning/Business - organization level/1-3 Years  Functional - Planning/Financial/1-3 Years  Functional - Project Management/Project Management Consulting/1-3 Years REQUIRED SKILLS General Business/Consulting for Solutions/ADVANCED  Leadership/Anticipating and Innovating/FOUNDATION  Leadership/Developing and Executing Strategy/FOUNDATION DESIRED SKILLS Finance/Delivering Profit and Performance/ADVANCED  Technology/Justifying the Business Case/ADVANCED Telework Specifications:ADDITIONAL JOB INFORMATION Aetna is about more than just doing a job. This is our opportunity to re-shape healthcare for America and across the globe. We are developing solutions to improve the quality and affordability of healthcare. What we do will benefit generations to come.  We care about each other, our customers and our communities. We are inspired to make a difference, and we are committed to integrity and excellence.  Together we will empower people to live healthier lives.  Aetna is an equal opportunity & affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of personal characteristics or status. We take affirmative action to recruit, select and develop women, people of color, veterans and individuals with disabilities.  We are a company built on excellence. We have a culture that values growth, achievement and diversity and a workplace where your voice can be heard.  Benefit eligibility may vary by position. Click here to review the benefits associated with this position.  Aetna takes our candidates's data privacy seriously. At no time will any Aetna recruiter or employee request any financial or personal information (Social Security Number, Credit card information for direct deposit, etc.) from you via e-mail. Any requests for information will be discussed prior and will be conducted through a secure website provided by the recruiter. Should you be asked for such information, please notify us immediately.  Job Function: Management  Aetna is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veterans status.

Name: Marketing Development Analyst (Web Marketing Analyst)
Description: Marketing Development Analyst (Web Marketing Analyst)DescriptionSummary The Web Marketing Analyst will have two main responsibilities: (1) report creation, development and analysis for the Media Analytics team; (2) development support for a proprietary business analytics platform. The Web Marketing Analyst is expected to collect and analyze data on prospective students, competitors, and media sources, while disseminating large amounts of data with trend analyses and actionable performance insights. On the development side, this position will support these reporting efforts through the continued development of our proprietary data analytics platform using a wide variety of skills. In addition to working knowledge and performance the Web Marketing Analyst’s ultimate success in the role will be determined by their integrity (both data and personal), respect (professionalism, self-management, and effective relationships), quality (accuracy, organization and effective communication), and efficiency (time management and innovation). SAS, Google Analytics, SPSS,Experience with utilizing various research methods and statistical samplingExperience with analyzing consumer behavior, market dynamics such as opportunities and threats.Experience developing and implementing research strategiesExperience with survey software such as Survey Monkey, Qualtrics, and or ConfirmitExperience managing out-sourced vendorsProficiency in JavaScript development including NPM and WebpackAbility to analyze and develop websites usingPHP, HTML, JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, and MySQLModerate experience with Git for setting up a local development environment and following Git best practicesSupervisory Responsibilities None. Name: Export Compliance Analyst
Description: Job Description:The Opportunity | Export Compliance Analyst Under close supervision, the Export Compliance Analyst ensures legal compliance and provides import/export administration and control within government rules and regulations, including appropriate licensing for shipments. Reviews routine contracts for required clauses and identifies omissions. Interfaces with internal and external customers, foreign order administration, freight forwarders, custom officers and other functional areas to ensure coordination and logistics of shipment. Selects carrier/forwarder for shipment of products and prepares documents for freight forwarders. Your Challenge:Handle routine export permit processing which includes completing and submitting export permit applications and managing internal processes required to execute export of goods; interface with DFAIT representatives.Review RFQ contract terms, conditions, prices, performance requirements, etc., for conformity with proposal submission, and prepare formal responses to customers.Attend and document internal program reviews to establish project progress, identify problems and notify management of any contractual issues requiring action.Ensure that proper legends, markings and notices are used to protect company and third party proprietary information transmitted or disclosed to customers.Formulate routine contracts and agreements of all types specifically as they relate to licensing and partnership agreements, process Non-Disclosure Agreements, and complete Representation and Certification documents from customers.Your Expertise:Bachelor's DegreeKnowledge of ITAR, EAR, US Customs, and other laws and regulations governing international tradeExcellent written and verbal communication skillsDue to the nature of this the work, applicants must be a sole US CitizenAbility to make effective presentations and organizedAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Office applicationsThis position may require exposure to information which is subject to US export control regulations, i.e. the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) or the Export Administration Regulations (EAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of U.S. regulations.  Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.Company Information:Transform Your Tomorrow...Today at Curtiss-Wright  At Curtiss-Wright, you have the opportunity to transform the way our customers do business, as well as transform your career. Our entrepreneurial environment provides our employees with excellent experiences that enable them to develop their skills through stretch assignments and the opportunity to work with the best talent in the industry. At Curtiss-Wright, you will have the opportunity to contribute from day one. And...that's just the beginning of how we help you transform your tomorrow.

Name: Small Business Consultant

At the heart of our technology is a commitment to (em)Powering small businesses with solutions to fuel their online presence and reach customers everywhere. It's what drives our employees every day and it's what ultimately changes the lives of our customers.  Are you ready to take the next step in your sales career?  We are offering the chance at unlimited earning potential in the fast growing web-tech industry as a Small Business Consultant at Endurance International Group. We'll equip you with the training and tools you need to succeed as a Small Business Consultant and to build a career at Endurance.  You can expect to work hard. In turn, you'll not only be rewarded financially, you'll get to feel good every day empowering small businesses to succeed online! What You'll Do:Receive hundreds of qualified leads every month from inbound lead passes, marketing forms submittals, and outbound data driven campaignsManage an ongoing pipeline as well as close new business on the same call to close new business consistently at or above sales quota levelGain experience in a fast-growing company in the web-tech SMB industryEducate our customers on the benefits of premium professional design and online marketingOperate and thrive within a fast-paced sales environment using multiple systems including but not limited to internal CRMs, SalesForce, and other systemsPartner with the other sales executives and find creative new ways to drive performanceAbout You:You've had a few years (2-5 ideal) of sales experience under your belt where you've consistently achieved and/or exceeded goalsExperience with (or a passion for) small business owners and online marketers is a HUGE plus!You're a competitive person with a drive to win and help others win tooYou're a self-starter with a strong business acumen to think on your feet creatively to solve customer's needsYou're flexible, a master at juggling and prioritizing multiple deliverablesYou're committed to doing whatever it takes to get it done even if it means working outside of 9-5 as needed to field sales opportunities from all over the worldYou have an eagerness to learn, a high-performance work ethic, and a great sense of humorWhen you join our team, we offer the following benefits$15.50/hr + upcapped commissionsA fun, high energy and challenging work environment.Team building activities and recognition.Medical, dental and vision plans. Eligible within first 30-days!!Excellent 401(k) matching program.Four weeks PTOOnsite Gym, Daycare and Cafe!!! Endurance International Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Statutory Transaction Reporting Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPrimary Purpose: Complete statistical and analytical reports, reconciliations, and allocations timely and accurately using SQL Server and other technologies, Research and resolve data quality issues identified within financial datasets and reports. Provide satisfactory responses to internal / external inquiries. Communicate effectively with regulatory agencies and maintain strong working relationships within and outside the department. Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and work experienceMinimum 3 years' relevant experience using Microsoft SQL ServerProficient in SQL programming, Python, and SQL Server Integration Services to manage data loads and queriesExperience integrating various data sources using Open Data Source Connectivity(ODBC) and linked servers, etc.Excellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work with little supervision and self-review to produce quality outcome.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Excel Functions, Pivot tables and Macros, plus MS Access query designAbility to meet firm deadlines in a fast paced environment; manage one's own timeAdapt and be flexible in a complex changing environmentUse statistical techniques and a methodological approach to solve data issuesFamiliarity with insurance premium and claims is a plusFamiliarity with Luigi or Airflow data pipeline framework is a plusExperience with government regulator filings is a plus Job Requirements About National General Holdings: National General Holdings Corp. is headquartered in New York City. National General traces its roots to 1939, has a financial strength rating of A (excellent) from A.M. Best, and provides personal and commercial automobile, homeowners, umbrella, recreational vehicle, motorcycle, supplemental health, and other niche insurance products. We are a specialty personal lines insurance holding company. Through our subsidiaries, we provide a variety of insurance products, including personal and commercial automobile, homeowners, umbrella, recreational vehicle, supplemental health, lender-placed and other niche insurance products.  National General is a fast paced, dynamic, and entrepreneurial organization. Our team members live by and exemplify what we call the 4Es. At National General, we are Energized, Engaged, Empowered, and we Execute every day in order to provide an exceptional experience for our customers! We are passionate about our organization and the value that we add every day. A successful candidate with National General will embody the 4Es. Our team is poised to outperform the competition. We are National General Insurance and with us you can be extraordinary! Come join our team! Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Do you have a strong background in Property, Plant and Equipment (PP&E) accounting policy? Do you enjoy taking the lead on projects? Are you ready to make a career move? If so, please keep reading!  We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to join our team in Arlington, VA. The ideal candidate would support a Department of Homeland Security client as a Senior Financial Analyst. Using knowledge of PP&E, GAAP and USSGL accounting processes, you’ll serve in the area of audit readiness activities. What you will be doing:Gather and analyze PP&E accounting data from multiple systems, reports, personnel, and other available sources.Analyze full life cycle of PP&E, to include property accountability and property valuation, maintain records in the asset management system, and prepare monthly and quarterly adjusting entries.Review and develop policies, procedures, position papers, and other documentations to ensure agency compliance with Federal financial reporting and audit requirements, the USSGL, and federal accounting guidance as issued by the FASAB.Prepare, compile, or review responses to external and internal audit requests.Review deliverables for quality assurance in line with project requirementsQualities and skills you need to have:Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate clearly both orally and in writing.Superior analytical capabilities and critical thinking skills.Ability to interface professionally with the client and provide expertise as needed.Good organization skills and attention to detail.Education and experience we’re looking for:Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance5 plus years of Federal Financial Accounting with some experience in Property, Plant, and Equipment accountingExpertise with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and reportingProfessional certification demonstrating accounting expertiseDemonstrated experience supporting a government agency to successfully attain an unqualified audit opinion or reduce material weaknesses related to PP&E business processes NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

Name: Accenture DayNine - Workday Financials Senior Analyst
Description: Job descriptionJoin the Accenture Cloud First team and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world.  The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance.  Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.Accenture is a leader in helping organizations move to the cloud to take advantage of a new era of service delivery and flexibility, where applications, infrastructure and business processes are brought together and delivered As-a-Service. Accenture’s Cloud First agenda offers comprehensive, industry-focused cloud services including strategy, implementation, migration and managed services, and assets including the Accenture Cloud Platform, that can drive broader transformational programs for clients. Accenture has worked on more than 13,000 cloud computing projects for clients, including three-quarters of the Fortune Global 100, and has more than 17,000 professionals trained in cloud computing.People in our  Client Delivery & Operations career track drive delivery and capability excellence through the design, development and/or delivery of a solution, service, capability or offering. They grow into delivery-focused roles, and can progress within their current role, laterally or upward.The long-standing Accenture and Workday alliance is focused on one thing: Helping our clients thrive in the digital world. We offer end-to-end services for Workday finance and human resources including strategic transformation, application implementation, application management and business process outsourcing. We leverage Accenture’s intelligent tools, like the Accenture Client Enablement Tool for Workday to help teams work smarter and faster.From pilots to complex transformations, we work with our clients to assess, strategize and manage their Workday solutions. But, we do much more than deliver technology. Our focus is on helping businesses realize the promise of integrated, cloud-based technology to do things that could not have been done before, effecting real change in how the business runs and the value it can create.Key ResponsibilitiesConduct working sessions with clients to gather, understand, and analyze business requirements.Provide subject matter expertise on key business process decisions.Advise clients on industry standards for financials in order to provide suggestions to achieve clean configuration and streamlined processes.Design and implement requirements in the Workday HCM Financials solution.Demonstrate configurations through the use of prototyping.Leverage prior financials-related Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) experience.Understand Workday’s Implementation Methodology and use it on all engagements.Provide the Project Manager with status reports and keep them apprised of overall project status.Ensure the client takes advantage of Workday best practices.Participate in update training and other events that help share one’s product skills with other consultants.+ Basic qualificationsBasic QualificationsExisting and up to date Workday HCM and Financials Certifications.1 year prior consulting experience implementing Workday Financials with a certified Workday implementer.Successfully completed at least 2 end to end FinancialsWorkday implementations.Ability and willingness to travel 50-75%.Preferred Skills2 years prior experience implementing Workday Financials with a certified Workday implementer.Thrive in a diverse, fast paced environment.Think analytically and can effectively apply logic to solve problems.Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines, despite conflicting demands.Effective interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate and team with others.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, and can clearly articulate complex messages and requirements.Strong desire to work with clients and provide exceptional client experiences.All of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You'll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization.We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is a Federal Contractor and an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.  Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. Description: Job DescriptionCCI has a Client who is managing a program to design and implement a replacement of the current Administration for Children and Families (ACF) SACWIS compliant system (CHILDS) with a system (Guardian) to align with the ACF Comprehensive Child Welfare Information System (CCWIS) regulations. Guardian is a child-centered, user friendly technology solution focused on quality data and improved processes to support all Client work for the safety of Arizona’s children.  The Organizational Change Management Analyst will support the Guardian change management effort to implement new and established change initiatives. They will support and conduct research, gather data and analyze information. The analyst will become a point of contact for workplace change evaluation and recommendations. They will work with all levels of the organization to ensure the goals of the change initiative are met.  This position will play a key role in helping the Guardian Program change initiatives meet business and schedule objectives. Successful candidates will demonstrate experience supporting change management solutions for technology, process, and/or other transformational programs. Name: Credit Ops Analyst l
Description: An area within Chase Card Services has an excellent opportunity for an individual with proven commercial underwriting abilities. The selected individual will thrive in a fast-paced environment. Primary responsibilities include portfolio management include proactive identification of credit trends and weaknesses, completion of periodic and annual credit reviews and initiating collections activity in connection with overall commercial relationship management. Strong focus on credit quality and risk assessment.Individuals in this position will be have prior experience working with commercial credit applications, along with proven verbal, written, interpersonal, analytical and problem-solving skills. The ability to interface well and build strong working relationships with internal partners such as Business Bankers, Business Development and Risk Policy is another important component of the role. Proven ability to spread business financial statements/tax returns, perform ratio analysis, complete risk assessment and make sound credit decisions and recommendations via written and verbal presentations;Experience in supporting recommendations when challenged and in negotiating counteroffers, where appropriate; Proficiency in credit/lending transactions and analytical skill sufficient to enable independent underwriting of commercial requests for lines of moderate to large size and complexity with limited guidance required from immediate manager; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; Proven ability to communicate verbally and in writing with internal and external customers and with various levels of management; Ability to work in a team environment; Flexibility in adapting to changing volumes and areas of focus (new applications versus portfolio reviews versus initiation of collections, etc.); Ability to investigate, recommend and initiate process improvements;Possess accounting and finance knowledge, and commercial banking experienceMinimum 3 years commercial credit lending experience;Commercial credit card lending experience a plus; Computer skills specific to Microsoft products and proprietary systems;Bachelor's degree in a business-related discipline (MBA a plus); Successful completion of a major corporate bank commercial training program (or the equivalent corporate banking/corporate finance or accounting experience).

Mesa is the central city of the East Valley section of the Phoenix Metropolitan Area. It is bordered by Tempe on the west, the Salt River Pima-Maricopa Indian Community on the north, Chandler and Gilbert on the south along with Queen Creek, and Apache Junction on the east. Mesa is the second-largest city in Arizona with an estimated population of 484,587 as of 2016. Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP): The Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP) provides eligible displaced Federal competitive service employees with selection priority over other candidates for competitive service vacancies. If your agency has notified you in writing that you are a displaced employee eligible for ICTAP consideration, you may receive selection priority if: 1) this vacancy is within your ICTAP eligibility, 2) you apply under the instructions in this announcement, and 3) you are found well-qualified for this vacancy. Well-qualified is defined as meeting all of the minimum qualification standards and eligibility requirements as well as possessing skills that clearly exceed the minimum qualification requirements for the position. Under competitive delegated examining, an ICTAP eligible will be considered well-qualified if they attain an eligibility rating of 90 or higher, not including points for veterans' preference. You must provide proof of eligibility with your application to receive selection priority. Such proof may include a copy of your written notification of ICTAP eligibility or a copy of your separation personnel action form. Information about ICTAP eligibility is on OPM's Career Transition Resources website at https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/workforce-restructuring/employee-guide-to-career-transition/. Name: Senior Credit Analyst or Credit Analyst
Description: If you are looking for a rewarding career Farm Credit West may be a great fit for you. With more than $10 billion in assets, Farm Credit West and its wholly owned subsidiaries are cooperatively-owned institutions providing financial services to farmers, ranchers and agribusinesses.Our employees represent some of the best finance, accounting and credit professionals around, and our technology, administrative and creative staffs are top shelf. We invite you to join our underwriting team.Key job responsibilitiesUnder the supervision of the Regional Underwriter perform a variety of functions including, but not limited to:Ability to spread financial information, including: balance sheet, tax return, borrower- or accountant-prepared statements.Knowledge of financial analysis, including cash flow analysis, balance sheet analysis, profitability, liquidity, and solvency analysis.Solid understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), taxation, legal forms of organizations, and business law.Knowledge of financial modeling techniques and preparation of pro forma financial statements.Ability to perform discounted cash flow analysis, capital budgeting (internal rate of return, net present value, etc.), and equity valuation calculations.Ability to incorporate information from many sources to identify underwriting risks and articulate a concise recommendation.Knowledge of complex lending, financial structuring and credit arrangements, and bank products.Solid understanding of credit underwriting policies, procedures, processes, collateral valuation, and documentation.Advanced ability to use spreadsheet, word processing, and database applications.Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, presentation, oral and written communication skills.Knowledge, Skills, AbilitiesBroad knowledge of credit and financing and the ability to analyze all components on standard and complex credits.Strong decision making skills as well as strong interpersonal, communication, customer service and team skills.Possess proven, effective problem solving skills as well as effective negotiating and influencing.Possess advanced computer skills including MS Office applications and other related industry applications.Must be able to travel to perform certain required dutiesMinimum QualificationsBachelors degree in Agribusiness, Business, Accounting, Economics or related field with 2-5 years of relevant work experience.Agricultural credit analysis experience preferred.EEO/AA/M/F/V/DWe are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: IT Analyst II - Database Analyst
Description: We Are Team Gilbert The Town of Gilbert is Arizona's 5th largest city and one of Money Magazine's Best Places to Live in the U.S., and the people who serve it are proud to be tasked with ensuring it stays that way. This is why we were recently named one of Arizona's 2017 Most Admired Companies to work for by AZ Business Magazine.  Team Gilbert is a high-performing, collaborative team of innovators who do important work that makes our community better every day. If you have the heart of a public servant and the spirit of an entrepreneur...please read on! We Are Seeking With every job we fill, our focus is on providing best in class service to our citizens while offering the opportunity for professional growth in a rewarding and innovative work environment.  Team Gilbert has an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated professional to fill the position of IT Analyst.  The IT Analyst reports to the IT Applications Manager  . The primary function of this position is to  establish, administer, and manage the data, workflows, and systems as well as advise management regarding potential risks to the Town. Duties include but are not limited to installing and configuring servers and workstations, developing and assisting with end-user workflows, customizing software applications to meet customer needs, and researching and identifying new ways of doing business through thorough testing and documentation.About You You are someone who effectively exceeds customer needs by building productive relationships, and taking responsibility for customer satisfaction and loyalty. You actively participate as a member of a team to move the team toward the completion of goals and produce quality outcomes. You are committed to our safety philosophy, and you take great pride in proactively managing time and resources to ensure that work is completed efficiently while accomplishing objectives and achieving goals beyond what is required.  At  Team Gilbert , we hire innovative, forward thinking problem-solvers who love what they do! In addition to possessing the ability to live out our core and functional values daily, candidates must possess the following requirements  Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Business Information Systems, or related field (a non-technical degree can be acceptable if complemented with the appropriate certifications and/or experience; 4-7 years of Information Technology industry experience; 3-5 years of Enterprise Application Support with database experience and workflow, configuration setup, and maintenance experience; 3+ years database experience for Data Warehouse or Open Data; 3 years Microsoft SSRS, SSIS, SSAS experience; 3 years of report writing and customer service interaction experience; Knowledge of basic network administration principles and practices, as well as Information Technology terminology, practices, and procedures; Ability to facilitate meetings to cover workflow processes, project status, and sharing information; Knowledge and ability to interpret business processes and requirements, and align with technology; Communication skills - ability to talk with an end user in a non-technical manner, and the ability to convey technical information and process in writing to technical and non-technical staff.About Us In addition to a competitive salary, Gilbert offers an excellent benefits package that includes medical, dental and life insurance, tuition reimbursement, participation and company match in the Arizona State Retirement System and more. For more information on Team Gilbert and all we have to offer, click here .  Up For The Challenge? Make an income while making an impact! If you are looking for an opportunity to make a visible contribution to our community, and get excited about doing interesting work that matters, then we encourage you to apply today.  To complete and submit an on-line employment application for this position visit http://www.gilbertaz.gov/departments/human-resources/job-opportunities .  Incomplete applications may be rejected so please be thorough . Your resume may be included as a supplement to your application, but it cannot replace any information required for the application.  This position is an At-Will position and is FLSA Exempt - ineligible for overtime compensation. Town of Gilbert offers a comprehensive benefit package for full time and some part time positions. For more information on additional benefits, please Click Here .

Name: Statistical Reporting Analyst
Description: American Reliable Insurance Company (ARIC), part of Global Indemnity LTD (GBLI), underwrites and services an array of specialty insurance programs marketed nationwide, with an emphasis on general agency distribution.  The Statistical Reporting Analayst is responsible for assisting in the timely and accurate compilation and reporting of Company data to the Departments of  Insurance and various Boards and Bureaus.  Assists in the completion of all state-issued data calls, catastrophe  claims reporting requests and the analysis, submissions and corrective  submissions of the statistics reported to ISO, ISS and regulatory bureaus for  both admitted and surplus lines business. This is a part-time position, 15-20 hours per week. Key Responsibilities:Analyze, compile and submit statistical data calls  including bureau (e.g. ISO, ISS) submissions, state-issued data call  filings, catastrophe claim reporting and surplus lines data to DOI’s and  various boards and bureausWork with Underwriting, Actuarial, Financial, Claims  and IT to compile information needed to submit filings and data calls in  compliance with state/bureau requirementsRespond  to Insurance Department inquiries and negotiate extensions, when necessary,  with the Departments of Insurance and Rating Bureaus Research filing-related bulletins, regulations, and  statutesRequired Skills:At least 2 years  of college coursesInsurance  knowledge/experience, designations and/or course work is preferredStrong listening,  interpersonal, written and oral communication skillsAbility to work  accurately with detailed informationStrong  analytical, mathematical and creative problem solving skillsMust be able to  multi-taskTeam playerProficient in MS  Office, MS Excel, MS Word, Adobe Acrobat

Name: Financial Analyst
Company: St Josephs Hospital and Medical Center
Description: Overview Located in the heart of Phoenix, Ariz., St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center is a 586-bed, not-for-profit hospital that provides a wide range of health, social and support services with special advocacy for the poor and underserved. St. Joseph's is a nationally recognized center for quality tertiary care, medical education and research. It includes the internationally renowned Barrow Neurological Institute, the Muhammad Ali Parkinson Center, the Norton Thoracic Institute, a campus of Creighton University's Medical School and the first Level I Trauma Center in Arizona verified by the American College of Surgeons. U.S. News & World Report routinely ranks St. Joseph's among the best hospitals in the United States for neurology and neurosurgery. For more information please visit our website at https://www.dignityhealth.org/arizona/locations/stjosephs .  Responsibilities JOIN US NOW as we our Financial Operation Deparment is seeking a detailed-oriented FINANCIAL ANALYST II to present financial information related to financial performance improvement and operational efficiency activities and ensuring accurate and timely information to management by providing opportunity identification, information sources, data collection and analysis, workflow analysis, statistical analysis, benchmark determination, process improvement design and measurement using written and graphic reports and presentations.  Located in Phoenix, AZ, this position is critical to the success of St. Joseph's Hospital Medical Center and requires the full understanding and active participation in fulfilling the Mission of Dignity Health.  Qualifications REQUIREMENTS: Four years accounting or finance experience preferably in a healthcare setting. BS degree in accounting or finance required.
